Author: gringamex
Review: I had long wanted to try the Rockfish and I have to say that I was disappointed. The staff were great and, fortunately, understanding, as I had to return two items to the kitchen. The melon salad was simply the worst salad I've ever been served: the melon was rock hard and brownish, the salad leaves were mottled and bitter, and the prosciutto consisted of smalll, thick slices of fat. They replaced it with a beet salad that was a bit better, though I don't understand why there were so few beets or why they were chopped up into small bits. My second plate was drum fish and that had to be returned because it was raw, which in this type of fish means you can't even cut it. On the other hand, I loved the possibility of having a wine flight.

Author: mrsirin
Review: This spacious place has a varied menu offering meats and fish. There is also a good wine list. Service was good.

Author: dolceniente
Review: What a wonderful surprise! We had dinner in this little gem of a place in Grandin Village. I like to cook and am a tough critic with food that has been prepared for me. Happily, the menu selections are interesting without being pretentious. Each dish we tried was creative, fresh and well prepared. Plus delicious tasting!They have a decent wine and cocktail selection.The atmosphere is serene, the service is very good and friendly. I will be returning for sure to try other selections.Tip: Be sure to try the Carrot Soup! And the Shrimp and Grits are outstanding.

Author: Gary W
Review: Really enjoyed our Sunday Dinner at Rockfish! Server was friendly, professional and timely. Owner was on the premise and stopped by to check on things - always a good sign. The She-crab soup may have been the best my wife has eaten anywhere.....and she has enjoyed it all over the SE coast. I had great tomato basil gazpacho that was soup du jour. My Corvina was excellent with a nice crisp edge. We liked that both entrees were served over delicious vegetables and greens really did not have a starch. Will return when back in Roanoke.

Author: veracity55
Review: Just had our first meal at Rockfish. The hostess greeted us promptly and showed us to our table while offering us the choice of a booth if we prepared. Our waitress appeared promptly, told us about the specials and answered our questions. We started with the black bean appetizer, the only speed bump of the evening. Although tasty, it was a lot of black beans and rice and a relatively minimal amount of chorizo, tomatoes, sour cream, and sweet potato chips. The chips were what would really have elevated this had there just been enough. We both ordered a wine pairing (what a great idea - 3 half-glasses of wine for 11.00). My husband's strip steak was good, but my crab cakes were the best I've had in years - all crab instead of mostly bread. They were accompanied by a tasty spiniach and lemon viniagrette that nicely offset the somewhat spicy root vegetable hash. We finished off by sharing a slice of flourless chocolate torte. Service throughout was prompt and correct. It was pleasantly quiet so that we were able to carry on a conversation. We will definitely be back.

Author: 942kenv
Review: There is no dedicated parking for the restaurant thus I dropped off group and searched for a spot. When I sat down the waitress immediately asked what I wanted to drink. I asked for a chance to review their drink selection. 5 minutes later she comes back. By that time I had forgotten and had to look again. I ordered 2 different martinis. They both tasted the same and werent worth the cost. We ordered oyster sliders, Caesar salad, crab bisque, crab cakes, and strip. Sliders were very good. 2 of the 3 people in our party ordered the bisque and cakes. We both sent back the bisque and cakes. The strip was fine.

Author: DomPaone
Review: Threat of snow seemed to keep patrons away but very happy we visited Rockfish. Had nice special of stripped bass and salmon. Started with some tasty calamari couple of bottles of wine with dinner and a wonderful dinner and evening with friends. Wait staff (Sarah) was very good and delight to speak with. All in all great food, delightful atmosphere and great friends made for a nice evening despite a little snow.

Author: 6744Sullivan3
Review: My wife and I are very fond of Rockfish in Roanoke: the menu is always interesting, the wine list extensive, and the prices reasonable. The chef is creative and skilled, and the owner is, welcoming, friendly, and knowledgeable about wine. We enjoy every aspect of this excellent restaurant and go there often.

Author: travlrrr
Review: Excellent, fresh, local deliciousness, engaging and pleasant staff, fantastic wine selection. Always delicious and safe gluten-free options. Highly recommend.

Author: Vacation332738
Review: This is my favorite restaurant in Roanoke. We had the fried green tomatoes, fried oysters, the grouper with grits, and the salmon. Every bite was delicious and cooked to perfection. The oysters were delicate and crispy. The grouper we moist and cooked perfectly. The service was top notch and very welcoming. I cant wait to eat here again!

Author: WayneWalkJr
Review: Great beer, great food , great service. This was a very nice experience! The food and beer were delicious. The service was top notch. Nice location. Parking near by.

Author: jjric
Review: Stopped for lunch and sat upstairs with street view. Nice beer selection of IPAs, but would recommend adding a few darker beers for those of us who prefer a more malty beer. Our server, Ben, was great! He gave us suggestions from the menu and told us his personal favorites. The Shut your hatch burger with a unique blend of flavors. Rich Parmesan fries. Fantastic! A must when visiting Roanoke again.

Author: travelqueen7810
Review: We went to Three Notch'd because we love to visit breweries whenever we travel. This place did not disappoint. The food was great from the pretzel bites to the salad and 40 mile Philly to the Borwnie ice cream dessert. Service was top notch and our food came out quickly. The Blonde Ambition beer was great!! Has outside or inside seating. Don't miss this place when visiting Roanoke!

Author: cremebrulee960
Review: This brewery staff is always friendly. The beer rotation is very good and most are canned and ready to go. I like the fact that there is a full service restaurant compare to most breweries.

Author: 801joef
Review: Great brewery and the food is excellent! Good selection of appetizers, sandwiches and main dishes. Beer selection is fantastic and the service is friendly and prompt ! Best thing is you can munch while tasting the brews unlike most breweries!

Author: Carolyn427
Review: Visited this brewery around 530 and seated on the third floor promptly by a window. Service was good. We asked for recommendations on which beer to try based on our liking. She was a help. Food was good, a little pricy. Beer was good to.

Author: Janine C K
Review: Enjoyed the $10 lunch special, had the watermelon salad - delicious dressing, but would have enjoyed a little less melon and a little more greens. The grilled tofu was bland, Ill try it fried next time. Mac and cheese side was creamy and had crumbled cheez its on top, fun and tasty! Great beer selection.

Author: AmbersM0mmy
Review: Visiting Roanoke for the day and this the perfect place to sit for a few and enjoy a beer. The server was extremely friendly and helpful. I enjoyed sitting out on the patio.

Author: GSP13
Review: We had to wait an extremely long time before someone came to our table. Waitress was nice, did apologize for the wait and was attentive afterwards. She made up for the wait. Beers were decent. Food I thought was extremely high priced for the quantity and quality. It was very loud and hard to hold a conversation. I would not come back unless just grabbing a quick beer.

Author: KShawnT
Review: I really enjoyed the beers at Three Notch'd. Tasty and lots of choices. I was disappointed by the meal, except for the deviled eggs which were excellent. Our sandwiches were dry and the fries were just ok, pretty limp.

Author: andytapatagonika
Review: From the start, the restaurant was inviting. Friendly staff, open kitchen concept make this restaurant a secret treasure. Their cocktail creations have all the flavours you want to taste in this (almost over!) summer/fall season. The menu is simple but powerful. Plentiful of choices, reminds me of restaurants in Europe. This place is here to stay.

Author: wkent17
Review: A refreshing addition to Roanoke! Bloom brings a farm to table yet fine dining experience to everyone in a casual, charming environment. The Chef-Owner Nate is serious about his locally sourced ingredients and he brings food to life in a creative and modern style. Who knew sunflower shoots could elevate a dish in such an amazing way? And pear butter is a thing he should package immediately for the masses! Do not miss out on a great evening in the revitalized Wasena neighborhood.

Author: CJDVirginia
Review: I really enjoyed this restaurant. Overall, my wife and I had several small dishes and enjoyed them very much. Even if I didn't typically like an ingredient, I felt that the dishes were good, a mark of a good chef. The parking is a bit tricky as it is all street parking and crossing from the other side of the street can be a bit difficult even at the cross-walk. Drivers are not used to slowing down there. Also, the restaurant can get quite noisy. I would try to put some noise dampening panels etc as having a conversation can be difficult. Also, they do not take reservations, so getting a seat on a Friday or Saturday might be difficult. I would definitely want to sit at the chef's table as I feel that I could hear the person next to me better as well as get to see the chefs prepare the food. So overall, the food is very good, and I think they will figure some of these other things out.

Author: Julia M
Review: We were spending a night in Roanoke on our way to a wedding. Husband checked out their website and said we need to go. It was packed when we arrived. Got the last seat at the bar. The tapas menu is short but filled with beautiful and delicious plates. We did cheese and charcuterie, oysters, heirloom tomatoes and potatoes in aioli. Finished with an amazing snapper dish. Homemade ice cream for dessert. Wayne and the rest of the staff offered excellent service. Newly added outdoor seating . A neighborhood gem! Can't wait to get back here!

Author: Diane1313
Review: We went to Bloom on a Thursday nite around 6:00 pm. I worried that we would have to wait a long time but luckily they were just clearing a table. It was crowded but the service is so excellent that it doesnt seem like very long before you are served. In the tapas environment something is always delivered for tastings. They have the best flatbread that came out immediately, so dont forget to order it even if you order one or two of the cheese plates. The chvre was especially tasty. My husband and I were going to share the beets but there were so many, everyone had a taste. Because everything comes out so beautifully displayed, it is tempting to taste, which is exactly what Bloom encourages. My Snapper was delicious and beautifully displayed with vegetables in purple onion rings. It is fun to observe what others are eating, reminiscent of European dining. This type of fresh food is not cheap, but certainly worth it. Only problem is the parking but there are places throughout the safe and up and coming neighborhood. If you are old or handicapped, consider being dropped off at the door.

Author: SkiBelize
Review: Fabulous restaurant...can't wait to have dinner there again! We sat at the Chef's Table and enjoyed engaging conversation with the chefs as they prepared plates of delicious, colorful food. Seasonal menu using lots of local fresh ingredients. Nice wine list with wines by the bottle or glass. Staff were happy to have us as guests and very helpful. We had a charcuterie and cheese plate (choose your own meats and cheeses to create a personalized plate), Heirloom Tomato Salad, and Brasstown Beef. And the DESSERTS...oh my! Chef Madi created Watermelon "Jello" and Chocolate Cookie Dough with mint chocolate ice cream. I can't remember enjoying a dessert so much...fantastic and beautifully presented. Looking forward to our next fun time at Bloom! They do not take reservations. We arrived at 6 pm and were seated immediately, but groups larger than 2 may have a bit of a wait. They try to make everyone comfortable while waiting, offering cocktails, etc. They serve "small plates" but the plates were large enough for us 2 ladies to share. Small and large portions are available for some of the plates.

Author: tarpon_and_bones
Review: Not crowded but reservations not a bad idea. Helpful pleasant wait staff who know the cuisine and are very proud of what they serve. You can order prepared dinners or single tapas selections brought out as you finish each one. We decided to just order all the tapas selections and had them bring them on a nice serving board. There was more than enough for two to share and they included local farms meats and cheeses along generally exotic and all fresh. Their dessert menu includes selections all prepared by the dessert chef and the one we had was excellent.Wonderful place and worth the short drive for dinner

Author: Kaitlin B
Review: We were so excited we did not have to drive far to go to a good tapas place. my husband was happy to see a nice DIPA on the beer menu. We got the cherv, oysters, beets, carrots, the beef dish, and of course the cookie dough dessert. I thought every dish was very well cooked. My husband said he could eat a bushel of the carrots!! We menu selection is limited, hopefully that will expand with time, but every dish they offer the have mastered. We will be coming back soon!

Author: Elnet V
Review: A new Roanoke spot with delicious small plates and aesthetically pleasing drinks. The aioli potatoes are a must-try (we ordered an extra portion of them)!! Everything is so fresh, flavorful, and unique. The food is ethically grown and the service is excellent, making it an overall great experience. Whether youre a local or just visiting Roanoke, you should definitely stop by for this culinary experience!

Author: jennyferr2017
Review: While in town on business and staying at Hotel Roanoke, I walked here for dinner. It was midweek and early and not crowded at all. The staff was helpful and responsive. I ordered the Formosa Roll and a salmon and avocado roll. The presentation was beautiful and the flavor was even better. The spicy mayo paired perfectly with the Formosa Roll. Overall the signature Roll was very good. It was flavorful and had great texture play. I tried it with my soy sauce and wasabi combo, but then decided it was so good on its own that I was ruining it by dipping it.

Author: 471deidrer
Review: Words cannot describe the service or the food at Formosa in the past I've always said "oh I'm going to try that place one day" well, since the first week of February I have literally been to Formosa Lounge one, twice maybe three times a week just put it this way the service and the food (ROCK SHRIMP) has kept my family and I coming back for more. The owners make you feel so welcome as you enter the door. The attentive service and the great food is awesome. And my son and I love the Japanese green tea. This will be a place I will continue to patronize over and over again.

Author: ashop77
Review: My wife an I ate here and was fantastic! Service was great, but I'll admit it was 2pm on a Friday and we were the only ones in the restaurant. I would highly recommend. Best sushi we've had in a long time

Author: timlubosch
Review: I would go here every week if i could afford it. puts wasabi's to shame downtown.Everyone deserves their own opinion. all their food is fresh i even got my parents to try it now they go once a month. If you want a one of the best meals in roanoke i suggest you try this place.

Author: Outdoorsman1959
Review: The waiter was most attentive. The flavors of the food were outstanding! My family truly enjoyed this restaurant.

Author: Jonny S
Review: The owner is very friendly, and the food is extremely fresh, and of superior quality. On Friday nights they have the best Latin music DJ in town, and the dance floor stays packed.

Author: seanmhorn
Review: I went in a group of 8 for a business dinner. The good- food was amazing, fresh, and artful. The bad- extremely slow. The restaurant was almost empty except for us and it took well over an hour for our food. Still, all was forgiven when we tasted it. I highly recommend giving them a try.

Author: Mommaratzzi96
Review: Had a business lunch here today and had the most amazing sushi I have ever eaten! Everything fresh and no MSG anything! LOVED IT! Can't wait to go back!!!

Author: pagetravelers
Review: Best, most creative sushi in all of Roanoke. We love it here and try to go several times a month and any time we have guests come in from out of state as well. Everyone we take here is equally as impressed as we are. We go early, between 5:30-7 because we bring our 1 year old with us, and he loves their food too. We get great service and attention to detail each visit. I love their hand crafted margarita! Order one, you won't be disappointed. The lobster roll is great, shrimp tempura, rock shrimp, steak teppanyaki is also delicious. We honestly haven't had a bad meal here and plan to go back again and again. Don't go at 5:30 and take our window booth whatever you do :)

Author: TheGahden
Review: Let me start off by saying the sushi is absolutely phenomenal, arguably the best I've ever had (and I've eaten a lot of sushi outside of Roanoke.) I would give the atmosphere a 7/10... I see what they're shooting for, which is good, but they're not quite there yet... a few minor improvements would accomplish their goals.Now the bad, and the ugly. The service was received was absolutely HORRENDOUS:-From the time we sat down, it took literally 30 minutes to receive beverages. The first 3 choices of my date, they were out of, including a specialty drink on their menu. Additionally, the servers couldn't remember ANYTHING, and every food item/drink had to be ordered multiple times. I can't even count how many times they couldn't remember/confused things!-At one point, there were only 7 people seated, 2 persons each, and 2 servers "working." At this point, a guy at another table turns to us to express his disbelief that service was this bad when only 7 tables had people at them. The "servers" were nowhere to be found half the night, I am talking completely just gone. When they did show up, we had to order drinks/food multiple times, because they had forgot/confused it. This literally turned into a 2 hour+ dinner because the servers frequently disappeared.-1 server brought our appetizer and sat it on another table. That table told them they didnt order it, to which I said "We ordered those" (45 minutes ago in fact). She proceeded to lift the food off of that table circle around the restaurant and place it on ours. That's a health code violation, but I ignored it, because I wasn't waiting another 45 minutes for an appetizer. 30 minutes per beverage was bad enough too. -Outside of my date's first 3 drink requests being "out"... I had to place an order for a mixed drink (jim beam and coke) three times!! they couldn't remember a 2 ingredient drink!-Other Patrons were openly complaining about the service. They, we, were literally discussing how ridiculous the lack of service was with other patrons... at which point, the server confused multiple table's items on one another's checks. After several back-and-forths to the register and failing to get it right, he had to take everyone's word for what they ordered.My suspicion is that the owner of the business is an incredible sushi chef, because the food itself was amazing, but the service and overall management of the place was a complete failure. I hope he/she hires a good manager, and the service is straightened out!

Author: Marsha N
Review: This is an interesting little grocery and restaurant, only about 4 booths. We went to eat and the food was very good. The owner was very friendly and enjoyed talking with him Could have used a little cleaning .

Author: Savyluncher
Review: Small in size but Big on flavor.. Good food.. friendly service.... good cooking. Just off of Orange Ave. on Williamson Road. Try it you will like the food and buy the way stock up on some groceries while you are there eating good food. Small Brick building with parking area.

Author: CarolinaGypsy
Review: Excellent food in a small restaurant and grocery store! My husband and I found Bethlehem Restaurant on TripAdvisor while visiting Roanoke. Everything was fresh and cooked to perfection! We had the hummus, lamb kabob platter and kufta kabob platter. The platters come with a very flavorful rice and a fresh salad that is made of cucumber, pickled red cabbage, onions, parsley, tomatoes and mint tossed in a very light dressing. The grocery section is filled with many interesting foods and spices! Do not judge this restaurant by the outward appearance of the building! Seating is limited to four booths. Highly recommend that you give it a try if you love Mediterranean food!

Author: reneeisorym
Review: We found this place on accident trying to find somewhere to eat when traveling to DC. It is amazing. I thought I had had some great Greek food, but this is the best Ive had in the craziest of places. Look at the Google reviews if you need further verification. This place rocks!

Author: Patricia W
Review: local grocery store with Greek food. Very good food. Pleasant owners. Good for a quick authentic bite to eat.

Author: SuzanneRimmer
Review: I found this place before our trip to travel down Skyline Drive and the Blue Ridge Parkway. We stopped off in Roanoke to eat. It is an easy off and on and worth the trip. This food was AMAZING! If you've never tried this type of food, this is the place to do it. There was a great variety and very reasonable. In addition, I got my favorite Arabic coffee.... it is super bold and comes in a tiny little cup. Don't let the size fool you.... it packs a huge caffeine punch and you'll be able to see into the future after drinking it!

Author: JRoOntheRoad
Review: Ate here twice and will return. Love the way they prepare the sandwiches by folding over on the grill. Last visit we got the mixed shawerma plate and a side of humus. Some of the best humus you will eat. We got some to go for later. The grocery store has a good mix of middle eastern foods and spices. Came away with date cookies, spices, and candy. Not a lot of tables. Don't let the location and appearance keep you from going. Great service. Will differently return.

Author: JEConrad
Review: My daughter and I went for dinner. She got the chicken kabob dinner and loved it. Generous portion of salad and rice and chicken was delicious. I got the chicken shawarma and it was fantastic. A word of caution though: it contains pickles, so dont order if you dont like pickles. If you are not familiar with the dishes available, look them up ahead of time so you know what ingredients to expect. We both loved our meal and would definitely eat there again.

Author: Jane M
Review: I did not know quite what to expect when my friend invited me to meet him here. I only wish I lived close enough to eat here all the time! We had the shawarma platters (he had chicken, and I had beef). It come with the best hummus I have ever had, a warm pita, and a salad. YUM! We ate outside under an umbrella to enjoy the beautiful day and the neat little neighborhood. GO eat there!

Author: Hootiewoo
Review: I always heard this place was good, it was better than I expected. I had the Shawarma, and boy was it good! I got some of their hot sauce, very delicious! The place is small so if it's crowded you may have to wait for a seat to open or get your food to go, but please try this place, you will not be let down.

Author: Hokiechip
Review: We had stopped going to the Outback in Roanoke because of inconsistency in service and food, but have eaten there twice within the last week and have been VERY impressed.Great service, and really really good food. Steaks literally melted in your mouth.If this keeps up, they will move back up on our favorite place to eat list in Roanoke.

Author: Victor A
Review: Went with my wife and two sister in laws and everything was really good.The food was excellent,The server went above and beyond.Loved it all,and would remmend it to anyone

Author: Anne H
Review: We eat at this Outback restaurant very frequently. My step son used to be their kitchen manager. We've always kept an affection for it.Ate there last week with my husband-all was well. Ate there today with my son and was disappointed. Not in the food, it was fine.It was the payment and server that bothered me. My bill was $46.50.I paid with (3) $20 dollar bills.She asked if I needed change, I said yes.Was planning on leaving $8 to $10 tip when I got my change.She returned with (4) one dollar bills. My change should have been 13.50 not $4.I sort of flagged her back down and told her I had given her $60 (3 twenty dollar bills). I was absolutely positive that's what I gave because all I had were $20's.I had just gotten 10 twenty dollar bills when cashing check for $200.In fact, when I got the bill, I was searching to see if I had any smaller bills to go with the $20's and only had a few one dollar bills and the twenties.When I told her I was positive I gave her 3 twenties, she told me I was wrong. She informed me I gave her 2 twenties and a ten.I tried to tell her I know I didnt give her any $10 bill because I didn't have any.She insisted she was right and I was wrong .I was not going to cause a scene and ruin the nice lunch I had had with my son. I told her not to worry about it. She kept insisting what I gave her and it was unsettling to me that she did not even entertain the idea that she was mistaken and that perhaps I was correct. I am a small business owner myself. I do not believe, necessarily, that the customer is always right. But I do believe, that when a customer states they are sure of something, that they should at least be listened to.She gave to hint that she even remotely considered that I was right and maybe she was mistaken. $10 not worth really arguing or even continuing to discuss as she was absolutely definite about what she said I gave her. Even when i explained to her I only had $20 bills from the bank.Just an unpleasant encounter. Not excited about going back anytime soon.

Author: Travelinglizarded
Review: Im always amazed that people flock here. We were told an hour wait on a sat night. But they didnt mention the tables in the bar were avail first come.... we had apps and beer and wine at the bar waiting for our table. That was he best part. It was Dads birthday and his steak was perfect. Thats why we come.

Author: Robert M
Review: Very good, wife's steak was overlooked , my seafood was good, service was good, lobster tails were good

Author: MrsKerren18
Review: On New Year's Day, we decided to have dinner at Outback in Roanoke, assuming it was open. Many restaurants were not, and it would have been better for us and Outback if they were among those that were closed. Frist, we and many others were waiting for over 30 minutes as we watched the tables empty and no one being seated. I thought table turn-over was the goal of busy restaurants, but not this one. Three hostesses who kept saying, 'you will be seated shortly'. Once we were seated, there was literally trash all around our two-seat table! paper trash, food; or should I say garbage; even liquid. There were bus-persons stationed around the dining room, just watching the empty tables. They were quick to bus them, but did not tidy up the cushions, chairs, or floor. After pointing it out to the server, who was running her tail off, we simply went back to the hostess and asked for a nearby table that was at least clean. She seated us, then conferred with a server who recommended we be reseated to a booth--no problem. This server was cheerful and seemed to be on top of things. Our salad and soup were quickly delivered and then the wait started. 30 minutes later, we asked where our 'simple' orders were - a sandwich! She said, "soon". Meanwhile patrons who had arrived after us were either on to their desserts, or were leaving having completed their meals.We waited longer, Finally, I went to use the restroom, and it too was a pigpen - paper and liquids everywhere--no tp in two of three stalls. Trash baskets overflowing. If I wasn't desperate by then, I would have walked out of the restaurant.On my way back to my table I noticed a dish that had just been delivered to another person, and it was unpresentable in my opinion. I decided we had wasted enough time, and my husband, having observed other disasters in my absence was also ready to leave. We took our coats, left enough money for our beverages and salads and left. There was no sign of our server, but there were more empty tables of people who had completed their meals. And there was still a long wait. We were tempted to warn people, but decided just to get out. Meanwhile, the hostesses were heard to say, "you will be seated shortly."And since I'm on a roll, i might mention the new remodeling inside does not contribute to ambience. I'm assuming more people can be seated, but there are fewer dividiers between tables, booths, etc, and nothing between the high tops and the entrance, leaving a continuing stream of people and cold air coming from the outside for those seated just inside the entrance. Definitely not inviting.We assumed there must be a new manager, who was invisible, since the former manager was often seen welcoming guests, checking on tables, service, etc, and we didn't see anyone doing this function - or we would have told him/her of the situation.

Author: soonerpirate
Review: Met some friends I worked with before for lunch. Chose the burger lunch special with a side. Food was good and the blooming onion was perfect. Only hitch was too the waiter about 20 minutes to bring the check AFTER he knew we were waiting on it. In his defense he was stretched way to far and this hasnt the first time it likes they wee understaffed. On a plus side like the new open format were it doesnt feel like your eating in a cubicle. Love the openness.

Author: paralegal4444
Review: I came for the clam chowder since it's the best I've ever had. All the Outbacks make it good so it's probably premade. All our apps and food were good. But the service was horrible. It took 15 mins to get water. Instead of just taking our order she came back 10 mins later. So 25 min to get water and the order taken. 45 min to get app. Wouldn't keep going you get the point. I still left a tip but come on guys it wasn't even busy.

Author: WVExplorer
Review: Its currently under renovation so the bathroom situation and some lighting is under construction. The food is still great and the new fish tacos are yummy!

Author: cedarridge2014
Review: It was my friends birthday and I knew she liked Outback. I hadn't been in a while so we went. She was already seated. First thing she said was I don't have my glasses I can't see up close (it was a good thing). The waitress was talking to her As I sat down the waitress left to get our drinks. I looked at the table cloth it had dirty spots on it. My friend just rotated the cloth a little, more spots appeared it took 3 twists to find 2 non dirty spots for us to have our plates on. When the waitress came back with the drinks I mentioned how dirty the table cloth was. She said it sure is, and asked if we ready to order.My friend never was offered a refill of iced tea, I never got the steak sauce. The big upset of the evening was a large family with a small child 2 to 3 years old who shrieked through the whole time we were there. The mother tried to hold it but just screamed louder. None of the other adults tried to help or take the child out. AS I left I asked the family if they were enjoying thier meal because we didn;t.

Author: John S
Review: As always, the service at Taste of Asia is excellent. The variety of types of Asian foods is incredible. My favorites are the Thai foods. They also do a great job with sushi.

Author: Old_Fat_MEN
Review: This is a very nice Asian restaurant. I was seated and wait on very quickly. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I ordered the Ka Pow with chicken, hot with a Thai Hot sample. The meal was great, hot and just right. The Thai spice I sampled had great flavor and about hit my limit on hot!!

Author: Dennis M
Review: On a recommendation, we hit Taste of Asia early on a Friday evening. Two of us planned to dine, but by the time we got our act together there were 18 of us in the party. We gave the restaurant better than an hour's notice, and they had arranged tables for us in short order.  Service was slow, but this was not entirely their fault: we arrived at the peak of the dinner hour and they were already busy, so the kitchen was backed up with our massive order. Sushi was the last order to come out of the kitchen. It was fresher than expected and was as good as any I have ever had elsewhere.  I would go back to try them again, but with a much smaller group.

Author: DR5492013
Review: I thought I was meeting my friend at another restaurant for sushi. He happened to be waiting for me at Taste of Asia so I headed on over here. I have eaten here many times but I've always had the Thai food which is delicious! Well let's just say we had the sushi experience that we enjoyed for hours. Pin, sushi chef was delightful and sushi was wonderful! Specialty roll, seaweed salad, sashimi...try the "modern" sashimi! I told them to rename Taste of Asia sashimi! We will be back not just for Thai. Ask for Stephanie she is awesome!

Author: Craig H
Review: I eat here frequently when in town which has more often than not has been a fair amount recently. Food is always good and service I have no complaints. Part my problem but tip (gratuity) added for a party of five!! I didn't catch and gave a handsome sum more on top of the forced tip charge. Amount to nearly half the bill and the believe me the service wasn't that great. I caught this the next day but was leaving town in less than an hour. NO ONE there could run the Credit on my card. Stephanie offered to return in cash but no way I could get back before the time to catch my plane.Since I go there often i don't look at the menu and again didn't catch the automatic tip being added. My fault but you would think someone other than Evelyn, on vacation and could't tell when she would return, was the only one to do the credit on my card.This was all Friday and Saturday and will try again today Tuesday to get it resolved..

Author: VirginiaHiker81
Review: I have been to the restaurant for lunch during the week & weekend and also dinner on the weekend other than serving portions & lunch specials , prices everything is the same between lunch&dinner selectionsI love the general tso's sauce its spicy with jalapeno in the sauce the only place I know that does this also love the sweet and sour sauce its different any other place and has pineapple in it, it's a sweet light tasting sauce not your typical red5 colored tastless glaze that is typical sweet&sour nearly anywhere in roanoke valley I think its my favorite of all I also really like the harlic chicken and orange chicken my niece loves the soup here today we had sweet & sour,general two's, & orange chicken all was nice and the hot towels are LOVELY NEVER STOP THIS!! I THINK IT SHOULD BE ADDED TO LUNCH SERVICE DURING THE WEEK AS IT PUTS this place a mark other Asian resturaunts

Author: Journey550369
Review: This restaurant has excellent food with all varieties available the proprietor is also a great lady I would recommend five stars for this restaurant thank you DENNIS

Author: Go567289
Review: For starters the restaurants menu is very large - it is broken down into three sections ; Thai, Chinese and Japanese.I could not decide on what to order - so I want very basic and started with an order of dumplings while I tried to make up mind. Once the dumplings arrived I decided that would be all I would be eating for the night. The dumplings tasted like mush - not very desireable. My husband ordered General Taos chicken and he said it was very good and flavorful. Portions were plenty. Staff were nice. Restaurant seemed clean. Service was quick.

Author: BattenBell
Review: We saw place advertised on TV and though we'd try it. It was a Sunday a bit after 1pm and only 3 cars in the parking lot. We were one of 3 tables and the greeting and ordering was quick, friendly and efficient. While we were there several other parties arrived and there was a bit of take-out. That being said the wait for our entree's (after the appetizers arrived and were eaten) was a good 15 minutes!! Disappointingly slow service, for which the server apologized several times. The summer rolls lacked flavor other than lettuce (and the dipping sauce) but the steamed dumplings were delicious. Our Japanese rolls were tasty and filling. The desert, Mango Sticky Rice, arrived promptly and was plentiful although a bit sweeter than we were used to. Worth a second visit.

Author: Denarchy7
Review: My sister in law ordered a variety of items, including Roanoke chicken, and Cashew Chicken, etc. Both were fairly good but I guess she had ordered Broccoli Chicken as well and they did not give it to them. Other than a mixup with the order the food was fairly above average. The pork dumplings (I believe they were pork) were good as well.

Author: Gregg O
Review: pulled in to the New Yorker at the last minute for lunch. what a pleasant surprise. I got the New Yorker sandwich - awesome. The prices are very affordableThe only caution is they are cash only.

Author: Michael B
Review: As a native Roanoker, I've eaten many meals at this place over the years and have never been disappointed. The New York Deli has been a fixture on Williamson Road since I was a child, and I'm now 73. Everything they serve here is delicious and at a price that will amaze you - my sub was $6.99. The hot rare roast beef sub was so big I brought home half of it for another meal (the photo is of that half after being in the fridge overnight). My friend got the Italian sub, which was also huge, and he managed to eat the whole thing. I love this place.

Author: Angela P
Review: If you are from out of town and hungry, save yourself the trouble. We have patronized this restaurant for over 20 years, but we were refused seats. The service wasnt up to par and management was rude. To top it off, the food wasnt as good as it has been in the past. We wont be back.

Author: litulk2018
Review: We went here on our weekly date night. Did not have to wait to be seated which was great. Server was kind and friendly but could have smiled more. She took our order and it was delivered promptly and the way we ordered it. We both had the cheese tray appetizer which was great. We ordered the Hot Italian Sub but had certain specifics that we wanted and were given exactly what we ordered. We ended up bringing part of it home as there was too much to eat at once. I do wish they took bank cards instead of cash only but I had cash so no problem.

Author: Joseph B
Review: Real, lean, packed high sandwiches of pastrami &/or corned beef on toasted real rye bread with deli brown mustard and a Kosher dill pickle ---WOW. close your eyes and your back at Kattz Deli in NYC. And best of all, the prices are really reasonable! Remember, cash only, and seat yourself. Good variety on menu items, and take a pound of sliced deli meat home with you too.

Author: B3473BOangelat
Review: Remember to bring your cash, not because it cost a lot because all the sandwiches are under $10, but because they dont take checks or credit cards. Have enjoyed coming here for many years.

Author: PhatPatW
Review: Amazing sandwiches here!!! Couldnt believe the size for the price. This is the perfect lunch spot. I got a roadt beef sub and it was worth all of the $7 I paid. My wife got the Italian and it was also super good. I highly recommend to come in for lunch and get a sub.

Author: MdTravelerX2
Review: Whenever we are in the Roanoke area ("Passing through"), we stop at the New Yorker Deli. The meats are tender and freshly prepared. Good value for the money.

Author: Carol4802
Review: From the crumbling parking lot, to the unswept and littered exterior and then entering this long standing Roanoke favorite that hasnt seen an upgrade since it was built, our expectations were hopeful that the food and service would remain great. But that wasnt to be. There were almost no other customers at the dinner hour on a Friday evening. The service was horrible and the management didnt seem to care when it was brought to their attention. The food was decent but all of the other negatives made our experience one that made us agree that we wouldnt go back. Very sad.

Author: Duey J
Review: The first order after being out of state for 2yrs was awful. It didnt have all the toppings and no pickle slice. I tried it 1 more time this evening and normally Id have enough meat for lunch the next day but not this time. They have always been affordable and my advice would be keep the meat and raise the price. Idk if its changed hands or what but its not what it used to be. They still have the best cheese cake in town but Im disappointed at the quality and quantity. I would give it a try if I hadnt been raised here but its nothing like before. They should give Boars Head a try also.

Author: walkntall509
Review: We love this place! We live within walking distance. They have great weekly specials. We love the wings, burgers, and sandwiches so far. They have a great alcohol selection. Kelly is our favorite server. Cant wait to go back again and try other menu items.

Author: AleciaLester
Review: The burgers here are fantastic. The drink choices are very good and the service is spot on. We went here with friends after a hockey game and enjoyed the live band and good food.

Author: pita231
Review: Best burgers in Roanoke. Taste straight off the grill without the "brick" factor. Others have raved about the ribs as well. Service is always great and the blue cheese tuna fondue appetizer is beyond delicious. Can't really go wrong here

Author: 801joef
Review: Thursday night taco at Martinis. You cant miss it! Fresh and delicious! Plus the staff is sooooo friendly! Amazing beer selection and the menu will blow you away! Entertainment at 9pm. Just a great place to eat drink and relax!!!

Author: atasteofcreole
Review: Our server took our order w/o writing it down and got it good. Disappointed that I was charged extra for a boiled egg as the salad that had one was LESS than the salad I ordered.Food okay nothing to exciting or memorable.

Author: MollysVoice
Review: For a nice dinner or just to hang with friends or even just to pop into for a drink, we thought this place was pretty neat. All 5 of us! Dinner was yummy. Service was quick. Our waitress was nice and visited often to check on us. The variety of foods chosen were all great! Not a single complaint.

Author: VickBurg
Review: First time visit to Roanoke! What a true gem tonight! Loved the whole experience!Food, Waitress, Cleanliness, Drinks, Music...Disco Risqu, were amazing! Thank you guys for a great night:)

Author: sherricollins101
Review: The food is amazing, the prices are very good for what you get. Tacos on Thursday, half price burgers on Monday - try the Southern Belle - it is out of this world! Coldest beer in town! Late nights and weekends they provide the best live music in town.Jason - the owner does a wonderful job! Bartenders, greeters and wait staff are some of the best in Roanoke.

Author: gypsy_kitchen473
Review: They have such variety! We ate like pigs! We tried so many different options, and everything was great! We will definitely stop by again!

Author: KathleenO52
Review: The bison burger with sausage was cooked to perfection and served on rye. The downtown sub with peppers was delicious!Doughnut bread pudding with ice cream was a sweet ending to our lunch. Let summer begin!

Author: B0bEvans
Review: Good Food, Good Service, Fast Service, Reasonable Prices, Great Atmosphere. You can't go wrong here if you are looking for pizza or sandwiches.

Author: Matthew M
Review: We went to Lews for the first time and were hoping for the best. We got the worst. We waited over an hour and a half for a sandwich and a small pizza. The sandwich was supposed to be hot and was barely lukewarm. The pizza was wet and only mildly appetizing. I can't tell you enough to stay away from this place. The saving grace was the attentive and apologetic waitress.

Author: stephensG7243PV
Review: Outstanding food and price. Everything on the menu is great and the staff is tremendous. Highly recommend stopping in when in the Hollins area.

Author: Toonsquadmom
Review: Has the best chicken wings around too bad I didn't realize there was a lews on willamson i been going to sw which is just as good!!!!!

Author: Kevprichard
Review: Stopped in after work looking for food. I've eaten every place in the area, this is one of the best, I will certainly be back. I had a French dip with fries and some chili and everything was very good my service was good and my drink didn't go dry

Author: joe0277
Review: We stopped at Lews for dinner on a Monday night while we were in the Hollins area. As usual I picked a salad for dinner. It came out looking great. My wife had the mushroom Swiss burger and our daughter had the Broadway Joe BBQ sandwich. Our waiter, Brian, kept up with our drinks and was really great. We definitely plan on returning to try more of their local favorites!!

Author: russellh752
Review: Lew's is the go to restaurant for the best hamburgers in Roanoke. If you're traveling along I-81, take Exit 146 Hollins and follow the signs about 2 miles. The menu has many options, but the hamburgers are a sure fire bet. Lew's decor and wash rooms need an upgrade, but the food is tasty and served promptly by a friendly staff. Large screen TVs are always tuned into sports networks. Lew's is popular among locals, so the dining area is sometimes full at peak hours.

Author: Q7498YDrobertm
Review: The brick oven pizza here is very good and at a reasonable price. The staff is usually very attentive although the restrooms could definitely use some improvement. Parking usually isn't a problem however, if they are busy you might have to sit at a table instead of a booth.

Author: Steve L
Review: Stopped by for a quick lunch. Service was fast and pleasant. Good variety of menu choices. I ordered the tavern Burger which was very well prepared. My only criticism would be the use of an over easy egg as opposed to a hard fried. Other than that it was fantastic. The batter dipped fries are a showpiece and we're equally awesome. Prices are good. One thing they probably need to work on is updating the decor and a bit of renovation. The location is a bit run down. Other than that, I can highly recommend this for a quick lunch. And I do mean quick, I arrived at 1:15 and was in and out in 30 minutes. Couldn't ask for better.

Author: Passenger56927493107
Review: Lew's on Williamson Rd is a super good place to eat and socialize. I have not had anything that was not as expected. They have a Pizza Special on Tuesday evening and Sunday until 5 pm. I cannot say I love the crust but this special allows you to choose any or all of the toppings they offer, no limit. This more than makes up for the less than perfect crust. The crust is just too hard for my taste. I was there this evening with a neighbor. A couple walked by and stopped to ask if the pizza "was as awesome to eat as it was to look at". I had to answer "yes". Their salads are delicious and large with good ingredients, their burgers are mammoth and the beer battered french fries are some of the best around. I don't know why, but their sodas taste better than any I have had other places. They have opened a second location across town and hopefully it is just as good. Don't be surprised if you have to wait briefly for a booth or table. One negative is their restrooms which are old and small but usually clean.

Author: foxtail1
Review: Dinner was delicious! We shared an appetizer and each got an entree, and everything was good. The dumpling appetizer (Manto) was spicy and tasty. The entrees are very large servings, by the way.

Author: bronxempress
Review: This is a small, friendly restaurant on Roanoke's historic market. The food was way better than we expected, Everything was great: we had lamb shanks, which were tender and flavorful; beef kabob, also delicious. The soup and the potato and leek bread were the best things out of a table full of delicious food.This is my new go-to place.

Author: SightsandSnacks
Review: I was excited to finally visit Bamyan after hearing that and Afghan restaurant was in Roanoke. I went for the first time with family, and each of us tried something different. We started with bolanee gandana and bolanee kadu as appetizers. Both were delicious, and the homemade garlic yogurt was the perfect accompaniment. I had the qabuli as an entree, and it was seasoned very well. The raisins added the perfect hint of sweetness without taking away from the rest of dish. Even my step-father, who is not very adventurous food-wise, really enjoyed (and ate all of) the chicken breast kabob. Overall, the food was great and so was the service. Our waiter was friendly, attentive, and did not mind explaining some of the menu items when questions arose.

Author: Slimy
Review: Best meal of our trip to Roanoke. 1st experience with Afghan food. Great host/service. Chicken shami and lamb we're excellent. Even the simple brown rice was memorable.

Author: markmX1GX
Review: A unobtrusive front on the street in a row of international restaurants, we were drawn in by the fact that neither I or my traveling companion had ever experienced Afghan cuisine. We were met by Nawie- owner/proprietor, who is a gracious host offering generous explanations of the techniques and ingredients used to prepare the food. Their philosophy is simple; traditional dishes prepared in home-style fashion. We ordered combo 2. For the chicken breast kabob, the meat is ground and combined with a subtle blend of herbs with just a small touch of heat, then formed into textured strips (not patties or nuggets!), and braised or baked (forgot to ask) to a light brown outer shell to give the appearance of chicken kabob without a skewer..The lamb kabob is more familiar, chunks of meat with a dusting of the herbal mix and perfectly complimented with the seasoned brown rice and a side of chopped garden salad greens to cleanse the palate between bites. Perfect size plate, we did not walk away hungry, and both agreed we would be back with more friends in tow.Bamyan Restaurant.. Afghan cuisine (home style). Amazing!!!!!!!! Go try it, you will walk away a fan.

Author: Curious443280
Review: Lamb curry has spicy flavors with Long Finish. Excellent! Nawib was kind enough to answer the questions about curry and his country as well. We will go back soon!!

Author: STH2016
Review: I went there on the day it was open. They managed it well but was day one and i did take out. Few weeks Later I went and they were settled. Extremely courteous. All family run and make you feel like family as well. Restaurant is clean and well decor.Food quality and quantity both were wonderful. Over I give it 2 thumbs up and recommend it highly.

Author: Teresa R
Review: My husband and I were in Roanoke for a delayed Valebtine getaway. We found this wonderful Afghan restaurant with a gracious host. The meal was exquisite. Definitely a must visit in Roanoke.

Author: DanetteWH
Review: Our supper club enjoyed the hospitality of Nawib. He introduced us to the cuisine. We ate heartily and enjoyed our time in the restaurant. We'll be back!

Author: Michael B
Review: My wife and I stopped here for lunch while Christmas shopping downtown. This new restaurant had only been open about 3 months and is located only two doors down from a favorite of ours, Nawabs (Indian). Our lunch was delicious. The Afghan soup for $3.95 is a bowl of sumptuous flavor, almost a lunch in itself, served with Naan. We loved the unique seasoning. Our next course was the lamb curry. The portion was very generous and also delicious. We needed takeaway containers because it was more than we could finish. Next time we want to try the kabobs, a feature item of this Middle Eastern cuisine.

Restaurant: Wasena City Tap Room and Grill
Author: GregM_VA
Review: The location and outdoor seating are excellent. Service was also top notch. Sandwiches were good but nothing out of this world. Good selection of beers. The brownie dessert with ice cream was excellent and just too much food.

Restaurant: Wasena City Tap Room and Grill
Author: Jeff M
Review: Great food & drinks. Staff is friendly and attentive. Wood fired pizza oven and lots of beer on tap.

Restaurant: Wasena City Tap Room and Grill
Author: jankitt
Review: Husband and I went here with two other couples. We sat inside before the crowds arrived. Im not much of a beer drinker, but they had some VERY interesting flavors that were good! Husband and I got the pork and chicken taco plates. Both were very good and the two other couples enjoyed their orders. My favorite thing was the sweet potato fries. So crispy and sweet!!

Restaurant: Wasena City Tap Room and Grill
Author: revrpb619
Review: Nice enough place to hang out with the local crowd. Decent menu, but nothing outstanding as far as we (2) adults were concerned, the (4) college kids in tow loved the place.They do serve a thin crust pizza, which according to 2 of the kids, is pretty good. My fish tacos were just MEH. The crab cakes I was told, were very tasty, but did not have the expected crispy crust; nor were they hot, just warm.Good beer selection, friendly staff. Parking is a bit iffy.

Restaurant: Wasena City Tap Room and Grill
Author: aliciafurrow
Review: The order: The tortilla chips w/ salsa and side of cheese sauce, onion rings, and the grilled chicken tacos with a side of black beans and rice....let me start with the best- the chicken tacos: omg so delicious with the lime cilantro sauce .. they were soooo good ; chicken was tender. The onion rings were tasty; nice and thick cut rings... the part that makes this review 3 out of 5: the chips and salsa with the cheese sauce, the salsa tasted like it had been made with sugar- eww and the cheese sauce, this was an interesting item - I was expecting something on the nacho cheese side but instead recd some sort of thick jiggling substance... the taste was a mix of bland cheese wiz and something else I couldnt put my tastebuds to... super disappointed and something that should be so simple... couldnt eat either sauce after a couple of bites ... at least the tortilla chips were crunchy? Lastly, the black beans and rice... oh my... couldnt eat a full bite... so bland, no seasoning whatsoever... an item that was for sure not tasted before serving ....I would say this wasnt an experience that would turn me off to eating there again , but I know definitely what I will not order on the second go around. Pricing was ok... the tacos were big enough that I felt they were worth the price at least and will be on my list for next time.

Restaurant: Wasena City Tap Room and Grill
Author: WWSPENCER91
Review: I had high hopes for this place but unfortunately we were let down. We waited for a waiter to take our drink orders for over 20 min and it was a slow day. When we finally got our food the steak on the taco was so tough I couldnt even chew it. They also served them in uncooked tortillas. Such a let down, will try again, hopefully a better result.

Restaurant: Wasena City Tap Room and Grill
Author: Jerry O
Review: this local watering hole has enough beer choices to keep anyone happy. great burgers and a sunday brunch

Restaurant: Wasena City Tap Room and Grill
Author: jeax2
Review: Cool atmosphere and good food, especially the burgers. Salads are also really fresh and good, great dressings.

Restaurant: Wasena City Tap Room and Grill
Author: John S
Review: Excellent place to visit for lunch. Very good burgers, chicken club and a variety of tacos. Good beer selection, but haven't had many there due to lunches being on work days.

Restaurant: Wasena City Tap Room and Grill
Author: WesOrmond
Review: We had rented bikes from Roanoke Mountain Adventures next door and they recommended Wasena for lunch. After four hours of riding, we were ready for some good food and cold libations and they were good for both. They have a great selection of draft beers available and a good food selection. I had the Wilmer Bowl which is their pork chili served with sauteed veggies over rice. It was very good. My wife had the pork tacos which she liked as well.

Author: MarkA40
Review: Good food, good service, and good music at a god price! The food is good, except for the chili, and the prices are fair. Plus they have live music on Wednesday and Sundays when the weather is good!

Author: Steve L
Review: I am going to base this review on to visit. Our first visit was a lunch date where everything was pretty much spot-on. Food was done well service was great and everything was cooked to order. The second visit was pretty much the same thing. Service was good food was good with one exception. I ordered the prime rib sandwich which is a premium sandwich on their menu. For the most part it was well done except for a bit of an off flavor with the meat. It had a freezer burnt flavor. I can understand not having fresh prime rib available all the time but I would recommend not keeping it too long if you do intend to serve it Frozen. Definitely looked like it came out of the freezer and then was finished on a flat top. It wasn't quite bad enough for me to send it back but definitely noticeable enough that I would not order that sandwich again. Outside of that no complaints. Decor is kind of sports bar like and the location is clean and well-maintained.

Author: Gayleetro
Review: It had been years since we had been to the Brambleton Deli and we were looking for a good sub for dinner. We were seated very quickly but service was a bit slow. The restaurant appeared to be short staffed.The menu had not changed much so we were able to order our favorities. I chose the chicken salad plate with fruit. Hubby chose a cold cut sub. It took a while to get our dinner as there were several tables and booths with patrons and not enough staff to handle timely.The chicken salad was a disappointment. Very bland with not much taste at all. The tresh fruit was not that fresh. Hubby said the sub he got was just okay. After this visit, it may be another few years before we go back.

Author: Paul L
Review: Been eating here for a very long time. Always satisfied. Had the All American Burger. Can't go wrong.

Author: harrietws2017
Review: We are regulars here and I have never had a bad meal. It's wonderful! My husband always gets the BBQ and my favorites are the BD Special and the Smokehouse.

Author: Jay B
Review: So this is nothing more or less than your average sandwich place. A Great Deli it is not. Variety of sandwiches is OK and the bar is good. Service is fair with a bit of the hurry up thing going on. Nothing terribly special and nothing really bad. Oddly they do not have a tuna fish sandwich???????

Author: Vicki T
Review: Sandwiches and pizza are good! I have tried both. Excellent sweet potato fries! Service is good. A very friendly place.

Author: cjsm44
Review: We were out of towners visiting Roanoke for a swim meet, and a family member who lives in the area suggested we get lunch at Brambleton Deli. We placed the order online for pick up an hour and a half later. We received an email confirming our pick up time, and we arrived 10 min earlier than the time on the chance it might be ready. Nope. So we waited, which was fine. It was a busy Sunday. But the pick up time came and went. We had to ask 10 min later if it was ready. It was not. Finally 15 min after the confirmed time, they brought our food out. We had to ask for utensils. Then realized they forgot one of the sides but thankfully we checked before we left the lot. The hostess was rude when she brought me the side. No apology, nothing, not for the late order and not for the missing item. I wish I could have asked for the tip back that I had added when I ordered and paid online. My husband loved his Tuscan chicken pizza, and my bbq pork was good but I would have liked more bbq sauce. The French dip my son had was meh and we both thought the Cole slaw was absolutely tasteless and drycabbage with a splash of milk, seemingly. And of course no salt or pepper in the to go bag. Honestly, if this is the best Roanoke has to offer, I am sadly disappointed.

Author: Lpharis
Review: Good food, quick service, and even with the parking lot full, you'll get quick seating and service. A nice setting for friends and family, not raucous, but plenty of young people there to enjoy a casual delicious meal. Their barbque and ribs are noted.

Author: Hokiechip
Review: Stopped in on a Sunday afternoon. Greeted with a smile and overall service was good.My wife ordered a Roast Beef Sandwich which she said was good. I ordered a cheese pizza which was not great. Crust was burnt.

Author: Linda W
Review: Once again, while visiting in Roanoke, we planned dinner Saturday evening at 5pm with our kids and grandchildren. We were so happy to get a reservation so we knew we would have a table for the kiddos, and we love the cool calm back room. We got first class service from Hannah G, who was all over us, keeping us in drinks, keeping the table clear, quickly bringing as well as refilling their fabulous warm bread baskets with kind of pesto olive oil dip that I love! She was also accepting that we brought a McDonald's burger for the toddler since he wasn't up for their upscale kind. We again chose the family style meals, which come with a big salad plate for each entree, and I am not exaggerating, that the Caesar salad at Remini's is the BEST EVER! I was beyond amazed that my 18 month old grandson accepted pieces of that salad and ate 8 of them!! We love the fettucini alfredo chicken, and the chicken parmesan as entrees. There is always more than we can eat, and we take it home for the kids to take to work during the week. We always have a great experience at Remini's and keep returning!

Author: Jacqueline L
Review: Tables are close. The food, service and prices are very good. We expect to return often. There is a private party room and bar too.

Author: SpaceCaptain
Review: Lucky enough to discover this gem of a restaurant. Excellent food. I have now enjoyed various meals several times in the last few months with every meal top notch. Great drinks, good wine, and reasonably priced as well. Fun bartender. Large portions.Warning; They close early so check the serving times.

Author: N7176EYtimc
Review: Been over five years since Ive been back here. As always fabulous food great service friendly people outstanding service. Best meatballs Ive had. You will not leave hungry. But with a smile on your face And leftovers.

Author: hbhakh
Review: Remini's is one of our favorite restaurants in Roanoke. They have a nice menu (mostly Italian), large portions, and reasonable prices. We find the food to be very well prepared. My wife enjoyed the scallops special. I had stuffed flounder, which was very nice. The only disappointment were the glazed brussel sprouts, which were of the frozen variety.I'd suggest reservations (Opentable) as they get very busy.

Author: cgandgg1989
Review: Although we live in the area, we are creatures of habit and generally eat at the same restaurants. We wanted to try something different and I was very happy for that decision. I had the baked ziti and my husband had the chicken parmesan. The portions were huge! The food was great and we had a good server. Will definitely go back!

Author: hbhakh
Review: We had dinner with friends at Remini's. The food was great and the portions were huge. The pasta dishes could probably serve 2-3. The prices are very reasonable.We'll go back.

Author: Sean K
Review: local joint, with great food at great price. Kitchen is open area, so you can see what they prepare, adn service was great. Friendly staffs and casual dining area. They didn't have coors light, so limited selection of beers

Author: Linda W
Review: Visiting from out of town, and listened to our kids who recommended Remini's... an boy, were we glad! First, we were delighted that they took reservations!And we had THE BEST WAITRESS EVER! Jenn took fabulous care of us, welcomed us and the children with wonderful hot parmesan bread, which was to die for! She made recommendations about the family style portions, and how wonderful the Caesar salad was, and she usually doesn't like Caesar salads. There are family style dinners for $20.99 which is a large salad, soooo good, and a platter with pasta and entree for $20.99, listed for 2, but would feed 3, maybe 3.5. So we got two and tried both, the fettuccini Alfredo with chicken, and the Chicken Parmesan on pasta, plus meatballs. There was lot of xtra for the four adults, and our kids were excited to have lots leftover for lunches this week. Huge shout out again to Jenn for keeping us in drinks and every little thing. We were plenty full with no room for dessert. Highly recommend this gem!! Please see pics.

Author: Jay B
Review: My wife and I go here often and I enjoy most of the items on the menu. Their bread is fabulous. Prices are more than reasonable and the service is good. If I had one criticism it would be the variety of the menu. It needs more dinner options. Crowded at popular times.

Author: Sherrie F
Review: I booked Kabuki for a party of 8 for my oldest sons birthday party. It was unusually hot outside that day. We were seated in the side room to the right. Not in the big attractive left side. When we got in there it was miserably hot. They claimed it was too hot outside for their air conditioning to catch up. They stated that it was 80. My phone read 88. It was so hot that our ice melted in our drinks three times in the hour and a half that we were there. Thankfully we had a good waitress. By the time the food got there, I was hot, sweaty and nauseous. I didnt end up eating. There were other small issues but at the risk of sounding petty I wont mention them. The bottom line was that my sons birthday happens once a year and the dinner was miserable to sit through. And I spoke with multiple people and no one did anything about it. Nor did they offer to. I would not recommend this place. They simply did not care.

Author: leel407
Review: The theatrics of dinner outweigh the quality of food but still a good meal. I do not care for the sauces they provide for dipping but the rest if our party seemed to like them. Vegetables were plentiful and seemed fresh, contrary to some other reviews I have seen they weren't canned. The scallops were good and sweet. The steak (filet) had just a hint of teriyaki. Rice was good. I would like better chopsticks and rice in a bowl rather than a plate.

Author: carolesau
Review: My family went here for a graduation celebration dinner. Our chef wasn't super entertaining but he got all of our orders correct and cooked the food well.I love the ginger dressing they have but my salad was swimming in it. I should have asked for the dressing on the side.The broth they bring is good.I had shrimp and steak. There was plenty of each.I love the rice and they give you a LARGE serving of it.I don't eat the vegetables but they serve lots of those as well.Service was good.

Author: atallbird
Review: I walked in for dinner and was treated wonderfully, from the time I walked in the door, sat at the sushi bar, the sushi chef,as well as, the hostess went out of their way to make make me feel comfortable. The food portions were, well all I can say is that I could barely finish my mail which was a first, for a sushi bar. As for being a long way from the coast the fish was very fresh as well as the texture was excellent. So if you happen to be in this area please take the time to stop in say hello and have a wonderful meal, you will not be let down.

Author: nwnh40
Review: I was there for a friends birthday, I didn't like the bartender, I felt she was rude and tried to rush us to pick a drink. After seated with our party,there was not much of a show, he throw sauces everywhere. I think food took way to long to cook, I got rice first and vegetables which I guess were ok but my shrimp was overcooked but the scallop was perfect, I don't like the fact that you don't get your whole meal at the same time, by the time I got the shrimp I just wanted a box, I didn't like the ginger salad dressing or the soup. I think it's overpriced. I haven't been to this place in probably 5 years now I know why. The parking was bad had to circle four times.

Author: stephentQ9882WQ
Review: Not been here in a good while. Little on expensive side, well worth it once in a while. Great food I had filet and chicken and shrimp, and added Mushrooms. My wife had Chicken and shrimp. Both had all trimmings, rice, vegetables, soup to start. I recommend this place even though on expensive side its a great night out for all. Drinks also great finished off with a Makers mark over ice.

Author: nat86_13
Review: Great service for our 45th college reunion. We called a week ahead to make reservations! They seated us in a timely manner and we were especially pleased with our chef!

Author: jkkendrick
Review: Hadnt eaten here in years but it was just as good as I remembered. Service was great and there was no waiting from the time we placed our order until the food was being served.

Author: nomadicone2013
Review: Checked in with the hostess 5 minutes before our reservation time. After a half hour checked with the hostess who rudely insisted we had not checked in. After another check and another half hour we were finally seated. Another 10 minutes before a waitress arrived. Waitress was obviously overloaded but did an excellent job given the crowd. The manager was on the floor trying to help. Food quality and service has gone down since our last visit. Vegetables were mostly onions with a little zucchini. Noise was deafening. Time to find another Japanese steak house.

Author: Ingrid D
Review: It has been a tradition for my grandson to want dinner at Kabuki for his birthday. Our family of 11 joined together for the meal. The chef was very friendly and could flip shrimp and he started a fire in a ring of onions. The meals were delicious and everyone needed a to go box. They even gave my grandson a birthday cake and sang the birthday song.A dinner well deserved and enjoyed.Ingrid D

Author: DrD0ugH
Review: Our tour group stopped here on a Saturday night and it fantastic. The people were friendly and the food was great. It is unbelievable the variety and amount of food. Great lace to eat.

Author: keith c
Review: Our party all fancied different food so thought Golden Coral would be a good option. We are used to Orlando Golden Corals but this seemed a better set up and a bit more restauantee than a fast food outlet. It was clean and tidy. Food was hot and varied and of course they are always reasonably priced. Keith C

Author: JimF592
Review: We stopped to eat on the way home from a trip to DC. This is an old restaurant, it was not clean and the staff was not happy people. I found that there was food I normally expect at Golden Corral like corn and carrots they did not have. Many of the dishes looked old like it had sat out all day. We were there at the height of dinner around 7 PM. Overall it was not a good eating experience I wouldnt recommend going to this restaurant.

Author: luvs2dive
Review: Many choices of items, pre made and made on request. Hot and plentiful variety to satisfy any tastes.

Author: Daryl S
Review: better to go at lunch depends on the day and time if it's a feeding trough or not but the food is much beter these days

Author: bandittef
Review: Enjoy eating here when i'm not sure of exactly what I want. There is a vast variety of foods available. All I've tasted has been good and the breakfast bar is open all day. Pork steaks are wonderful. Roast beef is good when they have it. Servers are attentive and helpful.

Author: Hungrystupidbear
Review: This Golden Corral is great a lot of varieties of food and desserts. It was really clean and server was fast to make sure we had everything we needed.

Author: 241bbqfoodguru
Review: What can I say, impressed with the selectuon of foods and most were really good. The steak is cooked to order. The squash, brussel sprouts were reallt good. Some of the pastries were a bit dried out. It appears that everyone that visits this place forgets how ro dress in public. And everyone brings the kids so its a bit loud and crowded. The waitress we had was excellant.

Author: saltshaker2
Review: Not the best today Service was good. They do have a variety of foods on bar. A good selection of desserts

Author: Hokiechip
Review: Stopped in for a Monday night dinner. Plenty of choices on the buffets including a HUGE dessert bar. Friendly, attentive service.

Author: Savyluncher
Review: Hubby, cousin and I visited Thai Oudone Valley Grill Friday February 22.Hubby had the Happy Family, Cousin Had Gen.Tao Chicken (prepared in a sweeter sauce than she was used to but very good), and I was served the Pineapple shrimp/chicken Thai fried rice. Everything was very good and well prepared.It is amazing how organized the two operators are, with phone orders walk in orders and dine in service.Try it I am sure you will be back for more enjoyable food.

Author: Kevprichard
Review: Stop here after work looking for some good food. I like Thai food it's light and warm. My service was very good as was the food. My spring rolls were wonderful. I'll go back

Author: Debra H
Review: I ordered spring rolls and the Shrimp in Lobster sauce for Valentine's Day for my Son.WOW! Seriously delicious! EXCELLENT Thai food! I will ABSOLUTELY return here! Food has really good energy and was just exceptional..

Author: 542krisd
Review: Had this restaurant recommended to me and so glad that I gave it a try. Very helpful staff with spot on recommendations. Food was fresh and every dish I have had so far has been great!

Author: Wesley R
Review: Tucked in beside a gas station along a busy road is Thai Oudone. We tried with reservation and were pleasantly surprised. The food is fresh cooked to order. The proprietor is friendly and will gladly adjust the recipe to your taste. Portions are huge - so be prepared to take home. Inside the restaurant is small - decorated in 1990s diner style. We highly recommend giving it at try!

Author: mwdesignphotography
Review: OK business 101 location location location! This prevented me from going there a lot. it is attached to a gas station and hair salon! However, I am so glad I finally stopped! A husband and wife team that brings the daughter in once and a while to run the register! The food is on point with fresh ingredients and the flavor is amazing! They will help you navigate the menu and spice levels. Everything is made to order and honestly AUTHENTIC as one can be outside of the Asia! Do not pass it up or judge it by it's cover you will be missing out!

Author: shereethomas1
Review: The food is absolutely delicious, and the staff are attentive and friendly. The portions are very generous, and there is a wide selection to choose from. This will be our new go to Thai spot!

There were two of us for dinner, and we had used the reviews on Trip Advisor to decide on this restaurant. We could not have found this location if we didn't have a GPS. However, the food was delicious and there was plenty of it. We ordered two spring rolls as an appetizer. It was enough for four servings. We also ordered Pho, which is a hearty soup, and Panang Curry. I ordered it mild, but it came a little spicy. Next time I will order it without any hot pepper flakes. My husband had a glass of iced tea. We had to leave our leftovers, as we are traveling. Our check came to $29.00, which included the tax. Please note, this is a tiny restaurant, with maybe five tables. Not sophisticated but wonderful food. We will return.

Author: Aaron Q
Review: I've eaten at Thai Oudone several times, now, both inside and takeout. Thai Oudone differs from the other, several Thai restaurants in the area in that it feels more like a takeout Chinese restaurant when you go inside. It lacks that dim, ornate atmosphere that most Thai restaurants have. And, yeah, that can be important to a dining experience for special occasions. But I eat Thai food enough that I'm really just concerned about two things 1) the quality of the food, and 2) having decent staff in the restaurant if I'm eating in. That said, Thai Oudone staff has always been polite and attentive, which I cannot always say for staff at at leats one other Thai restaurant in the area, which I stopped eating at because of their staff on repeat visits. I almost always get a curry dish, usually red curry. What Thai Oudone seems to excel at is getting "spicy" right! Their "hot scale" runs from 1 to 5, which is much better than a limited two-pepper icon on a traditional Thai menu or otherwise trying to communicate, subjectively, how spicy you want. Having a 1 to 5 scale means they are used to a varying degree of spiciness and standardize it in a way that repeat customers can easily accustom themselves to. Keeping heat in mind, I have never gone above a 3, and I like spicy food! I won't say that everytime I've ordered a 2 or something between a 2 and a 3 that it's exactly the same, but I can say I've pushed my enjoyability level with a 3 before and don't care to go beyond it. Portion sizes are also good, which is something very important to me. There is a Thai restaurant in walking distance from me that I don't eat at anymore because I always leave feeling hungry after cleaning my plate. At Thai Oudone, I almost always have leftovers. And in my opinion, Thai food is one of the few foods that not only taste good the next day but often somehow tastes better! Their Thai menu is smaller than other Thai restaurants in the area, I think, but they compensate that with a Chinese-food section and a Laos section. So, they have a little more than just Thai food or did last time I looked at a menu (I usually just order without looking).Their prices tend to be just a bit lower than traditional sit-down Thai restaurants, from my experience, and they don't skimp on the food. When I/we order from here, it's usually takeout. I don't do takeout at other Thai restaurants for some reason. I guess this place is set up for it and comes across like they intend for a lot of take out business. Certainly their dining area is small and limited, so if they are busy and you wish to dine inside, seating might be hard to come by. However, I've yet to not get a seat in there nor have I had to wait to be seated as of yet. I believe they are closed on Mondays, which is typical of other Thai restaurants, as I recall. Don't drive out without being sure they are open.
