These type of restaurants also tend to close for family-related things or during vacations, so if you're driving more than several minutes for your first time and are planning on eating in, since it's a bit out of the way (near Botetourt), it can't hurt to call and be sure they are open, though chances are they would be.

Author: saynotoplastic
Review: My family of 5 were surprised to find this restaurant in Cloverdale. There are not a lot of places that serve Laotian food, so we were delighted to see that on the menu in addition to the more popular Thai food. The food was very good, and this is coming from someone who has traveled to Southeast Asia repeatedly..... Can't wait to go back again!

Author: psudino
Review: I enjoy the slow-food movement but Local Roots takes the flavor to a whole new level. The items to choose from here are mouthwatering. I couldn't decide between a few and the waiter came over and very confidently said, "Get the turkey, best thing on the menu tonight." Glad I took his advice.Besides the main course the Charcuterie board was fantastic, pairing the main with wonderful sauces and dips. The salad, which I normally find boring, was anything but, with leaves that are so green they looked picked minutes before we ate.Overall, this was an outstanding experience and one of the better meals that I've had.

Author: fwinei
Review: We were in southern Virginia and saw that Yelp had given this establishment great reviews. Having just come out of the woods after a few days, we were ready for a quality meal. We sat outside on a cute neighborhood block. Abraham greeted us with water, THANKFULLY.. it was a rough hike out, and after a quick orientation, we ordered a local wine. After asking his opinion, he directed us to a different white wine, with explanation, and then we knew we were in good hands. We ordered the oysters, which were Rappahannock (from the Chesapeake bay) with peach and ginger mignonette... delightful, especially with the Virginia Albario! (His reco- and 1/2 price wine happy hour)We then had the pork belly BLT with cucumber Aioli and Kennebec potatoes- which Abraham explained why these local potatoes were important to the fry world. We finished off with the flat bread of the day with turkey confit, potatoes, squash, local micro greens... kale, too. We asked for his reco on a red- he brought us a Sangiovese from Umbria- excellent pairing! The food is all locally sourced and well prepared, the ambiance was friendly and warm and the service from Abraham was exquisite. I asked a lot of questions and he answered them with patience and added value to the answers. We learned about the oysters, the local Virgina wine scene, and he even recommended a hiking/ camping spot that we will check out in the near future. Overall an excellent experience.

Author: nataliecoxcritiques
Review: got taken here by some family members who wanted to show us the best places to eat in Roanoke, and this was IT. really good, fresh food and lovely wine

Author: KeithD16
Review: The attention to detail was evident in every plate. The local oysters with a peach mignonette were the perfect size and let the true oyster flavor shine. Then the charcuterie plate was the perfect app to share while conversing. All kinds of special gems on it like picked peppers and home made pickles, with the chicken livers being the best. The two entrees, scallops and grouper were perfectly cooked with light sauces and vegetables. The menu is limited but that probably helps with the freshness and quality. Silver our server did a solid job with service, and we saw all the staff work well as a team. The restaurant is fairly small, so I would recommend reservations.

Author: 106AnnH106
Review: We enjoyed our food very much. We had gazpacho as an appetizer that we shared was absolutely delicious with wonderful depth of flavor. The gnocchi were large but tender, with delicious flavor. The scallops were slightly under cooked but the presentation was gorgeous and the blend of flavors was delicious. Service was good.

Author: Alice W
Review: Pleasant wait staff and they guide you through there farm to table menu. They are genuinely proud of the unique food they serve. We had the vegetable salad and heirloom tomatoes with burrata for appetizers and the roast chicken and day scallops for entrees. Each selection was prepared very well. They have an extensive wine list and the deserts are visual and taste masterpieces.The wait staff was knowledgeable and courteous.

Author: RFWDGduo
Review: We go here a lot because the food has never disappointed. The creations are all made with fresh, local ingredients. Simple and unique such as the muscles in a whiskey and bacon broth. Best Ive ever had. The wine list is excellent, local craft beers, excellent waitstaff and a chill ambiance.

Author: tarpon_and_bones
Review: On the small side so reservations are a good idea. Very pleasant wait staff and they guide you through there farm to table menu. They are genuinely proud of the unique food they serve. Wife had a wonderful Fettucini Dish which she enjoyed down to the last forkful. I had their Charcuterie board which is a surprise show of various cheeses and meats. It even had course ground mustard they make in house. They have an extensive wine list and the deserts are visual and taste masterpieces.

Author: johncD6774BF
Review: Went to Local Roots for dinner with my wife on a Tuesday at 5:30. It was bustling even on a weekday at this early hour. We had the vegetable salad and heirloom tomatoes with burrata for appetizers and the roast chicken and day scallops for entrees. Each selection was prepared very well. The wait staff was knowledgeable and courteous. Prices ranged from $$-$$$.

Author: GMAS11
Review: Well the food is very good it is very small small portions with a very high price. Appetizer size is the dinner. I ordered a fish the full fish thats what I got what I did not get was any sides. My husband ordered a scallop dinner. He got THREE scallops and again no sides. Very disappointed. Not worth the price.

Author: fodiddymom
Review: My family and I visit this restaurant once or twice a month. The past visit or 2, we have noticed quite a bit of fruit flies. Tonight, in particular, I couldn't take a bite of my food without fighting a fly. Therefore, I requested to move. The table we sat at was better but was still bothered by fruit flies. As I sit, I see other customers bothered by them too.

Author: sluns08
Review: We were looking for a good local spot for dinner and I asked the staff at Holiday Inn - Civic Center. They mentioned Alejandro's. I'm so glad we choose this place!! Everyone loved their food. The salsa bar was excellent. Definitely returning on our next trip to Roanoke.

Author: coachgt
Review: Do not get takeout from this place. You have been warned! They do not have designated people working the register so even if your food is ready you will have to wait until others are seated so you can pay.They obviously dont care about takeout either. I ordered simple grilled shrimp tacos and they were horrible. Shrimp was over cooked, ingredients were missing, and the taco shells were in crumbles.This will be the last time I eat here inside or takeout!

Author: Paul L
Review: Been wanting to eat here for years now and have finally gotten around to it--and thank God! Alejandro's is not the best Mexican bistro in town, but it is pretty good. I had Carnitas, chunks of pork braised in a house special marinade. Served with grilled green onions, lime, red rice and refried beans, and it was so tender and juicy, absolutely delicious!

Author: tangofxf
Review: This location is close to I-81, VA, in Roanoke/Hollins. After a road trip, stopped overnight. Looking for a descent meal in the area and came up with Alejandros. Service was good, food was descent. It boasts California style Mexican fare. We are not used to California style Mexican fare. For the price, $8.99 for two enchiladas, with rice, beans, cant complain. Margaritas, not as good. I would not order them again. Happy hour they offer medium sized Margaritas for $4.00 each. Overall, not a bad spot for a quick meal at fair prices

Author: glenm586
Review: When we are in Roanoke, we always make time to stop in for a bite. The place is always busy, but the food is great. They have a large selection of dipping sauces for your chips, not just the little bottle of salsa you normally get. The downtown area has many places to eat all within an easy walk, but this one is worth stopping in if you like good Mexican food

Author: USNA1981
Review: First time here - I am in heaven! Special of the day was an enchilada dish, slight heat, perfectly seasoned, fresh avocado and veggies; couldn't be better. Hubby loved his Arroz con Cameron equally. Quick and friendly service, excellent food and drinks - we will be back

Author: spierce64
Review: Family of 5 went on a Thursday night. Light crowd. Good but not great service. It is the food that works here. A great salas bar with at least 10 different options. Ambiance is fair so dont expect too much. But the food is worth it. Everyone got exactly what they wanted and everything was really good. I had the enchiladas supreme and the pork carnitas enchilada was tender and sweet. My wife had chimichangas that werent quite traditional but great. Stop by here!

Author: NaniPops
Review: Stopped in for quick lunch while traveling. Tasty $5 lunch specials. Recommend shredded beef chimichangas and red rice. Fun to sample variety on the unique Salsa Bar. We'll be back!

Author: Mothersita
Review: It seems that is a family business, nice ambiance for family. The place was clean and we liked the salsa bar. Tortilla chips with the white sauce was a great choice. Our server was very good at explaining the choices.

Author: patiencein03
Review: I used to love Fork in the Alley, but the lack of cleanliness in the outdoor dining space our last few visits have me looking for another place to eat. This visit was spur of the moment and we thought we would give it another try.The pizza was hot and delicious, as always, but the tables were not wiped off and the floor was gross.

Author: Desiree626
Review: Came here for lunch with friends and we all had something different. I had a pimento cheese burger, one had a Chicago dog, and the other a pizza. All were delicious. Large selection of draft and bottled beverages and a full bar. A very enjoyable afternoon.

Author: Go567289
Review: We arrived after lunch on Saturday. We had to wait to be seated because the hostess was MIA. Once he did seat us he was apologetic for the place being a mess. Unfortunately we we were seated outside because there was no inside space available.Our waitress came and took our drink orders and then we waited for our food ... and waited ... and waited. We ordered burgers and finally 50 minutes later our food arrived. Once the food arrived so did the flies. The waitress seen how bad they were and said so sorry there is nothing I can do about it. The food was only mildly warm which made the wait time more frustrating. We nibbled our food and left. We wanted to enjoy the food not fight the flies. Overall a big let down from start to finish.

Author: Mike O
Review: We stopped by for a few beers on Taco Tuesday, when tacos are priced at $3.00 each. Three taco choices were offered, so we ordered all three. All were mediocre; a few basic ingredients with little seasoning or flavor. These days, in Roanoke, their are a couple of relatively new and delicious places to eat tacos; Tucos Taco Lounge and Cabo Fish Taco are two that pack their tacos with full flavor. I don't see much of a reason to return to Fork in the Alley beyond the beer.

Author: JM0330
Review: The majority of the seating is outside so be aware no a/c except at bar stools. Good pizza and Caesar salad. LOTS of flies which is really unappetizing. Service was only ok this time... We do like it there but wish they could address the flies and get some more airflow

Author: Jodi307
Review: We stopped here for lunch and loved everything about it. The service, the atmosphere and the pizza were all excellent. The menu had lots more options besides pizza too...burgers, hot dogs, salads, sandwiches. Great spot.

Author: O4480QBmariem
Review: Met a friend at Fork in the Alley to catch up.The outside part near the street was loud and for the smokers.We sat outside under the awning, table and chairs need to be maintained. We moved places and then fixed the table at the next table. Food was good snd service was excellent. Pizza and salad a must!

Author: my3Grans
Review: Recommended by a friend who said the pizza was outstanding. It definitely was greatfresh ingredients and plenty of toppings and cheese. Also loved the burger. Service was excellent. We ate outsidegreat for toddlers.

Author: patiencein03
Review: I have mixed feelings about our visit. It seems to alwayyyys be extremely loud (i.i, not conducive to a couple talk). That sside, everything seemed dirty this visit. The table was sticky and the chairs were crumby. The area around the table had food around it... The food itself was good, not great. The service wss mediocre. I am hoping it was just an "off" night. Will will try it at least one more time.

Author: Leona R
Review: We discovered this great dinning venue last August when my husband was a patient at the hospital and walked there several times from the hospital. The food was delicious and the service was exceptional. We had to return to the hospital this February for a week and again ate here several times. Just a neat little restaurant with delicious food very close to the hospital.

Author: Travelinglizarded
Review: Always yummy even when we get it togo and drive back home. The sake is always great and the sushi an excellent choice showing good taste and flair

Author: lcl50
Review: Best dish is shrimp lo mein! We've tried other dishes and they are usually good. Sushi not up to son's California taste but was OK he said. Service is usually good but there are some times when it is slow--usually when they are NOT busy. We eat there from time to time as it is in the same plaza as grocery shopping.

Author: ExploreExperienceEat
Review: I have been eating in and ordering to go on regular basis for the last two years and for the most part always excellent service and food.

Author: Explorer04081868533
Review: My family has dined at and picked up many orders here in the past. Tonight, the (mostly teenage) staff was completely rude to my husband, and withheld our order, because we couldnt list every single item we ordered, phone number on file, and credit card. The rude staff argued with my husband for a long time, and our food was cold by the time we got the food home. Definitely the last time we will dine here.

Author: Kori D
Review: We stopped here on our way home from D.C. Our kids said it was better sushi than what we had in a pretty fancy place in DC. Cafe Asia exceeded our expectations and rolls are B1G1 through Nov 30!

Author: MMM_and_MPM
Review: Having been on the road over a week we were craving Asian food. This restaurant seemed like a good bet with Sushi, Japanese, Chinese, and Vietnamese foods all available. We dined on Summer Rolls, Seaweed Salad,Miso Soup, Shumai Soup, a Salmon Cucumber Maki Roll and a Four Treasures entree with 4 proteins. Glasses of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay were great accompaniments. We left very full and happy with the quality and selection of our dining choices.

Author: ftice59
Review: My wife and I are traditionally country food eaters what we decided to try Cafe Asia I was very surprised with a flavor and the freshness of their sushi I would not say I would eat it everyday but I enjoyed what I ordered. Thanks to Cafe Asia this old country boy got to try something different

Author: Kim C
Review: I can't say enough about this restaurant. We eat at Caf Asia frequently. We take our family here/meet here, just my husband and I also we get take out. The sushi in my opinion is the best in the Roanoke Valley. All of their other dishes are hot, tasty and the staff is friendly and attentive, eager to serve you. My husband does not like sushi in general so he always gets a hot dish. I personally have tried most of their options including their soups. We like this restaurant so much they we have made it a family tradition to eat here every Christmas Eve after church. If you like Asian food can't go wrong here.

Author: apa028
Review: Food as always was wonder but the wait staff seem not very knowledgeable on menu items. They were very slow for a very empty restaurant. The real gotcha moment is the huge buy one get one sushi for equal or lessor value for free. Welllllllll let me tell you this is for only certain dates. So just FYI watch the small print. Lunch for five was seventy five. Not a real lunch deal. That being said they probably lost a regular customer due to the sign shenanigans.

Author: wvjake
Review: I started with summer rolls, husband spring roll, grandson (our sushi gourmet at age 11 - he's been to Japan) sashimi. Then Miso soup and Seafood soup. Then salmon and tuna sushi, Rainbow Rolls, Ebi and Fall Roll (tempura shrimp with a spicy sauce etc.) Absolutely first rate across everything. They also have a full bar. Service was excellent, we got there early but by the time we left, the place was filling up (it was a Sunday).

Author: Q3194XBrebeccap
Review: What a delightful day to try this restaurant. The weather was delightful so we could dine on the patio. And the food - oh my, how delicious, freshly prepared and nicely presented.

Author: rivahrydah
Review: On our daughters recommendation my wife and I had breakfast here this week. Both of us had one of the eggs Benedict dishes. Mine was on a croissant the size of a small football and hers was on a plate of hash browns. The hollandaise sauce was unbelievable! This is not an ordinary breakfast joint. If you are looking for a really good bakery and some uniquely prepared dishes, dont miss this place!!

Author: LishaRVA
Review: Visiting from out of town and looking for a quick lunch. Loved the name of the restaurant! The chicken salad was so yummy. My Mother, who is picky with food, ordered the salmon salad and loved it! Very relaxing! Great service! Would go back if in the area again.

Author: Q6399AIlesliel
Review: On my way from Ga to upstate NY. Got off the highway and drove here to have breakfast. Got the Virginia breakfast. Basically eggs bacon toast and potatoes. All done just the way I asked. Since this is also a bakery all breads made here. I had the Portuguese sweet bread. It was light with a hint of sweetness very nice. If I pass through Roanoke at meal time I will be back. For all you vegetarians they have chooses as well.

Author: John T
Review: My wife and I were visiting relatives in Roanoke this past weekend. So, as a small gesture of appreciation we took my wife's sister and husband to Our Daily Bread. My wife and I had not had Eggs Benedict in some time so we both ordered the same. 'This' was Eggs Benedict like we never had before. The eggs were the freshest I've ever eaten and cooked to absolute perfection. I've never had butter that tasted this creamy before. Instead of an English Muffin the restaurant serves this dish with the eggs and Canadian bacon sitting on half a freshly in house baked croissant. The other half I buttered with some of the fabulous butter they use for cooking their meals (simply delicious!). And, the Hollandaise Sauce was like the rest of the meal, superb! I ordered tea with my meal and selected an African medley of flavors. Like everything else it was great. All four of us really enjoyed eating at this cozy restaurant.

Author: timmL4364IW
Review: This used to be our go to spot for after church but then we moved across town and kind of forgot about it. Went again today and remembered all the things we loved about it in the first place. Completely revamped menu from when we were here for brunch last but still have all of the amazing pastries to choose from. Try it out. You wont be disappointed.

Author: Jackson1028
Review: We have eaten here several times and have never been disappointed. Their omelettes and croissants and probably everything on the menu are fantastic. The service is also excellent especially for the crowds they have. Highly recommend!

Author: Jay B
Review: A little place you might not notice, this restaurant is one of the best in outlying Roanoke. Been here on numerous occasions and have never regretted it. They have a lot of bakery items for sale all of which I would put in the good category. Dinner items on the menu are in the fabulous and innovative category. I love this place and you will too. Prices are reasonable, service is good.

Author: Lpharis
Review: Our Daily Bread in Roanoke VA has steadily improved since coming under new management. It is truly a gourmet eatery disguised as an unpretentious neighborhood place. Breads, salads, soups and entrees are excellent, and there are tempting take-aways to bring home or as gifts. Both my husband and my book club friends adore the place.

Author: 00Treasure
Review: Our favorite restaurant for breakfast. Designed in a French and European fashion you look at menus first, order, pay and then take your seat. The flow of the restaurant moves quickly and easily so there are very few times you may be waiting for a table and even then not for very long. Food is wonderful. Great variety on the menu. Everyone is very friendly and helpful. And if you are looking for a restaurant that makes authentic French crepes then this is the place. Not to be missed.

Author: sfw1956
Review: Had a bad experience at one of this chains resturants. Left and came to this Macados and had a great experience. Great food and service.

Author: Hetuck45
Review: Food was excellent but restaurant was hard to find (second floor of retail building). Needs cleaning

Author: aliciafurrow
Review: It has been years since the last visit, and there has been a change.. for the good! Looks like brand new staff that actually works and pays attention to the guests... finally!!!!! few new items to the menu... but the classics are still as good as I remember ... they switched from Pepsi to Coke products which was a great decision. Hopefully the experience we had today will continue on for future visits!

Author: rl3b
Review: At Macado's you always get great priced food and drinks. The food and drinks are really good and they have awesome portions in their foods for sure.

Author: Scuba-Obsession
Review: I heard a lot about this place, so I had to try it out. The sandwich menu is amazing. So many choices. I ended up having one on an everything bagel. It was very good! Great flavor.Service was OK. Nothing special. Server did her job.One of my concerns is my allergies went crazy. I don't know if it was something in the air or what, but my sinuses went nuts. They did clear after about 15 minutes after I left. I don't know why... I didn't see anything obvious.

Author: Nalabean
Review: Come on people! Clean up your restaurant! Its dirty and your awnings are falling apart! I would think the owner would take a look and do it better!

Author: Jay B
Review: Atmosphere is OK and the waiter was friendly. Ordered a hot pastrami on rye, one of my longtime favorites. Simply put the sandwich was disgusting. More fat and gristle than meat. I opened the thing up and picked off the fat etc. as best I could and ate what little was left. When I told the waiter about it he said he'd heard it before. So, are they trying to kill their customers? Maybe some of the other sandwiches are OK but they won't get any more of my money trying them out. I would avoid this place like the plague.

Author: aneishar2016
Review: Got some wings as usual. Always get the mango habanero. Love it! Love that macado always drinks special at the bar and the prices are reasonable.

Author: Bill H
Review: We've eaten here many time & it's always good. Went by yesterday and the Reuben's were the special. I love Reuben's but for some reason had never tried them here. Well, I won't make that mistake again - THEY ROCK!!Angelo is an excellent server as well, keeping my thirst quenched with some tasty cold Shock Top's and converting my fries to 'chili cheese"!

Author: LoriB2571
Review: I called in a lunch order and picked it up at 11 a.m. on a Wednesday. Service was excellent, and my lunch was ready when I was told it would be. I got back to my office and found that the $10 I paid was not enough for the wrap I got to actually have the bacon on it, as the menu describes. Fruit salad smelled SOUR, so I didn't eat it. The last time I got carryout here, I got a Stogie, which was also SANS bacon! This review gets two stars b/c of the service I received. Otherwise, a zero, and I'm done with this place.

Author: brendashaw
Review: Had lunch here after visiting the Transportation Museum. Food was over the top. The truffle fries are a must.

Author: bbg130
Review: We ate Sunday brunch there. Brunch is a special menu and not a buffet. The sausage biscuits and gravy was tasty. The veggie quiche was ok. Seems the pastry is a premade frozen variety, not crisp or tasty. The filling was ok though. The muffin of the day - banana - that came with the quiche was tasty though. Not being from Roanoke or college football fans we learned, Beamer is a former football player and coach for VA Tech.

Author: Sean K
Review: more like restaurant, modern setting and good food and great selection of beers. foods are mainly burgers, pizza and salad, but healthy side setting. nice place to be, but parking is a bit tricky

Author: rachelj555
Review: Nice variety on the menu. My husband had the pork burger and really liked the combination of flavors. Waiter was friendly. Went on a Monday around 1pm and there was plenty of seats available. Looks like they have outdoor seating when the weather is warmer. Even though the place had a sports bar vibe, it wasn't covered in TV's. The bar had several in a row, but in the dining area they were spaced apart.

Author: cbentley4
Review: My wife and I ate here after the Roanoke hockey game. The food was great and there were plenty of beer options. It was just the place that we were looking for. Wait staff was very pleasant, as well. Might be our new go-to spot in Roanoke.

Author: ExploreExperienceEat
Review: The best burgers in Roanoke!! Wonderful place to socialize... around a blazing fire outside. Great staff and food.

Author: Go567289
Review: We decided to try Beamers after church. The hostess was very cheerful when we entered the restaurant. We were seated quickly and got our drinks. We decided to start with Irish nachos and wow! They were delicious! Even after we got our meal we kept nibbling on the nachos. We both got burgers because they seem to be a popular item. Overall they were good. We will be back to try other menu options. This is a popular place downtown. Plenty of alcohol choices. Great outside seating area also.

Author: patiencein03
Review: We enjoyed our Irish Nachos and burgers Saturday night. I would have liked to have had an ample amount of guacamole on my Mayan. It was scarcely wiped into the bun and I had to open the sandwich to see if they forgot it. Part of the experience is to enjoy sandwiches that one cannot get anywhere else. Why skimp on ingredients? I did not notify management; I am just explaining why I am leaving 4 stars instead of 5 stars.

Author: Julie M
Review: We shared a dee-lish club sandwich mid-afternoon and requested unseasoned chips -- oh, my stars -- they were fabulous! Came out still warm and so crispy and tasty. I'm not even a potato chip person, and I could eat those every day. Friendly and helpful server. Looks like they have quite a good selection of beer.

Author: Hwb813
Review: Group of eight for Sat lunch!! Food was so delicious and service was awesome.wings portables sandwich and other items all were great and a perfect ending was the fried Oreo dessert we shared!!!

Author: SpaceCaptain
Review: Nothing special, but it has good decent food. I often stop at Country Cookin for lunch. Large salad bar, desert, cheap.

Author: Rhonda S
Review: Traveling on a bus from Alabama to NYC, we stopped in Salem,VA. Its a very clean place. The salad bar has a major variety of salads and vegetables with dessert. (Ice cream and apple crisps). Loved the salad bar. We got the chopped steak, baked potato, grilled chicken sandwich with sweet potato. Everything was very good. Prices were reasonable. Service was great. Shawn was our server. He was very friendly and attentive. They handled a bus load of us with no problems. Service was quick. Would love to have a place like this where we live.

Author: Kim H
Review: Pleasant staff makes this a great buffet place for families. Mac and cheese especially good tonight. Kids 6 and under eat free from the salad bar. Does not accept American Express.

Author: Kim H
Review: Great buffet of sides and salads, inexpensive meat entrees like small steaks. Casual and welcoming. We always receive excellent service from Sarabetha, one of the long-time servers.

Author: Pattycake49
Review: The food is usually good but I wonder if they got new cooks or something because the salad bar was terrible the lettuce was brown, mac and cheese was dry, the cornbread muffins were not done, the oreo pieces tasted old and dry. I was so disappointed with the staff as well, I mentioned to the fella that rang me out and he did not seem to worried about my complaint. So if the staff doesn't care then I guess that tells me what higher management feels about their customers.

Author: Hokiechip
Review: Very nice family orientated restaurant. A huge salad bar is included in almost all the entrees so the meal is very affordable. Essentially for an extra dollar, one can get a chopped steak or flounder.Service is usually very good and friendly.

Author: Steve L
Review: Stopped in for a weekday breakfast. The breakfast bar is well kept and offers a nice variety of options. I was a bit disappointed with the bacon. It was too thin and looked like it comes in precooked for convenience. Bacon is a big thing for a breakfast buffet, you shouldn't skimp. Other than that little speed bump, the food was quite good and fresh. The decor is typical of other restaurants and clean. Staff was friendly and efficient. Prices were adequate for the experience. Good location, plenty of parking and large dining area. Will definitely give them another try.

Author: Go567289
Review: We were pleasantly surprised today with our meal after church. Location wasnt very busy so we were unsure of what kind of service or meal we would receive. Seeing an empty restaurant at what should be a busy time always makes me proceed with caution. We were seated quickly. Our waiter was on his A game and was a pleasure to work with. Menu had plenty of options including burgers, steak and seafood.Hot and salad bar had limited options but still very fulfilling. Prices were very reasonable. We will return.

Author: Kim H
Review: Great choice for budget-friendly family fare, including a large "salad bar" with many side dishes and desserts. Can order simple chicken dishes and steaks; good kids' meal options. We always receive delightful service from Sarabeta at this location. May not be gourmet but is welcoming, hearty, and a solid option for a LOT of food when you are hungry.

Author: Hokiechip
Review: Stopped in for a business lunch and was very pleased.Excellent variety and HUGE salad bar. Luncheon sirloins were very good and our waiter was outstanding.

Author: Daryl S
Review: Maria's Taco salad is the bomb, stuffed with Shrimp, Beef and Chicken I get this all the time and it's always great!! Love this spot highly recommend!

Author: FrequentTravelerRS
Review: This usis very close to highway. Must visit to rest and to eat. Food quality was great particularly veggie fajitas.

Author: Shannon145
Review: I ate at El Rodeo for years, moved away, and when I came back to visit, I ate there for lunch. They gave the 4 of us a tiny basket of chips and my burrito was 1 flour tortilla rolled up with beef and cheese! It was like Mexican tapas. It appears they are trying to cut corners financially. We wont go back again.

Author: RollMeAway1965
Review: The restaurant was nice and not at all crowded on a Tuesday evening. My food arrived very quickly after I ordered it and there was a special on beer with a large draft for $3. The food was good and my server, Rosa, was very friendly.

Author: Kim H
Review: Much better value than nearby Mexican restaurants in the Valley View Mall area. Serves takeout quickly and has sincerely friendly servers. Options include what you would expect for American-Mexican food: tacos, quesadillas, huevos rancheros, enchiladas, etc. Able to accommodate families and large parties. Not the most opulent of locations but easily accessible from the downtown and crossroads areas. Great choice for a quick, casual meal.

Author: Kim H
Review: Much better value than other nearby Mexican restaurants including Rodeo Grande in Valley View Mall area. Mole sauce is a nice treat--this is comfort food. Friendly service from interested servers--a loud and broad (and clearly accidental) salsa spill complicated dinner. Comfortable but not upscale atmosphere. Plenty of lot parking. Good option for local takeout also.

Author: Denise_Atlanta
Review: The restaurant has a very attractive decor. The menu was not particularly adventurous, but everything was well prepared and tasty, and the service was quite good.

Author: Kim H
Review: Comfortable, casual Mexican restaurant with a neighborhood feel. Inexpensive food served quickly. Lots of "American Mexican" options with heavy mole sauce. Complimentary chips served with meal. Some limited outdoor seating with not-so-spectacular view. Parking best along sides of building.

Author: hbhakh
Review: I recently had lunch at this location, which is the original El Rodeo in Roanoke. The food and service were fine but nothing special. I think the portions are larger at the other locations. Prices are very reasonable.

Author: yankpete
Review: They have a huge menu with lunch specials. The speedy Gonzales is my favorite for a quick, filling meal.

Author: BobC123456
Review: In the past 12 months, something has changed at this restaurant and the buffet food on Tuesday was the worst I have ever experienced. Not only was it tasteless the items were not "Indian" and there is no rotation of dishes. This restaurant needs to get back on the ball with new kitchen staff and Management that cares about the quality and authenticity of their food. The additional dollar charge to the buffet is because of "food wastage," What does this mean ??????????????????

Author: BruceWGSO
Review: Our first time at this location. Did weekend lunch buffet which included, by request, Pani Puri and Dosas brought to your table. The buffet was excellent, yet not extensive. See pics. Good green salads and Masala Vadaithe latter larger and softer than typically offered on South Indian buffets and delightfully devoured with tasty gusto. Piles of Naan. A special mango Kesari (Saffron) dessert that begged for seconds and third helpings! An unusual feature was a listing of cocktails involving Indian ingredients such as Smoked Cumin, Curry leaves and the like. I really enjoyed their Curry Leaf and Cumin Martini and my spouse savored their Indian Cosmopolitan. In the four decades I have dined at Indian restaurants in two dozen states never have I been as enthralled with such a mixed drink. Everything we sampled had a wondrous, flavorful, take your breath away quality. We are so pleased with our meal at Taaza we can hardly wait to return for another memorable culinary experience.

Author: Martie703
Review: We work in Roanoke once in a while and make it a point to visit new restaurants for lunch. Orderly the counter and the service is good and food came out quickly. Clean and nice atmosphere. Variety on the Menu great and very flavorful. A bit pricey for the portion, I ordered the Greek salad with naan, $9.00 salad was fresh and good but not a meal Will come back again husband ordered a kabob 8.00 with three pieces of chicken, again not a big portion.

Author: moysian
Review: Familiar Indian fare in a very nice setting. Prices are right, and service was attentive. If you are from out of town, and staying near the airport, make sure to use the GPS for navigation - it's tricky to to navigate. Also, the return path is different from the path coming in (but no less tricky). Early birds can enjoy $3.00 drafts.

Author: Martie703
Review: We look for unique places to eat between gigs as we are full time musicians. I ordered a Greek salad and enjoyed very much. Not your usual salad. The portions are small and the price reflects that. Will go back again.

Author: 42georgei
Review: Went with a large group (19) for dinner, as a reservation. This was not this first time this group had been there and it has always been great in the past..... unfortunately this was not the case this time. Our group of 19 had one waiter, who not once asked if we wanted refills on drinks, but was instead flagged down to ask for refills, or we simply went to the bar instead of waiting. When our food came, one order was completely wrong, and they brought only 4 bowls of rice for our entire party. All of these things very minimal and was easy to overlook, until the end of our evening... our waiter was no where to be found, and after our table literally had been cleaned off for 45 minutes, one of the members of our party walked half way across the restaurant to tell him we would like to have our checks... he said sure... 20 minutes later, he walked out to our table with a 4 foot receipt in his hand and went around our table and asked each person what they had and made marks on the paper, then disappears... again... another 20 minutes go by, and we ask for our checks.. again... another 15 minutes later he finally comes out holding a stack of receipts, at this point its 9:00 and were all holding our cards ready. Then he starts again, asking what we each had... he hands out two checks, then gets to the third person at the table and hes confused... he skips her and moves on to the next, has several other checks correct and then stops.... he walked around to the front of the table and said can I just ring it all up together and divide it evenly..... NO! Some people had multiple orders drinks or appetizers, others just had drinks... absolutely not ok.. at this point weve been there 2.5 hours, this is not ok.. he fumbles with the checks in his hand and said uh I dont know what to do, can you each come to the bar and tell me what you ordered.... so all 19 of us stood up in a line.. one by one we began telling him our orders... again... he was so confused at this point the manager came to assist him. Mind you theyre only using one computer to have us check out one at a time... multiple people had to tell them several times what they got... by the time they got to me it was 9:45, third to the last one in line, Then their computer crashes... I give him my order and he takes my card and disappears, Im assuming to another computer, 10 minutes go by and he finally returns with two checks... I had two beers, an entree and bread.. on one check was my food and one beer, on the second, my second beer... he tells me I have to sign both because he ran my card two times.... 3.5 hours later we finally walked out of the restaurant... I understand we had a large party, but 1.5 hours to get our checks and pay is absolutely ridiculous... the food was incredible, but that scenario is enough to make me not want to return.

Author: phil753
Review: I've eaten here twice during the month, on two separate trips to the area...and I will return on my next trip. My waitress was patient, helpful, and answered all of my questions, I went with medium heat the first trip and medium-hot the second, which was absolutely perfect. I went with the Gobi Manchurian for an appetizer and Tikka Masala with chicken my first trip and Kurma with chicken my second; both times with the Garlic Naan. Perfectly prepared, full of flavor, can't wait to go back to Roanoke to try a third disn.

Author: Mike O
Review: Our visit was better than when we dined here a year ago. This time, the $3.00 happy hour draft beers were appreciated (bourbon ale), the Naan had plenty of garlic (just like we make it at home), and the Thaduka Dhal and Lamb Vindaloo had the level of heat we ordered. All were full flavored. We dined here after a Sunday movie at the Grandin Theater which let out at 5PM; we were the only customers. Service was prompt.

Author: Deena F
Review: Traveling through Virginia on my way south, I was craving Indian food but not expecting much. I was delighted with my lamb vindaloo, hot as requested, and the assorted vegetable appetizers were perfectly prepared. Service was friendly and professional. Nice atmosphere. Good stuff indeed.

Author: Diane1313
Review: Dont know anything about Indian cuisine, try Taazas lunch buffet. It is an excellent introduction to Indian food so you can determine what is your favorite. There is delicious soup (mango for us), assorted types of salads and hot dishes. My favorite was the shrimp curry and fried squash. Tandoori chicken is a good staple and was enjoyed by members of our group. Hot rice pudding for dessert was good if you want something less spicy. The Naan bread was delicious and hot. It is a real deal at the price, even if you know nothing about Indian food!

Restaurant: Roanoke Room at the Hotel Roanoke
Author: psudino
Review: I am assuming as the only on-site restaurant, they handle the catering for the conference center.The best thing was a mascarpone cheese french toast. I really enjoyed the flavors. Scrambled eggs were only OK. Otherwise, the rest of the food was as expected.The person who handled our conference was excellent. He was very attentive and did his job efficiently and without interruption. Perfect service.A nice catered meal for the meeting.

Restaurant: Roanoke Room at the Hotel Roanoke
Author: bugmuffin2016
Review: The service is friendly and accommodating. Hotel is beautiful and comfortable. Lots of history here - which is also fun. It's close (via the pedestrian bridge) to shops and restaurants. We'll definitely stay here again!

Restaurant: Roanoke Room at the Hotel Roanoke
Author: markhK3932JA
Review: After having this reservation for over a year in advance we were very dissappointed and left. Our reservation was at 2 pm. We arrived early and set in the hall waiting to be called. However, At 2pm with over 20 people arriving and standing in the door we were aware that they will not call us but seat others first. My wife went up and complaigned. We were them seated immediately. After waiting 5 minutes with no service we went and looked at the buffet. What a joke it waz. Everything was picked over and empty. Carving station dry as a bone. Bread gone salad wilted and disgusting. And still no one to fill a water glass. For $46 each plus 20% gratuity then tax what a disaster. Also the piano.player left when we arrived so no music. Completely dissatisfied and glad we left. I do not recommend at all. Oh and way to crowded. Too many kids running around unsupervised.

Restaurant: Roanoke Room at the Hotel Roanoke
Author: jpetula
Review: I had lunch at the conference center and felt compelled to write a review. The entire meal was fantastic from the salad to the main course. I hope there is another convention at this location.

Restaurant: Roanoke Room at the Hotel Roanoke
Author: 103elaineh
Review: I stayed here at this beautiful hotel and loved everything about it. The huge hotel had lots of charm, history and plenty of sights to see- all within the hotel. I would have given the hotel the highest rating, but someone forgot to make up my room , so when I returned from my meetings that day- the maids hadnt visited at all. It was rectified right away, but I was disappointed. I also wanted a blanket late that night, but when I dialed out to housekeeping- the phone didnt work. I also wanted to call the valet to have my car ready, but couldnt because of the phone issue. They corrected these small matters right away, but it was still inconvenient for me. I had dinner at the two restaurants in the building and both meals were truly excellent! I loved this hotel, hopefully I will be able to return again.

Restaurant: Roanoke Room at the Hotel Roanoke
Author: Patrice W
Review: The food was delicious as always and the servers were all pleasant. However, we asked specifically not to have a long drawn out meal. It was indeed busy but the pacing of the meal was exactly what we didnt want!Fortunately we enjoyed our table mates but they were exhausted having been flight delayed and got in at 1am.We love the Regency Room and its our special go to place but last nights timing missed the mark.

Restaurant: Roanoke Room at the Hotel Roanoke
Author: jmanley32016
Review: During a recent business stay I had the pleasure of being served by Bobby. Bobby has been at the hotel for over twenty-five years! His pride in his work is very evident! He is a professional. So when you combine the beautiful ambiance of the restaurant with the delicious breakfast buffet; and have the serving skill of a Master, well, it makes for a great experience! Bobby himself has a fascinating career to talk about! During his tenure at the Hotel, he has served Presidents Carter, Clinton and Obama,to name a few! On top of that he has served various notable politicians, celebrities and others; but, as he told me, his greatest pleasure has been serving multiple generations of the traveling public. In these times of apathy, poor training and lack of pride, to be served by a professional is a great experience. Bobby reflects the effort of all the staff and management of this historic hotel.

Restaurant: Roanoke Room at the Hotel Roanoke
Author: Lalo_de_Mexico
Review: I am reviewing our single experience with the weekday buffet in The Regency Room. I don't know why TripAdvisor is referring to Roanoke Room.Having arranged a lingering lunch reunion with friends in the Roanoke area, we didn't try The Regency Room for other meals. The charm and elegance of the place left us wanting to return for dinner.Every picture on Hotel Roanoke's website is accurate. The Regency Room is a beautiful part of a beautiful building. I doubt Roanoke has a more attractive place for a special event.Reserve your table, as we did the day before when checking into the hotel. Hotel Roanoke "and Conference Center" has meaning. We appreciate our waiter's alert when he saw us settling into conversation about 10 minutes before a conference lunch break. Conference attendees share the room and the buffet line, so he warned us to beat the rush.Attractively presented mostly in a discreet area separate from the main dining room, the food offerings included several special teats for people like me and two of my guests, native Virginians whose mothers provided not one, not two, but multiple fresh vegetables and salads from our well-tended farm gardens. For "company," pickles and relishes graced the bounty. Although my mother would never have served such things from fruit jars, Hotel Roanoke made us feel like company.Spoonbread was a standout, long overdue after 40+ years in Texas, served with Virginia succotash of limas and corn. Those two items alone produced two trips to the buffet from our table. Asparagus and mushrooms are other standouts from our lunch, as were black-eyed peas.Oddly but significantly, and I asked my wife today, we remember nothing about the meat we had. We can't even remember which meat we had at the famous Regency Room buffet. Hmmm.... Much the same applies to desserts, which were the same as other places or simply not interesting. Believe me, Virginia has desserts.Our Roanoke area friends pointed out, twice, that the buffet is better on weekends and holidays. I wish we could try them.We have an important negative, unfortunately. Although the restaurant advertises 11:30 - 2:00 p.m. for the lunch buffet, multiple employees interrupted our experience by starting a 1:00 p.m. tear-down. For the price and the setting, we think that distraction was inappropriate. The beautiful salad table was destroyed and taken away, with its tasty contents redistributed in and among what had been attractive food displays in the other room. The restaurant subtracted one hour from our otherwise excellent experience with no reduction in price. This should not have happened, and I believe it happened because of scheduled lunch time for the conference.

Restaurant: Roanoke Room at the Hotel Roanoke
Author: Christine B
Review: What you don't see in this photo...is the entire wall opposite this indoor stone structure is glass. Bright sunlight shines in all day. Natural light enhances and enlarges the ambiance.

Restaurant: Roanoke Room at the Hotel Roanoke
Author: 801joef
Review: Went for the Sunday breakfast buffet and as always was not disappointed. Friendly hostess sat us outside as we requested in comfy new chairs. Beautiful view of mountains and the Roanoke Star. If you want exquisite food that is cooked to perfection Hotel Roanoke is for you! Omelettes are cooked to order and also a choice of eggs, bacon, potatoes wonderful fresh muffins of course including fresh fruits. The coffee was brought out in a carafe by our excellent waiter Casey. He is so attentive to your needs and is vey informative about the area. Aside from the omelette chef you have to try the signature smoked salmon! Relaxed and enjoyed every minute outside! A must as the Hotel itself is beautiful.

Author: Scenic44253375836
Review: Cheddar's Scratch Kitchen is great! Love the atmosphere. Staff is friendly. Food is great! The onion rings are the bomb!

Author: lpdutil
Review: We have been to a few cheddars so whenever we see one, we try to stop. The food is good and its priced fairly well. We always get the chips and queso with beef appetizer and try something new for an entree. The best Ive had is definitely their salmon.

Author: mizzjay10
Review: Great dining experience. Had flavorful seafood entree from the lighter options.The sides were green beans and broccoli- tasty as well. Nice portions. Wait staff was attentive. I have dined at the Roanoke location multiple times, and in other cities.

Author: Paul L
Review: Had lunch with my mom here today and was neither dissatisfied or hugely impressed. The massive fan in the middle are nice, other than that its kind of hard to tell if you're in Cheddar's or another chain, they are all so generic now. And the food was good, but not original or special in anyway. I had grilled salmon with stuffed baked potato and steamed broccoli and seasoned rice. All very good, nothing like the seafood one might get at Local Roots or the Regency Dining Room. Service was good, but our server did seem to keep appearing right when we getting into a conversation about one thing or another.

Author: Scenic44253375836
Review: Cheddar's Scratch Kitchen is awesome! They have the best homemade onions rings around! Love their chicken tenders too!

Author: ConnieP757
Review: The food was spectacular. The service was superb. There were 5 of us and we all loved everything we had which almost never happens. I cant wait to come back!

Author: rven4ever
Review: Been to other cheddars and never had a issue. This one severed up some of the most over-salted food. Our server did try to remedy the problem by bringing out more but it was over-salted aswell. I left the restaurant out of pocket and still hungry as i was not able to eat the food and they did not offer to reimburse me for the horrible experience.

Author: Gregory W
Review: Never get tired of "great" food and service. My wife I came in 7/01/19. We had Mitzi as our server, and she is TOP notch. Came to find out she has been there since you opened 10 years ago. She when to come by and check on us, and told me the salmon was a good choice, well she was right it was great. My wife had the Monte Cristo, and she said the same. Victor your greeter, was not there that day but is very neat. All the best and yes we will be back!

Author: jerseyj0e
Review: We stopped for a quick lunch on a busy day but our choice was a good one. I had the iced tea and Ribs with a stuffed baked potato, my Wife had a grilled salmon platter that came with rice and green beans, she enjoyed her meal along with a watermelon rita that came in a large glass with a large wedge of watermelon in the glass, our server was very good at her job and we will return again if in the Roanoke area.

Author: kbpneacl
Review: Located next to I-581/US-220 and a Mall, this place is basically a Cheesecake factory, but better. Big plates of wholesome American dishes. Burgers, chicken parm, chicken tenders, a bit of beer. From the looks of it, a gathering place for family celebrations as well.

Author: Aubrey L
Review: Great selections and fast moving through the food line. I eat at their restaurant in Salem more than I do this one and their other one at Tanglewood mall, but all three restaurants use heavy salt on most of their food. The Salem restaurant is much worse than any of them, though. Complaining doesn't help very much.....depends on the manager on duty. The cook in the kitchen controls the salt, it seems. The customer with high blood pressure will have a problem making a selection with low salt here. Recently we had to return the pinto beans, lima beans, mashed potatoes, chicken pot pie....all in one visit. That ruined our meal. The chicken & dumplings are almost always so salty we can't eat them. Seldom do we make a visit without having to return something because of too much salt.

Author: barbararitaville
Review: visited for first time today. Had chicken ranch casserole; very tasty. Delicious suger-free chocolate icebox pie. Service very attentive and polite. Difficult to find such nice cafeteria with good food nowadays.

Author: ftice59
Review: I love k&w especially the fried white fish you get a plate full the baked chicken is also a treat I have not ordered a meal that I didn't like I've been going to k&w sense I was a child memories with my grandmother and grandpa I'm now 60 so keep up the good cooking K&W.

Author: pearldrift
Review: The cafeteria is conveniently located. There's adequate parking. They haven't spent any money on the interior in years and it shows. Detracts from the experience. BUT THE FOOD IS GREAT! The cafeteria line is just sparkling and fresh looking. The servers were super nice. I got liver, mashed potatoes and sauteed cabbage and some sort of composed salad - have no idea what was in it. The liver was perfectly cooked and tender. The mashed potatoes were light and fluffy AND were the same way when I ate my leftovers the next day. The cabbage was some of the best I've eaten. AND that mystery salad that I still don't who what was in - was great, very tasty. It would be a perfect experience if they'd freshen the interior and improve the lighting!

Author: Charles L
Review: Wide variety of reasonable priced food. Only negative was the wait in serving line, which is normal for a cafeteria. Seating very comfortable, and wait staff accommodating. Good no-frills dining experience.

Author: Leah O
Review: My sister and I came in with my elderly parents for breakfast. We were running late and got there a few minutes before breakfast ends. Everyone that works there were very understanding and didntRush us or make us feel bad about getting there at the end of breakfast. They offered us everything they have available. They made my sister a waffle which takes a few minutes but didnt act out out. The food was very good. Tasted like real country cooking. The service in the dining room was very good. The server checked on us regularly and made sure we had everything we needed. The dining room is very big and offers tables and booths. Its a very relaxed atmosphere. It would be great for families and children.

Author: pamperedPennsylvania
Review: The have unlimited selections of salads, entrees, and desserts. Not a fancy place but extremely good price and selection. Everything was clean and employees courteous.

Author: P0sterb0y
Review: I really enjoy going to the K&W cafeteria for breakfast (the Hershberger location serves breakfast). When you reach the beginning of the food line the first of a dozen women, dressed in a neatly pressed white uniform aggressively asks how you want your eggs, then reacts with lightning speed to prepare your answer....she probably cooks a 1,000 each morning. That sets the stage. Its all very orderly as you move down the line. The steam rises off the multiple variations of meat, potatoes, gravies and bread. If you say pancakes, they give you a special order sign and say keep moving Ill bring it to you. The women are matronly in a fun way, and if you are thin, cute, and male or if say you are hungry they will be generous with the portions. Once sitting down the dining area attendant are just as attentive. They help with trays, refill drinks, and bring special orders. The food is excellent and not at all like an institution. Its consistently hot, fresh and delicious. Its a good value if youre careful. The displays are clever with right colors and if you dont watch out youll put that green congealed salad on your plate cause its pretty but that can add a few dollars to your total.

Author: moonshinerkey
Review: We met for breakfast and there was a great selection to choose from. It is nice to see what you are getting and not have to wait.

Author: Charmain D
Review: While traveling with my tour group we stopped here for lunch. The food was fresh and there was a nice variety as always. Most of the older crowd like the cafeteria style more than the younger generation. I am older so I tend to like places that serve a lot of vegetables.

Author: Michael B
Review: This was my second visit for lunch at Paul's, a long-time family-owned Roanoke Restaurant that is a fixture in downtown Roanoke. Both visits I had the daily special, and that day is tas country-fried steak. For a flat $5 (including tax), I got what you see in the photo, and I enjoyed every bite. The bowl of soup, lentil on this visit, counted as one of the two sides. This place is a hidden gem and is always full at lunch, so I was smart to arrive past the lunch hour.

Author: nothappy1000
Review: I ordered a salad to go and specifically requested the greek and blue cheese dressings on the side as sometimes I don't like dressing at some places. I arrived to collect my lunch and saw that it was smothered with blue cheese dressing. I explained that I had asked for it on the side and was told 'you made the order you take it', I said I would like a new salad and was told no - I could have my money back I will not be going there ever again.

Author: Michael B
Review: I hadn't been to Paul's for many years but had lunch here with friends. I ordered the chicken cacciatore special, it was only $5! Quite tasty sauce on a slab of chicken over a bed of pasta served with a side salad. The salad was iceberg lettuce but fresh with some shredded carrot and cheese. The blue cheese dressing was delicious. My friend got the gyros - two, served with fries and a salad, he said it was the best he'd tasted. The prices here are unbelievable. The service was fast too.

Author: Christopher P
Review: Great atmosphere had a chance to meet Paul the owner and his wife if I ever come back to Roanoke this is a stop for sure.

Author: normanm329
Review: Quick friendly and affordable lunch specials for lunch in Roanoke. Where else can you get lunch for five dollars. Great salads and house dressing

Author: savacu
Review: Hidden away but very busy. Food was good with Greek flavors. I you arrive during busy hours be patient it is worth it.

Author: Tim D
Review: A little hole in the wall restaurant on Franklin Road downtown Roanoke is a great place to eat breakfast or lunch offering a great variety of sandwiches, salads, burgers and comfort food. Family owned and operated since forever. Sometimes parking can be a challenge but neavertheless a great place to eat.Recommend the breakfast burger or BLT Salad with homemade Italian dressing.Take cash, they don't do cards!

Author: Benjamin K
Review: Great menu of affordable delicious entrees and sandwiches. I especially enjoy their gyros and club sandwiches! Friendly staff. Quite busy often at lunchtime.

Author: spencerinthehat
Review: I like small family-owned clean hole-in-the walls. This place did not disappoint. Its too bad it took me so long to try this place, will now be on my list of go-tos. Lots of variety on menu. American and some Greek (first Thursday of each month is Greek specials day-owners are Greek). Yes they have gyros. Will cater to your food specifics too. Prices are cheap and you get a lot. Lots of homemade food. I had their Monte Crisco sandwich (ham, turkey, cheese, FRESH tomato and fried egg on buttery grilled bread) with fries. $4.84. And it was huge and delish. Friend had BLT (like $3.50). It too was generous with lots of bacon and FRESH tomato. Fries are crinkly cut fries....very good. We left there stuffed! Staff is cheerful with great sense of humor. Owners cook, greet patrons, run register. Owners are wonderful and grateful you chose their restaurant. Very authentic, genuine peeps. Coke fountain products served ($1.35 w 1 refill). Not open Sunday. Breakfast until 10:30 M-S). Open until 2:30.

Author: VTgirl84
Review: Was expecting a lot more because of all the write ups. It was good, but not great. We both ordered gyros and they were like I said, good. $5.00 including tax which is a great price, but that was with no side and water to drink. My daughter had a side and a drink and it was 9.50 so not such a great deal. The restaurant itself is old, service was fine. We went once, probably won't go back.

Author: tombigbee82
Review: Some good, some not. Steak and eggs were well cooked and tasty. Ordered biscuit, got toast, ran out of coffee. Wife was expecting "farm to table" oatmeal, got instant microwave, poorly cooked. Weren't charged thoigh. Didn't seem too busy but staff seemed overwhelmed. Waitress was friendly and very nice. Nice location and clean. Portions were large.

Author: Paul L
Review: Now this place is just awesome! Farm to table, so fresh organic and local ingredients. Also some very interesting items on menu. I had the country ham slider with a fried egg and pimento cheese and lettuce on ciabatta bread, with home fries. Very good. Also great spot to watch people and listen to live music when there's an even going on downtown, like today. Only thing I didn't like is that they do not serve alcohol. One of the things I love about Europe is they drink at breakfast. Not to get drunk, but a bloody Mary or a beer would have been nice with breakfast, like they do in Europe. Especially in Spain, where the menus only offer beer or wine with your breakfast, not juice or coffee.

Author: jjric
Review: We were looking for a hearty southern breakfast and found it! Cozy restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating. Star city scramble with eggs prepared in a variety of combos. Liked the veggie scramble with a little heat from jalapeos. Side of their signature vanilla French toast with warm maple syrup. Delicious! Servers Jordan and Lindsay were very pleasant and attentive. We will be back!

Author: Hokiechip
Review: Stopped by on a Saturday for lunch while attending a convention at Hotel Roanoke and was really, really disappointed.Very slow service and no sense of urgency by anyone involved. Had a $10 Gift Certificate from the convention and the cashier had to ask someone whether she could accept it. Then she told the person behind me that it would take 15 minutes or so for their order and implied they should go somewhere else.Not impressed at all.

Author: bigdaddy704
Review: Visiting Roanoke for the day. Opted to seek out local for restaurant breakfast. Was not disappointed! Excellent food and service.

Author: AmberBelle
Review: The food was delicious & the coffee was good! Not crappy dinner coffee either-ligit coffee!! The pancakes where huge and so good! We ate outside; such a great spot to enjoy a little bit of the city! I cant remember what my scramble was called but it had bacon in them and they were amazing!

Author: LasFamTravels
Review: By far the best scrambled eggs I ate on our vacation were the Souther Scramble at this restaurant. Always with a side of grits.

Author: PCBSML
Review: My wife and I had heard raves about this place. Not so much. Our experience, In order:We ordered two coffees and one water and got two waters and one coffee.When our food came, we had no utensils, had to find a server to ask for them.That took a few minutes, so half our food was cold, the sausage was nearly burned, and the hash browns looked like they came out of a bag from the grocery.My pancake came 8 or 9 minutes after my eggs, sausage and hasbrowns, and was undercooked (i.e. raw in the middle) and bland. I had to ask for syrup. Really, you don't bring syrup with pancakes except by request?We complained to the server, the manager came and apologized but didn't really listen to what we were saying. She did comp my meal, which we appreciated.Throughout our meal, the couple at the table next to ours was sending back food that was underdone or overdone, or poorly done.I will say that my wife's turkey sausage was good, and she liked the coffee. Me, not so much.Won't go back.

Author: davidsT1732ZN
Review: Almost better than homemade blueberry pancakes. Would have been nice if about twice as much syrup had come with the pancakes.

Author: John M
Review: My wife and I were downtown on 5/25/19 at the festival and decided to grab a quick bite at Scrambled. The food was good. The service was good. Definitely great value. It is primarily breakfast food that is served all day. We would definitely eat there again.

Author: drwillie78
Review: Fun old market area in Roanoke. Quiet restaurant on a Sunday evening. We had a nice wine selection and a great crab dip to start. Wait staff was friendly and attentive. Our meals were good. I would recommend the duck as you get a cooked breast along with a leg/thigh confit style. I wished the breast had been cooked about a minute longer but taste was really good.

Author: red1330
Review: We stopped here for dinner and enjoyed a very good meal. Tasha was tending bar and was outstanding, great service! I had the Wahoo special and was very impressed. The fish was cooked perfectly and served over a bed of polenta. Trish had the homemade spanakopita with Greek salad and was very pleased. Overall a great meal and great service.

Author: smeltz_s_t
Review: I tried the lamb. Why not! It was delicious! It didn't have the overwhelming lamb taste which is actually hard to do. The side was polenta, the waitress described it to me and I tried it. I wasn't a fan but that had nothing to do with the quality. I love food! I'm not a fan of grits and it had a similar texture so that was my fault. The tuna was the other dish I was thinking about so when we go back, I will definitely be trying that dish!

Author: johncD6774BF
Review: Romantic, low light restaurant. Very good soups and salads. Scrumptious roasted rosemary chicken and salmon dinners. Attentive staff.

Author: Ushuaia4
Review: Enjoyed a wonderful dinner with business colleagues at this restaurant in the heart of downtown Roanoke, VA.The restaurant was cozy, with warm lighting and wooden paneling and wooden floors. Service was great, and the drink selection, including wines wide and varied. For appetizers we ordered Moroccan spiced lamp Lollichops, sweet potato gnocchi, seared jumbo sea scallops. For dinner I ordered the blackened ahi tuna which came with a risotto of andouille sausage & crawfish, spicy and delectable! Other guests at my table ordered filet mignon, duo of duck, rack of lamb & grilled salmon. The consensus was uniformly a two-thumbs up on the food! If you are ever in the area, try this restaurant, which sources locally, and has added to the great vibe of the downtown area.

Author: CabanaWoman
Review: Table 50 is unpretentious, but has a great foodie vibe and atmosphere. The menu is made of seasonal locally sourced (for the most part) items with a signature in-house preparation.From the starters, the salads to the entrees, the offerings include seafood, meat and poultry and all were excellent. The wine list is above average, but not too large.And the desserts - they are fabulous.Our server was knowledgeable and very helpful and kept dinner going at the right pace.

Author: jeross1313
Review: Great wine list- tens of bottles and plenty of choices of wine by the glass. They had a Pierre Rougon Chateauneuf du Pape 2015 by the glass. The food selection ran the gamet I had beet salad and red pasta. They had five delicious sounding desserts. Quiet, relaxing and attentive staff.

Author: picky4me
Review: Food and service above what one might expect. Can get crowded so a reservation is a must. Have found that midweek is better for most restaurants around 6:45 in the Roanoke area

Author: Travelingatty24
Review: Passing thru Roanoke on our way north and decided to stay the night. It was a super hot evening so an outside meal was out of question. Asked our b&b hosts for recs and this was on the list. We saw menu and said lets try. Food was excellent. Had a wedge we shared and I had the Ahi Tuna over a risotto that was divine spicy but so so good. My guy had a fillet special with scallops also great. Very nice wine selection and we really appreciate that they did not rob u on the wine price. Would be a fav if we lived there we will go back when in Roanoke again.

Author: raven46
Review: Found this place by walking the charming downtown in search of something local. Waitstaff are very accommodating as we started out as two at the bar then grew to five with child and were relocated to a table when family joined us. Some of the best crab bisque outside of Charleston or Savannah. Salads are generous and interesting.

Author: psudino
Review: The menu for this place made me very excited to eat here, but by the time the meal was over I was not very impressed.First, there is no sound dampening here. I felt like I had to shout to be heard from across the table.Second, the appetizers and salads were the best part. For the main course I got the rib, which was not cheap, and mine was so fatty and just not up to the price charged. Dessert was decent, but nothing special.On the plus side, the wine selection was very good and the cocktails had rather funny names. Also, as mentioned above, we ordered appetizers including pizza the pizza was very tasty.For the price, average is the fairest rating I can give.

Author: captmorgan40
Review: We really liked the ambiance and energy of the place but the food was nothing to rave about. I had duck confit with pasta, It was dry, little duck and very bland. My wife had a pork Osso Bucco that was fatty, and the sauce was bland. Portions were small but the price was not.

Author: Diane1313
Review: Fortunato is not your run of the mill Italian restaurant. It has very unique selections for appetizers and entrees. Their appetizer selections of cheeses and Italian meats is refreshing. Not too many restaurants offer whole fish, and it is delicious. Two of us had the Osso Bucco and it was excellent. Their selection of pizza is also very different, my husband had the suppresso and basil and it was not your average pizza! The service was delightful and very informed about their food and drinks. None of us could order desserts, since we were so full. I had enough for lunch the next day.

Author: jhoch78
Review: The food was delicious! Lamb ragu, giant short ribs on a bed of creamy polenta. The calamari was wonderful, and I found my new favorite salad. The Ramp salad is phenomenal. Don't get me start on desert! The staff was wonderful and the wine selection is awesome! This is my new favorite place.

Author: 687audreyg
Review: Wonderful experience tonight, with Kayla as our server. She was especially attentive and friendly :)The funghi pizza was delicious, as was the special pizza which features ramps. We always enjoy dining here, as it is different in a good way! Be sure to try the smarty pants cocktail which is quite suitable for spring!

Author: saraa937
Review: Our table shared bread and olive oil (both of which were good) and a good bottle of chianti. I ordered the duck ragu on our waiter's recommendation, and it was delicious. The zeppole for dessert was amazing, and the coffee was good as well. Service was attentive and knowledgeable. I guess other reviewers have complained about the noise: it is somewhat loud (concrete floors and lots of glass), but I didn't think it was noteworthy. No worse than any other busy restaurant on a Saturday night.

Author: Shaylynn G
Review: Was not impressed with anything other than the amoibyvof noise in such a small area. Service and food wasn't great. Won't return.

Author: AustinnBoston
Review: Short walk from Hotel Roanoke & Conference Center, recommended by local business contact. The atmosphere is bright and warm. High ceilings, solid wood block tables, wood panels on walls and cool wall decor. Large and good selection of wines. Had an excellent Chianti. Had Mussels appetizer- good but not as good as Luckys. However the table bread was phenomenal-asked for more! Our party ordered a range of dinners and all were happy. The Italian Scallion pizza was pretty good. Finished it off with cannolis and a homemade limoncello. Very enjoyable dinner.

Author: bernardos539
Review: I can not even comment about the food. One of the dinning rooms was so noisy. You even have to yell in order to order your food. The noise in the room probably exceed the OSHA limits with out ear protection. They should seriously install some noise absorption system.

Author: dalowe
Review: My husband and I dined at this restaurant 2 nights ago in a private room, ordering from fthe regular menu. The restaurant is located on a small side street in downtown Roanoke with many large windows and a modern/rustic decor. There are a lot of hard surfaces and the noise level was high for a Tuesday evening. The service was very knowledgeable and attentive. The menu is available online and I suggest that diners have a look before committing to this restaurant. The cuisine is not traditional Italian, it has a more gourmet or "foodie" vibe and the prices are higher than usual due to that. We enjoyed tasting the grilled octopus that one of our more adventurous members ordered. The pizza was very good with an extremely tasty crust. Everyone seemed to enjoy their desserts- we shared a delicious budino. If you want traditional Italian, I suggest Remini's or Luigi's. If you want to spread your wings, consider Fortunato.

Author: Barbara G
Review: Ike was head chef at Kabuki in Roanoke, Virginia when it first opened sometime in the 1970s. Ike was our favorite. When Kabuki expanded to Christiansburg, Virginia (near Virginia Tech University) Ike helped get that restaurant established and we, of course, had to cheer him on. Years later we lost touch with Ike and then this restaurant opened with this familiar name. Today we found him at his favorite spot, the kitchen and he remembered us! This is the most authentic and diverse Japanese menu you will ever find anywhere in the USA. The man can cook! I listed this as 'Cheap eats' because the prices are so reasonable but the food is far from 'cheap'. Quality food, very high quality.

Author: DwarvenHB
Review: I eat a lot of places. After words I answer the question how was it? With it was ok. It was good or in some cases great but I dont feel the answer at my core.I ate at Ikes for the second time this year last night and I can honestly say it is a Pleasure eating there, I ate so much that I hurt, then I ordered more to take home with me. I am craving more now haha. The restaurant is clean. The staff are amazing. Kind, helpful and not judgmental at all, many places treat me different due to the blue steak in my hair but not here. In fact the server remembered me and made sure to give us extra napkins and Togo silverware because she remembered that we would be in the hotel from us visiting nearly 2 months ago.The food is an Anime lovers dream or just a fan of Japanese food. This Resturant is a gift to Roanoke and anyone who visits. They keep busy so get there early if you want a table. They dont seat you so grab a empty table, put your jackets on it then go to the counter to order.They will bring your food to your table. My only regrets is that I cant eat the little donut type fish with the red bean paste on a daily.If that staff read this, Thank you for all that you do. It has been a long time dense food outside of my moms cooking has made me feel a true emotion. I actually felt joy when eating your food.

Author: gizzyliz
Review: We have been here about 4 times and every time its been great. The Ramen is my favorite! The restaurant is a little small but still welcoming.

Author: Briarlee
Review: First visit to this local gem and it wont be our last. Food was delicious, generous portions and the staff was super friendly and helpful. The Tantanmen Ramen (pictured) was spicy and full of fresh flavors. We also had the Gyudon (beef bowl) which was rich and flavorful and garnished with a little pickled salted ginger. The beef was melt in your mouth tender and the rice was almost creamy. Prices are very reasonable for the quality and quantity of food. There is nothing fancy about the atmosphere so go for the food and be prepared to enjoy a terrific meal.

Author: AndrewCern
Review: Tucked into an older strip mall type structure, Ike's Kitchen offers a somewhat Izakaya feel to the Roanoke food scene. The entries they have are satisfying and fairly authentic. They had all of my favorite snacks and some wonderfully tempting entrees that are a bit more elaborate. If you are a fan of japanese food beyond just sushi, it is a must try establishment.

Author: Tim D
Review: Great little restaurant located in Roanoke operated by a former head chef of a local favorite Japanese Steak House. Serving some traditional Japanese steak house favorites but also other noodle dishes. Limited seatingFood taste greatModerately pricedFeatures limited dishes Will be eating there again

Author: brownemma75
Review: Ate here for the 1st time last than a week ago and went back today with my daughter. Holy moly this place is good! Had the butadon, which is beef, onion, and rice dish. Serious comfort food. It kind of reminded me of my grandmother's pot roast. Today we had shoyu ramen and tonkatsu ramen. This was our 1st time having real ramen and it did not disappoint! The food is so good that I was already thinking ahead and getting excited about what I'm going to get next time! We also tried the rice ball appetizer (the seaweed paste one is delish) and the gyoza. True hidden gem that is well worth it. My new favorite restaurant. And the prices are great too

Author: TW702
Review: Visited here while visiting family in the Roanoke. This place definitely doesnt disappoint. Amazing Japanese food at an excellent price, with two entrees with a one soda was 23 dollars. You definitely get your moneys worth eating here! I tried the teriyaki chicken with rice and vegetables. Cooked fresh, and perfectly seasoned. This place definitely comes recommended.

Author: nomadic_kitsune
