Review: Yes, roanoke has several sushi joints and places that serve hibachi, but we never had a place that served proper ramen, soba, and other Japanese meals. Thank goodness for Ike's Kitchen. Absolutely delicious, affordable, and the staff is so helpful. I can see myself going here once a week to eat. Hopefully Roanoke supports this little gem and they are a success.

Author: travlinrn
Review: I found this place while googling the name, and I was surprised to see that it's not only a Japanese restaurant, but an inexpensive one, serving foods that anyone in Japan can get by walking into the equivalent of an American diner, at diner or fast food prices. It's great food at reasonable prices and perfectly good portions! We need to have more of these places

Author: MrsOConnell
Review: My now husband brought me here once on a whim and I loved their food so much they catered our wedding! The tacos are worth the price and I am slowly making making my way through the rest of the menu. I recommend them to everyone I know and I am so excited because I just found out they are doing delivery AND opening another location!

Author: Thomas R
Review: I consider myself an avid expert mexican food expert and this is an oh my god experience. Yes, looks like a roadside dive but it is incredible. Perhaps the best mexican I have ever had in and outside of mexico..

Author: Keochin
Review: Tried this place from the reviews and it was okay. $3.99 per taco seemed high for street tacos. Flavor was missing authenticity. The red chili sauce was very hot but no flavor.

Author: kareem365
Review: This is a small family owned restaurant with music playing while the owner/cook dances in the kitchen. The food is so tasty. The dishes look beautiful and they have a large menu. My husband loves their tortas (sandwhiches) which are enormous and my kids love the giant burritos (also enormous) and the tacos. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. I have yet to try the soups but I have heard great things. Be sure to pick up an "I Love Tacos Rojas" t-shirt while you are there.

Author: Joe J
Review: Tacos Rojas is definitely not a 5 star restaurant that you would go to. What they lack in ambiance they make up for with great Mexican food at a reasonable price. Their lunch special is incredible with enough food to feed two people for half the price. If you blink going down 13th street past Black Dog Salvage you might miss it. It is brightly colored in the Colors of Mexico (green, red, yellow) and seeing the front you may not realize they have a kitchen inside. Go there for great food at a great price.

Author: Kenlynn P
Review: This is a hidden gem. The food was authentic and tasted great. We will definitely be back. I had the shrimp tacos and they give you a nice amount of shrimp in each taco. I seen a taco salad that someone ordered and it looked delicious, also a couple of boys came in and ordered the chicken and beef nachos (a mountain of food)..I can't wait to try them. This is one of those hole-in-wall places and it was well worth it.

Author: jjpuck
Review: The street tacos are worth the trip alone. Two pics of four types. Authentic, real, tasty, and home style. Growing up in Mexican culture this place brought us back, and the clientele is nearly all Hispanic. Everything we saw looked excellent!!!

Author: Hinun C
Review: My family is from Mexico and this is the most authentic Mexican Restaurant in Roanoke Virginia. The only place you can get Menudo.

Author: timmL4364IW
Review: Prices have risen a bit over the years and its less sketchy looking than it used to be. That makes me a little sad because I felt like I was in a very small club of people that knew about this place. Not anymore. The secret is out!Come get some!Try a diablo burrito and try not to bust out in a grin when they put it in front of you!

Author: 1399jda
Review: Wonderful little neighborhood restaurant. Portions big enough for two people and great taste. Very fresh and our party of four were all pleased.

Author: WWSPENCER91
Review: I got the jersey sandwich for breakfast and it was very good. Bread was soft and the food was nice and hot. The gentleman who checked me out was very friendly, the other coworkers at the counter didnt speak but other than that it was a good experience.

Author: KShawnT
Review: We had a yummy breakfast at RT Smiths. The food was delicious. Loved the old-timey atmosphere. It felt like the good old days. RECOMMEND!!

Author: savacu
Review: Excellent selection of sandwiches. Had the Madison one time and the Champ the second visit. The Madison came with sliced apple and apple butter, very unique. Give RTs a try,

Author: Joe58156
Review: Its nice to have a real New York style deli in Roanoke. Good menu of lunch sandwiches, or design your own. Nice choice of breakfast items. Its not open for dinner, so get there before 4 PM. If youre not in the mood for the very fancy restaurants surrounding you for breakfast or lunch, stop in at RT Smiths. Get a good meal at a reasonable price. And then go on about your day in Roanoke.Bonus: they have Taylor ham; thats an item you only see rarely. A nice spice ham that you can make a sandwich out of it or have it with breakfast. Thanks, RT, for bringing it to Roanoke.

Author: htstuckey
Review: I got acquainted with R T Smiths deli while making multiple trips to see my orthopedic surgeon in Roanoke following a motorcycle accident. My wife and I would religiously stop in for a Pastrami Ruben sandwich following my Dr. visit. Now I travel to Roanoke several times per month on business and every time I have enough time to stop in I do. This is a serious deli with great food and great people. Do not miss the opportunity to stop by and enjoy a great meal.

Author: 128Dawn55
Review: Excellent service, excellent food. Reasonable pricing. Serves breakfast all day. You can eat in or carry out. Food cooked fresh. The chocolate chip brownies are delicious.

Author: JM0330
Review: Not QUITE as good as expected from the raving reviews, but certainly worth a visit! Good sandwiches, nice change from your typical chain sub shop. A little pricey, but interesting options. Cozy place with seating inside. We'd go again.

Author: 2Yummy4U
Review: First of all, this is the only Roanoke deli with proper rye bread and dill pickles. The best has the genuine taste and texture of a NY rye bread. The dill pickles are crisp and have that sharp flavor that I recall from NY. I had the ham and cheese omelet which was omelet which was a little dry and too salty..... probably salty ham. The rye toast was excellent. My son's sandwich was piled high and delicious. I am told that the roast beef is made in house and I plan to return for a roast beef sandwich. The pricing was very reasonable and the staff very friendly.I will be returning and highly recommend this deli.

Author: Captbigguy
Review: Plain and simple, this is just a pretty darned good deli and place to get a good breakfast or lunch. While not a fast food joint for sure, they seem to take pride in making each sandwich just the way you want it with very fresh meats and veggies.The baked goods are very good, even though I got some cookies in there recently that were a bit over done. But that gave them a bit more "homemade" character and not something just pulled from the supermarket aisle.I've had several meals there, and my favorite was the Reuben. I've never been to NYC, so can't say it's as good as there, but it is as good as any Reuben I've ever had outside of NYC. Very fresh, very tasty, and very filling!

Author: wendye942
Review: Knowing this establishment is locally owned, I stopped in for lunch to support their efforts. They serve breakfast all day, but I was interested in their sandwiches. Decided on the Madison, which has an Appalachian flare by using apple butter as a condiment. Chose the fresh marbled rye as my bread. Delicious! Very friendly service. Also cool to know that the namesake belongs to a WWII fighter pilot.

Author: Savyluncher
Review: Stopped in after visiting friends in hospital. Food was well prepared and nice portion.This restaurant is located in a strip mall off of Petter's Creek Road. Look for the BIG Dollar Tree store and you will find the dinning spot.

Author: Savyluncher
Review: Our sea food offering was very tasty. Lightly battered Shrimp and hubbies Seafood mix was all good. Small seating is available and the lite smell of seafood in in the air.Very pleasant server/cook. In all would go back for more.

Author: matkinso111
Review: Pros...Quick serviceNo queue and no other customers waitingQuite CourteousCons...Wrong fish given me in orderTiny portion Oily and over cookedSummary..I would avoid but possibly I caught them on a bad day.Possibly the worst Ive had in last few years.

Author: Steve L
Review: Went there for lunch today, ordered the shrimp dinner with fries and hush puppies. This was a first visit so I based my knowledge of it on reviews. The pictures of the shrimp dinner I saw online, looked outstanding, and indeed the food was very good. Everything was cooked to order and ready when I arrived. The plate I received was a wee bit skimpy compared to other pictures I've seen in reviews. The other issue I had was that the dinner is supposed to come with nine shrimp according to their menu, but I only received 8. I wonder if this is something specific to lunch. In the end the quality is top-notch and the preparation is fine. Not the most friendly people in the world, pretty much business all the way. Also, if you want condiments, make sure you ask for them. Nothing in the bag but a fork and napkins. Not a big deal.

Author: 676terryt
Review: Visited here for lunch and had read reviews and seen pictures of the fried seafood platters and wanted to try. Got the fried Oysters n Scallops platter and was very good! The seafood is lightly battered Calabash style and No taste of oil or grease! Great job with the freshness n preparedness of this! Got a couple clusters of the Snow Crab Legs and they were brownish instead of Orange in color and lacked the flavor.. (have definitely had better) but overall was a tasty lunch and would certainly recommend the fried seafood here at Peters Seafood..

Author: 942kenv
Review: To say the least I was not impressed. The building was very enticing as it resembled the lighthouse at the Smithfield Inn. I ordered the lump crabcakes. I am sorry but putting a few lumps of crabmeat on a deviled crab cake is not a jumbo lump crab cake. Raw oysters tasted very fishy.

Author: Warren B
Review: We went to lunch at this place for the second time. First time pretty good, second time-we will never go again!We walk in, no hello unless you call being greeted by saying, "take out or sitting down?" I answered sitting down if ok and the "lady" says ok.I ordered a shrimp po-boy with fries. I couldn't make the "lady" understand that I wanted mayonnaise, not tartar sauce. I had to accept the tartar sauce.My wife ordered a Cod sandwich and fries. The "lady" left to go to the kitchen. Within 10 seconds my wife changed her mind and opened the kitchen door and told her she wanted the shrimp, the same as I was getting. Instead she got chewed out because she had opened the door of the kitchen and had not rang the bell on the counter. The bell was not seen or we would have rang it. My meal comes out, no mayonnaise-just tartar sauce.Her meal comes out and the young man that brought it out said that was what he was told to cook and we said that is okay, we can make the po-boy can you just bring a hoagie roll, lettuce and tomato and mayonnaise for her. The young man apologized and immediately brought back the needed items to make the sandwich, with tartar sauce.The "lady" came out and immediately started with, "I get you what you ordered" and I said no you did not. I explained what was said and not wanting to hear any of that she immediately takes off to the kitchen to explain to the young man that my wife had an attitude when she came in and that she is a liar. Yes, we heard it all through the very thin swinging doors. She didn't say it once but several times for all to hear.From that point on the young man took care of us. While the food was good, the service from the "lady" was terrible and for that reason we will not go back for more of her punishment. I would have complained but I fear she is the owner.While the food was pretty good, her service was terrible, unlike that of the young man that was caught in the middle and took care of us very well. I would have left a tip but I feared she would have stolen it from who deserved it.The reviews seem to pretty darned good for this restaurant but we were one set of only four people that came in between 11:45 and 12:30...perhaps we came at the wrong time? Perhaps any time is the wrong time?

Author: chester65
Review: I have eaten here twice in recent months. The first time I chose fried scallops and it was excellent. The second time I chose a combination, (C7) fried croaker (substitute for whiting), shrimp, scallops, oysters, and eggroll. There was just too much breading on the fish and a few of the other items. Most were good, others didn't have much taste. My wife was also disappointed, but she chose broiled shrimp. Probably not a good choice. As a result I have mixed feelings about returning. I think they are good with their fried shellfish, but I would avoid fish or broiled items next time.

Author: shereethomas1
Review: I ordered the flounder and green beans for lunch, and the fish was crispy and delicious! I was greeted warmly, which is very appreciated when dining solo. I'll definitely be back!

Author: lukelives
Review: We stopped in Roanoke as the half way point in the way home. Based on reviews here we decided to try Peter's Seafood, and were happy we did. Very reasonable prices and well done seafood. It is a buck extra to have your seafood grilled or broiled but it's still cheap.

Author: rallyn5
Review: A friend and I try a different restaurant for breakfast every week, and The Full Moon Cafe was this week's choice. Even though my GPS took me to their old location slowing me down, it was no problem because they serve breakfast all day, yeah! (We were waited on at our table because we were the only people in the place, but the lunch crowd started filtering in and they ordered at the counter and the food was brought to their table when ready which I think is the usual procedure.) Friend and I shared a western omelet and an order of "fluffy french toast" and I recommend both. Nothing prepared in advance and nothing prepackaged from a freezer. The only negative, and it's a small one, is that coffee is a bit weak. Because it was my first visit, I perused the menu for other offerings and I saw plenty of items that require another visit. The owners are delightful, and, if you go, take the time to read the back story on the wall near the bathrooms. We will definitely go back.

Author: Carol4802
Review: The address for Full Moon Cafe is actually 3549 Electric Road, Roanoke, VA 24018. Good food, nice clean restaurant which is well lit.

Author: Martinex
Review: They actually hand roll the bagels here, that's the same way they make them at the old time places in Brooklyn, NY. Amazing to find that in Roanoke.

Author: gizzyliz
Review: It's great to have a local place open for breakfast during the week. Staff (which I assume is the owners) was very nice and friendly. Breakfast was good although we stuck to pretty simple stuff. I was disappointed they don't do poached eggs though. I would recommend Full Moon cafe for breakfast.

Author: AmosC_13
Review: This place is actually located on Electric Avenue. We have driven by several times and decided to try it for lunch one day.It is in a building attached to Cafe Asia 2. You can park right in front of the restaurant. Thus, parking is not a problem. The place is a decent size with several tables. It is also very clean.When you walk in, you try to figure out if you should sit down and wait to be served or not. Actually, you go to the counter and place your order. They will bring your food to you when it is ready. The concern is that the little old gentleman who took our order would get it right. He scribbled it down on a note pad. I guess we were lucky it was not busy because our order came out correctly.The menu is breakfast sandwiches and also deli sandwiches. We had th Italian sub, and a couple of chicken wraps. They have lunch specials. The four of us agreed that the sandwiches and wraps were slightly above average. The prices were slightly on the high side. So, this is not a value meal.When we were ready to leave, we went back up to the counter to pay...no check. We reminded the guy what we had and he rang it up.Overall, the place gets good marks for having a nice clean place as well as a good menu selection for breakfast and lunch. The food was slightly above average and the prices were slightly worse than average. The service was ok but not sure how it would have been if it had been busy.

Author: andytapatagonika
Review: This place is a local gem. Their breakfast is always delicious and so is their lunch. I always order the lunch special, my favorite is the Reuben sandwich. Their baked goods are heaven.

Author: doupnikka
Review: It was a really nice surprise to eat at this restaurant. A Korean couple own and operate this restaurant and they are a very nice couple. The restaurant was clean and the food was good. We all had a breakfast special and we all loved the food and the prices were great. I will definitely go here again.

Author: Jeff B
Review: Always fresh, fantastic bread and cookies. An excellent menu of sandwiches, many are the "personal favorite recipes of the owner"I would recommend this restaurant.

Author: Pamela H
Review: Breads are fresh, sandwiches are made in the spot and the owner makes it a point to try to say hello to everyone. I really enjoyed my lunch here.

Author: WKK1971
Review: Charming little deli, owner makes all breads, bagels, pastries an sub sandwiches. Boars Head Brand meats, fresh made shrimp and other pasta salads. A gem of a nice local lunch spot. Very informal, very friendly.

Author: kristi m
Review: I was in town for a training and the service was excellent and fast. I had the vegetarian falafel sandwich and my boyfriend had lamb. The dishes were excellent!

Author: Penny0988
Review: Delightful lunch at the Athens Corner grill. Enjoyed the souvlaki although I was distressed that the french fries could not be substituted in the lunch special. Fortunately, my dinner companion had a sandwich...she ordered chicken lemon soup for me and I gave her my French fries. The soup was excellent...mild lemon flavor complimented the chicken perfectly. Vast array of international beers. Was able to take a special bottle home to my husband.

Author: stargazer1119
Review: I was encouraged and told to visit this restaurant - Athens Corner Grill before I leave the city. I went and was kindly greeted by the staff. The server was kind and attentive. I checked out the menu and it listed all the usual Greek appetizers, gyros, and entrees. I went with a traditional favorite - Moussaka and ordered a glass of red wine to enjoy together. You can't go wrong, because every Greek restaurant makes a big pan of this eggplant, ground meat, potato and bechamel casserole dish. The portion was large as it typically is, however the bechamel sauce had an unusual color. I took a fork full and another and it was just okay, nothing great. The wine was tart and not quite ready for consumption. My suggestion is to try your food and to taste your wine. This would not pass in a traditional Greek household.

Author: Heather M
Review: I went for dinner and everything was so good. The lamb chops were the best I'd ever had. I can't wait to go have them again.

Author: Taylor B
Review: I really want to like this place and recently gave them another try. But I just don't understand the hype unless the dining in vs take out experience is truly extremely different since I have only done take out. The food had the wrong meat, was off putting and I really think a Greek restaurant should not only have good fries. It's just not worth the price.

Author: FamilyWith3Girls
Review: So I've eaten here ever time I'be traveled to Roanoke for business this year. I think 7 times thus far. After eating here the first night I was so impressed with staff, owner, and quality of food I haven't ventured elsewhere. The only dish I repeatedly order is the lentil soup (fakes) as my appetizer. Amazing and I can't bring myself to try another soup. The main dishes are a perfect blend of home cooking with finer resteraunt accents. And the deserts are decedent. Save room and calories, you won't want to skip this part.

Author: marla247
Review: Roanoke needed this place! The food and the service is amazing. The owner makes you feel like an old friend from day one. They have the best Tzatziki sauce ever and I believe that I may be addicted. I have been to several Greek restaurants and since coming here no other place adds up. Parking is limited, but worth the effort.

Author: 12730zuman
Review: We went for dinner on a Friday. There were only one other couple in the restaurant. The waitress was more concerned with the bar staff than us. As far as the food goes the souvlaki dinner was ok . The meat tender and juicy. Salad was good. No fountain drinks only bottle tea and soda.If they want to survive they better pay a little more attention to the customers.

Author: MrsKerren18
Review: We really enjoy the authenticity Athens brings to Roanoke. Unfortunately, it's quite a drive for us, so we don't get there as often as we like. We had guests who had never been there and enjoy Mediteranean food, so 8 of us entered Athens on a Wednesdsay night in December. Sadly, we were the only table occupied. However, the service was excellent, and the food is always superb. Several got the classic gyro, which is my favorite. We also got two orders of Tsaziki/pita breads appetizer, which everyone loved--no left overs here! The falafel was some of the best they had ever had, and we had no complaints - only to go boxes for the left overs! We love the owner and cook-they are consistently bringing the level of food up in Roanoke!

Author: gutairmusic
Review: Great hummus and tzatziki and delicious pita bread. The gyro was also very delicious. Baklava was served warm which was different but loved it. Only thing is the portions are small and for what u are paying didn't seem to justify the price. Not when I can go downtown to the market building and get a whole platter of Mediterranean food for much cheaper and be full

Author: mztizliz
Review: I've been to City Corner 2 several times for take out soup. It was good and decently priced. But I never eat in as I can't stand the cheesy and dirty looking decor.Today I ordered a large Tom Kha soup. Previously it was a quart of soup with white rice for about $6 or $7. I always thought that was expensive for soup, but it was good and I was willing to pay for it. However, today when I went to pick it up, they charged me $11.12. I'm not paying that much for soup at a place like that. Not to mention the fact that there was about 2" of space between the lid and the soup.  Check out their prices before you go. Also couldn't understand a thing the guy said and he didn't understand me. Overall very frustrating but definitely my last visit.

Author: Don H
Review: DisappointedThis place is definitely going down hill fast, three months ago it was pretty good. Today the food did not seem fresh, and the portion size was much smaller. It appeared that nobody has taken care of the condiment station in a few days, most of the sauces were completely empty. The waiter brought out one meal and and it took another 10 minutes for my friend to get her plate of food.

Author: phil753
Review: A fellow traveler recommended City Corner 2 when I was talking about another Thai restaurant that didn't impress me...he was not wrong! It's family friendly, affordable, and the food is amazing. I wish that I could remember the name of the dish that I had, but it was Crab something or other. No fake crab here and it had fresh perfectly cooked vegetables in a savory broth. I ordered it medium to be safe, but will opt for medium hot next time. If you like authentic Thai food, this is your place!

Author: stephLexington_VA
Review: We had lunch here on Sunday based on TripAdvisor reviews. My husband (who is not finicky) said "could they really have over a hundred friends & relatives who gave them 4 or 5 stars??? Because it can't be based on this food....!!!" Truly, this was the least-authentic Thai food that we have had (and we've easily eaten at over a hundred Thai restaurants in the past 30 years). It was more like a very bland Americanized Chinese. Even though we ordered each dish "spicy to medium hot" it was bland and mild. We asked for a spice tray to attempt to remedy, but its hard to salvage dishes that were this poor. We ordered Rad Na and it was a dish of overcooked, pale vegetables swimming in bland gravy with a small handful of noodles and a few slices of grey beef. The Pineapple Fried Rice was seasoned with an abundance of powdered chicken bouillon and a few pieces of canned pineapple and overcooked chicken. I doubt the chef has ever stepped foot in Thailand.

Author: eryka138
Review: The food is fast and cooked to order. The staff is friendly and understanding. Vegetarian options are there if asked, not on menu.

Author: meljoy_11
Review: Don't shy away from trying this place based on its location (not downtown or near a lot of other restaurants) -- it was such a treat to eat here! We will be coming back again when we're in town. The atmosphere is cozy and accommodated our group of 8, including 4 young children. Our kids loved the food as much as we did and the prices can't be beat for this quality. So tasty!

Author: 112charityd
Review: Service was great and we loved our food. We had a couple of appetizers and the Tom Yum soup, and a pork lunch. Will definitely be back soon!

Author: fieschela
Review: I agree with what everyone else has posted with regards to looks and service, excellent on both accounts.Personally, I got the Pad ka Paow BBQ Duck and my fiance got the Chicken Goy See Mee. You are able to adjust the level of spiciness of each fish as well. We ordered the egg rolls AND the spring rolls because I wanted to try them out. The egg rolls are kinda small but are really good and not over fried. The spring rolls were awesome.Like everyone else said, you really need to stop in here and give it a try. There are a few "safe" dishes like Chow Mein which only has noodles and meat and nothing too fancy. So you can at least find something. 2 appetizers, 2 dishes, and drinks for $37.

Author: cg23494
Review: I cannot begin to describe how much I love this place. When I was in college and would come home to visit, whenever someone offered to take me out to eat, I would always choose here.It's in a weird location, and definitely looks a little sketchy from the outside, but I stick with my theory that the best food comes from those places.The inside is really cool to look at, the people are very nice, and the food is amazing. Also, the menu is the biggest one I've ever seen; you could eat there every day for a year and never order the same thing. Please do yourself a favor and try it out.

Author: Mark W
Review: I came , I saw, and from the looks of things I thought I'd just leave. OMG! Thank goodness I stayed. My number 1 rule. DON'T JUDGE A BOOK BY ITS COVER. Great food! Amazing Mango and sticky Rice. So fresh and great flavors. Pork egg rolls, Thai house special fried rice with chicken, and chicken pad Thai. The service was great and the family so pleasant. This is a must stop if in the area. Forget absence of curb appeal because the food takes it well past that.

Author: AlistairHull
Review: Being English I've had many, many Indian Meals. Nawab's varied menu has something for everyone from a veteran Indian Restaurant client to a first-time diner. Their quality and service is exceptional. Last visit they offered me a dish that wasn't on the menu. I went for it. So glad they did that for me as it was exceptional. Fabius, one of the managers there was fantastic, and helps to make this an absolute Go-to in Roanoke if Indian is your thing. 5 stars without flinching.

Author: KrishnaJK
Review: Based on reviews we visited this place for lunch and t our dismay food was par below quality. Having visited many indian restaurants in the past, we did go with a not so high expectation but despite that the quality of this one really bad. The vegetarian food was kept close to the non vegetarian dishes and there was contamination. The food which was specified as vegetarian like the fritters was fried in the same oil as chicken and not many patrons know it and neither do the restaurant staff mention it. Simple dishes like the nan bread and peas sabji tasted bad and the spices were not blended. Our rating 1 out 5.

Author: Michael B
Review: This is a place I can always depend upon for a delicious lunch. The buffet has numerous classic Indian dishes. I like the tandoori chicken and the tempura-like fried broccoli as well as the several dishes whose names I can never remember, and their naan bread is soft and served nice and warm. They also have a couple of salad and dessert offerings in the buffet line. The dessert I had was like a mango pudding and was delicious. The buffet costs about $9.00.

Author: Robert S
Review: One of the remarkably few restaurants in the Roanoke Valley that serves excellent food and gives good value. Atmosphere/overall ambience is very good. Service is attentive without hovering. Daily lunch buffet is first class , very reasonably priced, and has a varying menu. Regular menu is just fine as well.

Author: Distance09
Review: I normally do not eat buffets but it was my first time at this restaurant and I thought it would be a good way to sample a number of items. It was. The food was well prepared and very tasty and there was a good variety. They really had to hustle to keep the buffet supplied since a group of young men and women came in and literally filled up one whole side of the restaurant. I will go back. Try it.

Author: raysfire1
Review: I went in today for the lunch buffet. I was amazed with the selection of both meat and vegan plates. The restaurant is clean and simple. But the food and service was excellent. I was able to have 10-12 different veggie selections. Even though I am a vegan, the chicken and lamb plates were tempting and smelled delicious. If in town, you must put on your bucket list to visit.

Author: TheVeggieSeeker
Review: We visited for an early dinner on a Sunday. Staff was welcoming and got us seated with menus and water promptly. The place started to get busier as time went by and the service clearly slowed down and we had to flag the server a number of times for everything from water refills, silverware, to-go-boxes and the check. We ordered a vegetable and lentils. Both were not authentic preparations and disappointing on flavors. The bhindi masala (typically a dry preparation) was wet with a gravy that tasted liike Chinese Indian (heavy on ginger garlic). The dal bukhara was something between a dal makhni and dal tadka. Dishes were served with rice.

Author: PhDAchieved
Review: Wonderful food, large portions and great staff. Our waiter helped us pick a few options off the menu just to try something new. We explained what we liked and he made wonderful selections for us. Highly recommended.

Author: J S
Review: Best Indian food in town by far. No need to go elsewhere. Never have I or any of my friends, relatives or colleagues ever had a bad meal from this place

Author: Gonzalez1981
Review: I usually stop in Roanoke twice a year and go to this establishment. Prompt service-awesome and friendly staff-my favorite is the mango lassibeen coming here for a couple years !!!!Definitely check it out if your in the area ...

Author: tomconn42
Review: I went there in a group of five people. The salad was very good, with an interesting dressing (Avocado?) The accompanying garlic bread was excellent. I could have made a meal on that alone. The steak was cooked perfectly. The service was very attentive. I think everybody I came with was also pleased. Would definitely come back the next time in town.

Author: Mimibots
Review: I arrived at this restaurant knowing I would have pasta! WRONG! My waiter tempted me into trying the steak that night. Oh my goodness....best steak I have eaten in a long, long time! Can't wait til next time!

Author: rven4ever
Review: Enjoyed our dinner. Sauces were excellent. Our waiter was quite odd. Sort of argumentative when we asked for drinks as he forgot to ask when we were seated. After talking with table beside us they had same issue. Guy made excuses and strange comments whole time we were there.Would go again just would ask to be seated with a different waiter.

Author: Donna E
Review: This is one of my favorite Italian restaurants. The menu is extensive which I like. The atmosphere is like a lovely restaurant in Italy. Of course, the most important thing is the amazing food! The sausage appetizer was so good. Their veal dishes are great. Perfectly done pasta. Every meal I have ever had there has been wonderful. Molto buono!It is family owned. Always the best!

Author: annewa2017
Review: We went here on Easter Sunday evening. It was a family gathering for a funeral the next day. The staff was wonderful. Our waiter was also a mixologist and brought us a wonderful sample of watermelon sangria. The food was very good, and very hearty portions.

Author: Diane1313
Review: Dont like Italian, Luigis has everything. If you like Italian, Luigis is the best. Our group of 12, ordered all of the above. My eggplant was superb, the special of veal chop was also great. The typical Italian dishes like veal Marsala, were also great. What was most impressive with a party of 12 was that every meal was hot and fixed to perfection. Each meal came with a fresh salad and bread. My serving was so large that I toke a doggie bag home. My husband and I shared the chocolate cake which was a chocoholics delight. Part of that went home too. The staff is very attentive and friendly. I must admit that Luigis continues to be one of the best restaurants in the Roanoke area.

Author: harrietws2017
Review: Absolutely horrible experience all the way around!! My husband and I ate here for our Valentine's dinner. Luigi's has been wonderful in the past and we were expecting a very nice dinner for two. We made reservations for six and arrived right on time. As we arrived, we could see 2 empty tables in the dinning room and were surprised when we were not seated at either one. Intstead we were shown to the bar and told we would have to wait for a table. The bar is very small and cramped and they allow smoking. There was a woman at the front end of the bar puffing away. We sat in the bar for fifteen minutes drinking a glass of wine while we watched the two empty tables in the dinning room stay empty. Finally, my husband went to ask why we were not being seated and he was told that they would seat us in a few minutes. We then watched as the shoe-horned a table in the corner and set it up for us. The bartender made us pay for our wine before we could be seated which meant two seperate tickets for the evening. The other two tables remained empty for another 30 minutes. There were only two waiters for the entire dining room and the service was slow to non existant. When our salads came, we found them to be cheaply done and mostly iceberg lettuce that was wilted and warm. My husband ordered a surf and turf type meal. The steak was nearly raw and so full of fat and gristle that the table shook when he tried to cut it. The surf part of the meal was only 2 lousy shrimp placed on top of the steak. I ordered the lamb chop which looked great when delivered, but when I cut into it, it was so raw as to be still cold in the middle. It then took us ten minutes to find a waiter to get it sent back to the kitchen to be cooked. When it came back it had been microwaved. It was hot finally, but it tasted rubbery. It also had a great deal of fat and gristle to it. The tiramasu I ordered for dessert was also not good as it was thick and gloppy. The dinning room was so crowded that I wondered if the fire marshall would have approved. It was also very noisy and hardly the nice evening out that we wanted or expected. Luigi's is very pricey and when I pay those kind of prices I expect good service and good food. Last night, I got neither. I have had better meals at Burger King! I believe that the ownership of Luigi's got greedy and over booked, ordered cheap supplies and short staffed their restaurant. They used to be a good place to eat. Not any more!

Author: Jay B
Review: There will be a lot of people who disagree with my review here but I stand by it as I love Italian food and prepare many dishes on my own. This place is expensive for what it is. It's been a landmark in Roanoke and many people love the food. Me, not so much. I've eaten here several times and I'm over it. The quality of the dishes here is just not there.Italian food can have wonderful subtle flavors and this is missing entirely here.

Author: Lpharis
Review: This place has it down to perfection. It's been around for decades, and become a place for celebrations. We went there for our last anniversary. It has seafood and steaks and wine to fit the occasion.

Author: Mike O
Review: The two of us really liked our dinner experience here. The food, service, and ambiance were excellent. The Antipasto plate for two, at $15.95, had a nice selection; the portion of eggplant parmesan turned out to be the star of this dish for us. The Salmon special of the day, at $34.95, tasted as good a the freshly caught salmon we have had right out of the water in Alaska, and the Veal Saltimbocca, priced at $20.95, was served in a rich sauce. Our waiter, Mark, was a delight; he and most of the other staff have been here or years. We enjoyed discovering that he recently went skydiving, as my wife recently did. The one shortcoming is the fact that this restaurant does not post prices with its online menu; for us, that is the misstep that prevented this from being a 5-star review.

Author: johndP3371VC
Review: Love this place. The staff is excellent and very friendly. On my first visit I was treated like a regular patron. The sandwiches and spaghetti are excellent. Friday night dinner special is superb and varies. What I love most is that it is an old school bar where patrons are friendly towards one another even a stranger. The happy hour (3-8) prices and conversations are awesome. A must visit place.

Author: ORIORDANT
Review: We dined here one evening for dinner. Its a lively place, very busy while we were there. The staff were excellent and we enjoyed the food

Author: Helen g
Review: This is an awesome place to go and kick back enjoy live music and awesome food. The staff is very accommodating and friendly and try to make your visit enjoyable. I recommend Schooners!!!

Author: Kevin M
Review: I was looking for a place to eat lunch and saw this place and stopped in,the young lady that waited on me was very attentive,I ordered hot/bbq wings and a side salad and both were very good,it seems like a good place to watch a ballgame as well I will definitely stop in again.

Author: Mike L
Review: Had a great time, there was a band playing(Thornrose) that played lots of oldies but goodies. Everyone was friendly, the service was great and the food was good. Danced the night away. Fun times

Author: bigRJ
Review: We love this place. The Best Cheese Burger around. I tried the Club Sandwich on our most recent visit and love it also. Staff and Patrons,the folks are nice and friendly. We go here when we can. A couple 22 draft PBR, set back and enjoy.

Author: HDS1
Review: This is a restaurant/bar. We were there in the early evening on a Sunday, so it was pretty much empty. I had a good hamburger with a decent salad, while my wife had a sub with roast beef, cheddar and bacon. Two thumbs up. Our server was great and the music was 1970s rock, which was great for us.

Author: partytax
Review: Got the $9 pizza special. Plates were greasy, pizza was meh, and the atmosphere was depressing. Should have gone to the Mexican place a few doors down.

Author: happyone12190
Review: Schooners is a wonderful place non-smoking and they have so much to offer each day. Happy Hour Specials are wonderful and the food is to die for, The bartenders are the best. Went there on a Friday Mel and Teresa were working place was packed and they took care of everyone then a little later another bartender came in to help out, and they had live music and a buffet they said happens every Friday.These two ladies are great so if you are every in Roanoke Va on Friday go see them. Schooners is great and when I am back there this is where I am going

Author: bigrock1
Review: Make this your 1st choice to get out and have a great meal with fabulous service.. Rhonda Hartman is a fabulous girl behind the bar .. Stop in and find out why we love Schooners !!!!

Author: 208georgew
Review: We ate here on our way home from a southern vacation and liked it so much we visited again. The first time we has steak and it prepared perfectly . The second time we had oysters and they were great. This is a nice casual restaurant that serves excellent food.

Author: Dan M
Review: Our meal was very good and the restaurant was very clean and pleasant. Our server was very cordial and pleasant while the hostess couldnt be bothered and was TOO busy to work. Visit on 10/2 at 6 pm

Author: Pam D
Review: I have been to Shakers many times however my visit today just stood out. Clara my server was very professional in actions and also her appearance. She did a great job and made me feel welcomed. The food was great as well.

Author: Lori M
Review: Stopped here after a long day of driving, before we went to the hotel near by. Several good options. I had the cat fish bites and the Mocha Mud pie. My husband had a shrimp salad with rice. Both very good. They wait staff was exceptional.

Author: barbararitaville
Review: Ate here 2 days in a row! One lunch; one dinner. Food excellent both times.Pizza appetizer is great; thin crispy 12", plenty for 2 or as a meal for 1. Club sandwich delicious. Asian chicken bowl was a real treat. Attentive friendly service.

Author: ian07095
Review: Shakers is a very good local restaurant that is open later than other restaurants here in the Roanoke area. Kara was our excellent and informative server ( she was great!!). We ordered the catfish bites and the gorgonzola salads...the salads were delicious and not skimpy. The catfish bites were spicy and also very good. The catfish is really done right here, so we ordered some catfish dinners and the veggie burger, all of which did not disappoint. Other things to know are that the menu has a good meat free section and Shakers has a good offering of beers.

Author: Paul L
Review: Established in the 80's, this place was very popular back in 90's. Mostly forgotten now, I am grateful I have two chef friends who have cooked here, otherwise I would not have know how good the food still is! Had the beyond meat burger--with cheddar, mayo, lettuce, tomato, onion, and fries. Veggie patty had heavy smoke flavor! Amazing!!

Author: Gary F
Review: fantastic home made food the room was lovely with spa bath and the staff and service was first class would recommend

Author: Trail44486496714
Review: I was here on a business trip and dined alone. My waiter was very attentive. I ordered the Cajun Shrimp Pasta and it was AMAZING. The salad was especially good as well.

Author: Hokiechip
Review: Shakers has hosted several events for the Roanoke Rail Yard Dawg Booster Club and have always been great partners.Tonight we needed a place for our granddaughters Graduation Dinner (11 people) and choose Shakers because of past experience.PERFECT CHOICE!We were seated in a semi-private area and Franklin, our waiter, was unbelievably friendly and efficient. Food was great as well. It simply could not have been any better, They even held our graduation cake for us until it was time and then brought us plates and forks.It was an absolutely unforgettable experience and we will be forever grateful.

Author: Brian S
Review: Stopped for the night in Roanoke and was looking for a quick bite and a cold beer so took a chance at Awful Arthurs. Good beer selection, good service and the food was between OK and good. Nothing to write home about but the atmosphere was relaxing and I would go back if ever in the area again.

Author: 778danad
Review: As chains go, it is not Awful, but I have been twice and won't go again. Too much mass produced food when you can get fresh and better prepared food all over the Market area.

Author: Blissfultraveler47
Review: Traveling south this week, we stayed overnight in Roanoke. We are huge fans of Awful Arthurs in the OBX so we thought wed give this a try. We know they are not related but figured they would be good imitators. The food was just OK. We had 2 items off their specials for the evening. The soft shell crab and a strawberry and salmon salad were not the best weve ever had. The salmon itself was cooked well and delicious. The rest of the salad meh. The dress8ng was described as a strawberry vinaigrette was actually a very sweet creamy dressing. It didnt come out with the salad and I had to ask for it as I was half way through since our waitress had disappeared in a very empty restaurant. We were greeted promptly and in a friendly manner when we entered but it was downhill after that. All we can say is the server was not what we would have expected. This restaurant seems to carry many good reviews but we cant figure out why.

Author: 2Billinz
Review: Hubby ordered the calabash platter and I ordered the combo platter of oysters and scallops fried. It was all badly overlooked. Husband had to ask for cole slaw that was supposed to come with the meal. When manager came to ask how everything was and we showed her, she remarked that maybe it was time to change the grease. I told her mine was inedible, she took it and brought me grilled instead - 3 watery scallops and 5 rubbery shrimp. No sides or hush puppies that were on my first plate. $50 later, we left. Wont go back. Be warned.

Author: JHAllen
Review: We found the back door of the establishment crossing from the art museum area and walked into the pool room, but were told just to keep walking to the restaurant area. Seating and service was quick and friendly. I had their lunch portion of fish and chips, the wife had crab balls and a salad. Both were adequate, nothing special about either. With the pool room it might be busier at night than when we were there for lunch.

Author: AliciaK873
Review: After reading the reviews we were a bit iffy about eating here but we decided we'd try it since we were in the mood for seafood. The crab Rangoon dip was amazing and so was the shrimp and grits! Service was fast and friendly. We will definitely go back if we make our way out there again!

Author: Denise R
Review: I had an expectation of having good seafood. We ordered clams on the half shell. The clams were so small and they did not make them correctly they shells were still attached and so was the muscle, it tasted like they washed them so there was no flavor. I also ordered cod and shrimp platter it tasted like it was fried in 4 week old oil. After I took the fried breading off the cod was good. The shrimp were large but it was also fried in the same oil which is why it tasted terrible. Had the soup that was very good. My suggestion please save your money and do not go here for seafood you will regret it. I really do not like giving reviews like this but I would not want anyone to waste there hard earned money.

Author: MichaelFinchy
Review: Found this restaurant on trip advisor and ate here with my wifeThe food here is really good the staff are very helpful and politeWould definitely eat here again

Author: JohnDoe22222
Review: Waitress was nice but...Couldn't find crab in the crab balls.Soups were both cold (to cold to eat). Grits seriously undercooked. Hushpuppies burnt. Manager came over and copped an attitude with my wife. He was not helpful at all. We had to pay and leave. Worst dining experience in YEARS.

Author: whiskeygirl7794
Review: My friend and I came here just to have a couple drinks and play a couple rounds of pool. Waitress came all the way from the dining room to the pool hall to accommodate us and I thought that was super of the staff to do that. Beer was cheap. Will definitely go again to try their food

Author: algswg
Review: Took my son out for his birthday and they were great! Food is awesome and they even sang to him. Thoroughly enjoy this place!

Author: Kelley M
Review: Wonderful place. Great food great environment and staff. Go with couple and able to talk. Some places too loud to hear each other. Never had a bad experience. You leave feeling good. Thanks Plus good prices too

Author: Henri Tascherea... H
Review: While many Chinese might favor another restaurant, we have noticed many faithful Chinese patrons, and we have become one of them. The food is tasty, and the menu offers many items for any palette.

Author: Grantmale
Review: Stopped in here for lunch after needing my sushi fix for the day. This place was great from the sushi chef to the ladies welcoming us. The waiter was not an attentive server. Perhaps he was too busy or I didnt look like a good tipper. Never the less, the sushi was great tasting!!

Author: helen t
Review: I went for lunch, very busy time of day. Despite the time of day my seating, service and meal delivery was very expedient. I ordered shrimp tempura for a starter. It also came will tempura vegetables. The shrimp were large, well seasoned and tasty. An excellant choice! The batter was light and not greasy. It actually was enough for a light meal. Yet I ordered more. I had a lunch condo meal. Miso soup was delicate and flavorful. Fried rice was also great with very nice seasoning. Also no meat in it which I appreciated. Koung Bou was cooked well with the amount of heat I ordered. I am also handicapped and was able to negotiate easily. My server Cory was great! Informative, speedy, polite and very kind. Assisted me with my walker and every whim I had. He was great! Seriously ask for him!!

Author: marla247
Review: I love the food at Cafe Asia II. I have been many times and I have always had a good experience. They have many choices and all we have tried has been fantastic. The food is freshly prepared and you can taste the difference from other Asian restaurants in the area. This place would have a five, but the seating is close together and you can hear every conversation going on around you.

Author: jbo3
Review: We enjoyed the dim sum appetizer with the shrimp dumplings. The noodle bowls and rice noodle dishes were also really good. We will be coming back again soon.

Author: Brett-Chelsie
Review: If you are a sushi/foreign food lover...look no further. When you walk in, the place is decorated nicely,The workers are welcoming, The place is SO clean (which is really important), and the Food is to die for. One of my favorite sushi rolls is the empire roll. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Author: debber44
Review: I have eaten here several times while visiting Roanoke. It is fabulous! Everything I've ever had is yummy!

Author: jhais28374
Review: Always get a hot meal here! Wife and I go about once a week. We like to split the Chicken cashew and we get extra fried rice along with the meal. I always order an egg roll! The have real great food and the service is always quick and the food is hot.

Author: Mark D
Review: We popped in for dinner on a quiet Tuesday night.Being from out of town on vacation we wanted a change of foods so we chose Thai.I had the Kapow Beef and my wife the Orange Chicken, both were excellent.The staff were very polite and friendly.Would recommend the food.

Author: walkntall509
Review: My boyfriend and I were looking for a new place to eat because we just moved to the area. The owner of the restaurant notice we were standing outside. Mr. Peter greeted us and asked if we would like to try his restaurant. We said sure. We were treated like first class the entire visit. The food was great and the service was exceptional. We will be back.

Author: Kathy M
Review: We are Thai food lovers so it is usually our go to type of food when visiting a new town. This place was nice. Staff was pleasant but the food was just okay. Never had a place that charged extra to get more rice so that was a surprise. Asked for the food to be higher on the spicy side but food was still very bland. Tom Kha soup was barely warm and was not a favorite.

Author: Pete H
Review: This was my first time eating Thai food. We were just walking by and the others with me wanted Thai food. We got a menu and another family sitting there said this may look like a whole in the wall nothing place, but the food is ALWAYS incredible. And how right they were. Cooked to perfection and they got everyone's order done exactly as ordered. I will 100% go back there the next time I am in the area. And the owner treated everyone like royalty.

Author: LynYork_PA
Review: This was in a mall type of place near many other restaurants and shopping but it was a large shopping center with many offerings. Can't go wrong here for the shopping or the food. The server was very nice, with a smile and prompt even though she was busy. The cooks were in sight and very happy as well and made eye contact with patrons. I would definitely return since portions were great and huge. We had a very personal, romantic type booth so this would be perfect for dating couples.

Author: Freedomtribe
Review: This is my favorite Thai place in Roanoke! All of the food Ive had has been excellent. They listen to your dietary needs and make recommendations based on them. They truly want you to have a great dining experience and never disappoint! Their mango and sticky rice is the best around.

Author: shaz4119
Review: Great Lunchtime venu if you work downtown. We loved dining there before our office moved! Great service, and speedy!

Author: Mitch L
Review: Some good dishes and they can make it "Thai spicy" if you want! Overall good, quality food but a bit too "mainstream" Thai for me. I like Thai "street dishes" and items beyond "Pad Thai", etc...Owner friendly and talkative! Could have a wee bit better ambience for a downtown restaurant, but food is more important to me than that. Had Cang beer and (I maybe wrong) BeerLao or maybe it was LEO. Better than just the Canadian brewed Singha.I would say rates up there with City Corner, which has a more diverse menu but not as clean and location's a bit out of the way.

Author: D3336HD
Review: In the mood for Thai food and this was good but not memorable. Many other options nearby when you are cruising downtown Roanoke.

Author: Diana_Warner
Review: After our morning meeting we were hungry and settled on Thai. One of the guys with us wasnt a Thai kind of person but he still really enjoyed his food. I got the Thai tea and it was HUGE! I didnt even finish it and took it to go! I recommend the pad Thai because its my favorite and I get it every time I eat at a Thai restaurant. It wasnt the best Ive had but it was still yummy! The atmosphere is nice. The place is open and they have a beautiful bar area. It was very clean. Not busy around lunch time (we got there around 12:10) which surprised me. The service was great. Our waitress was very kind and accommodating. And the location is great if youre downtown Roanoke. I wouldnt drive just to go here. Parking downtown scares me. Personal preference!

Author: rexerazo
Review: We were not impressed with the selection of food- it looked like a large continental breakfast set up that you find at a motel, nor at the quality of food. Price is cheap, yes, but I prefer a better set up and selection. Parking is on lot.

Author: drclif
Review: This simple restaurant appears to be part of a chain, but don't let that let you stop from coming. It has great food and fine service at very good prices. We had a couple of down home favorites, chicken fried steak, and grilled meatloaf. Both were great. This was a very fine recommendation by the motel staff where we spent the night.

Author: paige9182017
Review: Stopped in for lunch with my mom and granddaughter after a long drive from Richmond. Mom ordered the fish, my granddaughter, the chicken tenders and I had the fried shrimp. The meals we ordered were great! Everything was piping hot and server was extremely attentive and helpful. Not very impressed with salad bar once again. My granddaughter was looking forward to an ice cream after dinner but the machine conked out after one small twirl, I didn't bother to tell anyone it was out of ice cream as we were getting ready to leave and knew we wouldn't have time to wait.

Author: Melissa W
Review: Hailey ( or Haley ) was our waitress and is a fast and hard worker... refilled our drinks quickly and is a very sweet young lady

Author: Hokiechip
Review: Stopped in for a Saturday lunch and was pleased at our experience. Met at the door with a smile and the host also took care of us. Pretty attentive although we had to get up and ask for drink refills. Buffet was good and was included with the entrees.

Author: emilycortes
Review: We stopped in our drive to Florida. Didnt expect much. I was wrong. Great burger and must try cucumber salad. Waitress never let the drink drinks get less than 1/4 empty.

Author: lange1
Review: What a nice selection of salad items, vegetables and dessert. The service staff was good and Wed. you get a free drink as a senior citizen.

Author: lewinsc
Review: Country Cookin' is a chain of restaurants I drive miles out of the way for when I come to Virginia. They're found only there, with some 13 or 14 locations. It's a two-way country buffet. You can order a meat -- anything from sandwich to steak -- and then add the buffet bar for a nominal price. Or you can do as we do: skip the meat and focus on the salads, veggies, and desserts for $7.99 plus coffee or tea. My all-time favorite veggie is what I call scalloped tomatoes (stewed tomatoes cooked with sugar and chunks of yeast rolls). There's a bar for building a traditional salad, along with slaw, potato salad, fruit salad, and such. Vegs include sweet potato casserole, mashed potatoes, corn, okra, mac and cheese, and lots of others. There's a different soup each day of the week. Desserts include cobblers and creamy puddings, soft ice cream, brownie bites. I give top ratings to every location where we've eaten, including this one in Roanoke along with Brambleton Avenue. On this trip we also ate in Christiansburg. At other times, we've eaten in Orange and Harrisonburg and probably another place or two. My ideal vacation trip would be to spend enough time in Virginia to hit every one in the chain.

Author: paige9182017
Review: Found this restaurant while staying over in area. It was late by the time we decided to eat dinner so I will say that maybe some of the "drier" buffet foods were due to the fact we were eating later than usual. Having said that, this place was packed. The staff was friendly and took us to a booth/table. Sadly, we were seated (very closely) to a large group of loud and obnoxious teenage boys. Throughout our meal, they were yelling, laughing and making fun of other customers. This completely ruined our meal. Watching them stand behind a particular older man and mimicking his eating was disgusting. I kept wishing that management or the waitress would say something to them but in management's defense, one of their mother's was sitting one table over and never said a word to them. We couldn't really enjoy our food with that disrespectful ruckus going on so close and right next to us, but the fried shrimp we ordered was good, the buffet was average, I'm sure the late hour was the reason some of the items were a bit dry on the buffet and the price was right. Lucky before we started our desert, the group next to us left and we had our coffee and desert in much needed, peace and quiet.

Author: batspeed29
Review: Stopped In For Noon-Time Lunch And Left FULL And Very Happy About Making This Choice On A Whim While Running Various Errands On Thursday, 06-01-17.Was Greeted, And Seated Promptly By Asian Hostess. Chose To Use Restroom First, Which Was CLEAN, Odor Free & Well Stocked... Faucet On Sink Kinda Unique... You NEED To See It.No Sooner Than Sat Down, Than Had A Menu, Which "Cute Blonde Waitress" Pointed Out That (11-4pm) "Lunch Specials Are On The Back". Sweet! Chose The Chopped Steak w/ Fries And HOT/ Salad Bar . Had To Ask For Foam To Go Box Cause Ate So MUCH Salad/ Hot Bar. EVERYTHING On Salad Bar And HOT Bar Is Continuously Monitored And Added To By A Staffer Devoted To Just This Task During My Visit. They Stayed Busy Replentishing Everything. i.e. They Do It Right !!! At 7am Would Strongly Recommend This #CountryCooking Location To Anyone Visiting The #RoanokeVirginia Area... Might Even Be Worth Finding Off I-81 At Either Peters Creek Road Or Route 419- Salem Exits { flap! flap! - @batspeed29 }

Author: Q3194XBrebeccap
Review: Stopped in for a quick lunch - or that was the idea... Not... The food was wonderful, the service not so much...I was toldtonight that this restaurant is closing at the end of this week. Very sorry to hear that as we really enjoy O'Charley's. But this one is difficult to get into and out of the parking lot, so that may be part of the problem. Definitely the food is not the problem....

Author: JustinThomasF
Review: The food was really good, came out of the kitchen very fast and was hot. The beer was cold, and the wait staff is very attentive.

Author: low-maintenance-57
Review: While heading home from visiting family we were so delighted to find an O'Charley's on a Wednesday to take advantage of the free pie. The food we ordered was good, but the service was soooo slow. There were very few customers inside; if it was busy I could understand the delay. We ordered our dinners and waited quite awhile for the server to bring our food. None of us asked if there was a problem and she didn't offer a reason. Hopefully they do better when there's a crowd.

Author: William M
Review: Recently after a family function, 14 of us went to O`Charley`s for an early dinner. They assigned 2 waitress`s to serve us and they did a great , professional job. The asst manager came by an introduced himself. The food was quickly served and everybody in our group commented on how they enjoyed their food. A comfy place that we all enjoyed.Try the sirlion, with steamed brocolli and salad, It was good..

Author: stephentQ9882WQ
Review: My wife ordered salad. First one cane out frozen. Second one a little better. She then ordered cedar plank salmon. There was so much seasoning she had to scrape it off. This is usually her favorite dish. Not any more. I ordered chicken pot pie. Not too bad but not the best. Have to say it will be a very long time before I go back there again. Not impressed at all.

Author: Sandra M
Review: Ate lunch with a friend there 3x within last 10 days (convenient to hotels and airport). Comfy place (not too crowded at lunch) and they had no problem with us parking for 2+ hours first day (we were waiting for hotel check-in: manager said NP, hang out as long as you need). Service was good to superb (second day, we had a server with only 3 weeks experience in sit-down, and she hit every service and sales mark I can think of). Steaks and ribs properly cooked; my fish tacos were nicely crisp and not greasy. Ordered a half-portion of the California chicken salad and had to double-check with the server that they *hadn't* accidentally served a whole portion: HUGE, leftovers made a second meal and I am no shy eater. (I think a full-sized portion could satisfy anything short of a teenaged dragon.) One of their selling points is many entrees under $10 USD, and glory be, they are NOT all variations on burgers or chicken! It's not "fine dining", but a good comfy family-type restaurant with interesting dishes that won't total your dining-out budget.

Author: Daryl S
Review: outlived their day was great13 years ago behind the 8 ball these days much better choices for the money... drinks weak...

Author: fromMartinsvilleVa
Review: This is the first time that we have visited O'Charley's in about 10 years. Within 5 mins of arriving to the restaurant, we had been greeted by the hostess, waitress, and the manager. All were super friendly and made it a point to ask us how our day had been. This is the way a restaurant should be ran with the focus on customer service! The meals we ordered came out in a timely manner and were cooked to perfection. Everything tasted well. The waitress did an excellent job of keeping our drinks filled and plenty of rolls on the table. The manager made sure to ask us about our visit and thank us for coming! All in all a great experience. We will be back in the near future.

Author: Hokiechip
Review: This was our second time being seated in the area around the bar and you simply don't get the same level of service that you do elsewhere in the restaurant. Tonight, the bartender/waiter "forgot" to bring us our bread (he has "too much going on").Food was pretty good and the salads were HUGE.

Author: laurapQ3862SF
Review: This was a huge disappointment. The hostess who greeted us was pleasant and friendly but we were seated in a booth refrigeration unit near the bar. Conveniently, where the staff was getting together to discuss a guest wanting to know if the salad dressing was made in house or not. It is not. Our server did not know (or care) what I could find for low carb options on the menu. We ended up taking our food togo because the atmosphere was so unpleasant. The very loud music was a mix tape of wailing and whining singers chanting of relationship worries. When we got the food home it was okay but not worth bothering to ever return to that restaurant.

Author: captmorgan40
Review: This Red Palace was a go to place for us many years ago when living in Roanoke. We were in Roanoke for a visit, it was raining hard and the place was not far from where we were staying. We eat a lot of Chinese food and usually always start with Hot & Sour soup and an egg role. If these are good it's a pretty good indication of how the rest of the food will. Both of these at Red Palace were excellent, especially the soup. Many Chinese restaurants Americanize the Hot & Sour so that it doesn't have a kick and lacks the sour (from good Chinese vinegar). Egg Rolls should be plump, crispy with a good filling. The hot mustard should be hot enough to take your breath away if you take to much. Both the soup and egg roll being very good I felt confident the rest of the buffet was going to be very good and it was. The place is very clean and the service good. A very good value also.

Author: helen t
Review: I visited for lunch shortly after it opened. Seated immediately but already busy. I chose the buffet. Cost was only $8.75. The food was hot, very good, individually flavored and spiced. Some buffets all taste alike to me. I was surprised at the options! I happen to be allergic to beef and pork. There were many vegetarian options, chicken dishes as well as small steamed clams, shrimp dish and a fish dish. I was very pleasantly surprised for the cost!! Also many beef and pork dishes I couldn't try. I happen to be handicapped and dining alone. My server very kindly met me when I had a new plate and carried it to my table without me asking.

Author: aneishar2016
Review: Absolutely delicious and buffet has alot of variety. The curry noodles and coconut shrimp is my favorite. It is the best tasting Chinese buffet in Roanoke

Author: 241bbqfoodguru
Review: For the money you can't beat this Buffet seems to have everything you need.The bar is always well stocked and clean.Service is always good definitely eat too much when were here.I love the fried wontons and the sauce that goes with it.The desserts are just okay they're frozen and then thawed out nothing special.Great place for the kids.

Author: AlfredoMartin
Review: In traveling through Roanoke, we stopped here for dinner. You definitely get your money's worth. Dinner is a large buffet, and you have tons of options. The best two dishes are probably the hot & sour soup and the chicken wings. This is all you can eat restaurant, and they serve just about every Chinese option possible. It is a good place to bring family, but do not expect a spectacular restaurant/dinner. The restaurant could use a clean up, especially the rest rooms.

Author: Michael C
Review: Went with wife for a surprise lunch. Many selections to choose from. The usual asian buffet items and some house specialities. There is also real ice cream for dessert. The Hot/Sour soup is likely the best in town.

Author: Gayleetro
Review: Hubby and I have been regular customers of Red Palace for years.We love the variety of the buffet and it seems like they do introduce new dishes occasionally. We like that!My favorite is the coconut shrimp dish and beef and brocoli. Always a great selection and a crowd! That's a good sign!Servers are always very considerate and keep glasses filled.One of the best chinese buffets around!

Author: R1GRO
Review: While visiting Roanoke recently i wanted to return to this restaurant. Unfortunately it was not as good as I remembered it to be. The pot stickers had a thick dumpling coating and lacked flavor. The hot and sour soup was not very flavorful. The other dishes were just average.

Author: David L
Review: I regularly visit both Red Palace locations in Roanoke. Food and service is typically very good at both, but dinner at Tanglewood Mall location last night did not meet expectations. Our male server was inattentive and much of the food on the hot bar was not hot as it typically is.

Author: leel407
Review: It has been a few years since I had visited. Busy but not crowded. Steam tables were replenished steadily throughout my visit. Place was clean. I would like to see spicy selections a bit spicier but I can understand that not everyone has the tolerance for hot food like I do. All selections were fresh and had distinct flavors unlike some buffets where everything tastes the same. I wish the salt and pepper shrimp and scallops (now listed as imitation although we knew that all along) were choices on the lunch buffet. Two adults ate for less than $20.

Author: Michael L
Review: First off let me say that this is truly a must place to go for a great meal with excellent service and to add probably one of the cleanest restaurants you will ever experience!you will always be greeted as if coming to someones home, by the husband and wife who are hands on proprietors. The food is always fresh , and a large selection of daily specials. SO SUCCESSFUL THAT THEY HAD TO MOVE AND OPEN A MUCH LARGER LOCATION !!!!I have been eating at this restaurant for a couple years now, since I visit Roanoke for business. I felt that it was my obligation to make a comment about a 1 star review from DMARTIN1975. To start I am Cuban and live in Miami "Little Havana" , 1)with respect to DMARTIN1975 COMMENT, "Congri" is actually MADE WITH "RED BEANS" mixed and cooked with rice !!!!! NOT black beans !!!2)The "BLACK BEANS "and rice mixed is called "MOROS Y CRISTIANOS" or "MOROS" for short , so DMARTIN1975 has no clue as what he is talking about. 3)there are many variations of croquetas, which is basically a Cuban fast food normally ate at a place that sells cafecito cubano (Cuban coffee, similar to expresso but better)along with other cuban patries, and/or type of sandwich made called a "croqueta preparada" or just as an appetizer.again you can eat anywhere in Miami and you will see what I mean. everyone has their tastes , doesnt make it gross !!4)AS FAR AS TAMALES ,again like croquetas , they all are different, its a simple Cuban fast food, that is made from ground corn, with some pieces of pork, DMARTIN1975 mentioned it was not Cuban but Central American, let me say that in Central America they make much better tamales than Cuban tamales , and I say that as a Cuban. So do not listen to DMARTIN1975, who just recently started 2019 to review, and a possible motive behind the false and incorrect claims. I will be visiting Roanoke this week and will definitely will be stopping there for lunch and highly recommend that you go experience Cuban Island!

Author: Rebecca L
Review: We happened upon reviews for Cuban Island when we were passing through Roanoke. The food is fantastic! The restaurant is spotless and the owners are great. Well be back every time we are traveling down 81.

Author: DMARTIN1975
Review: This is the WORSE Cuban restaurant I even been to, I am actually CUBAN, the croquetas " croquettes" are GROSS, this is are not Cuban croquettes whatsoever, this is like a red flour dough, no flavor they taste more like spam than ham, the tamales are like Salvadorean tamales with maceca flour, Cuban tamales are made of 100% corn with pork , the CONGRIS " black bean are rice cooked together, it was RED, This is not congris, by the way they use RED food coloring in their food, The mango juice was terrible from concentrated also had tons of sugar, I have to give credit for the restaurant to be very clean but food wise TERRIBLE!! THIS IS NOT CUBAN FOOD!!!

Author: JanSara
Review: Thank you Trip Advisor for allowing us to find this local gem! Please note the restaurant recently moved to 5508 WIlliamson Road which needs to be updated on the TA site. We were warmly welcomed as we entered. The food was authentic, plentiful and delicious. The history of the owners and their quest to flee Cuba and find a better life in the USA is inspiring and makes a visit here to support them that much sweeter. If you like Cuban food, put Cuban Island on your menu! AND two of us and appetizers and main courses for $30!

Author: SophieKellyGreen
Review: Estela and Mr. Jimenez had just moved to the new location the day we visited and we could tell that they were so happy. We were so happy after we got our food! My husband got the island chicken and I got the rope viejo. We also started with empanadas. We both agreed that the food was some of the best we have ever eaten. The service was amazing. It was like you were a guest in Estela's home. It's a shame we live in Texas; we would go here frequently. I wish them the best of luck.

Author: magic_carpets
Review: They may have moved since we visited on June 6th. They were renting the building and had purchased a place about 3 miles down the road (near the Arby's)They were just waiting for their liquor license, they had actually taken all of their wall decorations down & placed them in the new location.Food - large portions. Their homemade hot sauce was super hot! My Cuban sandwich was good - but I personally would ask for less mustard and more pickle.

Author: UnderC0verBr0ther
Review: Food and service were excellent. The staff was friendly, helpful and shared lots of laughs. For good reason, it seemed to be popular with an eclectic group of locals. I recommend the Cubano sandwich, con gris and especially the Cuban mojito. This gringo and his filipina wife will be returning soon.

Author: doupnikka
Review: We have eaten here several times and have always enjoyed the food. We took our neighbors this time we wanted them to taste the great food. My husband had the Cuban sandwich. I had the black bean soup, which could have been hotter. The soup was good but there was definitely a seasoning in the soup that made it taste different. I also had three chicken tacos. The flavoring on the chicken was very good. Our friends each ordered sandwiches. One porl and one chicken and they each had to take half home with them. They are always very friendly and the food is always good. We cant wait to go to their new location.

Author: Manskittles
Review: Authentic Cuban dishes!! Served by Cuban family. Do try their Cuban coffee. They also serve their own signature sauces.

Author: shereethomas1
Review: Our hostess was patient and answered all of our questions! She even let us practice our Spanish while ordering. Well definitely eat there again!

Author: Mike O
Review: Wow. Really big Saturday night crowd. Since we come here on Wednesdays, we had no idea about the level of popularity on the weekend. When we stopped in after 8PM on a Saturday night, the place was packed; hard to hear yourself think. Every table and every bar seat were occupied, and people were standing two deep in the aisle. Great to see so many customers. My Hokie Club with Brew City Fries were the same as always. And, our waitress, Debbie, although a bit rushed, was the same as always.

Author: aliciafurrow
Review: My hubby and I love to come here for cold beer and fried pickles ... lets keep it real this is a no frills bar... pool tables, standard bar food .. no wait staff just bar tenders... they have TVs and music... weve never had bad food .... just a place to relax and have a good time in casual atmosphere

Author: Mike O
Review: Well, this place is now sporting new vinyl booths; red back with black seats. Thankfully, it appears that no other changes were made. For me, the value of this place is that it remains the same. Same standard food, same beers, same appearance, same low prices, and best of all, same friendly vibe. That makes me feel at home here.

Author: george264
Review: Very nice little tavern. Always crowded and lively. Service has a hard time keeping up with the crowd at times, but worth the wait.

Author: Mike O
Review: I really like this place. After coming here every couple of weeks for evening beers and dinner with a couple of friends, I am now a regular. That's great. We sit at the same table. Debbie almost always waits on us. She has such a delightful personality; more like a member of our group and less like a member of the waitstaff. At this point she remembers what I like to order and delivers my usual every time without me having to ask. And that usual is a Hokie Club with Brew City Fries. The club is similar to what I have had elsewhere, but the fried are surprisingly different; extra crisp and crunchy; maybe the best I have had anywhere.

Author: lecian2013
Review: This is now our go-to for a delicious burger! Prices are great and one of these days, we will stop in to shoot some pool.

Author: frankcmartin3rd
Review: Not quite ready to go home? Looking for a convivial crowd and some billiards action? This is a great little hangout in the Grandin Village area with a cool, casual vibe and inexpensive fare.

Author: roahokie
Review: Dropped in here with friends after seeing a film at the wonderful Grandin Theater. Cold beer, simple bar food, and great atmosphere. Highly recommend the 1/2 lb burger and onion rings. Excellent. If you're expecting hanging ferns and tablecloths this isn't your place. We highly recommend

Author: SlyDill
Review: Not fancy but you can't beat the prices! Ice cold beer and all beef hot dogs! French fries and onion rings are delicious as well! Staff is very friendly!

Author: Kayla C
Review: I love hanging out here, it is a classic dive bar that attracts a good crowd. They have food and drinks are reasonably priced.

Author: AlanSx
