Review: It was the first time that I ordered a pizza from this place and I can say it is one of the best I have ever had in the US. It worth every penny you pay for it. Give it a try, you won't be disappointed!

Author: Aubrey L
Review: Overpriced pizza on frozen crust. No thin crust available. There's plenty of other pizza in the valley that is just as good at a much less price.

Author: catmom24
Review: We were not expecting to check this place out, but the nearby Famous Toastery was full so we popped in here after church. So glad we did. Not sure if its like his every day, but when we visited it was a one man shop. The same guy told us to pick a table, gave us menus, cooked our food, brought out our food, and rang up our check. A steady flow of folks came and went, but he stayed calm and collected. We ordered a 16 inch cheese pizza ($12.99) and side salads. The salads were the perfect size and the dressing was yummy. We were expecting a long wait for the pizza, but it came out soon after we finished the salads. It was cut into squares and tasted absolutely delicious. Not sure why we were so surprised at how good it was, but we couldnt stop eating. We finally made ourselves stop so we could take half home for leftovers. This place is located in Keagy Village and is definitely a place you want to check out. Weve been telling folks to try it because its a hidden gem. We will definitely be back. If you want a delicious pizza, check out this place!

Author: John S
Review: Best white on green pizza around Roanoke Virginia quality fresh produce. Tomatoes and broccoli and ricotta/garlic

Author: bluefield4
Review: The staff was very friendly, the food was excellent, the friends we were with enjoyed the newness of what we all ordered. We wlll be back!

Author: Jc24153
Review: A great Pizza. I would have gave it a five but the Pizza Sauce was a little bit sour for my taste. I highly recommend that they put a little Sugar in their Pizza Sauce!!!

Author: travlinrn
Review: When we arrived, there was only one lone worker there (we assume is the owner/chef). He was very kind, attentive, friendly, and his pizzas were some of the best I've ever tasted! I really was impressed with the buttery crust and the generous amount of toppings on the Hawaiian pizza.

Author: StarCityMom
Review: Remember hearing about this place, but not really thinking I needed to try another pizza place. However, a friend suggested going there as she had heard good things about it. SO glad we went! DELICIOUS pizza! Their sauce is amazing ....it makes the pizza! Pizzas are not only delicious, but attractive and piled high with toppings! Friendly staff, waitress checked back often to see if everything was OK or if we needed anything. Owner/manager came to our table to make sure every thing was to our liking. Dining companions had flatbread pizza and subs and everyone liked what they got. A couple of us ordered side salads, and they were fresh and tasty. Don't wait any longer to try them out! You might just find your favorite pizza place!

Author: iipuffs
Review: Went here for lunch with the guys. 2 of us got flatbread pizzas, 2 got subs. Everyone raved about their choices. My flatbread was delicious and the perfect size for a hearty lunch eater. The people were very friendly and patient with our questions as first time customers.

Author: SharonM723
Review: We ordered the cheese pizza. The place was very clean but small. No booths only about eight tables. They deliver too. Wasnt expecting much but the pizza is amazing. Its cut into squares and each bite is more delicious than the next. Definitely recommend over standard pizza chains. No sweet tea though!

Author: ShellieFalls
Review: Broth is the real deal, delicious and generous portions. The best dumplings I have ever eaten, hands down. Very nice owners, and delicious, authentic food. Prices are unbelievably reasonable. I have a bag in the backseat right now, and I cant wait to get home to eat it! We go as often as we can. Just go!

Author: dreamz_in_color
Review: First visit here. Last visit here. Someone recommended I try Pho Viet Nam. My husband and I placed our order before thoroughly looking this establishment over. Had we done that first, we would have walked out. Bugs under the table. Many dead flies on the windowsill. Several roaches and roach eggs in the bathrooms. Ants on the windowsill and crawling on my arm. Our waiter was so nice and humble, and the food was decent. But the filth was unlike anything I have seen. Most of the staff were just sitting around. Pick up a broom and a cleaning rag, for goodness sake! The health department should close Pho Viet Nam until they get their act together. If youre looking for authentic Vietnamese food in the Roanoke area, go to the very clean Viet Sub on Williamson Rd. We will not be returning to this place.

Author: doupnikka
Review: Coming into the restaurant I was wondering how customers do not fall and hurt themselves. There is a carpet pulled away from the step and someone could catch there shoe and fall. The front door was stuck open. We sat at a booth and the table top had several cracks and looked like it needed replacing. On the wall by the kitchen entrance supplies are lined along the wall. You certainly won't come to this restaurant for the decor. We ordered two meals and the food taste good. Our server was rather shy but answered our questions. When I see a restaurant in such dis-repair I wonder what their kitchen looks like.

Author: JC0l
Review: I've eaten vietnamese Pho befor and it was good, that's why we ate theere across the street from the motel and didn't regret it. The service and food were both very good.

Author: CLEVELANDS2
Review: From the outside, you would never expect the delicious food you will find insdie. Don't be deterred by the appearance. The pho is amazing, full of fresh herbs, full flavored broth, and meat and noodes. The service is good and the portion sizes are great.

Author: Debra C
Review: We had a group of 11; including 11 toddlers. Staff was very nice and able to handle our group. We also had a celiac person who had to had gluten free menu, and some vegans! no problem, great food. I had 2 appetizers, spring rolls & lettuce wraps with chicken, then I had stir fry veggies. The place isnt kuch to look at but food was Great! Prices are cheap!

Author: aliciafurrow
Review: My hubby brought home 2 phos ... one beef and one pork... it was deconstructed which was good. The broth is very gingery but really no other flavor.. so the broth was kind of bland... the pork was good.. the beef was ok, it had hints of lemongrass.... huge portion for 8.95 a piece ... comes w/ bean sprouts/ jalapeo and mint added ... soy and saracha on the side... in comparison to viet sub not far away.. I hate to say it, but viet sub has this one beat... its really about the flavor of the meat.. they do have other options that I would like to try.. just sad to say ordering pho again will not be an option... nothing beats DC Chinatown pho!

Author: 2Yummy4U
Review: I read the reviews and came for the pho. I ordered the chicken pho and spring rolls. The spring rolls were very good, as was the peanut sauce. The chicken pho was excellent. I added a little peanut sauce to the broth which added flavor. Everything was properly seasoned and not salty.The service was prompt and attentive and the environment tidy, relaxed and comfortable.I will return to try another dish.

Author: paralegal4444
Review: The Pho here is not only great but the portion sizes are huge! I usually get take out and it ends up being two meals for me or I share with my son. I love the chicken with rice noodles Pho or the vegetarian with rice noodles Pho. They were out of chicken last night on a Saturday which was disappointing, but it's ok. Ignore the lacking upkeep and poor decor. This place is a gem with a nice family running it!

Author: gintarem9
Review: Pho was great, they also have Asian market you can find vegetables and other stuff for cooking. Very simple and mind the overlook outside.

Author: Phil D
Review: The food was very tasty. The staff was friendly and prompt service. Some of us had breakfast others had lunch items.

Author: doupnikka
Review: We had never eaten here before so we decided to give it a try, and we weren't disappointed. It's a cute little diner and the prices were good too. My husband and I each had an order of hashbrowns that had cheese, ham and peppers on it. The price was great too at $3.95. We will definitely come again and try something else. There was only one waitress when we arrived and she moved around the diner in precision and never missed a beat. She was prompt, courteous and she always checked in with us. She was awesome.

Author: Steve L
Review: I went by this location for a quick lunch which turned out to be breakfast because they serve breakfast as well all day long. The decor is simple enough and clean. Easy access good parking. It's a seat yourself location so no problems with that and I was greeted immediately and had my drink order taken. I ordered a sausage and cheese omelette with home fries and a biscuit all of which were prepared perfectly. I especially like the home fries which had quite an amazing texture and we're definitely made from homemade and the biscuit was outstanding. The Omelette was equally well made. One thing of note is that the service here is top-notch. I overheard one waitress who was stressing over making sure that a call in order was completed to the customer's specifications. I saw emphasis on good customer service which was very refreshing. Prices were also very reasonable with nothing on the menu over $10. I will be visiting this location again for sure and can highly recommend.

Author: squrrily
Review: Stopped in for breakfast after my VA appointment. Got to say that I had the best breakfast I have had in years. HUGE quantity. I love fried catfish for breakfast and to my amazement it was on the menu. The fish was a piping hot fillet that was fried to perfection. My eggs were perfect and the hash browns had a nice crunch. The server never let my coffee get below half full. Do yourself a favor and seek out "Chip & Jo's. Good fresh food at working man's prices.

Author: Joel F
Review: They have very good food and nice quaint small diner atmosphere. Burgers and fries are excellent.. Diners are just as good.

Author: jhais28374
Review: Stop for lunch with large group! They handled the group great! Never missed a beat. We all enjoyed our lunch. Service was first class and did not see one issue. Great place to have lunch, food was great!

Author: wvbarber
Review: Had breakfast at 1130 which was great! Large selection on menu and very nice staff. They have boars head meats do sandwiches are yummy too.

Author: Steve H
Review: I have had breakfast and lunch here, what great service and food! You cant go wrong! The biscuits and gravy are awesome. The waitress is always so nice and friendly.

Author: becky w
Review: We eat there often and always enjoy it. Food is great and service is just as good. Wish he would enlarge because especially at breakfast it is often crowded

Author: walkersandy
Review: Our go-to place for breakfast. Nice selection, good old-fashioned diner atmosphere and great service.

Author: bbg130
Review: This place is huge with 4 bars, rooftop seating and a pool hall. The rooftop is cozy and the staff is friendly. The hand battered onion rings were tasty and fresh. The meat eater ordered a corned beef and pastrami sandwich, which was NYC tender and delicious. Me, the vegetarian ordered the veggie quesadilla. It too was delicious. Overall a good choice for a casual meal Though the menu has everything from appetizers to full entres.

Author: lisa s
Review: This place is a restaurant by day and club at night. It has several different areas to relax, dance. Play pool, socialize, and eat. The food was great, we ordered tarter tots, pizza, bang shrimp, chicken mini sandwiches and it was all delicious and hot! As night approaches it time to dance, it was a mixed crowd and the DJ played music that everyone would enjoy. There is plenty of space to dance, there was 2 levels of dancing. The drinks at the bar were strong and over flowing, all bartenders had great attitudes. I would difinently return back!

Author: Distance09
Review: Service was pleasant. The food was bland unfortunately but there was plenty of it. It was also noisy as some kids were screaming and jumping around on the second floor. That is just not relaxing. Why the hell people allow their children to act like savages in restaurants is beyond me. I guess they think their kids are so cute that they should share them with everyone else. They aren't.

Author: Paul L
Review: I remember when the left-hand side was Ward's. Anyway, despite the fact that Corned Beef is mostly known as a bar, billiards, and comedy club, it actually has excellent cuisine. The corned beef sandwich is amazing . . . and the pizza is some of the best in Roanoke.

Author: Roanoketraveler888
Review: The service was very slow and un organized. I ordered the corn beef platter special and it came very late and cold. The potato chips were stale and the burgers were ok. The fries arrived like warm. Overall really sad performance.

Author: dlfoster04
Review: Had the specialty sandwiches. They were great. This looks like a small place from outside, but huge inside. Inside there are several bar and dinning areas, lots of TV's and pool tables. I saw where they have comedy night and other events. I did get ticketed for parking in lot directly across the street, which I thought would be for patrons.

Author: 801joef
Review: Went before a show and sat at bar. Ordered the Turkey Ruben and Crab Cake sandwich. Both were excellent and tasty!I had veggies instead of fried. They were ok not great. Good beer and wine selection! A must visit if in Roanoke!

Author: Jeg H
Review: Took the waiter three trips to bring five non-alcohol drinks. When another booth was seated behind us, took and delivered their drinks, then took their order before taking ours. Forgot several items we ordered when he finally delivered our meal, then made multiple trips to deliver additional condiments. The kitchen left pickles off one sandwich, left cheese off another, and the onion rings weren't even warm. The booth was horrible for leg-room, which made sitting comfortably impossible for the five of us (one only 7 y.o.). Adding the step up, and a post right at the entry point made getting into and out of the booth difficult and potentially dangerous. Since there are 30+ other choices within 5 blocks, I can not imagine ever returning.

Author: WesOrmond
Review: Was not very busy and was able to get a table right in front of the TV showing our game. Basic bar food with a bit more than you would expect. I had the bacon bbq burger which was good and the spiral fries were good. My wife had the turkey reuben which she raved about the taste of the smoked turkey used. Waiter was very attentive had some small problems with computer but I think that he was fairly new. Good place to watch a game.

Author: piperlady2016
Review: Don't worry if you only wanted a salad or alternative to corned beef; there's plenty. Corned beef sandwich is usually pretty decent; just sometimes a little fatty which just happens from time to time. Service is pretty quick considering it is usually very crowded.

Author: aneishar2016
Review: Visited for lunch with my dad and it was really good. I had the chicken and he had the fish. The portions are huge so I definitely will return. I will try the ribs next time.

Author: Gogogb
Review: On Saturday and Sunday Mi Tapatia, grills on a open flame Ribs and Chicken. I heard about it from a coworker, and decided to go try it for myself. And I must say, it was well worth it! I first got the chicken meal, which was good. But I went back the next Saturday and got the ribs. And I've been going back every Saturday to get 2 racks for the past 3 weeks. I am highly recommend taking a trip to Mi Tapatia on a Saturday or Sunday and trying the Ribs or Chicken. You'll be glad you did!

Author: bbqBilly
Review: We have been there twice, and each time the food was fantastic. Nothing fancy about the dining room, all the effort has been put into the menu, which is the way it should be.On the weekends, they set up a grill outside and cook their own style BBQ Chicken and ribs. If you want the usual Tex-Mex, skip this place and go to one of the many local franchise places around. If you want real food, go here. Great flan too!

Author: Kelleylt
Review: Food was good. More authentic then most. However, there were 6 of us and only 5 dishes showed up. The last meal, mine, took another 20 min. No reasoning, no apologies, no discount. Not the best customer service.

Author: VarunaRaaja
Review: This is one of the best Mexican I ever had in long time. Very authentic and tasty. Family owned and amazing atmosphere. I will definetly recommend this place if you looking for good authentic food. I tried hibiscus water and polla tapatio. It's amazing.

Author: 421judithj
Review: We had been told that this restaurant is the real deal. As we walked in, I did feel as if I were entering a small town, typical Mexican restaurant. They were busy with only one hard-working waitress attending the two small rooms. No issue as we weren't in a rush. Food and drinks were average, nothing to write home about. Not Tex-Mex. Just average tasting Mexican. Prices ok.

Author: infamouskatie
Review: I agree with the other reviewers that this place needs more followers! The location is sort of hidden. It is a taco truck next to a grocery store on Williamson road. There is indoor seating. The food is AMAZING. I had the asada steak sopas (photo attached). Sopas are fried corn tortilla-ish. The sopa is much thicker than a traditional corn tortilla. Everything was perfectly cooked. You get 3 sopas with the order. My husband had the lengua burrito. Some of the meat was used in his rice. I'd never tried lengua before and it tasted like a very flavorful stewed beef. The burrito was huge and came with a side of rice and a small salad. With any dish, you get your choice of meats. My plan is to eat my way through their whole menu and try everything. Not all at once, of course!To drink I had horchata. I ADORE horchata. If you've never tried it, you should. It's a rice milk sort of drink that tastes like Christmas to me. If you are unsure of what anything is on the menu, the staff is very helpful. Overall...tell your friends about this place. You won't be disappointed!

Author: 2Yummy4U
Review: Just stumbled on this place . What a great find!!!! Something straight out of a Mexico. Just like I remember from my visits there. Happy atmosphere and music. Super friendly staff and excellent food at a very affordable price.You need to go!!!

Author: T9136ZEtonyp
Review: Went hunting for a local gem nobody has heard of and this is it! I always try whatever is on the specials of the day board and have yet to be disappointed. I cannot honestly tell you I know true Mexican cuisine but this has to be it. A level above the other Mexican restaurant "local chain" that is all over Roanoke. You may not get the free chips and salsa here but you won't want it so you can save room for the REAL food!

Author: 833leer
Review: Amazed to have found authentic Mexican on the east coast. I am a native south Texan with Mexican roots. Food at Mi Tapatia exceeded my expectations. DELICIOUS FOOD :-) don't pass it up.

Author: JPolino
Review: Pretty good pizza. Place closes at 10pm and we got there at 930 (7 of us) and our waitress was great didnt feel rushed and we all enjoyed our meal.

Author: Paul L
Review: I have been eating here since it first opened and I usually get pizza since that is their specialty; but today i felt like trying something different and ordered what is possibly the best lasagna I have lever had in a restaurant.

Author: Judy M
Review: Wait staff is nice and food is good (good, not great),very high for lunch. Especially with the new menu.

Author: Go567289
Review: Our first time checking out this pizzeria today after checking trip advisor for pizza selections. We tried pizza, salad bar and the lemon chicken pasta. We were very impressed with everything. We cant wait to go back and try the subs and calzone options. Service was great. Facility was clean. Salad bar was fresh. Parking is across the street.

Author: KiKiBug
Review: We had heard a lot about this long time pizza restaurant and decided to try it after an afternoon movie at The Grandin Theater. The pizza was very good, but the server was a bit off and she actually became annoying with the crowning glory from the beginning was she approached the table while we were talking and she just stood there with a straw in each hand waiving them like they were beating a drum and when we didn't stop talking she put them back in her apron like putting guns in a holster. We didn't know what she was doing and asked if she would just leave two straws for us. Aside from her, it is a very nice place for lunch or a dinner and the pizza was very good as was reported by a few friends. The pizza was brought pretty quickly and the ingredients tasted very good. If I lived in that neighborhood I would definitely get a take out pizza on occasion. The rating would have been higher but the server brought the rating down. The food is very good.

Author: Susan0614
Review: We ate here for lunch today. We are from NC. It was very good. I had a calzone and he had chicken sub. Both was delicious and loved the dough used for both item. Service was wonderful. She was attentive and great to chat with too. We would eat here again. Cool neighborhood pizza place.

Author: Marla A
Review: The group discussion on where to eat was a firm decision to not have pizza. So you can imagine my surprise when we pulled up to this place. But my family did not lead me wrong, totally awesome pasta. Very accomodating for our little group of five, quick and helpful service. And oh, the lemon chicken pasta dish. I couldn't stop eating it, though I did take a container home. Definitely hope to be back.

Author: offunspirit
Review: The food is outstanding. We had sandwiches on the fresh baked bread and ordered a slice of pizza. We were celebrating our anniversary so we ordered dessert..tiramisu..so good! There is a salad bar also. Lunch specials are a deal. We have high expectations when we eat out and Grace's did not disappoint. The Grandin area is a fun place to hang out too.

Author: georgifisher
Review: We visited Graces Place for a quick dinner after a long day of meetings. Food was pretty good, but not outstanding. Service was decent.

Author: Joseph W
Review: Grace's is a great place for pizza and very reasonable prices. Menu offers lots of items and all are fresh and home made. We love the pizza and the salad bar.

Author: ThePCGuy
Review: I had the Filet and the wife spicy chicken. Both were VERY good. Service was great. The place was busy for Thursday. Not sure why the reviews are not higher considering the service and food. Close to the Holiday Inn, I would go back and recommend you check it.

Author: aneishar2016
Review: Visited for dinner with my brother. Ordered ribs and baked potato. It was really delicious. The ribs were so soft and had seasoning. The only thing I didn't like was the wait time. Had a long wait to be seated and a long wait for the food to be ready.would return though.

Author: SpiderEffect
Review: This Texas Roadhouse sits high on a hill in Roanoke, with a winding and gear churning trek to get to the parking lot. For those not familiar with the area, the best way to get to the restaurant is to go travel into the Lowe's parking lot and head up the hill. Never have we gone to Texas Roadhouse and NOT had to wait to be seated. Now - that is not to say that they were packed....far from it. You can enter the restaurant and see 5-10 booths plus some tables open and waiting on customers, but you will still receive a buzzer and will have to wait. Why??? Not really sure....you can ask, but it seems to dumbfound the hostesses when you ask why there are tons of empty tables. Let's talk about the Hamburger Steak. It is a staple for my husband. He absolutely must have one when dining out. We have tried repeatedly to order a Hamburger Steak at this location and they have NEVER gotten it cooked correctly. I will talk specifically on our recent visit. This visit was just the two of us....which is pretty unusual but we are enjoying some empty nesting in our home. Upon arriving - the parking lot had maybe 20 cars in the lot. It was around 4pm and a little early for the dinner rush. We were told it would be a 20 minute wait in spite of counting 10 tables/booths wide open and waiting to be filled. I am going to assume it was the 'changing of the guard' as I call it. The time when there is a shift change and they are balancing out patrons to waitresses/waiters. When we were seated, we immediately ordered because my husband is a creature of habit. We ordered an appetizer and drinks in case this trip ended up like the other 10 attempts to get a decent hamburger steak. I always order a chicken dish because their smothered chicken is so delicious!When the waitress brought out our meal, the hamburger steak was burned. Let me paint the picture.....the steak was literally so black it looked like the asphalt in the parking lot. After a few muttered cuss words, my husband took his fork and tapped the steak.....you could literally hear a 'ping' when the fork touched the meat. After flagging down the waitress, a manager came over stating she saw the order come out and was trying to find who had the burned hamburger steak. After handing it to her, the manager proceeded to peel the burned area and simply said 'I have no words'. The steak was taken back and we waited. We had friends sitting at a neighboring table who then came over to talk. There were laughs and it was a great social time. When they left, my husband said 'how long has it been since we sent the steak back'....we looked and 'oh my' doesn't begin to cut it. The manager was flagged down and informed us the hamburger steak was burned AGAIN and another manager was in the back teaching the cooks how to prepare a proper hamburger steak. Needless to say - we had been there for more than 2 hours at this point. I wouldn't eat without my husband receiving his order. By the time he received a properly cooked hamburger steak, he was so disgusted we took everything home in to-go boxes. I will commend our waitress for her amazing customer service skills. She kept us in rolls, drinks, and was constantly asking what she could do for us. Just a gem in an otherwise negative dining experience. The manager definately took care of us. I will say that in spite of not receiving the order correctly OR the time we took to receive the proper order, she went above and beyond. Think about it......knowing these cooks are subpar could be ignored. Instead - this manager took the time to TEACH her employees and not to pass the buck. She didn't let this lack of doing their job properly be ignored. The cooks were INSTRUCTED with another manager standing behind them making sure they cooked the hamburger steak correctly. How impressive is that?? While this is just one example in a string of visits where something on our order was undercooked or overcooked, I will say it gave me a new respect for the manager that is currently trying to shape things up at her restaurant! Our waitresss - we couldn't have been more impressed!!

Author: TreeHugger54
Review: Visited the restaurant while in Roanoke visiting family. My meal was perfect and prepared differently than other country fried chicken dinners. It had a smokey taste to it and was delicious. Others in our party complained their steaks were not prepared as ordered. The service was great with Angelica as our waitress. The sides were also good. As for me, I enjoyed the taste of the meal, service and atmosphere.

Author: 614brendaf
Review: We arrived and were seated with no wait. We waited 10 minutes for a waitress. I finally stopped one and she got our drinks and took our order. We waited 30 minutes on our food. and it was still not served when we walked out. Note - the people next to us came in after us were almost finished eating when we walked out.

Author: Dennis M
Review: This is a meat-and-potatoes franchise steak house. No frills, nothing to write home about. Steaks can be ordered off the menu or purchased from the meat counter. There are choices for those prefer something else, e.g., salmon or chicken. There is a limited selection of draft beers.  An interesting dish to try is the chicken portabella; a grilled chicken breast is covered in portabella mushroom sauce and melted Colby-jack cheese.  If you don't like the hoopla of a birthday song-and-dance, then don't tell them it's your birthday.

Author: Thomas G
Review: It is the steakhouse that you thought it would be. They will let you pick your meat, serve you drinks, and sing you a birthday song.

Author: paisajesycomidas
Review: Second time at this TRH. Again, a delicious meal, steak was juicy and flavorful, even though the place was somewhat busy, I was seated right away. Will come back when in the area.

Author: rven4ever
Review: Had NewYorkStrip and Ribeye. Both were very salty. Our Waitress Chelsea was more interested in sitting with her friends at another table talking then serving us. Had to ask other waitresss to get drinks etc. complementary peanuts were empty. She didnt clear table of used glasses plates until we left. Overall mediocre food with poor service. Will not be returning

Author: TravelinJim2014
Review: We had a early dinner at the Texas Roadhouse this evening. We arrived around 5:00 and the parking lot was packed. We figured around a 20 minute wait since we did not have a reservation, but were seated immediately. This was a pleasant surprise since this was the first time we had been back since they opened. The reason we had not been back was a long wait and poor service. Not so tonight, my wife had the prime rib. It was done just the way she liked it and I had a half rack of ribs and it was more than I could eat. Needless to say , We will be back.

Author: MrsKerren18
Review: Cancun can always be counted on for freshness, cleanliness and professionalism. We love that the servers are dressed for work, and yet somehow always are neat, tidy and clean! They are very friendly, recognize repeat customers and are very fast. This particular location has the lunch buffet, which we enjoy because it prods us to try things we might not otherwise order. Thanks for your consistently, both at this location and at Smith Mountain Lake!

Author: 290meganl
Review: What can we say thank you for a great night. I called in to look at the menu and Manuel meet me and showed me the menu and we decided to come back for dinner. What welcoming staff and the food was great. Huge servings and what a margarita we had. Would recommend you try this place. Thanks again Manuel and all the staff for a great night.

Author: JennWil84
Review: I am so impressed with Cancun Mexican Restaurant and Grill. The atmosphere is on point and the food and service are excellent. Ask for Manuel! He always takes the best care for food order quality and accuracy. I love Mexican food but hate beans and avoid gluten - if that makes any sense haha. But Manuel and the rest of the staff are always accommodating and understanding, welcoming and hospitable! Thank you all!

Author: rexerazo
Review: Mexican restaurant located on Market Street in downtown, waitress seemed to have trouble smiling, other than that service was good, food came out in good time, but the food was just ok, nothing grand. Didn't seem like authentic cooking but it was edible. Alcohol is available, outside seating in very small area. parking is on street.

Author: rancherojack
Review: Had dinner with the family, this was our third trip to this restaurant. We try to go every time we are in Roanoke. The food is fantastic, the restaurant and restrooms are clean. The staff is very helpfull and friendly. I highly recommend this restaurant, it is the best one in the area. Good portions of quality food and reasonable prices.

Author: Allenflusa
Review: Wasn't expecting much when a relative took me to this small spot on the Square, but the service was truly excellent, and the food was some of the better Mexican food I have enjoyed lately. Manager went out of his way to ensure that everything was good in our experience. Would definitely repeat

Author: David E
Review: They have a pretty substantial menu and the food was served hot. Portions were pretty big; we couldn't finish our meals. It's a basic Mexican restaurant, nothing especially fancy, but good value.

Author: 444garym
Review: We enjoyed our visit to Cancun Mexican Grill. Luis took excellent care of the four couples there for mid afternoon bite to eat. The drinks were cold and the volcano margaritas were wonderful. The food was excellent and other customers were great to talk with - we were a little rowdy but felt welcome throughout our visit. We will be back on our next visit.

Author: Pamsreview
Review: Most eateries seemed to be closed when we arrived downtown for a meal but we struck it lucky with this restaurant. It had a good family atmosphere. the service was attentive and the food substantial and tasty

Author: mb52015
Review: I love my guacamole with lots of cilantro and lime and when I asked for those items the service was friendly and very providing. I have a bowl of limes and cilantro to spice up my guacamole as I desire. I also have ordered their marguritas and they are always quite tasty and plentiful. This time I ordered the shrimp nachos. They are beautiful and perfectly grilled and covered in cheese.

Author: Asia922
Review: We had a double date night with my cousin and her husband they hadn't been out since their new baby and she wanted logans. We have all worked in restaurants and I still do so we are very patient and understanding but I have never had such a terrible experience in my life. Our server greeted us in a timely manner we order a prime rib, ribery, and steak salad as well as a chicken breast entree. My cousin and I had ordered drinks as well, the salads came out before the meal but still no drinks I kindly reminded our server, no big deal just in case she forgot. She brought them back the margarita was completely watered down with water floating on top, it had been sitting there, still we didnt say anything we just didnt drink it. Then the prime rib and chicken dinner came out but the other two plates didnt, which is odd because realisticly chicken should take longer than rare steaks to come out, she said it would be 3 minutes on the other plates. We waited to eat since my boyfriend and cousin still had no plates, 20 minutes later the manager brings out my boyfriends steak without the side and drops off the salads. Both steaks were overcooked he never asked us how anything was, and never apologized for our now cold food. Our original server never returned to the table instead we had another server return to the table to give us our check. We never got asked how our meals were, If everything was cooked properly ect. Being in the industry myself, I of course still tipped (everyone has bad day) but I can say I wouldve never neglected my tables that way, this goes for the server, and the manager that brought the food out. All food should have been brought to the table at the same time. Very disappointing we never go out !

Author: Michael B
Review: Sept, 2019: In the area for a few vacation days. We were in a different part of VA and liked the Logan's at the location. We both ordered the filet minion, sweet potato. They were delicious, but I could not finish the steak. I finiahed it off at 10pm that night, and even cold it was so good. It was busy at 4:30 when we arrived, half empty on that Sun., by the time we left. They must have some city food tax as we had almost $8 of tax on $71 bill. I asked for $10 back on my $101 payment. So they cost more then Texas Roadhouse. Friendly staff, tough location. My GPS wanted me to drive over a curb to get there. It's on a secondary road next to the mall. So be careful getting there.

Author: k n
Review: My wife and I ate dinner at Logans and were very dissatisfied. We ordered the beef tips and they came cool and tasteless, even though they were supposed to be grilled mesquite. My wife's sweet potato had no butter and just a pinch of cinnamon as well as also being cool. The waitress never came back to see how things were as well as giving us a trainee and just leaving her with us. We ate at one of these restaurants a few years ago while traveling through Virginia and liked it real well but it looks like they are going downhill.

Author: Barbara C
Review: Hubby and I had lunch this past Sunday Logan's Roadhouse. He had the club sandwich band wasn't impressed. I had the American Cheeseburger with fries. I took the slice of tomato off my burger, due to the center was black. Otherwise, I was happy with my food. The service was great!

Author: cgandgg1989
Review: My husband and I had stopped visiting this restaurant because it has gone downhill so much over the past few years. Every time we went, we were disappointed. We decided to give it another shot, which was a bad decision. My husband ordered filet mignon and requested it butterflied. Steak was not butterflied and husband said it tasted more like pot roast. As the server was setting down our plates, she asked how was the food. She must have known. Baked potatoes were small and salad wasn't very fresh. There are plenty of other steak houses in the area. Doubt we will go back to this one anytime soon.

Author: Scenic44253375836
Review: Logan's Roadhouse is a great place to sit down and eat a awesome meal! The atmosphere is so cool! Laid back, friendly staff. Peanuts on the floor! It's cool.

Author: JerBob
Review: We had excellent Service by Jessica. She was quick witted and wonderful sense of humor. The kitchen was slow to get our food out over an hour. The food was Logans standard. However... I want to say THANK YOU for the two brownies!!!! These were for a charity auction!!! The brownies were sold at auction for $100!!! THANK YOU again for supporting our STAR FAMILY FOUNDATION charity auction!! Its these small gestures that makes our world good again!!!

Author: Milton A
Review: It's been a couple of days since I took my family of 7 to Logans in Roanoke to eat. We wanted to enjoy a nice meal together before the 4th of July activities began. Wanting to beat the crowd, we arrived at 11:30 AM. The appetizers of onion petals and fried bacon were good and the rolls were fine, however, the issues began once the main courses arrived. My wife's steak that she ordered medium rare arrived WELL done. My steak that I ordered medium arrived WELL done and my son's steak on his sausage and steak platter which he ordered medium also arrived WELL done. My son and I ate all of ours that we could, however, my wife asked that her's be sent back and prepared the way she prefers it. While she waited (the rest of us began eating) she decided to eat her side dishes of broccoli and rice. By the time her new steak arrived she had finished her sides. A gentleman delivered her new steak (we assumed he was a manger but he never identified himself) and she said to him, "The broccoli and rice were excellent but would have been better with the steak" to which he replied, "I bet he would have been" and walked off. No apology for the incorrect steak(s) and no offer to bring fresh sides due to the kitchen error. After spending $134.00 for 7 people to eat, a person would expect a little more from a manager. I would normally blame something like this on the crowd but there was none to speak of--just poor food preparation and even worse customer service from the people in charge! Sorry Logans of Roanoke, VA--you will not be getting any more of this families hard earned money! And based on our recent experience, I will not hold my breath for a response to this post!

Author: Michael A
Review: Stopped n while shopping in Roanoke. My wife and I expected a good steak, we did not receive one. Very average. They also dollar you to death. Anything you get will be a 2.50 of up charge. Not my cup of tea. OOPS anther upcharge.

Author: Hrtfixr9
Review: Came in on a Saturday for lunch. They were not busy at all, they sat us right away. Nine minutes later we hadn't seen a waiter/waitress yet. Finally she comes takes our drink order. After we order here come the rolls..(only good part of the meal) I ordered steak medium , sauteed mushrooms and corn. My wife ordered her steak medium rare, broccoli and baked potato. Anyway my medium steak came medium well and cold. My wife asked for medium rare and it came medium, also cold and the corn tasted stale and old. We will never eat there again.

Author: 536jeanniel
Review: Biscuits and sausage gravy were great. Really good breakfast and coffee. Karen was an excellent server and so very nice!

Author: Kim H
Review: Attentive wait staff on this visit made our meal so pleasant. Good, simple, Southern fare including generous "veggies" like pinto beans, squash casserole, stewed tomatoes, and similar. Kraft Mac and Cheese is among kids' meal options...which kids love. Waffles and chicken on Wednesdays. Casual, family atmosphere; always clean.

Author: keyperson43
Review: We were in town for a meeting. Heard about this restaurant. We were treated to breakfast by our clients. Omlet okay, Bacon was rancid, spoiled the taste of the omlet.Biscuits-A+ A true win for this restaurant.Came back for lunch. Burger and Fries, Fries were done well. Burger okay, nothing special for the price.Desert-Butterscotch Pie. Not good. It tasted like instant pudding put into a pie shell with whipped topping.Staff at breakfast-rushed. waiting line. Staff at lunch Polite but curt!

Author: Kim H
Review: Reasonably-priced comfort food in a simple atmosphere in the Towers Mall area. Biscuits are a local tradition. Serves children's meals at a good price. Good place for a meal with extended family -- something to please most everyone (sandwiches, salad, spaghetti, etc.). Recommend California panini sandwich. Taco salads are huge. Parking on site.

Author: Ktgalb1
Review: WHAT an amazing experience! GREAT variety and prices. WONDERFUL service. Worth a visit to eat at this great restaurant.

Author: Q3194XBrebeccap
Review: It has been awhile since we have eaten at this restaurant. There are many choices on the luncheon menu and today there was also a daily special. I chose the broiled flounder and my husband ordered the fried chicken. The portions served where quite generous. I would have liked my sides to have been warmer; but the biscuits made up for everything. They are very good.

Author: Michael B
Review: I've eaten here many times as this place is a Roanoke fixture. Recently my sister and I had lunch together and we both enjoyed our food and found the service prompt (my sister waitressed her when in college over 40 years ago!). I ordered the turkey and dressing plate that came with two sides and either corn bread or rolls. I got the former, my sister the latter. She ordered a veggie plate, which can be three or four of the sides. They do a good job on the sides too!

Author: GreatDayTraveling
Review: Lunch specials, Grilled Sirloin with sides & California Panini with potato salad. Excellent fluffy biscuits. All good. Friendly, helpful wait staff. Clean restrooms

Author: nwnh40
Review: I had the broiled seafood, it was bad crab cake horrible, fish not any better, the two scallops were ok and three shrimp over cooked, my meal came out at different times first entree, then about 5mins later potato then 10mins later corn sticks, friend said fried fish was good but fries came out 15mins after fish, other friend liked braised beef, the service was ok, although my drink was never refilled. I prefer to never go back but, people seem to love this place. This is my second visit and 1st was no better, I went for breakfast and disliked the omelet, I had what taste like canned mushroom.

Author: Denny G
Review: I got there early on a Sunday morning and got right in but there was a line before I left. Good food and service in a very comfortable setting.

Author: cgandgg1989
Review: When you pull into a restaurant in this town on a Sunday afternoon, you expect to wait. We arrived around 1 PM and the parking lot was virtually empty, which is a bad sign. We were seated right away and had to wait quite a while before the server made an appearance. Husband ordered a beer and my granddaughter and I ordered water. Bartender brought my husband's beer long before the waters arrived. Granddaughter is 7 and drink was served in an adult glass with no lid. Seeing as though our server was an older woman, she should have known better. The food was not bad, but our server was constantly disappearing for long periods at a time. Every time she returned, she reeked of cigarettes so I can only assume she took multiple breaks. From what I could see, she only had 2 or 3 tables. It is bad enough that their food is overpriced, but for the service to be that poor, there is a reason all the restaurants in the vicinity had packed parking lots and this place was empty.

Author: litulk2018
Review: decided to go here as we have not been in a very long time. well this time was no where near like it was the last time. no wait time which was good but...we were sat in the very back with the sun in our eyes. server did greet us almost immediately but that was the last time anything was done on time. we ordered our food, appetizer first and told the server to wait till half way thru app to put in meal. that didn't happen. things came out right on top of each other. my steak well lets just say tiny was not the word for it plus it was not medium rare it was rare. husbands steak was not right nor did it come with the sauce like it was supposed to. sent mine back to correct the temp and they said they would bring his sauce right back. ten minutes later he still had no sauce and his steak was cold now. they redid both of our steaks. food was overall fairly good but service was horrible.

Author: Gayleetro
Review: After working late, hubby suggested we eat out -so we met at TGI Fridays. The parking lot was almost empty. We walked in and there was no one to greet customers.The restaurant was almost empty - duh - parking lot was almost empty. After waiting a few minutes someone finally acknowledged that there were people waiting to be seated. Once we were seated, we were given ample - more than ample time to choose from the menu. We placed our order with the server who was very attentive. After what it seemed like an extremely long time to get our meal, it was missing cocktail sauce for the shrimp and the glaze for the steaks. The shrimp were overcooked, the steaks were overcooked. The mashed potatoes were good.We were disappointed in our meal, the only redeeming thing about dinner, was the server. He was so eager to do a good job and he did.

Author: Debra W
Review: Staff was the most congenital and happy. Everything was great. Food was good. Will be my go to place next trip

Author: Cornbred
Review: I knew Fridays was way passed its glory days but I had no idea it was this bad! Quesadilla was soggy and greasy! Bartenders were all just standing around while one person was actually trying to provide service! Dont bother. Really disappointing. No Southern hospitality here!!!

Author: Daryl S
Review: Our server was nice just didn't know the menu... she couldn't tell us what was or wasn't a preimium side, not indicated on menu at all... ordered the 2 entree and 2 side special got ribs they were way over cooked and a med rare steak that was burned and rubbery.. sent back second steak came out medium well and cold... had to eat it was running out of time took 45 min for first order 15 for replacement steak... food was super sub par... never again

Author: jewels1420
Review: We called a week in advance to TGI Fridays's in Roanoke Virginia to alert the restaurant that there was a huge wrestling tournament in town, and many people would choose their restaurant for lunch Friday afternoon around 2, come all at once, and need to be out by 3:30 or 4. Told that they had no separate party room, they promised to hold tables together if they could for 20-30 people. We didn't care so much about sitting together as to make sure there were enough servers for our group. We called again the day before the planned event and again reminded the manager that we would be coming all at once around 2. When we arrived at 2:15 the manager said she was just about to leave, but had staff available. (The weather was bad, so the bar staff was short). She then proceeded to try to serve the entire group by herself! Our people went to the bar for their own drinks several times. She took orders for the entire group one table at a time but didn't take any orders back, so the kitchen got orders for 10 tables all at once! Needless to say, it was quite a wait. I was disappointed in the service, although the food was satisfactory once it finally arrived. The manager needed to have help available, ask for help if it was available and be more efficient for her kitchen staff who stood around and waited for orders and then received them all at once!

Author: Robert L
Review: Stopped in to watch some NFL football and get some food to go after being on the road. Ordered a draft beer which was about room temperature. The big screen TV was in disrepair, it had a yellow glow to it, very distracting to watch. I observed some dishes coming out and they did not look very appetizing, but to be fair I've had some meals that were great that didn't look real good, just not very often. The menu pages were stuck together, like they hadn't been cleaned recently. Decided to get food elsewhere. After waiting 10 minutes to get my bill for the one beer I had, $7. Overpriced for a draft beer. Maybe I just came at the wrong time, but this experience was disappointing.

Author: 677dan
Review: What can I say other than it was a disappointing visit. Food was below average with above average prices. Even staff said they could not recommend some of the menu items. While the place was not dirty, you did not feel like it was clean either. We requested a table, and they kept trying to put us at the bar. There were plenty of open tables. Do not go there if you are at Valley View Mall. Even the food court in the mall is vastly better.

Author: John H
Review: Ate here a couple of times, service was friendly but several drink and food orders got mixed up or incorrect. Food was pretty good but not great. There are dozens of restaurants within a few miles, I would probably choose another next time.

Author: Linda C
Review: We had crab cakes and risotto which was the nights special and did not disappoint. Good wine and beer selection and a nice atmosphere. Definitely recommend this eatery.

Author: rhfatula
Review: If youre in Roanoke, near Roanoke, or driving through Roanoke, eat here. Excellent taste and seasoning. Expertly prepared. Interesting variety. Attentive and knowledgeable staff. We felt like long time regulars eating at our favorite place when in reality we were passing through town for one night. If\when we pass through again we will be back.

Author: Ktgalb1
Review: Wow! This restaurant really went above and beyond. The food was extremely good. The atmosphere was dressy casual. The servicer went out of her way to make our experience extremely pleasant!

Author: Aruth35453
Review: Ordered the lunch special it was a bbq grilled cheese sandwich. Very good! Definitely worth checking out.

Author: flyinbunny03
Review: Came here last night, after a friend mentioned this place, so we decided to try it. And, we were glad we did! Our food was great! My husband really liked the shrimp and grits; I liked the chicken Milanese , and our friends had the Texan hamburger and the fingers and toes. We appreciated the fact that our food was cooked to order. Chef did a great job! Service was great. Will definitely return!

Author: 4travelers02
Review: Perfect spot for a business lunch or after work drinks. The chicken piccata is really good. I enjoyed the atmosphere and the food.

Author: Gohoosao
Review: First the folks who complain about slow service have no idea what it takes to prepare a cook to order meal. Shameful. This was a pleasant experience. Hate it took so long to try. Must Drink: Poached pear martini My wife had the burger with the charred Brussels. Both amazing. The wedge salad was unique;I loved the cucumber addition. The added chicken breast was seasoned to perfection. Cant wait to really explore the menu.

Author: Artemus
Review: My wife and I had lunch today at Bernards. The restaurant is a bit upscale but casual and comfortable feeling at the same time. The bar is very nice and there was great Irish music playing at a comfortable volume. We both got sandwiches and we we both loved our sandwiches. I had the The Stackhouse which is a Club Sandwich and it was one of the best Clubs Ive ever had. It was huge and made with high quality meats plus the bacon on it was excellent. The fries were also very good. My wife had The Irishman which is very close to a Reuben and she loved it. We both had iced tea which was good. Our server was Jimmy and he did a great job and was very welcoming and friendly. We look forward to returning to Bernards and high recommend it.

Author: August410
Review: Dont order the onion soup.......its a very poor presentation of that dish.The blue cheese wedge was soaked with way to much dressing.Service time was way to long for a quick lunch!Must say the server was very nice....told me there will be no charge for the terrible soup, yet when i received the check the soup was still charged, the real sever apologized and made the correction.

Author: Michael F
Review: We had heard good things from friends about the place. We were highly disappointed.Do not order the chicken. It arrived on the cool side, dry and very overcooked. Sauce was bland and watery.Service slow. Server promptly took order, then we, a table of four, waited nearly an hour for our meal. This is a small place. When we asked for a basket of bread, we received very dry, toasted, white bread. No butter or oil. For which we were charged $8.00.I hope this was just a bad night. It will be a while if we go again.

Author: andruscherij
Review: Jersey Lily's was recommended by our Hotel. It was the worst meal of our entire trip. I ordered "well done" and got shoe leather that walked 100 miles. My friend ordered "medium rare" and got burnt to a blackened crisp. The Shrimp was barely warm and in a slimy "butter garlic" sauce or what was suppose to be. The service was almost non existent and it took almost half an hour just to get the waitress to return to our table, while taking care of the table next to us. She kept walking away as I tried to get her attention more than a few times. I highly recommend finding another restaurant.

Author: Voyager782774
Review: For well over a five years, we have been visiting this restaurant during our annual trip to Roanoke VA. The location has a Texas steakhouse atmosphere with a modern look, The service this time was extremely slow, We waited over an hour for a table for three on a Friday night at 7:00 pm. While some food was good, some food was mediocre at best. My ribs were dried out and staff was over loaded and we waited for drink refills. We were highly disappointed and probably wont return next time we are in that area of VA..

Author: Gayleetro
Review: We go to Jersey Lily's on a regular basis because it's close to home. My go to dish is the Steak Salad. The salad is always fresh and the small steak is cooked to order and just the right amount of steak for a salad. Their loaded potato soup is good too.Just recently had the Cheesy Fries - and they were really good. Just the right amount of cheese. Hubby gets the boneless wings quite often and always enjoys them. Sweet tea is hit or miss - it tasted old on our last visit. Service is usually good - if they have enough servers. Restaurant needs some TLC - it's looked the same for years.

Author: Leah O
Review: We had sort of a mini family reunion here. My dad and I came to town and met my brother and his wife, his son and wife and baby and my uncle and his wife. This was the first time my dad met his great grandson. It was a busy Friday night but they gave us this huge table in its own little room which was nice. Also, it was a round table so you could see and talk to everyone. My uncle said he has been coming here for about ten years and always gets great food and service. I believe him! Our server was very sweet and attentive. She was always there when we needed something and she got all of our ordered correct. Im a vegetarian, so I was impressed by all the veggie options they offer. In most steak houses I can get a baked potato and a salad and thats it. This place gave me those and other options. I ordered Mac and cheese, French fries and a salad. It was so good. Everyone else really loved their food too. The server even took our picture for us. It was great! There plenty of room outside the building that we could take lots of pics. Its covered so it would work even in the rain. They also have a really big parking area so no problems finding parking.

Author: Heather M
Review: Our steaks were not cooked properly and when we brought it to the managers attention he told us that we were wrong and cut into my husbands steak and poke it with his finger and tell us that it was. He then told my husband that he wouldn't charge him for the steak but that he could take it with him, but who wants an overcooked, tough steak that someone else has been touching. We asked for our check and I asked for a box and for some reason our server seemed angry with us now. We won't be going back any time soon.

Author: Hokiechip
Review: Decided to visit again to see if things had changed and while the staff attitudes was significantly better, the quality of the food was not good at all.I ordered a filet cooked medium well and it was delivered close to burnt.The potatoe was really crunchy as well. The waitress apologized and agreed to get it redone, but I asked for chicken this time to try something different. The chicken was good, but no new sides - just the cold, crunchy baked potatoe that was dleivered originally.Perhaps one day, they will get things all together.

Author: 0kristi
Review: The restaurant was clean and rather large dining room. So we didnt have to wait at all for a table but it was pretty noisy. I had the salmon and it was ok. Not many vegetarian options if that is something you need. On the plus side, the mixed drinks were delicious and strong! Our server was very nice and attentive. Was not bad but wouldnt be a destination for me.

Author: Wesley K
Review: An overnight stop in Roanoke brought us here. We were seated right away and promptly greeted by our friendly server. I will start on a positive note by saying the hot rolls and honey butter were delicious! My meal was good - pot roast with mashed potatoes and green beans. The meat was tender ( a little peppery), potatoes tasted fresh, flavorful gravy, and seasoned green beans. Hubby got the seafood platter which was a crab cake, about a dozen fried shrimp, and two nice sized pieces of cod. First, a disclaimer - we're from MD so we know what a good crab cake is SUPPOSED to taste like, and this wasn't it! Entirely too much filler, to the point he couldn't finish eating it, and my taste of it concurred. The cod was super breaded, so much so that hubby had to scrape some off. He said the shrimp were good. His meal was to come with fries and slaw. Fries were hot and crispy. Slaw was missing from his plate! Server said there was someone new in the kitchen who was still learning what sides get served with what entree. So why isn't there more oversight with the newbies??The menu offers a large variety, so lots of choices. Prices are moderate.

Author: Marsha N
Review: Did not know were to eat as wanted a hot meal and pulled in to Jersey Lily's. Nice place and we had a great hot meal. Our waitress was very friendly but not to friendly. I would recommend this and the prices are right.

Author: nwnh40
Review: I wished I looked at reviews before going, because I had the steak with garlic butter shrimp, gross I took my napkin and wiped it off the shrimp, it's bad, also ask for 2 broccoli said there was a upcharge so I said ok well then just leave the potatoes, so what I got was a potatoes no broccoli, so a dish that comes with broccoli I get none after asking for two. I use to like this place or maybe Salem is just better but I have no plans to return in the future, also I ask for med rare perfect, my boyfriend ask for med well , his came out looking like mine, but also one who doesn't like to complain, but after observing someone else send there steak back maybe he should have.

Author: Planetflavor
Review: You walk in and immediately feel like home, the spices full the air as smooth r&b serenades the space. The service is top quality the level of care I experience feels like I am at family dinner. The owners are the best people in restauranting. They are there everyday and all day keeping the pieces together running smoothly. They aren't afraid to jump in the kitchen or bust a table. I appreciate that type of leadership. Then THE FOOD IS OUT OF THIS WORLD! Jam-packed flavor and robust! It is impossible to leave with anything less than a full belly! I have been patronizing this establishment for 6 years because they are the BEST! Long live Elephant Walk!

Author: javalover5050
Review: Just what you'd expect in a hotel bar. Pretty good selection of bar food and a few items beyond. A zealous bar tender that was attentive, yet perhaps could use a little more training. (as I was eating he piled dirty dishes right in front of me on the bar to facilitate ease of his efforts in moving.) Very nice guy...just a little inconsiderate.

Author: Rose_sink
Review: Pricey food but the staff is very friendly and professional but don't bother stopping by for the happy hour free hor d'oeuvres cause they are NOT good

Author: greenehalltam
Review: I ate here 3 times over the course of my business stay. The waiter was very friendly and personable. He was very accommodating to any changes we may have asked for. The pub chips with bacon and cheese are a great appetizer. The burgers are awesome and the bbq wings are extraordinary. I also ordered cheesecake which was to die for!! All portions were generous and everything is tasty. Room service is quick, but the actual restaurant is a great place to watch games and socialize.

Author: 978suzanned
Review: Average breakfast buffet but noticed some age in dented coffee pots they leave on table, discolored salt/pepper shaker lids, slow service (but very friendly and helpful).

Author: jereid2018
Review: I stayed at the hotel and I wanted a night cap and a quick snack. I went to this restaurant and the customer service was friendly and quick. I was able to take my order back to my room, this made it very convenient and I was able to continue to work.

Author: RBPilotcat
Review: Had a view Dinners in this place, the Chef did a great job with the Crab cakes. Had the the Creamy Alfredo Pasta with Shrimp witch was good also. Bartender Mr. B is on top of everything.

Author: AlvildaL
Review: I had the grilled chicken caesar salad, and a few cocktails. They were good, but it was the service that made it a wonderful experience.The bartender was super friendly, and made a great drink. He had a way of getting all the patrons around the chatting with each other and laughing. I went in intending to grab a quick meal before I called it a night, and ended up staying just to keep in the fun.The establishment was well maintained and clean.

Author: jedimistressdragon13
Review: The breakfast was super. The hot food hot and the coffee delicious. The servers got us to a table and got our orders quickly.

Author: stirringconstantly
Review: The food was good, my salad was large. The bartender was nice and professional, very patient. Would have loved better beer, doesn't Roanoke make beer local?

Author: psudino
Review: 202 Social House from the perspective of decor, seating, TVs and selection is pretty much average. Nothing good, nothing bad. This was heading to a 3 star review until one of our business colleagues decided to order a round of shots for our group. This bumped up to 4 stars because talk about a generous shot pour. Apparently 3 oz is the norm; make sure to eat some carbs if you plan to enjoy a shot here!

Author: Susan M
Review: We went to 202 twice during our visit in Roanoke. The first time was for a late lunch. We opted to sit in the bar area since it was a Saturday afternoon and college football was on almost all of the TVs. (They are all around the restaurant). The bartender came & greeted us. We asked for waters until we could decide what we wanted to order. After about 10 minutes my husband went to the hostess & asked if one of the waitstaff could come to our table which they did almost immediately. She took our drink orders and in the meantime the bartender came with our waters. She apologized and said she had gotten busy at the bar. Our new server was excellent and attentive. We ordered a flatbread and it was enough for the two of us and very tasty. Our second visit was at night & once again we sat in the bar area. Same story...we had to hunt down a waitperson. Bottom line - drinks and food are good, but their service could be improved.

Author: CorpSpy
Review: We were driving through from Western North Carolina to the DC area and stopped in Roanoke for dinner. We made the mistake of stopping at 202 Social House. Our waiter was working very hard but he had so many tables to cover that it was impossible to keep up. As a result, we asked for ketchup for the chicken sandwich. It took 10 minutes for it to come. We asked for the dressing on the side of our salmon salad. Instead, the salmon came on the side with no dressing. When we asked our waiter about this, he said, "yea, I wonder why the kitchen did it that way."  We asked for the missing dressing and it came 15 minutes later! Looking around, it seemed that other patrons were having a similar experience.

Author: Broadean
Review: Yes, they were unexpectedly busy, but to wait almost an hour for average food was over the top. We were there at 1:00pm and finally had food close to 2:00. It was nice to be able to get brunch, but because it sat so long, the grits were coated with a glaze where they sat under the heat lamp.Our server tried. But, I asked three times for butter for our toast until it finally came.Been there once. There are many other opportunities for good food on the market and I will visit.

Author: Natasha C
Review: Stopped here for food, great atmosphere, staff were great. I had the BBQ Chicken sandwich and my husband had the Burger with blue cheese he said it was the best burger he had ever tasted- pretty bold statement but was great! Would definitely recommend this place.

Author: MikeK403
Review: In the middle of the Roanoke party district..this restaurant offers a nice reprieve. Good food and reasonably priced.A hidden jewel

Author: Spufi10
Review: We stopped in after driving all day - we were seated right away. Drinks were ordered first and came within the appropriate time. Our server, Ozzy, was friendly and attentive. Entrees were delicious - I ordered the pesto linguine (it was so much food, but I finished all of it). Hubby ordered pork shoulder on flat bread that was equally tasty but he could only finish half. We took the rest back to our hotel. Good choice!!

Author: 784cindyg
Review: Very slow for a half-full restaurant. Ordered drinks which took a while. Appetizer came out with food. Nachos were cold and flatbread pizza was lukewarm. Very slow service.

Author: infoX9636PF
Review: Popped in for a few beers after driving up from Virginia beach and was very impressed with the service from the young lady behind the bar nothing was too much trouble and although we didnt eat with them the food looked good and generous portions,the bar tender also recommended a steak house for dinner which was wonderful so many thanks

Author: raysfire1
Review: I went this afternoon for drinks and finger foods. I started my order with their order of tater tots with the works (bacon on the side, chives and cheese). While I waited in this sports bar atmosphere with big screen TVs, I ordered a neat Makers Mark. I received my drink quickly. It took approximately 20 minutes for my tater tots to arrive. The portion was small to average. My first taste of the tots, I immediately tasted an odd flavor. I tried another and still the taste was gross. I had my boss with me and she also acknowledged that the tots tasted rancid. I told the manager and they sent them back and order me another batch. After waiting another 30 minutes we received another new batch of tater tots. Again when I tasted them, they tasted awful. The manager came to see if I liked them and I told them no...i asked what rule of cheese they used and they said a homemade cheese....that was the problem. I left the tater tots after only eating two tots on the table. I was still billed for the tater tots. I paid it and I warn you from this establishment. If they cant please you with an appetizer...I dread anything more complex. I would give this less than a one if there was a lessor option.

Author: livinglocal-latest
Review: Stayed one nite nearby. Used TA to review a few places for dinner. Decided on tacos. Easy to access and park. Modern take on Mexican food and decor. Ordered both margaritas and wine. Starter was the chips and spicy cheese dip. Salad was delicious and tacos excellent. Fare value for the quality. Service was friendly.

Author: trevan
Review: So nearly 12 days into road tripping things can get stale. I needed some guacamole stat!! This restaurant is downtown. We were able to find easy parking on a Wednesday night. I loved the interior, big booth and the music they played. Now for food. My husband had the seared tuna taco and two basic beef Rs is. He said they were great. I opted for the black bean taco and the portobello taco. Both were excellent! That guacamole fix......satisfied completely and their chips were great!!

Author: Julie B
Review: Our adult party of four were exploring the 'other side of Downtown' Roanoke when our friends suggested we come here to eat. According to our friends, the menu had changed from their last visit, and from the waitress, the new menu has been in place since this past spring. It's fantastic! A wonderful selection of tacos to choose from or build your own. Our party had The Hillbilly, The Texan, Portabello, Black Bean and the Pork Carnitas. What was delightful was that each taco had its own flavor - this is not a case where a "base" taco simply switching toppings or ingredients. The ingredients were very fresh and unique to each taco and the flavor was outstanding. Another fun element was the decor - very creative and original: the murals were imaginative, the reclaimed wood for seating very inspired, the lighting, even the concrete dividers were fun. We were not in a position at that time to take advantage of the tequilas & mezcals but we will definitely be back to do so.

Author: JM0330
Review: Pros; friendly service. Good shrimp tacos, good cheese dipCons: slow food service even with almost empty restaurant. Pork was sweet, too big chunks and taco was dry. Good prices, $27 for 3 people. Don't love sodas per bottle instead of free refills

Author: PennyM1472
Review: Looking to try something different while here on vacation and Tuco's Taqueria Garaje came up so we though let's give it a try. Mainly tacos on the menu along with chips and salsa, chips and queso, nachos etc. We ordered the chips and queso for an appetizer and then my husband got the Hillbilly tacos and I ordered a fajita steak taco as well as chicken taquitos to share. The queso was really tasty and the chips were good-got a decent portion of chips. The tacos were good except a chicken bone in one of the taquitos the food was good. Would go back again!

Author: Hokie1Traveler
Review: Visited this past Sat. evening with my wife and it was only good, not excellent like last year for a few reasons. My tacos (beef and carnitas) both had way too much grizzle and fat in the meat. Taste was flavorful but had too many chucks of fat in the meat portion. The sauces and tortilla were excellent, just wish the meat was trimmed a little more. Our chips with the con queso were not very fresh and room temp...warmer chips would have been better, seemed not very fresh also. We will be back as we still enjoy the restaurant, since there are little options like this in Roanoke, but the quality just wasn't what I remembered from last time. Service was very good, a little unorganized at the front, a hostess would be nice vs. servers kind of running the front-seating when they see people waiting. We finally opted for an opening at the bar and the bartender was very nice.

Author: patiencein03
Review: After a day on the eater, all we wanted were some delicious tacos. We arrive to find a new (and lame) menu. fried chicken tacos? Cheese was on everything, even the portobellas that were supposed to have avacado creme. The fillingsmon all 8 tacos were dry, the taco shells were dry, and the shells were only 1/2 full. You took a delightful dining experience and destroyed it overnight. What a waste of $70. One sar for seevice and drinks. At least your employees still care. I am so disappointed... to anyone reading this, go somewhere else.When you have a good thing, tweak it... ask for customer feedback if you want changes. THIS was a deal breaker for us!

Author: Stephanie P
Review: When you feel like having mexican food and you get this...you're very happy!!Portions are huge, taste is authentic and amazing, the Churros are to die for!! I could eat there everyday! Really on my list of place to go back

Author: mulesinmo
Review: Late lunch on Sunday. Seated quickly and got drinks ordered. Food came fairly quickly. Pulled pork nachos were humongous! Tacos were okay, the price was right! The margaritas make it worth a return trip!

Author: nwnh40
Review: The service was good, but the drinks and tacos weren't I had a shrimp taco and chicken, the chicken was so brunt I wasn't sure it was chicken, so dry I put more salsa on it and hot sauce nothing helped, the shrimp taco, looked and tasted like grocery store frozen shrimp with spinach and very little sauce so dry. I had a margarita average and a bloody Mary average, I will not go back there is better Mexican places downtown for less money. Side note my boyfriend did like his steak tacos

Author: David L
Review: We have lived in Roanoke for more than 30 years and talked about eating here, but never did. A few days ago my wife and I had a late lunch here and returned again today. My only regret is I missed eating here for all those years. The food is excellent and service is superior. I look forward to many more meals here in my future.

Author: Diane1313
Review: It has been many years since we went inside this restaurant with our grandchildren. The food was good then and it is still good today. The portions are large so expect a doggie bag for tomorrow. I tried the pineapple shrimp and it was delicious and fresh. The presentation was lovely with cucumber and orange design. My husband had the orange chicken and it was very good. We had the shrimp dumplings for an appetizer, not my favorite but OK. We were served quickly and everything was hot. I had forgotten that eating in a Chinese restaurant with chopsticks is half the fun.

Author: Lorraine N
Review: We placed our order for delivery. I believe the restaurant is a sit down one. The prices were a little high if a take out restaurant. Food was very good except didnt care for wonton soup.

Author: adviceman66
Review: Excellent take out!. Shrimp fired rice and egg rolls were great and we had enough for two people and all for around $10.00

Author: ejm99
Review: Hadnt been to Szechuan in a couple of years. Made reservation. Arrived at 7 pm. Seated promptly. Restaurant not crowded. Ordered drinks which arrived after some confusion. Ordered egg drop soup and chicken combination (#612). Others ordered duck, Generals chicken, egg rolls, and beef. Food was mediocre. Food quality was nowhere near as good as it was in the distant past. I dont recommend this establishment. Young man server was pleasant. Others seemed confused and were difficult to communicate with.

Author: Dennis P
Review: We've eaten here a couple times, and have been happy. The Peking Duck and Grilled Eel dishes are, for example, excellent. The Szechuan Beef is made of high quality ingredients, but isn't very spicy. Set your expectations properly, and you will have a very nice meal.

Author: roahokie
Review: I have eastern here twice in last 3 weeks. Food is always delicious, fresh, well presented. Service is attentive and friendly. I particularly recommend the soups and am a big fan of the Tempura Vegetables...delish. I highly recommend this place and prices are reasonable.

Author: chrisbT8957OF
Review: The is clean and tidy Chinese restaurant with your typical assortment of buffet style Asian foods. Not a huge buffet (3 tables), but prices were reasonable and it appeared they make a good effort to maintain the buffet and surrounding food service areas.Good for grabbing a quick bite for lunch without having to resort to fast food.

Author: gcassady
Review: We went here for a birthday dinner. The service was prompt and they worked as a team to see that all are needs were met.

Author: ArtD959
Review: Went for lunch. Sushi wasn't fresh tasting. Service was ok. Very disappointed. Probably will not return.

Author: christinee457
Review: We were just out and about and stumbled upon Viet Sub while out on a day trip. Wow! Absolutely delicious! We will be going the the next time we're in Roanoke.

Author: Mike O
Review: My Chicken Bahn Mi sub was terrific. The sub roll was the best tasting bread in memory. The chicken and associated ingredients that filled the sub were as fresh and tasty as can be. For $4.75, this was a real bargain.

Author: kareem365
Review: We love to go here with our kids. The place is not fancy and quite small, but that's part of the experience. You order food at a window when you walk in and they bring it out to you. The menu is limited and very reasonably priced. The sandwhiches are variations on a theme. They all have cucumber, pickled carrots and radishes, cilantro, chicken liver pate, and jalapenos. Then you can choose from ham, grilled chicken, pork, a combination and a few others. They will often ask children if they would prefer no jalapenos. They also have a small or large bowl of pho, a noodle bowl with your choice of meat, and a saladk with the same fixings as the sandwhiches. I love to get the sandwhich combo which comes with a drink, and either spring rolls, egg rolls, or mung bean buns. Everything here tastes very fresh and light. I usually spend less than $7.00 for a meal and walk away full. Although the place is small, I've never had trouble finding a table. They do a lot of carry out service as well.
