Went to Viet Sub on a rainy nasty day. I ordered the pork noodle dish. Everything was great about it. Not too spicy if that is a consideration for you. Ni9ce fresh carrot and cucumber in the plate. My co-workers love their subs as well.

Author: Hollander1621
Review: Very Good Subs, the Pho soup is very good as well. Fresh baked bread and authentic Vietnamese subs ! The staff is very friendly and quick with your order.

Author: Tom B
Review: A little "hole-in-the-wall" that makes great tasting subs at very reasonable prices! Just the right size for lunch. I'm a big guy, so I would have appreciated a bigger sub, but hard to complain about a tasty, unique, sub, 1 side and bottled soft drink for $5.85! I will be back to try some other items.

Author: schindlr
Review: Had the Banh Mi and the Bun Thit Nuong, which is normally my favorite. The sandwich was good, the Bun not so much. The pork just didn't have any flavor. I'd go again, but only for the sandwiches.

Author: johndP3371VC
Review: The traditional Banh Mi is great. The Pho is excellent. Take out Pho separates the broth into one container and noodles etc into another . Dont be shy. Ask for everything spicy. The small building and seating area may deter some Dont be fooled. The food is excellent

Author: gabs789
Review: Simple place with good prices. The salad was good, my husband liked the pho. The sandwiches are just the right size with lots of fixings make for a solid lunch!

Author: spencerinthehat
Review: Order at indoor window. Food brought to your table. Not tons of seating but that was okay. Just time your visit or get it to go. Had Pho soup, small size. It was really big and very good. Fresh lime and basil (I think, on the side). I had the Roasted Chicken sub. Excellent fresh banquette, Yummy real chicken pieces that seemed to be from a roasted chicken. Loved the ingredients on the sub. Dont be scared away by the chicken liver pate the menu says is on their subs. I either didnt taste it or it added a good taste to the sub. I did not get the jalapeo peppers, but something on my sub gave it a burning hot taste. Still a great sandwich. Next time I will ask them what makes it so spicy hot and will ask that not to be included. Just providing a heads up in case hot spice is mot your thing. My friend had the meatball sub. Hes a particular eater (doesnt enjoy trying new things) and it wasnt what he expected. Was thinking something with red sauce. I didnt taste it so I cant tell u anything about it other than it was their standard meatball sub with all the standard fixings. It too had the spicy hot bite but he had the jalapeo peppers and I did not. This place is worth visiting, especially if you like Pho and/or like to try different versions of what a sub can be. Prices are extremely reasonable. Soda is bottled, ice tea in glass is available. Glasses of water also provided (I didnt even have to ask).

Author: Susan M
Review: The brunch was plentiful with a large variety of choices from fresh fruit to made to order eggs & omelets. The food was fresh & hot, the service was excellent and the ambience was lovely.

Author: CityCoupleLovesParks
Review: Lovely Friday evening leisurely spent dining & dancing to the Regency Trio. Mr. Lowell Hill is a gracious host and warmly welcomed us upon entering the restaurant. Our waitstaff, headed by Joshua, was timed perfectly, quite an art with one of us having the multi course chefs tasting menu, the other a la carte items off the menu. I particularly recommend their chefs tasting menu, beautifully presented and delicious. It ranged from a scallop bisque tangy appetizer, then bourbon glazed twin mini lamb chops, to lobster & chive mashed potatoes, a main course of pepper encrusted filet over grilled peaches & a finale of apple turnover with chai ice cream garnished with fried basil. Can hardly wait to return to visit this area & the Regency Room.

Author: BPKJMK89
Review: We celebrated our 30th anniversary dining at the Regency dining room. The service was excellent and the food outstanding. We has banana fosters for dessert. It was prepared right at the table and was delicious. Highly recommend for an unforgettable evening.

Author: Vicki T
Review: The Regency Room was selected to celebrate a special occasion with family. The Lunch Buffett was excellent and it featured the famous Hotel Roanoke Peanut Soup and Hotel Roanoke Spoon Bread. Great service. It is a must dine when in Roanoke!!

Author: Calvin C
Review: I usually get to enjoy the Regency Room at least once a year. Its always the highest standard for food, service, and atmosphere!  The menu has several traditional favorites. They also have a unique specialty: peanut soup. I had the Shrimp and Scallops Chesapeake. It was excellent with large shrimp & Scallops and lump crab in a creamy sauce over corn cakes.  Its a bit pricey, but well worth it especially for special occasions.

Author: Ohiosoccermom68
Review: This is old-fashioned dining in the best way. The maitre d' and waiter were incredibly attentive and there was a 3 piece band (Friday and Saturday nights). We haven't had live music in a nice restaurant for a long time and it was all very enjoyable. The food was delicious-must have the peanut soup form the 100 year old recipe!

Author: psudino
Review: I didn't eat in the restaurant but we have a meeting here and I am assuming as the only on-site restaurant, they handling the catering.The person who handled our conference was excellent. He was very attentive and did his job efficiently and without interruption. Perfect service.The best thing they served was a mascarpone cheese french toast. I really enjoyed the flavors. The scrambled eggs though, were only OK. Otherwise, the rest of the food was as expected. A nice catered meal for the meeting.

Author: freespiritedone
Review: This is a very elegant and upscale restaurant! Jesse was friendly and welcoming as we entered. Brody was a friendly and excellent server who anticipated our every need. We loved the banana foster! Josh also helped us have us have a wonderful dining experience!

Author: Helen g
Review: Superb food excellent service very attentive. My favorite is the peanut soup of course! One of their signature offerings. It's amazing place to just go and feel pampered and have excellent food and service.

Author: kristi m
Review: Fine dining! Great location and food. Wonderful vegetarian options and the peanut soup was outstanding!

Author: Mauro G
Review: Looking for a good place to eat found this jewel. If you want to try great Venezuelan food, this is the place. The Pabelln was excellent and today we will return to eat good arepas. Congratulations

Author: RoverP
Review: What an odd place. Walked in and the place was deserted. There was nobody behind the take away counter so I walked through a short side corridor into what was the main dining area. This was quite spacious but only 2 tables were occupied and no staff to be seen. Went back to the takeaway area and someone appeared and we were shown a table. The dining room was pretty bleak with exposed air conditioning pipes and no effort having been made to make the room welcoming. We ordered drinks whilst looking at the menu. My wifes cola arrived together with water for me but not the beer I had ordered. When the waiter came back there was still no beer but he wanted to take our food order. He said someone was just getting the beer. I mean, it was not as if they were busy!The beer eventually arrived. The food arrived but with no attempt to present it attractively. However, contrary to expectations the food was actually very good. Apart from the man who showed us to the table, there were 3 waiters and yet the way they were behaving you would have thought there were 54 tables in use instead of a maximum of 4. Its a shame. With a lick of paint, some tasteful decor and a bit of understanding of customer service then with such tasty food this could be a decent restaurant.

Author: aneishar2016
Review: Visited with my friends for lunch and absolutely loved it. I ordered the chicken wings. It was alot and delicious! Waiter was super amazing! Will definitely return

Author: Matthew F
Review: We waited forever for our food and sadly the wait staff was worse than the food. Maybe this is a new place because the staff did not seem to know what they were doing. I saw a bartender mix a martini and when he poured it the glass was only half full. He must have learned bartending on youtube. The food is also overpriced.

Author: Lee S
Review: Our visit was an evening before Mothers Day dinner. The restaurant was nicely situated and near paid parking. The house was about half-full and appeared to be primarily family staffed with a fair number of regulars. Our meal took a solid hour to arrive with only one check-in from our waiter about a half hour in. It took twenty minutes to get refills on our drinks. Ten minutes after that, our food arrived. What was really surprising was that staff seemed totally oblivious to the divide apparent between the regulars who must expect this pacing and those of us at several tables who were clearly irritated to angry at the service level. I gather that this means our experience was the typical one. My meatball dish was overcooked to nearly burnt, but it still had decent flavor. The pizza my little one ordered was tasty. The other pasta dishes ordered by those at the table got average reviews. If the service was better or the food was better, I might go back. As it is, I doubt I would return. Good Italian in Roanoke seems scarce, sadly.

Author: 11eddiel
Review: Nice, but a bit $$. A nice selection of not-so-ordinary cuisine was recommended on the menu. We made our selections. But then our server returned to tell me that there was no pork for the dish I wanted. :-/We settled for a salad each, water to drink and it was still $20. The salad was very good.

Author: 106AnnH106
Review: A good gluten free crust that is thick and bready, with lots of choices of toppings. My husband had a Margarita pizza and really enjoyed it. They use a separate oven for gluten free than flour based pizzas, hooray!

Author: Keith M
Review: Visiting my nephew and wife in Roanoke and they took me to Leonore's. What a delight! A marvelous mix of Italian and Venezuelan dishes to choose from and I only had one visit to experience it, darn as the entree I selected, Pabellon Criollo was flavorful with a hint of spicy and a bit of heat. Yes, I recommend. I had a salad also which featured fresh greens and other fixins. Kevin was our server and he was super with a nice sense of humor and a true advocate for Roanoke altho' he is originally from Maine! Nice atmosphere and pricing is reasonable. It is downtown near old courthouse. Definite recommend if you are in the area. Enjoy.

Author: Gohoosao
Review: Walked by this place numerous times. What a mistake. Meatball appetizer was amazing. Arepas were awesome. Tuna and steak were both great. Kevin our waiter was very helpful with the menu.

Author: Brian B
Review: Nice change of style of food. Good to have different choices of establishments to try different types of ethnic food.

Author: mysticalfoodie
Review: Went there from local hotel and was pleasantly surprised by tasty, hot pizza. Appears to be a popular place for locals. Glad I found it.

Author: hbhakh
Review: We recently stopped at Bellacino's for a quick lunch. They have a couple of reasonably priced specials. The food was fresh and good. We'd go back.

Author: chjones50
Review: Order at the counter and food is delivered to your table. I had pizza and it was very good, but had very little pepperoni.

Author: 241bbqfoodguru
Review: Yes they call them Grinders. Their house specialty Italian Grinder is the best.Dont get the Full unless you want to share it with someone cause its huge.Great service, food came out fairly quickly.

Author: Savyluncher
Review: Everything on this menu is delicious and served very friendly. We eat here often and have never had anything but good food. And a special note if you like Southern Gospel Music come on the second Sunday night in each month to here the real thing. We eat and clap to the good ole songs and some new ones.

Author: Denarchy7
Review: The pizza we had ordered was tough to chew and the sauce is too sweet for my liking. Nothing special here.

Author: Michael C
Review: Pizza is very good with some different offering. Seating is plentiful. Mom and I could sit at one booth and the young folks had there own table a bit away. You order before setting down so sort of like a cafeteria. Prices were reasonable.

Author: Headwindtom
Review: You order at the counter, fetch your own drink, and then they bring the food when it is ready. We shared a meatball, mushrooms and black olive pizza. The crust was cooked perfectly and was exactly between a thin and a thick crust. They cut the whole pie into squares  or as square as you can get a round pizza! It was actually easier to eat that way. The toppings and cheese are very generous. We savored every bite!

Author: KillerB5
Review: Bellacino's is one of my favorite pizza places in Roanoke. The prices are great and their pizza is absolutely delecious! we usually eat there at least once a week for lunch. They also have delicious hot sandwiches (grinders). It is counter order and they bring it to your table. If you haven't already done so, check it out. Great place for a cheap family meal with the kids.

Author: Michelle B
Review: Since we ride motorcycles was looking for something close to our hotel and this was a good little joint, very affordable prices and food was good! Had the lasagna, the bread could of used a little more garlic but other then that looked like the subs going to the next table were tasty looking as well! Service was friendly and quick.

Author: Mike S
Review: I have eaten at this establishment many times and in the past I was always very happy with my meal, service etc. This week I stopped in with two friends that had never been. I recommended wildwood and really talked it up. My friends ordered brisket plate and pulled pork sandwich platter. I opted for a cheeseburger. I asked the waitress to make sure my burger was not overcooked, requested a little pink. My burger was cooked to death! The waitress asked if I wanted a new burger but then I would have been eating by myself and we were pressed for time. My friend who ordered the briskit plate commented that the portionwasvery small for the price and that the sides were just okay. His wife did not have anything good to say about her pulled pork platter. Definitely not worth the $12.81 I paid for my burger...I'll be looking elsewhere for BBQ and a burger next time I'm in Roanoke...

Author: Patrick K
Review: Countless times over the past 10+ years have I sat at table in Wildwood Smokehouse of Roanoke ~ alone, with a mate, with a large party ~ and not once have I been disappointed with the food or the service! The barbecue is outstanding and both the dry-rub and the wet BBQ varieties of meats are as authentic to their named styles as any you'll find east of the Mississippi River! The sides are all prepared on premises and the owners are local Roanokers who grew up in this Valley and are committed to supporting our hometown and its folks in numerous ongoing ways. A small bar offers a nice selection of adult beverages to accompany your savory meal or go for the Iced Tea ~ it's always fresh and the perfect non-alcohol accompaniment to all of Wildwood's outstanding fare. I have hosted numerous out-of-town friends for meals at Wildwood Smokehouse ~ to a person, they have raved about the food, atmosphere & service!

Author: Stacy L
Review: I love bbq... but this place will make you hate it... I had the pulled pork and pulled chicken platter... it was horrible.. the pulled chicken is not smoked its just chicken they have pulled apart with not seasoning or flavor... the pulled pork is just as bad with no flavor and the sauce is Heavy on the vinegar so there is nothing to assist with the lack of flavor unless you like vinegar. My daughter and husband order the ribs wet.... the sauce is over powering and makes it hard to enjoy a decently cooked rib... oh and the sides... yuck... green beans out the can and Mac and cheese that is worst than Kraft. A huge $60 disappointment!!!! And both my husband and daughter had to RUN to the bathroom within an hour of eating there... please dont go until you like dry bland food.

Author: jody656
Review: Shame on you the 1st time, Shame on me the 2nd. The 3rd time, well They consistantly suck and I'm a fool. The dry rub ribs are like dry jerky and 5 times more bone than meat. Horrible. I've mentioned my concern on 2 other ocasions. Tonight I was so ticked off I threw a $20.00 on the table and walked out after eating only one small rib. I don't expect anything free. I Showed the Mgr. the pathetic ribs. I'm done!! I threw the $20.00 on the table because the waitress shouldn't have to be penalized for the crappy cook preparations. I hope she got her portion of the tip.

Author: Jesserlaw13
Review: The food is delicious and the portions are huge! The restaurant could use a face lift but if you're looking for "down home" barbecue and sides, I would suggest this local gem.

Author: K3588TZdang
Review: Took out of town business associates to lunch. All of us had pulled pork and it could not have been better. The staff is always very friendly and good. They seem to have allot of regulars. Would recommend this restaurant to everyone! Will definitely go back!

Author: joe0277
Review: I go here for lunch with coworkers every couple months. Its always consistently good food and service. I usually have a salad and they have a really good pulled salad that has shredded smoked pork on it. Its definitely not a cheap lunch option but comparable to all the other $8-$9 lunch salads. Very filling and fresh.

Author: teacher0107
Review: Wildwood is relaxing after a long day. The pork bbq is tender and tasty. It is well flavored so I go light on the sauce. There are many good choices for sides. I enjoy the bbq beans with peppers, onions and meat. The Brunswick stew is good enough for meal on its own, but it is also available as a side. The service is very efficient. They have nice small dessert choices that won't blow the budget or the diet. I highly recommend a visit.

Author: Ilikech
Review: Not terrible bbq just not as good as mission bbq in Roanoke recommend you drive the extra 5 miles to go to mission the staff is friendly but the bbq is usually overcooked

Author: georgesO7303US
Review: All of the different meat choices here are good but ribs are the best in the Roanoke Valley. They have excellent sides as well including deviled eggs which are not found anywhere else around that I have seen. Great choice for a good lunch or dinner.

Author: Katy C
Review: My husband and I have been wanting to try this Cafe, but initially they were only open Mon-Friday daytime, when we are both at work. However, we took today off and went for lunch. We split a Zen Garden Panini and a southwestn quinoa bowl. Both items were delish! The Panani was on a wonderful grainy local sourdough bread and the amish cheese melted beautifully. The quinoa bowl was perfectly seasoned and proportioned. We grabbed a chai muffin to split later, after hearing another customer order one, eat it while paying and then promptly order a second. Yes they are that good.It appears they have not only extended their hours, now open evenings and weekends, but also have an ABC license and a nice selection of beer, wine, hard kombucha and more. We are already talking about coming back for dinner soon. Note: the quinoa bowls are only served until 3:00 pm. Not sure why that is, but there are plenty of other, healthy options on the menu that you can order for dinner. Next time, I'll try their soup and avocado toast.There are a few tables outside, for those wanting to walk down and bring their dog too. Really a nice, earthy vibe. Great wait staff! Also some nice local jewerly for sale, for good prices.Can't wait to come back, bring a friend, grab some wine and make an evening of it. Really glad to have something like this in Roanoke.

Author: Luvtravels33
Review: After finally finding the place, we really enjoyed the unique, healthy food. The BBQ jackfruit was sweet and tangy, and the savory crepes are very filling and delicious. We also enjoyed a couple of dessert crepes, but the portions are so generous that we could have easily split one and still been very full. The lone barrista/cook/dish washer was very nice and also very quick. Our only complaint is that it was hard to find in the dark. We didn't see any signs, and the building looks like a house. As we left we realized the signs are behind the umbrellas for the outdoor seating.

Author: DianeH1311
Review: This little cafe is charming, the owner/waitress/cook was just lovely. She made the most delicious crepe stuffed with greens, onions, tomato and olives. It was absolutely beautiful. My husband had the Zen Garden panini with house made, vegan cheese, both dishes were filling, and delicious. I suggest you try this place if you love healthy, nutritious food in a quaint atmosphere. So glad we went!

Author: Paradise79124
Review: I come to this restaurant every time I am in the Roanoke area. The food is delicious, exceptional quality and the service is outstanding. It is very hard to find healthy vegan and gluten free food in Roanoke. I also have a soy allergy and they have multiple options for me.The atmosphere is as fantastic as the food and service.

Author: Beth P
Review: We had a delicious meal at the cafe. We had the garden crepe, breakfast crepe and apple butter crepe. All were wonderful.

Author: JimFromFloyd
Review: I am not sure how long this place has been there but I only heard about it recently. It is well off the beaten path and I had driven by it several times without even knowing it was there. If only someone had told me earlier!Almost everything is healthy and organic and most of the choices can be made vegan. If they cannot get organic then they try to source as close as they can get locally. There is an extensive menu of cafe type items. Some of the choices are panini, salads, smoothies, quinoa bowls, and several baked goods. They serve organic wines, local beers and local kombucha. My wife and I each had different quinoa bowls and both were excellent. You order at the counter and then the food if brought to your table. It is small and has a cozy atmosphere. I cannot recommend it highly enough. It is not cheap but it is worth every penny you pay. I don't know of another place in town to get such high quality, healthy vegetarian food. Try it out, you won't be sorry.

Author: sunnyography
Review: This cafe is mainly gluten free with the exception of 1 or 2 items on the bakery list. It's tea selection is also phenomenal! The staff is so kind and attentive. Love it here!

Author: Debbie R
Review: This place ruined me for other hot dogs. I never eat them unless Im in Roanoke and then I od on them. Great diner in historic Roanoke Market. Dont know how they make their chili but Ive nevet seen it duplicated and I travel around the world. Dont miss this awesome diner.

Author: harryh409
Review: While visiting Roanoke and Market Square we decided to have lunch at Roanoke Weiner Stand and glad we did. It is a quaint, clean and wonderful place to have lunch while overlooking the Square. The hotdogs are small but tasty and the dining area was kept clean. It was a great lunch for a reasonable price on the square.

Author: Cynthia G
Review: If you visit Roanoke you have to go here for a hot dog. We ordered our food and sat outside and watched the people downtown. So yummy! Great stop for lunch.

Author: 32ericp
Review: Stopped by for lunch. We have been coming here since I was a child. No longer live in Roanoke so we make it a point to stop by. I miss the team that owned and operated it for decades. Just not the same. The taste was there but the quality was not. Please get it back to what it used to be.

Author: DayleD
Review: Interesting place to visit, good hot dogs but very limited seating. Park on the side and plan on eating outside!

Author: P0sterb0y
Review: I had not been downtown for quite sometime so when I decided to suck down a hot dog, all the way, I was confused. The place the dog stand was, was now a window. I thought I was losing my mind. I stumbled around and found it when I backed up. Once there, I noticed it was larger and gone was the whit marble counter with the crack in it. I asked when they moved, and the young lady at the counter said with little feeling, 6 years ago. If anything, her attitude and her he absence of the white marble reduces the charm of the experience. So for about $2, you get a good dog with a unique taste. Its not the best, its above average, but theres a loss in status because its no longer the same. One can spend years dishing it out, and the practice becomes familiar, welcome and comfortable. Changing the location interrupts this charm. Im glad one can still get a legendary dog, but its just not the same. My rating is based on my overall history with the stand. If I was going in as someone unfamiliar with the stands history, my rating would be lower, perhaps slightly above average.

Author: Patrick K
Review: You really can't say you've explored Roanoke, Virginia without including in your experience a meal visit to the Hot Dog King, Roanoke Weiner Stand! Cheap eats that are always freshly prepared and down to earth, served up by folks who know Downtown History in a place that has survived floods and fury! The kids will love the dogs & fries and mom, dad or whoever is paying the tab, will love the bargain!

Author: Leah O
Review: My husband and I stopped in after visiting a nearby brewery. The chili dogs are wonderful. The chili is sweet and the people working were very pleasant.

Author: pegathin
Review: Stopped in for a quick bite while visiting the market. Only options are mustard, onions, and chili. Hot dog and chili both tasted of poor quality. And the fries were cold and unsalted. Also, the staff were very unfriendly. We won't be back.

Author: jhais28374
Review: This place has been downtown for many many years. When i was working I had a dog about once or twice a week! Always a great lunch and fun to visit this place just to watch them serve up the dogs in many different ways.

Author: carolemdg
Review: We were looking for a quick but not fast food option with vegetarian options and found Agave Azul! It was perfect! Fast, friendly service, yummy dishes, and conveniently located near I-81. Definitely recommend if you are searching for good food with a fun atmosphere while traveling. We are vegetarians and enjoyed the special options they had. I loved the quesadilla deluxe and my husband enjoyed the taquitos. The house margarita was also very delightful!

Author: MommaBaileyof4
Review: We had to take a trip for my daughter to the hospital and decided to stay the night to save one some dragging kids. This restaurant was close to the hotel and easy to find. It is super nice and very clean! There were families there as well as couples eating with a good beer. The staff was super friendly and we amazingly fast. We have to make frequent visits to Roanoke for my daughter and she has requested that we eat there every visit, which I have to say I am NOT mad about! Can't wait to go back again for some amazing food! The sizes are also amazing as well! Please go and visit this place. You won't be disappointed!

Author: alanecanoes
Review: We had a very large party of 20 people and you not only accommodated us quickly but your service was great. The food was amazing. Highly recommend and Im a foodie!

Author: lsantos80
Review: Came in for the weekend and met up with friends for a wedding. There was a large party and they accommodated us quickly. It was rather late in the evening and a little after closing by the time we left and they never made us feel like we had to leave. Very friendly staff. I had a build your own combo and my husband had a burrito smothered with white queso. My combo plate was very good but OMG their white queso is amazing!!! I tried some off my husband's plate and just wanted to eat his dinner as well. We also had a Blue Motorcycle and they did not skimp on the liquor. If I'm ever in the area again, I am definitely going back to this restaurant!

Author: Judy C
Review: My husband and I love eating here. Great food and excellent service. Prices are very reasonable. Wait staff are always friendly and serve with a smile

Author: WhoKnows0839
Review: On a trip from NY to Western N. Carolina we stayed at the motel next door and decided to eat here instead of getting in the car again and driving to a restaurant. It was a great decision! The giant Happy Hour Margaritas were excellent as well as the food we ordered. The staff was very friendly and efficient - it was a great end to a long drive! Wish it was close to our home! We'd be regulars!

Author: John B
Review: I have the occasion to dine at the Agave Azul during a business trip northeast of Roanoke. I was staying in a Hotel next door to this restaurant with no other dining options available without driving a few miles. The hotel manager suggested I try it, and he thought the food there was good. I took his advise, since I had been driving all day and did not feel like having be back in the car for a quick dinner. The Agave Azul has an attractive building with plenty of parking. I found the interior atmosphere to be very pleasant having a clean and appropriate western look and decore. The staff was also very pleasant and the service was surprisingly fast. The menu selections were varied and consistant with items one would expect from a quality offering of Mexican fare. The pricing was slightly higher than mid-point, but not unreasonable. Unfortunately, this is where my acclaim for this establishment has to end. I would sum up this way:1. Convenient Location.2. NIce Atmosphere3. Great Staff with Fast Service.4. Mediocre Food. I guess you could say that three out of four isn't bad, except that good food is why we eat. I ordered a popular dish, that was supposed to be a specialty. I thought it must have taken special effort to cook all of the flavor out of the entre before serving it. The side items were fine. Personally I prefer to eat in a hole-in the wall dive with great food, rather than a nice restaurant with "just OK" meals.So, if you find yourself staying next door the Agave Azul, and just want some chips and a beer, by all means eat here. However, if you are in the mood for a really good meal, take your car for a drive to another location.

Author: jpennington28
Review: Traveling to NC and stopped to have lunch. Menu prices were great. Decided to try the lunch buffet. Food was hot and really good! The Wait staff were very nice and inquired if we needed anything.

Author: d0rrianl
Review: Our waiter was so friendly and great with my toddler. He went above and beyond for us. The food was great as well! Definitely recommend!

Author: zenmomm
Review: I ordered take-out based on a recommendation from my hotel's Front Desk Clerk. Super yummy!! If you love Mexican food and your in the area, this is excellent fare.

Author: 907sh
Review: I found this restaurant here on TripAdvisor.... we were in town visiting colleges and I had a night with one son to grab a bite. The area was very sleepy for a city, granted it was Tuesday pm. Parking was busy so it appeared to be a busy area. The atmosphere when you walked in to Lucky was a great vibe, dark lighting dining in first room and then second room had expansive bar and more tables for dining. The drink list was beyond creative. The menu was as well however it is very small, Im not sure how often they change it but I would assume often. The Brussels sprouts were drenched in oil and garlic, I actually like the taste of them simply roasted so this was disappointing and Im not sure there was one even half never mind full Brussel spouts it was a plate full of shredded Brussels.Service was a 10!

Author: rlwags13
Review: Had a wonderful night here with another couple while visiting Roanoke for the weekend. Started out with some excellent cocktails and brought in a bottle of celebratory wine ($20 corkage fee). We'd heard that we should try the marrow bones but thank goodness we didn't because dinner was crazy good and filling! Husband and I both got the ribeye and were NOT disappointed and we are pretty particular about our steak. I hate saying that but it's truly hard to impress me with a steak and a few weeks later I'm still raving about it. The flavors and texture were ridiculously good. Our friend got the scallops and she was very pleased as well. Staff was attentive and efficient, the atmosphere was lovely. We really enjoyed our time and highly recommend Lucky.

Author: ADF6879
Review: We had the scallops and fried chicken. Both were excellent and beautifully presented. The chef was very helpful in dealing with our allergies (alpha gal) and adjusted ingredients or made substitutions readily. Will definitely be back!

Author: ClaytorHokie
Review: This was my 3rd visit and Lucky continues to impress. We were there for our Anniversary and the staff, drinks, food, were all excellent. Sit at the bar if you can and you will not be disappointed.

Author: 778danad
Review: Amazing food; clever presentation; knowledgeable and friendly staff; interesting cocktails...must try the Cube!!

Author: accessall
Review: Kind staff and master cocktail craftsman. Ordered variety of house specialty drinks. All wonderful. Small plates/appetizers were all delicious. The atmosphere is excellent for couples or friends. Woody, artsy, and comfortable. Absolutely recommend.

Author: journeymaid48
Review: We had dinner here on our stay in Roanoke. The service is good. The food is very regional and reminded me of my grandparents. The quality is exceptional. The kale is amazing and so is the fried chicken. The bread pudding is outstanding and an excellent choice for dessert. I would defintely recommend stopping here if you like southern comfort food.

Author: brianmZ4811PI
Review: Had an amazing dinner at Lucky this past weekend. Our table had the ribeye, scallops, crab cakes and the buttermilk fried chicken and everyone was over the moon about how delicious everything rated. Their customer is second to none. Also I cant say enough about their bourbon/whiskey selection. Its one of the best I have had the opportunity of enjoying. Please go to Lucky and enjoy! You wont be disappointed.

Author: Jill108
Review: Lucky is always the first choice for me and my friends; convenient location, incredible cocktails, wonderful atmosphere. The bartenders are the perfect mix of keeping you company if you just want to hang or giving your space and just taking great care of you if you want to catch up with a friend. Amazing fresh food, they never have an off night. Order the frites to munch on while you have a couple great drinks and then get the scallops and one of the fresh beautiful salads. You cannot go wrong here, make reservations though, they stack out.

Author: steve82257
Review: Our first time to Lucky and last time .Pluses Service was good , well staffed , clean . Negatives Food is overpriced ,and just average on quality of food  limited menu ,There is much better choices in Valley Noisy like VERY Noisy this is a real turn off

Author: Steve L
Review: We attended a business dinner here and it was a most enjoyable dining experience. The decor is classic yet rustic as they strive to maintain the charm of the old building within which it is located. The staff is abundantly pleasant and service was top notch. As for dinner, we had the Lump crab cake app which was delightful !!! The dinner salad was good, fresh, well prepared but nothing over the top. The entree was a combination of the Pecan Crusted Chicken breast (outstanding) and the Grilled Filet of Beef. Both perfectly seasoned and prepared. They were served with creamed potatoes and seasonal veg mix. Dessert was Creme Brulee that was equally well done. Overall, a most pleasant experience. The prices are steep, but within range for a fine dining establishment. For me, it was worth the price to be pampered with amazing food.

Author: SafetyWoodDude
Review: Went to Alexanders for dinner celebrating our 47th wedding Anniversary before attending the Ringo Starr Concert. I ordered the Rack of Lamb, which consisted of two small lamb chops. Each chop was approximately 1/2 fat, 1/4 bone and 1/4 meat. Was not satisfied with the entree. I did not complain at that time not wanting to put a damper on our night celebrating our special time together. Alexanders was our choice for fine dining during special occasions. While I understand nothing stays the same, quality should not degrade with the prices of that entree. My wife ordered Glac Chocolate for dessert and got Vanilla ice cream with fudge topping. Not worth the top dollar cost of the meal.

Author: sparky4365
Review: Great food. Excellent drinks ( Blueberry Margarita) and wonderful servers. Mixed grill and scallops were fantastic. A little pricey.

Author: TheWorldTravelGuruX
Review: Very welcoming staff and great service! Well taken care of by the waiter! Menu was too small to read but they provided me with loaner readers. Nice selection of food on the dinner menu. Enjoyed my meal very much but not the best I have had. I had the veal dish. Wine selection was limited but had a decent bottle for a decent price. Will return on next visit. Thank you for the hospitality.

Author: Valiant1968
Review: Being Roanoke natives, my husband and I have visited Alexander's many times over the years, including hosting a group dinner for 20 recently. It never disappoints. They have an exceptional staff, a wonderful menu and the ambiance is unsurpassed. You can enjoy a nice conversation with your dining companions, unlike 90% of most restaurants where loud music or chatter impacts the experience. All of this is available for a reasonable price. And don't forget Wednesday, when the restaurant opens for lunch, offering hot and cold specials in addition to their regular lunch menu. Alexander's is a class act!

Author: 32ericp
Review: After a awful experience with the valets at The Hotel Roanoke, it was redeemed by the staff at Alexanders! From the time we walked in to the time we left everything was perfect. Made a reservation and asked for the window seat. They had it ready for us. Everything from the filet, seafood and pork chop was cooked to perfection. The staff was attentive and always ready. Great job Alexanders! Will be back every visit to Roanoke.

Author: Jeffrey W
Review: We like to treat ourselves and go to Alexanders on special occasions. This is a top notch full service eatery. This was our wedding anniversary and they did not fail to impress. The food was delicious and very well plated. The service is always perfect. Cant wait to go back.

Author: dixiedreg
Review: Top shelf food and service. Most people dress for dinner there. Great Southern charm with a quiet reverence that demands respect.Not cheap.

Author: O4480QBmariem
Review: We had a business meeting at this restruant in the private room upstairs. This provided a nice view of the street scene while waiting on others to arrive. Every aspect of the food and presentation was perfection, including credit to the company for setting up this event.Everyone had plenty to eat! Some of us plan to return to this restruant in a small group setting.

Author: Kate S
Review: We were treated with care and the service was excellent. The food was thoughtfully prepared , beautifully plated and served with style A nice variety of choices of both meats and fish and veggies. Veggies were tender and a bit crunchy is the way I love them.

Author: karentdesign
Review: I waited after being seated yesterday for 35 minutes and never got fed. My waitress was so busy another person had to take my order. While I waited I noticed 2 different couples who were seated after I was were already eating so I got up and left!

Author: Thomas G
Review: They were able to accommodate our large party with little wait which was great for a Saturday and Sunday morning. On Saturday, they did seem understaffed for waitresses and bussers.

Author: Hokiechip
Review: We have visited this location twice within the last two weeks and have been very disappointed in the service both times. Not efficient and it takes forever to get your food - even when they're not busy.They may have had a change in management as I haven't seen Lisa there either time and you can typically count on her to keep things moving.

Author: 241bbqfoodguru
Review: We had 26 people for breakfast New Years day and the staff did an excellant job in making us comfortable and served everyone promptly.Food was as good as always.

Author: Linda H
Review: This is a very accessible location.Our server was very helpful and attentive.Food was very good. If, in the area would come here again.Very clean.

Author: Richard H
Review: Stopped at this IHOP on the way home from a trip. This visit was not as good as the last time we stopped here. There were only a couple of other customers there, even though it was around dinner time. We were seated and after a wait that was starting to get a little long, our wait person walked by and looked surprised to see us. She was very friendly, took our drink order and came back a few minutes later to take our order. We ordered breakfast and I asked her to make sure my bacon was crisp (i hate under cooked bacon!).Then the wait begin. With no more customers than there were (by that time there was only one other table), I figured the service would be as quick as it usually is. But not this time. It took approximately 15 minutes for our food to arrive and this was just eggs and bacon and pancakes! My bacon was crisp but that was about the only thing they got right. Our "over medium" eggs were not and the pancakes were so cold the butter wouldn't melt. I got the impression the they had been sitting back in the kitchen waiting to be picked up. I sent the pancakes back to be heated up and went ahead and are my runny eggs. When we got the check if was $25, which I thought was a little high, but I have the girl 2 twenties. She had to go find her manager to get change because apparently they didn't have enough money in the cash register up front.Very disappointed with this place on this visit. Probably won't go there again.

Author: Hokiechip
Review: We eat here about once a week and whenever Lisa, the Manager, is working, you can count on fast, friendly service and things running smoothly. When she is not, especially in the evenings, then things may or may not go well.Generally LOVE their breakfast as they do have some of the best pancakes anywhere.

Author: Steve L
Review: We frequent this location and it has always been a good experience. Orders always come out mostly correct, and if anything is wrong, it is remedied quickly. Items are cooked to order and well prepared. Service is average speed and for the most part, staff is friendly. Standard IHOP decor, nothing out of the ordinary. Solid choice for breakfast.

Author: jhais28374
Review: Was a quick meal with friends and a meeting before our club meeting on Friday night. I had the BLT on toast and it was great. One of the fellows got a full breakfast plate and his looked good. The other got some eggs and the were nice looking as well. He seemed to like his food.

Author: Hokiechip
Review: Visited on a Sunday morning, which is probably their busiest time. Although, we had to wait a little while for our waitress to get to us, overall service was pretty good. My wife's order was not correct, but it was quickly corrected. The Manager, Lisa, does a nice job of checking on customers to make sure everything is good.

Author: P3699IXvictorias
Review: Made reservations for a birthday celebration and had a wonderful time! Received a celebratory glass of champagne when we arrived. We split dinner of a hamburger special, deviled eggs, and fried chicken that was to die for! One of the best restaurants in Roanoke for sure! There was outside seating as well which is nice on a warm night!

Author: dalerK1288NY
Review: Took me a few minutes on trip advisor to find out where to eat tonight... I am so glad I picked The River and Rail.... The food and ambiance was amazing.Had some great cocktails before dinner and then an awesome steak ...Ill be sure to come back when I visit Roanoke

Author: BenGlassLaw
Review: First, food and service were excellent and well worth the visit. My cautions would be that at 7:15 on a Friday night the noise level was really high, just from conversation. It abated after about an hour. Also, this is a 2 hour meal, which is fine, but just know its a different feel from many restaurants . Again, service and food was excellent

Author: dance820
Review: This place is truly one of the very best restaurants in the Roanoke Valley. Fresh and innovative menu and cocktails, great ambiance. Ali was our server and she was phenomenal - so knowledgeable and friendly. Only critique would be to offer more non-fish entrees for those of us who do not eat fish/seafood. Highly recommend!!

Author: Filmprof
Review: We had dinner here on a Wednesday night and virtually every table was occupied. That speaks to the quality of The River and Rail. It was a great experience from beginning to end, from being greeted by GM Aaron as we were seated to the warm goodbyes as we left. The room is cleanly designed and inviting. And the food is outstanding -- fresh ingredients, imaginatively prepared. The pickles (cucumbers, mushrooms, carrots, celery, etc.) are a nice way to wake up your palate. The chicken liver mouse was silky and rich. I adored my catfish. It was light and crispy and the prep did not overwhelm the flavor of the fish. The rice grits and collards were a perfect accompaniment. That may sound like a sort of typical "southern" dish, but everything was elevated. A scallops special was a winner as were the savory pork ribs. My only quibble was that the side of beets with dill and yogurt sauce might have been better at room temperature rather than warm. We were going to skip dessert, but were happy we didn't. A chocolate pots de creme type of thing and a semolina cake with berries were both delicious. Drinks and wine were top-of-the line.I can't say enough about the service. The staff moved as if they had been choreographed, especially when it can to the delivery of the dishes. Our server (wish that I could recall her name) could not have been better. She was friendly but not "familiar", attentive but never hovering, and had an answer for every question -- everything you could hope for in a server.This was one of the most satisfying dining experiences I've had in the past year. Any large city would be lucky to have River and Rail and I'd say if you're anywhere near Roanoke it's worth going out of your way for!

Author: Mark W
Review: 100% FRESH at its best! The chef and staff are so attentive to each presentation. The cocktails ate absolutely dead on and expertly created to bring out the best of the mix! Cannot have had an experience this good so close to home!

Author: DDnthebeach8
Review: We had a great dinner at the bar with Nexis the bartender serving us. Nexis is a master of his craft. Hes friendly, knowledgeable about all things food & wine & more on the menu. The food was excellent & the host n hostess also were hospitable. This restaurant is well run & I just wish it was located closer to Washington DC area. Our favorite items were the pickles, the pimento cheese, grouper & crab entree. Dont miss this restaurant when visiting Roanoke VA.

Author: patiencein03
Review: We had a fabulous night at The River nad Rail! From the Crab Toast to the Oyster Wraps to the Soft Shell Crab and Pork Cheeks - every dish was prepared masterfully! Our server, Jessica, was absolutely wonderful, too!

Author: aliciafurrow
Review: First time stopping in, sat at the Bar- Shane is excellent- bartenders here are very technical in application and drinks are upscale .. too fancy for my taste, so Pinot Grigio was good enough for me! :-) ....cheese board was delicious, pork rinds with pimento was good.. each individually was nice but I think the pimento would have been better paired with something else, no offense to the chef- Brussels sprouts with the spicy mayo- so tasty, cornbread was okay- honestly the butter made it. Fried oyster wraps were a nice little treat and the banana pudding was excellent. Would definitely come back- the atmosphere is very nice- bathrooms are clean and you are able to view the kitchen from anywhere you sit in the restaurant- the restaurant is small so others conversations do echo. - reservations are a must

Author: Easy508th
Review: The River and rail is without a doubt, one of the finest restaurants in the Roanoke Valley. The drinks are fantastic and the bartenders take their time and get it right. The food is amazing as well! One of the best kept secrets is the cheeseburger. You must sit at the bar to enjoy this delight, but it is well worth it! The dinner menu is also amazing. There is an array of fine dishes to choose from and you cannot go wrong. Also, Sunday Brunch is out of this world!I suggest everyone give it a go! On Monday, you can enjoy steak tartare, if you are into that. Me, I prefer the burger!

Author: slynnep
Review: One on my favorites local restaurants with good food, reasonable prices and friendly service. Convenient location.

Author: aneishar2016
Review: Had dinner with the family and it was really nice sitting outside. Friendly staff and delicious big portions of food! Will definitely return

Author: SpaceCaptain
Review: Your regular Mexican Restaurant. Had a number of meals here and will return. Good drinks, but very slow service at the bar.

Author: Q3194XBrebeccap
Review: Stopped by for lunch, sat outside as it seems like a real vacation stop (unfortunately no ocean) but the food and atmosphere seems like a vacation. The chicken chichango was excellent.

Author: vacayersva
Review: They have ruined this restaurant. Have been going to it since it was built. Recently went and they had changed their menu. Of course all the prices had gone up, expected. The main issue is that they removed all the combinations. The main reason it is a one star, is that they removed free refills on their soda. Is that a joke? A mexican restaurant with limited soda? Who knows if salsa was extra, left after that. Will never be returning. Good job el rodeo, ruined the experience for regular customers trying to be something you are not.

Author: Michael B
Review: I've been to this hometown restaurant many times, but not for a while. In my experience, this one is the best. I always like their fajitas, steak fajitas is what I had this time - very good. The free appetizer of tortilla chips and salsa are also good here. My son got one of many combo meal offerings, and he gobbled it up. Portions are good, flavors excellent. Only thing I could see needing improvement is the service. We had a long wait to get our bill.

Author: bnasht
Review: This was my first visit to Roanoke and to this restaurant. I've eaten Mexican food all over Mexico, California, Texas, Nevada, Arizona and Virginia is the best? At least the best shrimp fajitas and chicken tacos. So impressive! Loved it!

Author: 354hl
Review: We have eaten at Tex-Mex joints throughout the USA. This one falls solidly in the average (and cliched) category. Typical free chips and salsa, large cups of icy soft drinks served in indestructible plastic cups, and food served on ceramic colorful plates. Flat screen TVs tuned to sports channels in every corner. We could have been in Peoria.I got my typical order of Mole Poblano. Again solid but unspectacular. My only surprise was getting two chicken breasts instead of one, which meant leftovers.Considering our visit was during the Mexican-Germany match in the World Cup, the place was surprisingly subdued when Mexico scored and eventually won. I expected more noise and celebration, which probably meant neither the patrons nor the staff were Mexican.

Author: Victoria K
Review: We were just staying in Roanoke over night and found this great Mexican restaurant. The building is very attractive and the flowers and shrubbery were beautiful. Inside, we were served quickly and courteously. The menu was excellent - varied and very reasonably priced. I had the chimichanga which was delicious. Portions are generous and the food flavourful. I would definitely visit here again.

Author: fun2cruzjanet
Review: We were seated immediately outside (our preferred location) but the hostess was in training so she forgot our silverware with the menus. There was a slight delay in getting waited on but once things got rolling, everything was okay. They made a mistake on one order but rectified it with no extra charge and it all turned out well. The staff at El Rodeo aims to please and we had a wonderful meal. The food is fantastic and it is one of my favorite places to dine.

Author: htaawd
Review: I had the sailor sandwich and it was one of the best Ive in years. The waitress was very knowledgeable and patient. Will return very soon

Author: Steve T
Review: I had the Chicken Montano's which came with two pieces of chicken and enough angel hair pasta to feed a family of four. The chicken was surprisingly bland. My wife had a shrimp dish which also left something to be desired. All this was offset by our server. She was upbeat and full of energy. She brought so much positive energy we didn't mind the deficiency of flavor. We enjoyed coconut cake and French silk pie at the end which were both excellent. Might stop in for dessert in the future but not a meal.

Author: ftice59
Review: My wife and enjoyed a quiet meal and it was magnificent I recommend it to everyone this place will be great for couples or family

Author: Mike O
Review: I was disappointed when I stopped in for lunch to be charged more for the California Cobb Salad than the price listed in the menu on their website; I was charged $13.75, which is $1.00 more. That makes the price of their Cobb salad $4.00 higher than at the nearby Wasena City Tap Room and Grill and at the nearby Wildflour Restaurant and Bakery. Since I could not detect a difference if the size or quality of their salad compared to the competition, I don't see much of a reason to return.

Author: blackbear25
Review: Stopped at this place for a drink with a friend after shopping, bar was pretty quiet, enjoyed a glass of wine, did not order food, while sitting at the bar a roach scurried by my hand, my friend and I squealed and I knocked it on the floor. The bartenders response when we told him it was a roach was shhhh, youll upset the customers. Um, excuse me but what are we? There was only one guy eating at the bar and one table behind us. We paid and left, wont be eating at a place that has roaches crawling around.

Author: Donna E
Review: We frequently go to this restaurant because the food and atmosphere are so good.We go every year on our wedding anniversary because we had a small exception there when we got married. It is a great place for weddings and events. The staff is very accommodating.I usually order Italian food but this year I thought one of the specials looked interesting. It was ribs, shrimp and some type of creole rice with chicken in it. So delicious! The ribs were to die for, the shrimp was grilled and the rice was wonderful! There is a nice bar with music somenights. Really a great restaurant.

Author: Janet L
Review: We dined tonight after excellent suggestion from our hotel (Springfield Suites). My husband and I ordered the same dish except that his was veal and mine shrimp. Being new to the area and restaurant we asked our waiter (Chip Liles) for recommendations and he did NOT DISAPPOINT . The food arrived quickly, perfect in temperature and was outstanding! Chips service was excellent as well. We boxed leftovers so that we could enjoy dessert an were glad that we did, as the bread pudding was to die for. We will return to Roanoke just to eat here!

Author: K3588TZdang
Review: Five of us went for dinner to celibate Fathers Day. Three of us got spaghetti and two got Rubins. It was wonderful. The waitress we had was very good and pleasant. The music was a little loud for dinner conversation. We will go back.

Author: Pottsmtn
Review: By far one the best places to eat in Roanoke.Great menu, lots of choices,great prices and delious Staff is wonderful and Kelly is the GREATEST, knowledgeable, and very helpful.

Author: Kenlynn P
Review: This is so unlike any visit or meal we have ever had at Montano's. I don't know if they were short staffed which it really didn't look like it since they were not full. It took almost an hour from the time we were seated until we got our food. I ordered the shrimp tacos and both of them only had 2 shrimp each on them and they were cold and tough. Their credit card machine was down so that was causing a lot of problems for them....I realize that this is beyond their control, but the waiters/waitresses were having to spend their time trying get in corrected and was not able to look after their customers. Again....we have always enjoyed eating here and this is not the normal for Montano's.

Author: rereno
Review: Visited while passing through and had a really good time. It's counter service with 10 seats. Joe kept us laughing during the short wait for our chile and cheesy westerns. The food was fast and served hot. Not the best burger ever, but for $2.75, why not go and savor the notoriety? The local regulars bantered with Joe, adding another fun element.

Author: pjkiss
Review: Read about this place on trip advisor, so e made a special trip through Roanoke just to check it out and we were not disappointed. Great burgers without breaking the bank ! Be sure to check this place out when in town.

Author: bradrealtor
Review: You have to try this is if you come to Roanoke. Bowl of chili, chili dog, and a cheesy western. Getting hungry writing this review.

Author: Amymone
Review: The Texas Tavern serves basic, tasty, food without pretension. The 10 bar stools and classic menu have not changed, thank God! I recommend the Cheesy Western as a yummy way to start the day. The patrons include so many regulars among the locals that you'll know you've found a place that earns loyalty from its patrons. Just to sit there and feel the comfort of people right at home is a pleasure in itself -- and the food is plenty good. The Texas Tavern advertises that "ladies" like the place, too -- indeed they do! May this place live forever!

Author: MikeK403
Review: Came as a recommendation from a former resident of Roanoke. Its a throwback to days gone by with prices to match.They like to say theyve sold millions of hot dogs .. ten at a time..the number of stools for patrons to sit at the counter.We had fun..parking is available on the side.

Author: Debbie R
Review: Ive been coming to T&T for years and the food is awesome. Homemade chili like you will get nowhere else. Cheesy westerns hot dogs and more. Small old diner with great history and ambiance. Food is always the same which is to say great and its just a fun experience to go. Check it out next time youre in beautiful Roanoke Va. Open 24-7 so great for late night snacks.

Author: amysU4223IB
Review: Found this place on the way back home from Tennessee. Its a great place to eat and simple place. I would highly recommend

Author: 784cindyg
Review: Its a must stop place! Even if you only get a hot all the way!! Cheesy western is another great choice! Not for those on a diet but well worth the experience!

Author: ecbronze
Review: This is truly a Roanoke "must do!" Even if they can only seat 10 people, you should make it happen. We took dinner back to our hotel one night. Delicious! We had already seen it on TV and then two of our Uber drivers suggested it, so we checked it out. Wow!

Author: dalt61
Review: Hot dogs they way they should be ! Served hot, tasty and quick! 10 bar stools only so be patient because its well worth it !

Author: Hokiechip
Review: Stopped in for dinner and should have left when we were left waiting at the hostess stand for 4 minutes before being seated (restaurant was not crowded).The burgers some of the best that weve had in a long time. Service, however, was just so-so. We waited for refills on our drinks as well as refill on fries as well.Good service would have made the visit a five.

Author: 119TomB119
Review: We usually do not like to eat at chains but I have been wanting to try Red Robin and it was close to our hotel. We could not have been happier. Meals were reasonably priced and we especially liked the ability to substitute a different side without an upcharge. Tap selection was adequate.

Author: The_Travelling_Lady
Review: Ate here while visiting our children. Service was a tad slow but they seamed to be short staffed. Our server was friendly but had a bad habit of handing the food/beverage to one person in our party and asking them to "pass that over" thought that was rather odd but since it was our 1st ever visit to a Red Robin maybe it is the norm.Drinks cam a bit slow were cold and refreshing (Beer) kids had sweet tea and the server kept the glasses filled.All the food was good, I tried the Cod and Chips, it was good. Hubby dove into a bacon cheese burger and he was very happy with the size, taste and appearance.I was excited to try this place as we do not have one locally. Was not disappointed and would consider eating here again if in the area.

Author: saltshaker2
Review: Burgers are only fair. Not as good as they used to be. Forgot to put tomatoes on both of burgers We were almost finished when server checked on us

Author: James J
Review: We were back in the area for a family and stopped in at the Red Robin. It is a favorite of my father's, who was traveling with us. The staff was friendly and who does like bottomless fries.

Author: R0ADTR1PP1N
Review: The service was okay. The fries tasted like cold cardboard. They want you to use the little kiosk on the table to pay your tab....now I know why. They can over charge you. The amount on the kiosk is not the amount on my emailed receipt or what was charged to my credit card. NO paper receipts. Spent 15 minutes on hold waiting to talk to a manager and was disconnected. NEVER AGAIN!!

Author: brenda2472u
Review: Went around 2:30pm, not very crowded. Took a while to have order taken, reasonable time to get food, which was dropped off by waiter and walked away. My husband upgraded to onion rings which he didnt get, halfway through meal we see waiter and flag him over, my husband says make sure you dont charge me for onion rings, the reply was yeah . As we are finishing our meal the waiter comes back around ask if we would like a refill he took my glass but never came back with it. After we finished our meal we had to wait for the waiter to come back around again let him know I never got my refill , his reply was what refilled?  Never acknowledged the fact that he brought the wrong order or that he forgot the refill, it was as though we were an inconvenience by Being there.

Author: rven4ever
Review: Ok we have eaten at Red Robins all over Canada and US. This is probably the worst one we have eaten at. Fries were dripping grease and still half cooked (white looking and raw tasting). Had some more brought out but they were the same.Burger was a soggy mess with wilted lettuce and so greasy it was inedible.

Author: JulAl75
Review: We rolled in to Red Robin which we already knew we liked their food. We had a 10 minute wait for a table which was ridiculous given the place was not crowded and there were empty tables everywhere. We ordered and it took over a half hour to get our food - much too slow. Waitress was nice but again super slow. Kids did get balloons so yayyy

Author: M O
Review: I ordered the fish and chips. Probably some of the best I've ever had. Large proportions and done just right. Service was perfect. Good selection of beers too!

Author: karentdesign
Review: Had lunch with my sister here and we both ordered the Feijoada; after a few bites we realized the pork and kielbasa were tough and had the flavor of having been re-heated. Collards were tough and stringy as well. Neither of us finished the meal.

Author: hbhakh
Review: I recently had dinner at Carlos with a group of colleagues. The restaurant is located on top of a hill, providing a great view of the Roanoke Valley. We had reservations and our table was ready when we arrived. They have a large menu with a variety of fish, chicken, and meat entrees along with a numerous appetizers and desserts. I enjoyed the branzino special. It was topped with crab and came with pasta. The avocado salad dressing was excellent. The other folks in our group all seemed to enjoy dinner.Service was very good.

Author: michelek442
Review: Seven of us met for dinner here on July 7, 2019. We have been here several times before over the past 2 decades and are always pleased. This particular evening was just so delicious and memorable. Everything was prepared perfect. I had the flan for dessert  best I have ever had anywhere. Our waitress was on fire. She kept us very well looked after.

Author: Bhav1982
Review: I was only in Roanoke for 1 night whilst travelling on my own. And I came across this restaurant which was close to my hotel. I turned up without a reservation and was shown to a table straight away. There was no window seats available but i could still see the views from my seat. Food - you get complimentary hot bread and salad. The avocado salad dressing is amazing. I ordered the chicken with okra and rice for my mains and it was delicious. Unfortunately I didnt have space for dessert but they did look super yummy. Drinks - the peartinis were delicious. My waitress - Amanda was really friendly and took time to talk to me and even offered to drive me to my hotel at the end of her shift to avoid me crossing the high roads. Definitely recommend this place to anyone in the area.

Author: outoftown7
Review: The only good thing is the avocado dressing. Every other thing we ordered was absolutely disgusting.

Author: Katynspinny
Review: We enjoyed eating outside on the patio and watching the sunset. The food was delicious and service was excellent!

Author: Patrice W
Review: This is one of the best places to eat in Roanoke. Views are unbeatable as is the food. The paella is my favorite but every meal at the table is always a hit ( steak, chicken, fish)

Author: 682bethf
Review: My husband grew up in Brazil, so when we saw Roanoke had a highly rated Brazilian restaurant we had to go! It was a lovely place for 'date night's as we watched the sun go down overlooking the Blue Ridge. My husband says the food was authentic, very nice flavors. Our server was very friendly and attentive. The wife of the owner even came out and chatted for a bit in Portugese with my husband! Not super fancy and prices are reasonable. It was an enjoyable night out during our visit to Roanoke.

Author: who642
Review: We went here based on Trip Advisor recommendations and the food was average at best. We got the lobster bites which others raved about. They were good, not great, and overpriced. The lobster bisque was ok. The Feijoada did not do it for us. Great portion size but taste was not great. The atmosphere was dated. However, the staff and the cheesecake were great.

Author: cegemoore1976
Review: Have you ever found yourself craving Brazilian food?? I do, and have for 20+ years thanks to Carlos in Roanoke. I dont get to go often enough, as I live two hours away. But anytime I am in Roanoke, I will always plan a stop at Carlos. Our meal for the night was the Feijoada. A traditional Brazilian dish of chicken, kielbasa, and black beans. It is served with rice, collard greens and oranges. It was incredible. Such a great comfort food. But, if you try nothing else at Carlos you must try the Avacado Vinagrette dressing. It is one of the most amazing things to ever hit my mouth. We went through 6 cups of it between two salads and a ton of bread. Service is always on point, and you cannot beat the view

Author: ejm99
Review: Last minute decision for dinner out. Wanted healthy casual.Arrived about 6:45 pm. Seated ourselves. Jano came over and took our drink order and gave us menus. Ordered a salad and a falafel pita. The food was fresh and delicious. Service was excellent. Nicely appointed dining room with booths and tables. Nice bar area. Location is off Colonial Avenue just beyond the Roanoker Restaurant. Restaurant is not visible from Colonial Ave. Highly recommend.

Author: rmdanstrom
Review: Seven of us stopped in for dinner on a Wednesday night. The proprietor, Jean, could not have been more pleasant and his food was even better. He prepared it all from scratch. Good beer selection, too! This is a hidden gem!!

Author: PriusGirlVA
Review: We were driving cross country and stopped in Roanoke for dinner on a Friday night. Checked out some online reviews and Caf Jano seemed very well liked by most people. We love Mediterranean food so thought we would give it a try.The dcor looks like a fast food restaurant. Not fast food like McDonald's, but in the same league as Chipotle. The tables were clean and the temperature of the place was good (it was cold outside). There were 3 other tables taken when we arrived, and it didn't take long to notice that there was only ONE EMPLOYEE WORKING. On a Friday night. It appeared to be the owner. He was functioning as waiter, chef, owner, and bus boy. Alone. All the while wearing what seemed to be the same pair of blue latex gloves... I felt bad for the man - juggling all the work alone is crazy. He was out of some things - French fries and kibbi as an appetizer. He took our order promptly enough, but that is when the loooong wait began. Everything is prepared fresh, which is fantastic and I expect that to take a while (I think the menu even noted to expect to wait about 15 minutes for food). But when it was well over half an hour and our small order - a salad and one shwarma - had not yet arrived, well, we almost bailed and left. But I felt bad knowing the poor man was probably back in the kitchen trying to prep our dinners...When the food finally came it was very tasty. The meat especially was very well marinated and delicious. It did seem over priced for what we got, but by the time it got to our table we snarfed it up because we were starving. Another table of people arrived while we were there, so the chef/owner/bus boy/waiter never got a chance to rest at all. Nor did he really get a chance to do re-fills on drinks or ask if anyone wanted dessert or anything else.Recommendation: keep the same good food, hire 2 or 3 servers.

Author: JimFromFloyd
Review: We visited recently for lunch when it was very quiet. The food was very good and the service very friendly. The owner was alone but took the time to talk to us. We will probably return, but not too often as there are other choices in town which are better value. The restaurant is very nice inside and a pleasant place to eat. The vegetarian options are more limited than expected for a middle eastern restaurant but are adequate. The food was tasty but was a little dry and needed more sauces. For the portion sizes we thought it was a little too much to pay for lunch.

Author: Jim B
Review: This restaurant doesn't look like much from the outside but don't let that stop you! Just past Towers Mall, inside is clean & bright. We started with the babaganoush an I had a Lebanon beer. Then I had the beef & lamb gyro. My wife had the chicken gyro. Both were excellent! Can't wait to return!

Author: Tblass24
Review: I visited Caf Jano last week for the first time. The dining area was very clean and tidy. There were 3 occupied tables on my lunch visit, but that may have been because I took a later lunch (1:15 pm) than usual. They offer Mediterranean and American fare from an uncomplicated menu. Items such as Gyros, Souvlaki, Kabobs, Falafel, Burgers, Submarines, Greek Salads, Grape Leaves, Kibbi, Baba Ghanouj, etc. I tried the Beef & Lamb Gyro ($8.50) as well as my dining partner. It comes with chips, but I opted for the French Fries for an additional $1.95. We found the Gyro to be tasty and both remarked that it could have used a little more meat for the price. The chef was a little heavy handed with the tzatziki sauce. The onions were of a large dice and I had to remove some to manage the strong flavor. I shared this with the waitress who said she would inform the chef to dice the onions into smaller pieces. The fries were delicious and appeared to be hand cut. The service was fine but would note that the chef and waitress appeared to be the only two employees working. The chef actually came from the kitchen to bus a couple of tables and to ask if we enjoyed our meal. I will definitely go back and try some different offerings from the menu.

Author: Dennis M
Review: When Cafe Jano used to be in Salem, I was a regular there. He closed it and went about other things but now he is back! Three of us went in for lunch and found a bright clean place that was very nice. Our server was very nice and very good. She answered questions and took gave us excellent customer service. The food was awesome just as I remembered, and we all three really enjoyed our dining experience!

Author: ejm99
Review: Stopped in for lunch with a friend. Restaurant was not too busy. Ordered the hummus and crackers to share and the tabulleh as an entre. Both were delicious. Service was friendly and pleasant. The time it takes for one's order to arrive is longer than normal because everything, I believe, is made fresh to order. The restaurant had a sign up trying to hire staff but was having a difficult time finding people willing to work. This is a very good restaurant that serves excellent fresh meals and is worth the extra minutes it may take to be served. I certainly will return. Dining room could use a little help on decor to create better ambiance.

Author: dhoffie
Review: We were headed to Towers Mall for dinner when I remembered seeing a small restaurant earlier when my granddaughter accidently turned into the short street before our turn. So I drove back Broadway to check it out. Everyone in the car was game to try a new Mediterranean restaurant. My son-in-law said his gyro was the best he had ever tasted. My daughter, who is gluten free, had the hot and delicious, fresh cut French Fries and grape leaves with hummus and enjoyed them. I wanted something light and chose the delicious Baba Ghanouj with fantastic fresh baked pita triangles. We will definitely return again to the Caf Jano and try more of their made to order, from scratch food.

Author: Chryscenthia
Review: ate here with my husband on a Saturday. Came here for the toubulleh but of course they had none. Humus was good and the kitchen accomodated my gluten free choice by providing veggies as well as pita for my husband,. Fatoush sald was large and good and fresh, but $10+ for lettuce, tomatoes, peppers and no meat or cheese? Turkish coffee was good. Service was outstanding.

Author: Bud G
Review: Not overly impressed, the salads would have been fine if not for lots of brown lettuce. Not fresh at all. Unfortunately because my wife was turned off by this she couldn't begin to enjoy her wrap because it was laded with same lettuce. I had chicken kabobs and it was tasty....the rice was plentiful and good. The bathroom was a letdown too. Doubles as a small market with middle easter goods. Ok but not in a hurry to go back.

Author: debbyappr
Review: Awesome food. Awesome service.Nice atmosphere.The desserts as just as good as the food. This place will definitely be a go-to place.

Author: Claudia H
Review: I ordered chicken kabobs and asked for a cucumber salad & yogurt sauce instead of the traditional lettuce, tomato and cucumber salad. I was not charged extra for the change which I would have gladly paid because the salad was so good. The prices for very reasonable for the ample portions you get. I definitely will go back again.

Author: Mike O
Review: We enjoy eating at places like this; small, family run, authentic, tasty, international, and inexpensive. And, the people were quite friendly; so much so, that the three of us were given complementary lentil soup. Everything we ate here during our early Sunday dinner was delicious, the Lamb Schwarma was packed with flavor, the Tabbouleh Salad was fresh as can be, the Petra Sandwich had surprisingly tasty cauliflower instead of meat, the Hummus Sandwich was also quite flavorful, and the Arabic Coffee Pot was oh-so-strong. All of this for $38 plus tip; good value.

Author: Quigg L
Review: My wife, grandson and I had lunch here. Thought it was a sit down restaurant with waiter or waitress but you order at the counter, grab your own drink and someone brings your meal to you. No big deal. The Petra platter was surprisingly good. Chicken kabobs were above average for the US but just average for the middle East. The hummus was light years better then store bought. The falafel was great. Grape leaves average, baba ghanouj and tabbouleh were delicious.Employees were courteous but were not fluent in English. No problem in ordering though. If you love Middle Eastern food and want a mid priced place in the Roanoke Valley, this is place is pretty good. Not as good as some in Israel but still good. It was super clean the day we ate there.

Author: T9136ZEtonyp
Review: After trying the gyro on the first visit and leaving with mixed feeling, I returned and tried something else and was pleasantly surprised! I had the shawarma platter the second time around and enjoyed it thoroughly. Nice sized portion that was bursting with authentic flavor. My tip is to stick with the platter dinners that are freshly made and avoid the seeming pre packaged gyro.

Author: Adrien M
Review: Petra caters more to takeout than dining in, but there is plenty of room to order at the counter and dine in, as I did on Saturday, April 28. The service was fast, friendly, and professional at this small family owned business (I believe they hail from Jordan). The prices were very good. I ordered the Petra platter, a delicious vegetarian sampler consisting of stuffed grape leaves, crispy falafels, creamy hummus, smoky baba, tabouleh, and tzatziki. The platter was drizzled with olive oil and lightly accented with a delicious condiment made in house that I would liken to a tangy salsa. It was a generous portion and I appreciated that the plate and flat ware were real and not disposable. I appreciate being able to sample lots of items, and six items for $10.95 was well worth it.My husband ordered the kufta sandwich that came griddled and wrapped in foil. The meat was tender and flavorful. There was an excellent garlic sauce on the side for dipping.I love MIddle Eastern food and will definitely return to this local gem! For a casual experience, the quality and value can't be beat.

Author: Michael B
Review: My wife and I had dinner here while passing thru the Cave Spring area. It is a small place in a new building and an Indian grocery store is next door. The menu is not extensive but has the usual items for Middle Eastern cuisine. Two soups were offered, a lentil and another that we both ordered called Freekah.
