Neither of us had had it before and were curious. We also ordered the appetizer sampler to split and two Gyros. The soup came first and was piping hot, the way I like soup. I think this soup is an acquired taste. My wife really liked it; I wouldn't order it again. But the appetizer sampler! Wow, enough for 6 people! We decided to have that for dinner and had them pack our Gyros to take home, lunch the next day. Anyway, the baba ghanouj was delicious, as was the hummus, yogurt, falafel, etc. Even the tabbouleh was great, and I'm picky about that item, but this was very flavorful, and not overwhelmed with parsley taste. The pita was warm and soft and cut in small pieces, perfect. I would definitely return to this place. The framed photos decorating the restaurant depicted places in Jordon, and Petra is there, so I'm thinking the owner/cook could be Jordanian. They speak Arabic, so, pretty authentic food I think.

Author: T9136ZEtonyp
Review: This has taken over the space previously occupied by Indika Caf on Brambleton. Pretty much the same setup without the pitchers of water on the tables. I was excited to try this place for the first time but leave with mixed feelings. First, my samosa were quite cold in the middle. Very disappointing. The gyro was ok. Not the best I have ever had. It was made like a wrap instead of the traditional pita. The meat was too uniformly sliced and shaped for me to believe it came off a rotisserie. It makes me question if they were even made on site or pre made and packaged elsewhere and simple heated up to serve. While it wasn't terrible, it definitely did not have the freshness or texture of a well made gyro. The girl at the counter insisted on pronouncing gyro as "JyeRoh" which was a small irritant. It was a little pricey for a place you order at a counter. $15.17 for the gyro combo with fried and bottled drink and the order of samosa. Perhaps their entrees like the kabobs are better? Still try it out and support local and make your own decision.

Author: helend0407
Review: Fresh food. Tastes like it was made on the premises. Good service. Wonderful flavors. Did I say fresh and tasty?

Author: ejm99
Review: Stopped around 6:30 pm. Half priced appetizers. Ordered corn fritters and two shrimp taco dinners, one grilled and one fried. Both were excellent. Appetizer hit the spot. Excellent service. Highly recommend!

Author: rocnative
Review: I love this place. Small, local and great food. My husband says it's the best burger in Roanoke. I love the quesadilla. We go here a few times a month.

Author: spencerinthehat
Review: Excellent food. Huge portions. Cooked to order. Had the grilled chicken salad/bacon/tomato sandwich w crinkle cut fries. Partner had The Authentic Cheesesteak (made w rib-eye) and fries. Sandwich was butter-grilled to perfection..and they use a good quality thicker bread. Chicken salad was tasty. Bacon just-right-crisp. Cheesesteak was best my friend has had around here. They make their own cheese-sauce. The meat was tender and tasty. Served on a good hoagie-type roll. Crinkle cut fries were greatcooked in good oil. Nice and hot. Cute place inside. Very clean. Not cluttered. Bar or tables to sit at. Staff was great and just-right attentive. The cook spoke with us and was genuinely a caring person.Coke and Pepsi products (bottled or canned). Beer on tap. May have wine-not sure. TV in dining area and several in bar area. This place has dine-in specials Tues-Saturday. Check their website. We had left-overs to take home. Give this place a try. Their menu and specials are on their website.Live music some weekend nights. Check their website or Facebook page.

Author: 677dan
Review: We stopped in on a Saturday night, and while they were not packed they had a steady flow of customers. Having never experience this hybrid dining setup, with server taking our orders and taking it to a food truck parked outside, it worked out quite well. The food was good or better, and hot. They have a nice selection of beverages inside. We left the place feeling like it will be a good place to return to later.

Author: ejm99
Review: Stopped in for their excellent fish tacos. Beer and soda to drink. Convenient on weekends because, although excellent, its not busy. Ambiance has gotten better with improvements to the decor. Service is very good. Prices reasonable. Recommend!

Author: ejm99
Review: Stopped in around 6 pm. Welcomed and beverage order taken. Ordered Key West Fish Tacos and Chicken Tacos. Option for a two or three taco dinner. We went with the two for our dinners. Excellent taste. Served with chips. Highly recommend.

Author: French62164
Review: Its the second time Ive been to the Rock&Roll Dinner, it has a great atmosphere (if you enjoy rock music). Love the outside area and the food has been spot on. The Philly Steak is the best Ive ever had. The food is cooked in a food truck. Its not out of the way to find but it is unassuming. Ill be back

Author: ejm99
Review: Stopped in around 6 pm. Welcomed and beverage order taken. Ordered Key West Fish Tacos. Option for a two or three taco dinner. We went with the two for our dinners. Excellent taste. Served with chips. Highly recommend.

Author: ejm99
Review: 6:30 pm arrival. Seated promptly. Ordered shrimp tacos, two taco version, and beer and Diet Coke. They were delicious!! Nice menu. Somewhat plain dining room. Nice service. Ample parking.Highly recommend!!

Author: 830june
Review: We ate dinner here last night. We both had sandwiches which came with a side. Both were very good! Their kitchen is behind the building in their food truck. The building used to be a copy center and has no kitchen. The owner or manager was also our waiter, and he was very friendly and gave good suggestions as this was our first time there. I would go back and try something else! The drinks we ordered did not come with straws and our to go box was cardboard--both trying to help the environment.

Author: cgandgg1989
Review: We have been to this restaurant multiple times and never had a bad experience until now. Not sure what was going on last night, but I was extremely disappointed in my meal. I had sirloin tips, ordered medium rare. They barely had any pink left in them. I had mushrooms as my side. I have had mushrooms as my side many times, but this time they were horrible. They were incredibly salty. My husband had a baked potato as his side and said it was still hard in the middle. Place was packed, but service was still great like always. Salad bar remained fully stocked. I hope this was a one time issue with the kitchen and doesn't become the norm.

Author: jperini79
Review: We enjoyed a wonderful visit to the Great 611 Steak Factory. Our filet and ribeye steaks were juicy and tender. The salad, potato, and dessert bars were all delicious. The variety and fresh foods on the buffet were wonderful. Our server was very helpful and courteous. She kept our drinks full and checked up on us a number of times. This restaurant was a great find and we shall be visiting it often. Don't hesitate to try it and be sure to take your appetite with you.

Author: SKTFLT
Review: One of,our favorite eateries. Food always delicious and staff delightful. So grateful for an establishment like this to visit with family and friends.GREAT MANAGEMENT!!

Author: Catherine C
Review: Despite the fact there were folks waiting, the large parking jammed, we took a chance and signed in. The super friendly woman who took our reservation asked if I had a cell phone so they could text me when our table was ready. She thought it might be 20 minutes or less. It was only ten! Our terrific server (Dana K, thank you!!!) was so busy but made sure to take our order and serve our delicious meals and ice cold beers really promptly. My petite sirloin was perfectly cooked, baked potato, piping hot. And their yeast rolls, scrumptious! Would definitely return!

Author: 086kevina
Review: Had one of the best dinners ever!!! I had the 16oz thick cut sirloin. It had the best flavor and was fantastic!. I have gone to many top chain restaurants over the years and this steak ranks toward the top. Friendly staff. Probably could use a few more waiters but overall a great meal at a good price. Will stop by here every time I'm in town!

Author: CharlieLikesToTravel
Review: Either these reviewers know nothing of a good meal or we just came on a very bad night! Know your menu... first thing in the restaurant business. Second, dont use instant crap because people with a half decent pallet will know. My daughter orders wings and expressly says make them extra crispy. They were breaded and soggy with an excuse that you cant make breaded wings crispy. Well, tell us theyre breaded because the menu doesnt say that. I order an 8oz fillet mignon powder keg. My wife wants the same but not with the seasoning of a powder keg. The waitress tells her shell get the same without the seasoning. She was served a cheaply cut thin sirloin filet. Definitely not what the waitress described. Again, know your menu. My powder keg steak came out beautiful and the one bite I did get was awesome. But since its our daughters birthday and her wings were crap I gave her my steak and waited on a replacement that never came. A steak that literally takes 5 minutes to cook never came within twenty five minutes before I said screw it. Let me not forget to mention the side of mushrooms. I told the waitress when I ordered to please get me a side of sautd mushrooms. My steak arrived with some kind of mushroom gravy that you would poke over your dogs food. I originally wanted mashed potatoes but the waitress did warn me they were instant so I went with the baked. They bring you a baked potato that you are required to then take to a potato bar across the restaurant to dress. I guess they cant be bothered to bring you a loaded bake potato like every steakhouse in the country does. By time you get back your damned dinner is cold. Great thinking there...The potato bar: made up of fake bacon bits, and some hard as rock sour cream you have to use the cutting knife to dip from the huge container on the bar. I also told them it was our daughters birthday. They brought the crappy frozen piece of cake out before our dinner was even served so the choice was stare are the cake and wait until after dinner or ruin dinner by eating it. It wasnt edible anyway so the choice was easy. So, to recap: waitress didnt know her menu, lots of instant and fake crap, cant be bothered to bring you your dinner, make you go get your own accoutrements for your baked potato that are fake and ruin the taste, argue with you about not taking the cold mushrooms off the check... I mean, I could go on but you get the idea. Weve eaten all over the world including Africa and had better food and service. This place is crap!

Author: Guy K
Review: Right next to a hotel. We stopped here on a motorcycle trip. Service was very friendly and efficient. Steaks were cooked perfectly medium rare. Will definitely stop in again.

Author: Hokiechip
Review: We eat here once a week at least because you can usually count on getting a good meal at a reasonable price. Every now and then, you'll get a dud on service or the meal, but seldomThe salad bar is among the best in town and the wait staff is mostly top notch.It's one of our favorite places to eat in Roanoke

Author: pvesey
Review: We ate here because it was next door to our hotel and we could walk. People who stay at the Quality Inn receive a 10% discount, but the hotel did not tell us. It was the restaurant that mentioned it. Both of us opted for the all you can eat salad bar, dessert bar, everything else bar!!! Everything was excellent. Everything was fresh, hot or cold as it should be, and all was completely stocked, even though we were there up until closing time. The waitress, Brianne, was very efficient and very friendly. They also brought fresh, hot, homemade rolls!!! They were named after the Class J Steam Locomotives that were built in Roanoke back in the late 40s. Everything about the decor was train related, and very unique! We enjoyed eating here very much.

Author: HJ379
Review: Wanted a steak so we stopped in. The service was great and the food was good. Thinking it was a steak place when we looked it up but its really more of a buffet style family steak house akin to a Ryans, Golden Corral or Western Sizzlin.

Author: trnichols17
Review: We were on our way back to Florida and stayed in Roanoke Va.We have stayed here several times.We always have good luck with the hotel and dining out.Last year was Alexanders and it was terrific.This year I asked the Desk guy at the Hotel if we should go to Alexanders or Lucky.He said are you a beef guy?Yes I am and he said if you are try Coach and 4 up the road.We did and it was delightful.In an old brick house that you wouldn't know it was a restaurant.Very nice interior with a small bar.Our waitress,Julie was very knowlegable about the food and drink having worked there for fourteen years.I had the Queen Primerib Baked and veggies my wife the Petite Filet.Both came perfectly done and the sides were great.Dessert was Godiva chocolate creme brle.Outstanding.Reasonably priced and delicious.Staying in Roanoke,try Coach and 4 on Williamson Dr.You won't be disappointed.

Author: BBloves2
Review: This is my favorite place to dine in Roanoke. They have an extensive menu, consistent quality, and friendly and efficient wait staff.

Author: SKTFLT
Review: This is one of our favorite dining facilities. Great food and friendly staff. We enjoy our visits each time we have dinner. Great menu and NEVER been disappointed.ENJOY!!

Author: Pspon
Review: Headed south on I81, looking to stop for dinner. Chose this based on TA reviews. Always easy to find fast food along the highway, but a short detour to eat "real" food was so worth the extra 10 minutes. Absolutely the best! Servers were plentiful and pleasant. Food was prepared and presented in a timely manner. Everything was delicious. Had She Crab soup, tossed salad with choice of toppings and Perfect Prime Rib with veggies and potato. Fair to say the most tender, "melt in your mouth" Prime Ribs ever. We were made to understand the owner is the chef. He's also an awesome manager! Clean, efficient, tasty and very reasonably priced!

Author: chris p
Review: Lovely restaurant with excellent food, service and ambiance! Affordable elegance! Freshly made in a timely manner! We will be back and we will request the cheerful, efficient and knowledgeable Rachel!!!

Author: barbararitaville
Review: First time to dine here last night. Lucky to get Shannon for our waitress. Complimentary meatball appetizer very tasty. Steak Diane delicious as were the potato croquettes. Veal marsala excellent. Onion soup rich and hearty.

Author: magbut
Review: We were passing through and the Coach and Four was on the list at the hotel. Great atmosphere and service. We enjoyed it very much.

Author: editor75
Review: Gourmet food at a small-town price. Comfortable ambiance, excellent service and very attentive staff.

Author: j0yceg0rd0n
Review: First time my friend Bill had been there, he said this is the best Prime Rib I have ever had and large Sea Scallops. The service was excellent. The Appetizer, shrimp cocktail, was also delicious. We will be going back. Beautiful decor.

Author: jmhudson1
Review: We rarely eat here more than once a year; we come here at the end of each June near our anniversary. We should come here more often, because it's a comfortable place with a dependable menu and service. And if you're celebrating an anniversary and give them a reservation with 24 hours' notice, they give you a complimentary baked Alaska. Our server was good and professional. He was prompt and served us efficiently. He might have been a little overextended -- it was very busy -- and I am dinging him a little for not splitting our tab (an anniversary habit: I pay my wife's and she pays mine) and for being too slow with it. But no big matter. My wife's martini was very big and very dry and only $6 for a call brand. I drank San Pellegrino; it was $7. We both had tossed salads, both with blue cheese dressing. The salads were fresh and lightly chilled (not too cold) and toppings are served at the table. Our entrees were the Coach & 4 Special (broiled shrimp, scallops and chicken breast over rice), which my wife complimented, and the "Grande New York Strip," 14 oz., medium rare, which was very tender with a nice strip of fat down its length, and done as requested. A memorable meal? For us, yes, because it's what we always have. And that's both a plus and a minus: Except for posted specials, the menu has gone largely unchanged for decades. The crowd seems to indicate that this is OK, but the crowd is also graying, like my wife and me. Still we like it, and we like the baked Alaska.

Author: SportsmomMichigan
Review: We arrived in Roanoke after a long day of traveling and wanted a quick bite to eat before we checked into our hotel. There were no tables inside, so we ended up sitting outside. Our server was very nice and he took care of us. I had the spinach salad with blackened chicken. It was delicious. My husband had the German hot dog and fries. He enjoyed it also. We were in town later that evening and the place looked very busy. It looks like a popular place.

Author: MikeK403
Review: In line with the craft beer trend..great spot for local brews..Definitely a bar atmosphere.Nice outdoor seating area.

Author: LasFamTravels
Review: I had the cheese steak pizza. So good. It's a good place to sit outside and people watch. That's all.

Author: roger3116
Review: Stopped in for a couple beers. Bartenders were friendly, even talked to a couple servers and they were also friendly. The food looked alright, but we decided that this wasn't the place for us and move on. They have a nice outside street-side seating area.

Author: Don G
Review: We stopped in here looking for a quick bite, and we left satisfied. On the down side, my wifes sandwich was barely warm (supposed to be hot), and I tasted zero horseradish on my horseradish-steak-sandwich. But the fries were good, and everything was edible, and the price was right ($20 for the both of us, including drinks). You could do worse.

Author: 431nancyp
Review: Our pizza was burnt and blackened; there was black soot under the pizza on the baking sheet! The waitress said it was normal! I dined there yesterday, Saturday, May 25, 2019 at about 3-3:30 pm. I am highly dissatisfied with the pizza we were served; and, that the waitress told us that this is the way Fork in the Market prepares pizza. If so, I wont be dining there again.

Author: Linda P
Review: Needed somewhere for drink and early dinner after a day looking round museums. This place looked busy so we took a table for two outside. I had blackened chicken burger with side of chef's vegetables. The chicken was excellent, the vegetables (baby squash, pepper, onion and garlic) were absolutely delicious. We had to wait a while for attention, initially, and the bill took ages to arrive but he food more than made up for it.

Author: raysfire1
Review: I ordered the black bean burger with French fries. The taste was off the hook. I have had black bean burgers before...yet this burger have the perfect combination of spices and black bean. I was very impressed with the taste. The fries tasted homemade and the atmosphere was friendly and comfortable. I do recommend this for lunch or dinner with a beer.

Author: QsbyTraveler
Review: Great fresh salad with excellent service. The salad had fresh salad mixings and nicely cooked chicken. Clean, friendly and reasonably priced. An awesome outdoor space to sit and watch the world go by.

Author: HokieHoo
Review: Had to have a pet friendly place to meet our daughter and her puppy on a very rainy Friday. Burger and fries were good. My wife had a salad, which she enjoyed and my daughter had a chicken sandwich. Pizza was way better than we had anticipated and we ate some of it for a couple of days. Only drawback was the weak brew selection. Waitress was nice and very attentive.

Author: sunflower35
Review: My husband and I stopped by Wall Street Tavern for a couple of drinks, wings, and split a Wall Street burger. Service was friendly and fast. The wings were delicious and they split our fries and burger for us so that we didn't have to pass a plate back and forth. We will return.

Author: Alan D
Review: Neat little shop with seating inside and outside. Good selection of burgers, wraps, and sandwiches. Beer - bottled and on tap. Nicely stocked bar. The garlic Parmesan fries are to die for!

Author: roger3116
Review: Stopped in for nightcap and sat on the sidewalk. Server was really friendly and the drinks were cold. Saw others eating and it looked ok.

Author: Kuntriqt
Review: I've been wanting to have dinner here, since I saw they had shrimp & grits on their menu! With an upcoming visit to Festival in the Park, we made reservations for a party of 35 afterwards. We were promptly sat street side. We had 3 waiters/waitresses working our party. They were very well on top of things, prompt, friendly and to my knowledge we had no issues at all with wrong meals, incorrect drinks or checks or anything of the nature. I of course order the shrimp and grits and it was FABULOUS! As well as a Caprese salad as an appetizer. It was delish as well! Hubby got a Reuben. He said it was good. I also heard the cheesesteak was good. The salads looked fresh. It was a great time and great food! Will definitely be back again!

Author: giuseppe0057
Review: My wife and i stopped in for a quick lunch on our way out of town and were not disappointed. We shared a chicken bacon wrap and a cup of broccoli cheese soup. both were well prepared, tasty and the wrap had tons of chicken. The service was great...stop in if you can

Author: NJerzeyTraveler
Review: Walked across enclosed walkway from hotel Roanoke to this restaurant. Very convenient . Nice attentive server . Prices kept pricey considering the atmosphere and inside table area is more like a dive place than a lovely restaurant atmosphere that warrants prices to match. Service was good and friendly but it was on the more dingy sparse side and the bathrooms are located oddly outside doors down in somewhat of a in my opinion not so nice food courtyard area of common other.... but when paying menu prices like Wall Street has , i expect different . And the street area oddly very historic and potentially pretty but reminded more like streets in New York City but much quieter , much less busy, without the crowds and hustle and bustle but the town struck me as i didnt feel as safe as I would in a town like Alexandria va for instance. Lovely historic town but oddly prices dont seem to match with atmosphere, and surroundings and reminded me more of a dive like bar and restaurant than an establishment for a pricier menu . And inconveniently on top , No apple juice . No milk, etc . Hotel Roanokes menu had prices set at same and Id choose to stay on property and dine on hotel property before walking across to this or other in town across that walkway

Author: MavisB801
Review: Walked around the streets and came across Wall Street Tavern and decided as such a lovely evening would be good to sit outside for supper. Greeting was good, table good was able to watch the world go by. Menus delivered and drinks order taken. Food arrived and I had ordered the salad with steak and very tasty, men had burgers and were ok but chips were cold sadly. Was not offered more drink or dessert. But enjoyed our visit.

Author: Patricia M
Review: I had the ahi tuna starter and the garlic parmesan fries, both of which were excellent. Spouse had mahi mahi which was OK, but rice and vegetables were overcooked. Only eat here if you can get a street-side table as inside is a bit dingy bar.

Author: beaglem2011
Review: My son got sick after eating here. He had the pulled pork sandwich with french fries. A few hours after he left the symptoms started. Enough said.

Author: ecbronze
Review: When our family decided to do lunch inside the market so everyone could get what they wanted, my son and I chose the Wall Street Tavern window. We were NOT disappointed. They went over and above to take care of my son with his dairy allergy. I highly recommend both the turkey and brie sandwich and the garlic/Parmesan fries. My son enjoyed the barbecue too! I will say we waited a little longer than the rest of our family, but it was totally worth it! The window staff was very friendly and helpful. I wish we'd been in town longer to come back and eat in the restaurant.

Author: SportsmomMichigan
Review: We had three couples and no reservation. The hostess promised a table within fifteen minutes. She did a good job and we were seated by then. Our server was pleasant and efficient. We had salads and soups as appetizers. I loved the crab and corn chowder. Our dinners included ravioli, crab cakes, a spicy seafood pasta dish, a scallops pasta dish. My crab cake appetizer was delicious. One dinner was cold and sent back to the kitchen. It was remade and it was cold again. The manager brought a cup of soup so our friend would have something to eat while her dish was remade. Once she got the dish it was cold again. They offered another meal, but she wasn't interested. The manager offered dessert for the table. They really went above and beyond to try and make it right. The desserts were delicious. Limoncello cake and creme brle was yummy.

Author: Susan M
Review: The menu is varied and our selections were delicious. Pork belly, lamb lollipops, seafood chowder. The service was excellent. Easy walking distance from the Hotel Roanoke.

Author: ginam191
Review: The prices are in line with the other restaurants in the area. The wine was expensive. I had the chili and salad. Cant remember what hubby had. So thats why I gave it a 3.

Author: C W
Review: We look forward to going to Billy's multiple weekends a year with friends and family specifically for the patio area, all times of year. The recent renovations took the fantastic Billy's vibe up a notch. I didn't think Billy's could improve upon excellent, but they did. Billy's has been "the spot" and has evolved to keep up with the love of outdoor relaxing and dining trend. The additional bar an extra seating allow for more fun with friends in the space we love.

Author: Ellen24019
Review: We have been to Billy's many times, for special occasions or just for lunch when we're downtown. We enjoy the ambiance, large windows for a view of the market.But we especially enjoy the food. We routinely take visitors here and Billy's has not failed to impress. I recently took my sister and niece here for lunch after showing them our lovely city market. We loved the hamburgers and sweet potato fries and a chocolate brownie with ice cream and chocolate sauce that was big enough for the three of us to share. One of my particular favorites is the limoncello layer cake. The staff has always been accommodating for special occasions.

Author: Desiree626
Review: Went here for lunch with friends during a recent visit to Roanoke. We all raved over our choices. My mermaid mojito was amazing and one of the best I've ever had. Same for my shrimp and grits. Another had the BLT which was enormous, one friend had a burger which she claimed was one of the best ever, and another had the crab chowder which was also amazing. Interesting decor. Definitely recommend. Very friendly staff!

Author: Chefsfan
Review: First time in Roanoke and everyone recommended Billy's - in fact we walked in with long-time residents who frequent Billy's regularly. Neat architecture though the service was a little slow given it wasn't that crowded. The food was very good and the Moscato wine from a Virginia winery was an nice complement to the meal. Would definitely go back if we weren't in a rush to eat - would be great to spend a little time walking around downtown and the nearby museums when the Fall weather hits.

Author: hbhakh
Review: I recently had dinner at Billy's with some colleagues. We didn't have reservations but a table was available just before 6 pm on a week night. The menu has a nice variety of appetizers and entrees. My short rib was tasty and nicely presented. Service was very good.I recommend

Author: Diane D
Review: We enjoyed our family dinner here last weekend very much!Despite the fact that there were many high school students there at the same time, we were seated promptly, our waiter was attentive and efficient without rushing us. ( Students were all dressed up and behaved in a way that their family's would have been delighted to observe)Our food was delicious! Our first time will not be our last visit here.This restaurant could use valet parking, it would put it higher on my go to list! We were lucky as we were driven by my daughter and son and law, who dropped us off and parked in a parking garage.

Author: Patrick H
Review: Had dinner here whilst in Roanoke for an evening. Food was very good and although it was a long wait, staff remained attentive. I had the short rib (4/5) and my wife had the strawberry salad with chicken (4.5/5).

Author: jmd220
Review: We had an exceptional, well-made meal. The environment was clean and the wait staff friendly and helpful. We came just before lunch, which allowed us plenty of time to explore the environment and get an education about the culture and food.

Author: Shuya
Review: Prompt, friendly service. The decor was interesting, good location in downtown Roanoke. Nice varied menu, each dish had good-sized portions.

Author: rlwags13
Review: Went here for lunch with another couple and had a wonderful time. We all wanted to try so many things and as it turns out there was an option for that on the menu. We split the 10 dish option between 4 of us and were very happy with our choice. The owner? was extremely helpful and friendly and helped us pick some of our dishes. The food was just fantastic; super fresh and full of flavor. Get the tabbouleh! We enjoyed some coffee and shared one dessert between us (just one bite per person--we wanted to try something sweet but were full). Lovely little place. Thanks!

Author: 606ianak
Review: Floor was sticky, water tasted like bleach, restaurant kitchen smells wafted into dining room that were reminiscent of a kitchen sponge on the verge of getting thrown out. Also, we put in a gin martini order and they delivered a vodka martini 30 min later, the server was clueless when we asked for hummus (top item on menu). We accidentally first sat in the hookah bar next door which is also part of the restaurant. When we said we dont want hookahs, just appetizers and drinks, we were asked to move to the other side. Not going back.

Author: D308DEdavidp
Review: During a visit to Roanoke, I happened to find street parking in front of the restaurant. Cedars looked good, so I tried it. I ordered the chunk chicken kebab. It was excellent.A nice blend of flavors with a great finish. I will Cedars on my list of places to return to in Roanoke.

Author: covalentblond
Review: I am not a big lamb person in general but love the lamb shwarma here. the owner always remembers you and is very friendly.

Author: Heather B
Review: My sis and I had been wanting to try this for a while. We were able to this past weekend. It was all delicious. I can't remember the specific names for what we had. I know I had tabbouleh and a lamb wrap and we both had the baklava for dessert.Don't forget the coffee.It is in the square area of Roanoke so just be aware of parking frustration based on different times of the day.

Author: Andrea C
Review: This is not Lebanese food at all. The pita is really just a tortilla. The beef was chewy and the ground beef was salty. Rice is just regular rice... just an overpriced, not very well done home meal. I have been to other Lebanese restaurants and the food here is seriously not it at all. Dont waste your time and money! Not worth it!

Author: AllyJC2014
Review: As I can recall, this was my first time eating Lebanese although I am quite familiar with Turkish which seemed similar. Personally, I wasn't over keen on the Lebanese beer as I found it too citrusy for my taste. On the recommendations of the waiter (and previous reviews) we went for the 5 plate meze) and we were very happy with our choice which I considered to be great value. Would definitely return again.

Author: andres123123123
Review: Amazing experience! Our server Mathew was fantastic, very welcoming, attentive and helpful. The food came very quickly and tasted very authentic! 10/10 will come again!

Author: meemaria
Review: This restaurant has good food and seemed very clean. Our server also had a great sense of humor. I would eat here again.

Author: Michael F
Review: On the road and looking for a good steak. The Longhorn was a short walk from my hotel so was an obvious choice. I had the 6 oz Renegade steak and it was the perfect meal. Medium well done and the steak was tender, juicy, and had a great marinaded tang to it. The side of broccoli was generous and done just right. The meal came with a huge piece of bread (actually a mini loaf), the side and small salad. The portion size was just right to avoid feeling stuffed. The service was good as well. Ill definitely visit again if I pass through this way again.

Author: SurveyorScott
Review: I was on a business trip. On the evening of August 16, 2019, I went into the Longhorn for a quick meal alone. I sat at the Bar had a very good scotch and ordered the Prime Rib. Service at the bar was excellent. I had some great conversation with the 2 bar tenders on duty. The steak was cooked well and flavorful. It was a great experience and a wonderful meal.

Author: Michelled18182019
Review: This restaurant was very clean, staff friendly food great! Always love going to Longhorn. Never disappoints!

Author: 31gjones
Review: Half empty, still a hour to get cold food. Server was nervous, or could not hear. Orders were mixed up. Overall a terrible experience .

Author: Michelled18182019
Review: Longhorn is always a favorite and this location is no exception. Nice service pleasant people enjoyed the food

Author: MileHighFox
Review: I recently dined at this restaurant. The food was good but the service was slow. The Waitress apologized for that; explaining there was a party of 40 people, they were also serving. Surely, they made reservations, for that many people. Perhaps it would have made a difference to bring in extra help.

Author: Barbara C
Review: We had dinner with friends at the local Longhorn steakhouse.The chicken tenders were delicious. My hubby enjoyed the parmesan chicken.

Author: Sherry B
Review: Had some gift cards to use up so we came here for an early dinner. Initially they were not going to accept them because they were no longer part of the Darden family, but server checked with management and they said they would. Server was very friendly and accomodating, except when we were ready to leave and could not find him to obtain the check. Could not decide what to get so initially hubby and I were going to split our steaks. Hubby got 12 ounce sirloin and proceeded to eat the whole thing, except the one piece he gave me, because it was cooked and seasoned perfectly. My prime rib on the other hand.....had ordered it medium, came closer to rare, very tough, no flavor, even with the horseradish sauce. Hubby took one small bite and I left most of it. Loaded baked potato was small and did not have alot of toppings. Side salad was the right size but had too much dressing--my fault for not asking for it on the side.

Author: aneishar2016
Review: Visited for lunch and was absolutely amazed. The waitress was very friendly. Food was fast and delicious. The bread is scrumptious!I was surprised at the cost. It was not expensive at all and it was alot of food. Will definitely return!

Author: xxlovetotravel12xx
Review: I have been going to Pete's since I got my first job, at Crossroads Mall. I have since moved out of state; but, was back recently for a visit. We had a wonderful lunch and our waiter was the bomb. Highly recommend.

Author: HHicks4803
Review: Today our Community Day Program visited Pete's Deli. What wonderful food. The facility was clean and spacious. The staff were amazing. Our waitress was personable, professional and caring to our individual and their needs. We will be back to visit soon. What an overall great experience.

Author: Becky J
Review: We placed our breakfast order and were told they ran out of biscuits (after being asked if we wanted toast or a biscuit) which was "somewhat" understandable since it was 15 minutes before the end of breakfast hours. We changed the order to toast, etc., but kept a side of gravy. Twenty minutes later, our server came out to tell us they had run out of gravy, too. Waiting 20 minutes for our food only to be told it was not available (and now past breakfast hours) was not acceptable. We walked out; and a return visit is very much in doubt.

Author: David J
Review: Neither my wife nor i could talk the other info fixing dinner tonight so the vote was 2 to 0 for carryout from Pete's. Food was just coming out when I arrived. Got back home and both dinners were as ordered and delicious as always. Misty and crew always provide great service and AwEsOmE food at a good price

Author: TravelinJim2014
Review: We just returned from having an inexpensive meal at Petes. We go out every Wednesday and try a different place. Tonight, while we were in Roanoke we thought we would stop at Petes. We were seated right away and our food was ready within 15 minutes. Petes has very good diner food. My wife had the special; beef tips and noodles. I had a chicken salad croissant and our friends had pork chops and chopped sirloin. We had a good meal for $21.00. We will be back.

Author: Passenger56927493107
Review: Something has changed at Pete's Deli. Servings are smaller, prices are higher and business is noticeably down. They don't seem to be able to keep good servers. Every visit there are new servers. They do have the best hot dogs in town with yummy chili (made in house). I miss the old Pete's!

Author: CCPABL2
Review: This is the best place to go for great food fast. Fits in with my lunch time or I will order out. Very nice staff.

Author: Daryl S
Review: Food was good the portions for a little bit small I thought prices were average atmosphere was more of your elderly and retirement crew

Author: WWSPENCER91
Review: We came here the 1st time just to grab a quick bite. We were seated and served pretty quickly which was great. The portions were great and the food was very good. We will definitely come back.

Author: youbetterbelieveit
Review: Not greeted upon entering. Weird atmosphere. Weird/expensive menu. The soup...really why even bother. Grilled chicken (how do you mess this up) Greek style green beans (I know somebody there is Greek?) and canned pintos. A tiny burger with fries added was like $8 bucks. Just ridiculous all around...Skip it.

Author: David N
Review: Always busy. But never turned away or waited. Friendly greeters. Menu is creative but simple. Service is prompt. Food comes quickly and always good Never had any issue with taste of quality. Not ez to find in center section of a mall and no entrance on lot

Author: ncstateva
Review: This was our first time here and we will be back. My husband and I shared an order of fried green tomatoes and his comment were these were the best he had ever eaten. We both had the blackened tuna steak with asparagus and rice. This also came with a side salad. Everything was fabulous and more than enough food. Can't wait to go back and try something else.

Author: LilyMyrtle
Review: Varied menu always makes it a nice choice for a group. Food is always good. One of my favorite veggie lasagnas!

Author: BigguyNC
Review: Our server Robert saved the day. The food was ok. The tomato and cheese soup was outstanding. On the other hand, my wife's soup that was supposed to have shrimp, scallops, and clams missed the boat.

Author: Elizabeth G
Review: Hidden gem. Make sure you try the shrimp avocado quesadillas or the cuban sandwich. Very tasty! Will definitely go again.

Author: vasportsmom
Review: New to the area; came here for lunch with my daughter. Food was good but service was poor. Waited FOREVER for a box and the check, even after requesting it; felt like we were invisible compared to everyone else around us. First time was also the last time.

Author: BrittlePeanut
Review: It was nice to eat somewhere that had such a good selection of veggie dishes. I had the red beans and rice, which was very tasty. My husband had the veggie lasagne which he enjoyed. Nice friendly service in a cafe setting

Author: Steven C
Review: This has been one of my regular lunch and dinner spots for years. However, upon my last visit for lunch the hostess was NOT accommodating at all. The time was later during the lunch hour, one side of the restaurant was very full and noisy and I requested a table on the quieter side where a few people continued to dine. I was refused the quieter area and the hostess asked if not eating in my preferred spot would "mean that I would not eat there?" To which I replied correct. And I quietly left the restaurant and I have not returned to date. On a separate occasion and much later in the month, my wife dined there for lunch with a friend and was greeted by the same hostess and she was also shuffled to the noisiest side of the restaurant. My question is, why not just close the "better side" of the restaurant if they do not like to seat paying patrons there?I'm done with this Wildflour at Towers.

Author: georgesO7303US
Review: Wildflour is one of my favorite local restaurants but last night was not their best night. First of all, they were incredibly busy for a Monday night so service was pleasant but very slow. We had to wait on our coffee and then had to flag the server down to get a refill and an offer to refill when dinner arrived never came. I had scallops and then serving was sparse. My wife had the fish special which she couldnt eat because the fish was fishy which means old fish to me. No hint of an apology. And the bread was pretty stale too. Overall, not a good night!

Author: khughes91
Review: The server greeted us immediately with a smile. She was very attentive. One member of our party arrived later, and the server greeted right away and get her beverage order. The menu has so many great dishes to offer, it is difficult to choose. I got the crab cake salad, which was terrific. Everyone at the table enjoyed their dishes, which included red beans & rice, salmon cakes, and grilled cheese with tomato soup. The prices are very reasonable. Definitely a great place to eat!

Author: BarbaraNYC23
Review: Not just huge but GOOD! Stayed over in Roanoke on our way to Pigeon Forge and stopped in here based on Tripadvisor reviews. It's a bit out of the way, but very well worth it, especially if you plan a visit to nearby Black Dog Salvage. There are a number of tables - we chose to take our food to go. Very busy on a Saturday morning, but service was quick and friendly. My hubby had the bacon, egg and cheese biscuit - it was tasty and filling. I had the biscuits and gravy which was great too. You will not leave the place hungry!!

Author: bradrealtor
Review: My wife and I like to get scratch to go. Always busy but fast. Service is always good and food has been consistently good. Love the chicken biscuit and biscuits and gravy.

Author: bbg130
Review: Its a small place that gets crowded. Patrons order then sit and the staff delivers the orders. Our group got a variety of offerings. The buttered biscuits are delicious. The biscuits and gravy are delicious too but peppery - black pepper - and one was enough for the 3 who ordered that (they offer 1 or 2 with gravy). The breakfast plate with scrambled eggs and sliced tomato was good, fresh. The coffee was ok.

Author: dantheman619
Review: What a gem. We had the fried chicken biscuit, the half biscuit and gravy and egg/bacon biscuit. I have high foodie standards and they were exceeded here! Well done, great value.

Author: Rolo6261958
Review: Came off the highway from Connecticut to Tennessee to stay over night in Roanoke,VA Found this place via on Trip Advisor . Saw that it was 8 miles away but we still took the risk and drove out . Well worth it so worth it on our next road trip down my Wife and I will be making this place a planned stop no matter what time of day were passing thru ( hopefully during business hours ) . The staff was very friendly and accommodating to a couple first time out of towners who had no clue at all no rushing no roll of the eyes just very very friendly good ppl who gave a couple northerners that southern hospitality .

Author: orcaluv97
Review: I can't wait to go back! We had breakfast here and it was fresh and delicious (and I don't like breakfast foods). I had to get a biscuit, even though I typically don't eat them, and I loved it! I mixed breakfast with lunch by getting the pulled pork on a biscuit, both were outstanding. You have to try their homemade cookies also; chocolate chips, nuts, and BACON!!! YUM!

Author: Travis H
Review: Amazing large biscuits. Jezebel biscuit with country ham, pameinto cheese, and sauce was an A++!. Can get busy but worth the wait.

Author: T1173UVadamh
Review: This place has the kind of biscuits that your grandmother would make. Inside was really nice and the food was exceptional.

Author: Ratman937
Review: Huge and yummy biscuits! They have local hot sauce that is very good as well. Fast service and very polite staff! I ordered the Bless your Heart biscuit that comes with bacon and a fried green tomato. Southern food at its best!

Author: episcobob
Review: Following the Tripadvisor ratings, we tried this place. WOW! Excellent breakfasts. We had their "Crippler Platter" with bacon, ham, sausage, grits, eggs, and biscuit... plus an order of french toast. Both were perfect. The grits were superb -- great consistency and seasoned just right. Inexpensive, with simple seating. All one might wish for unless you are more into comfort than quality of the food.

Author: ginam191
Review: We had the fish tacos. The servings are huge. The fish was fresh. The only complaint was ,....it was freezing cold. I had to go outside while hubby paid the bill.

Author: aneishar2016
Review: Visited with a few friends and I enjoyed the customer service. I had the rasta pasta, it was ok, the sauce was not what I was expecting though. The drinks are expensive but one thing they have that is super delicious is the crab dip. It is so good and the pitas or whatever it is, is freshly fried. I would go back just for the dip.

Author: aliciafurrow
Review: Ordered through a delivery service, got the beer battered fish tacos, a steak taco and a calamari taco... all 3 were super good! Had a side of jalapeo mash but that wasnt anything to write home about. Also ordered an app of the queso... came with a big bag of chips but to my dismay, the container was only a third of the way full.. which is definitely not worth the price that was paid for it.. it was also pretty runny... The guacamole was ok.. but I think whoever made the batch that I received put way to much lemon juice in it...over all the tacos are the star and thats what Ill return to get.

Author: Livmakers
Review: My boyfriend and I visited Cabo Fish Taco downtown Roanoke last weekend for the first time. It was so good and the service from Ben was so amazing!!! We highly recommend the Buffalo Shrimp Tacos (right) and the Lemon Grilled Shrimp Tacos (left)

Author: walkntall509
Review: The food was amazing! The service was great. Our server Katie was really sweet and very attentive. We will definitely be back again.

Author: Mike O
Review: We thought the tacos we had here were very good; updated contemporary flavor combinations with a twist. Our server, Katie, was a pro. She knew the menu, made helpful recommendations, was super attentive, and was as nice as can be. We were disappointed with the restaurant's website; the menu there was not consistent with what we were given at our table, and it did not list any of the beers available on tap. We were also disappointed with the reservation situation; when we arrived, the employee at the host stand informed us they don't take reservations for groups of four. She dismissed the fact that Chris Wade, the Cabo Operations Manager, has responded to our email reservation request for four people, "Ill have your name written down at the host stand."

Author: Fgw3
Review: Was in town for a conference. Wanted something divey and fresh. This hit the bullseye. Amazing, I mean truly amazing, fresh shrimp and fish tacos. Outstanding. The bartender, SHY, was great in both conversation and making margs. I was so impressed I came back 2 nights in a row. Why wouldnt you! Tavaroo tacos and caboritas! Im sad to leave as I know it will be months before I can get back. I will return for sure. Great mgt as well. Kudos for doing it right!

Author: 784cindyg
Review: Best meal weve had in a long time!! Our server Derek was awesome and helpful! The tacos were to die for!! Margarita special was great!! Absolutely will make it back here when in the area!!

Author: Tom B
Review: We had a great lunch! The avocado pasta salad is amazing! Great tacos with fresh ingredients. We will definitely be back!

Author: Jessica H
Review: This place has awesome food and drinks! Our server Patrick was awesome and helped recommend the best food. I would highly recommend this restaurant and this server to anyone.

Author: spencerinthehat
Review: Order at the counter. Very reasonable prices (see menu I posted). Owners and staff are very friendly and appreciate your business. Its obvious in how the treat you, welcome you and say hello and good-bye. Separate large dining room to left of where you order. Lots of booths seating 4 and a big table to sit 6/8. They will ask if you are eating in or to go. They bring food to your table on paper plate if you are eating in. We did see one table with food served in to-go plastic containers. Perhaps, they asked for that. Hot tea is available in the dining room for no extra charge. Coke products in cans, individual bottles and 2 liter bottles can be purchased. Food is plentiful and fresh and not overcooked. We had enough to have lunch tomorrow. I had shrimp with fresh vegetables. All delicious and not over-cooked. I like my veggies a tad bit harder so next time I will ask them to cook a little less time. But all veggies I got were bright in color, fresh, solid (vs limp) and not overcooked. 5/6 good size shrimp cooked just right with great flavor. Great amount for the pint size order at $5.75. Not a fancy place-but clean. Clean large restroom too. Bus your own throwaways to the garbage can near the ordering counter. They are quick to wipe table down after you leave-so clean tables when you sit down. We will be back. I want to try their wings. The best wings I have ever had are at another local Chinese restaurant. Have to see how they compare. Didnt see egg foo yung nor moo shu pork/chicken on the menu. Give them a try. We drove across town to try this place...we were looking for a chinese hole-in-the-wall to replace the one we have frequented for years. This was a good find.

Author: Daryl S
Review: tastes like any other greasy spoon takeout chinese give me red palace anyday not impressed better than goin hungry

Author: beachboundfamily
Review: First time getting take out here and won't be my last. Yummy, huge portions, and fast. Busy place! Their lot was full and others parked at the adjacent business (and this was on a Monday night after 9:00 pm). Delicious!

Author: 778shandab
Review: Stopped here while traveling with family. All of us vegetarians. We each ordered a different vegetarian dish we all thought it was delicious and will come back again while traveling through the area.

Author: 716MattB
Review: Best Chinese food I have found in the area. I pass two other places to go to China Wok. Food is fresh and delicious. Lunch prices and portion cant be beat, about 5.50 for a main, rice and soup. I have enjoyed all that I have tried. General Tso, beef and broccoli, chicken and broccoli, steamed vegetables, wonton soup, hot and sour soup. Definitely recommend. Dinner prices about 7.25 (combination plates).

Author: K9condo
Review: The one on Hershberger has good food and the staff is very friendly. They will cook the food the way you ask for it.

Author: Steveuj
Review: Decided not to drive so ordered delivery. Prompt, plenty of food. Tasted fine nothing exotic. Would do it again.

Author: h0peeisd0pee
Review: Super reasonable and delicious! I always get takeout because the dining area is very small. The staff is amazing and always recognize my boyfriend and I. Beef and broccoli is the best!

Author: K9condo
Review: This place has great food and they are very friendly! I have been getting take out from there for years.Their food is always cooked fresh when you order it.

Author: Michelle P
Review: The food is always great and they are consistent with flavor and spice. Delivery or eat in , the staff/ driver are always nice and make sure you have all you need and are satisfied . I love this place , have been eating China Wok for over 16 years . A must try if you haven't yet :)

Author: traderjane2019
Review: Food is always good, and service is quick, and prices are reasonable! Their homemade bakery item are wonderful, and the fried green tomatoes are great!

Author: 192giallu6
Review: I arrived here without any expectation and the staff was very welcome and the food delicious! Prices very reasonable. Absolutely stop by if you are in the area.

Author: Susan W
Review: What a nice surprise! Riding by , pulled in, checked Trip Advisor; and had a fabulous lunch. Very friendly and attentive staff. Food and desserts homemade! Clean place and comfortable. Will def be back when we come to Virginia. Check out the US map with push puns from all the hometowns of the visitors that have eaten there. Wish we could have dinner. Nice wine selection .

Author: Mohlerbuys m
Review: Absolutely the very best food hands down ! So good , that we stopped from Lynchburg Va on way to Charlotte NC for dinner and returned for dinner two days later - same meal Meatloaf ! Yum . Indeed it is a fav restaurant

Author: runamook
Review: My wife got the pimiento cheese appetizer and a bowl of their tomato soup, just what she needed after a long day on the road. I ordered the Coco Loco chicken salad after reading other reviews. Glad I did, it was very good and the salad fresh and crispy.We would highly recommend. I also must comment on the friendly wait staff which really added to our appreciation of the restaurant as compared to all of the others we have put up with in our travels.Good job - keep up the good work!

Author: Kathy S
Review: We almost drove pass it. Wasn't sure what to expect. The staff was absolutely great. My husband enjoyed his and mine. We took dessert to go.

Author: Jay9875
Review: A very diverse menu plus a long list of daily specials. Everything sounded good. The waitress helped with her recommendations. The Ghost Pepper Chicken Sandwich was great. The sweet potato fries were very good and were crispy (my favorite way). The California Grilled Cheese was pretty good. The dinner rolls were ok but surprisingly not great. The cheesecake was a huge serving and very good. The peanut butter pie was very good, relatively small, and very rich. Overall a very good dinner.

Author: MomMDof3
Review: Stopped at this restaurant on recommendations from other Trip Advisor reviews for lunch. The parking lot was full at 11:30 which was a sign of good food. We ordered the Cobb salad and the new Beyond Burger (non-meat). It was so delicious and the rolls and bun were baked fresh onsite. The cream puff for dessert was well worth the extra expense but maybe not for my waistline.

Author: SouthernFoodie1
Review: We stopped for Dinner here will traveling down the interstate! It was great and we enjoyed our Dinner! Worth a stop if your looking for Dinner! The hummus platter was the best!

Author: blueheaven1989
Review: Raved by many locals as number one for lunch is great ... but Im not on the same page. I had a fine cob salad which I give a 7 out of 10. The friend green BLT was a great sandwich though. First time and maybe well try it again. Their service was the best part of dining there.

Author: kb633
Review: Tasty sandwiches-had the reuben, Turkey w/a twist, & Ham. Friendly staff & excellent service! 1 1/2 Miles off Interstate 81 exit 146.

Author: phil753
Review: I was introduced to Mike's (Dave's Good Food back then) working in Roanoke in 2012 and I have made it my mission to introduce as many people as possible to this jewel of a Deli. The first time I walked in I thought I was back in New England and it hasn't changed a bit. The servings are plentiful and affordable. My favorite is the Reuben! Mike uses the best corned beef I've tasted south of NY. But you can't go wrong, no matter your choice. I am a happily returning customer whenever I'm in Roanoke and my only complaint is that I can't go there for dinner too!

Author: Dennis M
Review: We've been to Mike's several times for a family lunch, usually from two to five of us. We always have great food and we've tried quite a few different things on the menu, all of it excellent! And Mike is a HOOT!!!! Always good for a laugh and he and the rest of the crew do everything they can to make your food and experience as good as is possible! You won't find any better customer service anywhere!

Author: Jim W
Review: Mike's Deli is about a 10 min drive from work but several times a month several co-worker's and I place to go orders from there. Mike always has the food ready and enjoys a friendly banter while you are waiting to pay. He certainly makes you feel like you are in New York City between the conversations and the food. Everything we've gotten has been fresh and very tasty. If you enjoy crunchy bacon like I do then this is your place. The subs are big enough to share or take home half for a snack later in the evening.

Author: NRBi2019
Review: I've eaten here for many years as David's Good Food as well as under the current name Mike's Deli. I've never had a bad meal her not bad service. This is about as consistent as it gets and will be apparent by their faithful customers that come dailey, weekly or monthly. I'm surprised they don't have more comments as they've been around for a long time and are always busy. I take clients here often and have not heard anything but compliments. I even have a little fun cutting up with the owner. In short, good food and good service and definitely a good choice whether you live in Roanoke or traveling through. Trip Advisor is a great tool for the traveling public but constantly busy with paying customers is the ultimate recommendation.

Author: Rhinelander88
Review: Superb sandwiches. Daily Specials. Fresh food and plenty of it. Good food prepared and served by good people.

Author: chiknlvr
Review: I don't suppose we'll ever get a real NY deli here in the mountains, so I'll settle for Mike's for the time being. Unpretentious, limited menu. Place your order at the counter, take a seat, and your order will come flying out. Had a good Italian sub, just the way I like them. We were bantering with the owner about free cookies and darned if he didn't disappear and come back with them! Now there is a guy that wants his customers to leave happy and to return. Limited hours: 9:30-2:30. Seemed to do a good takeout business.

Author: Warren B
Review: One of the chinese buffet restaurants in Roanoke. The food is good, normally hot and tasty. The service is typically great!

Author: glynr34
Review: We ate at the Red Palace for lunch buffet on a Sunday afternoon. We were seated quickly and our server was topnotch.The selection of food was admirable, but the majority of our selections were very bland. They need to work on their quality because it is a good value for the selection.

Author: joanw2902
Review: Everything we got off the buffet was delicious! They removed dirty plates from our table often. Prices very reasonable. Employees were friendly. I would recommend!

Author: RocketFloyd
Review: Good quality of food, and enough selections that anyone with any food aversions can find plenty to eat. A pleasant ambiance. Friendly wait staff. Right across the street from Hampton Inns.

Author: hannahsM3177ZD
Review: We visited this restaurant as we were staying at a hotel nearby. There was a great selection of food which was all delicious, including a pudding section. Although they dont serve alcohol there is a selection of cold drinks available. We were pleasantly surprised at how reasonable our cheque was at the end of the meal, would definitely recommend!

Author: Becky S
Review: I don't care for buffets, but it was my sons birthday. We were on the road and stopped in Roanoke for a night. His favorite food is chinese and so we tried the buffet across the street from our hotel. My kids loved it. The place was clean. Our waiter was kind. The food was good. The best part was watching my new 10 year old!

Author: joecool11
Review: This restaurant was recommended by the airport shuttle driver. The restaurant is right across the street from the Hampton Inn Airport hotel where I was staying. The food was very good and I would recommend it to anyone coming to Roanoke.

Author: Donna L
Review: This restaurant was very close to our hotel. After a long day of driving we were looking forward to a cocktail before dinner. They don't serve alcohol...bummer.They have a large selection of food items. There was no wanton soup on the buffet so the server had ours made fresh from the kitchen. Small language communication issue with server but we made it work. Very reasonably priced.

Author: gratefulal
Review: This is, by far, THE best chinese buffet in these parts. Waitstaff are attentive without hovering. Comfortable seating and tastefully decorated surroundings. Perfect for group gatherings, and also a good place for solo-dining (twice last week). I love eating here.

Author: donl355
Review: This Chinese restaurant offers a complete taste of China. All dishes to fit every taste are available hot and well prepared. The price @ about $10 for all you can eat is a real bargain. Enjoy.

Author: Steven W
Review: Hometown type of place. Not fancy but clean. Ample parking. First impression inside was so-so: but it turned out much better. The waitress was right there and did an excellent job the entire meal. I had the flounder-scallop plate. About $18. The flounder was lightly seasoned and broiled. Excellent. The scallops were also broiled (option 2). The other option was fried. Scallops are not the easiest fish item to prepare. Too over-done and they are like little balls of rubber. The chef at this place did them perfectly. Overall this is a great find in a little town. The meal was 5 star, the service was excellent and we could not have been more pleased.

Author: MAGJR
Review: Found this place on TripAdvisor while driving back from Virginia. It was near the highway, so I gave it a try. Called in my order and headed over. Fast and friendly service and the fried catfish and shrimp was excellent...even had "real" sweet tea. Give a try and you will be satisfied...

Author: robertcP5040RV
Review: Wanted some seafood and saw this place listed on the internet so I decided to check it out. Staff was friendly and place is spacious. I ordered the Jumbo Shrimp Platter which came with two sides was good. My total bill including a pink lemonade was under $20. Could definitely go back again.

Author: N3615TNkimw
Review: We stopped in Roanoke on the way towards Shenandoah. Looking for dinner at 8:00 pm, this was recommended by our hotel. Amazing food. Even though they were less than an hour from closing we did not feel rushed. Food was hot. My son had the broiled grouper which was amazing. Large portions and reasonable prices and friendly staff. Definitely would recommend!!

Author: Anthony H
Review: Great, great food and servings. When busy, they can get a little slow. Highly recommend. Take out is a quick option.

Author: Ktgalb1
Review: Wonderful place to eat. Had some great seafood . Neat aptophere as it feels like your in boat. Great food and service.

Author: At-large1
Review: Can't even begin to describe the horrible quality of food served at this restaurant. Even the sweet potato was not edible. Don't waste your money.

Author: travelover000
Review: We love good fried seafood - especially fried mini shrimp. This place had really good fried mini shrimp. I ordered the lighter portion and it was plenty for me. It came with a choice of potato (I chose fries), hush puppies and choice of slaw or salad. It was nice to have salad as an option instead of paying more for it because I don't eat slaw. I would have tried the desserts, but I was too stuffed.

Author: luvs2dive
Review: Great seafood menu. Waitress was exceptional. Traveling with a group of First Responders. Hardy appetites satisfied. Attentive service, Large potions, good for eating and carry out. Happy atmosphere allowed us to freely enjoy outselves.

Author: David N
Review: Went to Harbor Inn April 28 on the advise of the front desk clerk at the Fairfield Inn. The restaurant is close to the hotel and easy to get in and out of.Atmosphere is kind of cafeteria style but the food and the service makes up for any deficiencies in the atmosphere.Service was outstanding. No wait for anything.Food was also outstanding. I had swordfish steak which was thick and perfectly cooked. The cole slaw is fresh and outstanding.My wife had fried shrimp and really enjoyed it.Overall, a very nice surprise for a stop on the highway and I would certainly go again and recommend to anyone.

Author: SpiderEffect
Review: During a jam packed day of shopping, we decided to have a 'long' lunch and enjoy the Olive Garden. Even though we arrived after 1pm during the middle of the week - the restaurant was packed! We were offered a 'bar table' which did not bother me in the slightest bit. When you are hungry....you will sit pretty much anywhere! Our server was also responsible for bar orders, so he was pretty busy. Yet - he seemed to manage waiting on all of his area with ease. I orderd the unlimited soup, salad and breadsticks because I simple can't get enough Chicken Gnocchi!! My daughters ordered appetizers and pasta dishes. All of our food was served warm and the way we requested!! A great location for an enjoyable meal made to order the way you request!! Love Olive Garden!!

Author: bsorge
Review: Lunch today of soup and salad was good. The soup was a bit watery. Excellent service and mint deserts!

Author: shirleys334
Review: Just had Soup and Salad, but as always, it was fantastic! Love their Chicken Gnocchi Soup! Salad was fresh and Breadsticks were wonderful too. Consistently a great place to eat!

Author: Scenic44253375836
Review: Olive Garden is so great! I love their soup, and bread sticks! They have the best Italian food around!

Author: LMantero
Review: I was hungry for pasta and salad. So we decided to give Olive Garden another try. This time we were very pleased. The service by Michelle made all the difference.

Author: Mike O
Review: We were surprised at just how good this place was. We had not eaten at an Olive Garden for well over a decade and never eaten at this one. The interior was large, bright, open, clean, and attractive. When we arrived at 2PM on a Sunday we were immediately seated in a booth; the church crowd was just departing. Ryan, our server, was quite attentive and friendly. Both of our entres were excellent; just as described on the menu, large portioned, and full flavored. The Chicken Giardino was loaded with vegetables mixed with pasta in a light lemon herb sauce. The Chicken Piccata came with a lemon garlic butter sauce, sun-dried tomatoes and capers. Well done.

Author: O4480QBmariem
Review: This Olive Garden is like many I have been to throughout America.This one is a bit more exceptional beginning when you walk through their doors. Very friendly atmosphere, exceptional customer service, snd thr food tastes a better.I had the chicken and eggplant parmesan, both great!

Author: Daryl S
Review: nothing special amazed at how people flock out here for overpriced pasta past a is cheap!! and they are SO stingy with sauces and cheeses...

Author: clarkfourfan
Review: Food was nothing to write home about. Server was very apologetic and definitely trying his best to accommodate us. He asked if we wanted bottled water, then they didnt have any. Then he couldnt get them to take it off the bill. Both my sons had very dry pasta, hardly any sauce. Would not go back again. Not worth $20 a person.

Author: jelias71
Review: 20+ minute wait. A busy spot, but staff were quick and attentive. Had a nicer meal than I've had in the past at other Olive Gardens.

Author: Connector03327556173
Review: Have eaten here several times and have not been disappointed in the food or service. Very nice inside and clean. Service was fast. Has outside dining area. I can highly recommend this place to eat.

Author: aneishar2016
Review: Visited for dinner and it was surprisingly good. It's small but so clean and staff is friendly. Food didnt take a long time to be ready either. I had the tropical chicken quesadilla. It was delicious.

Author: Tom B
Review: Friendly, attentive staff. Better than average food, although the prices were a bit above average as well. I had chicken and spinach enchiladas. They were flavorful with a very nice mole' sauce.

Author: chakaquaker
Review: I came here because a friend said it was great and she was right! I will be coming back :) The good is fresh and tasty :)

Author: Hrtfixr9
Review: was a little disappointed . Food was average Mexican fare with a little bit of presentation...6.00 for queso dip? 7.00 for guacamole?...They are not any better than Alejandro's..and Alejandro's is waaay cheaper. I will be saving my money next time....

Author: Cliff O
Review: We took a chance onthis little place and the Food was GREAT. Fresh Hot and Fast out to us. The staff, Bartender was Super nice. Not much parking so they even had a guy outside helping fit my car in a small spot. Don't miss this place if your in the area!!!!!

Author: Mitch L
Review: I've lived in Texas. I've lived in California. I lived in NYC. I've been to Mexico more than 5 times!! I love good food and good MEXICAN food! Until now, I've never found it in the Roanoke area. While not purely "authentic", Los Amigos has the best variety and freshest ingredients I've ever experienced in this region. They have a great selection of Mexican beer (including Victoria) and make a great margarita.Steer clear of the usual slop you find at virtually any Mexican restaurant in America, and try this place. I think youll agree its a notch above all others.

Author: Trickyfae
Review: This new restaurant is just what Brambleton needed. This restaurant is definitely beyond the quality of most of the chain Hispanic restaurants in the area. Even the starting salsa has double the flavor of others. It tastes fresh, cool, and with the perfect amount of cilantro to add a wonderful flavor we didn't want to stop tasting. The entrees were great in size the enchiladas were packed with chicken and the verda enchilada sauce was the perfect amount of spice. I could tast the roasted jalapenos and my guess is poblanos and serrano peppers. The dessert had me in love! The xango were perfectly fried and the filling was so sweet and creamy. I definitely can not wait to return.

Author: CLEVELANDS2
Review: Inside you find many booths, so if you want a private atmosphere, this is for you. The shrimp fajitas were outstanding, loaded with big shrimp. And the shrimp tacos were quite tasty as well as the beans and rice that came with them. House margarita was good.

Author: ejm99
Review: Went last Thursday for dinner. Parking lot was full. Followed signs for added parking just past the Shell Gas Station. A short walk. We were seated promptly in a booth. Jaqueline was our server. Chips and salsa delivered. Ordered an organic margarita and a Modelo cerveza. Ordered the shrimp fajitas. The shrimp was nice sized and cooked perfectly. Tortillas, salsa, sour cream, refried beans and rice accompanied the fajitas. This was the best Mexican meal weve ever had in our 28 years living in Roanoke! Jacquelines service was friendly and professional. The decor of this newly opened restaurant was very nice. We sat in the front dining area and saw about seven tables and booths. There may be more around the side. They do no take reservations. We were seated immediately even though the parking lot around the building was full ( 15 or so cars ). There were a number of folks seated at the bar.I highly recommend Los Amigos Bar & Grill. Excellent food, service and atmosphere.

Author: Pablo_Diablo_55
Review: We were staying the night in Roanoke and decided on Chinese food. I got the beef with mushrooms and it was quite tasty. I got the white rice, and it was fine, but the rest of my family got the fried rice which was subpar and the low point of the meal. My daughters got the chow mein fun and the sweet and sour chicken respectively and they were both pleased. My son got the Hunan chicken and he thought it was okay but it wasnt very flavorful. My wife had the Garlic chicken and she thought it was just average. They did not like the egg rolls either saying they were oily and tasteless. Our server was nice.

Author: Z168CLtomm
Review: China Taste is a unique restaurant. Small but the food is always fresh and tasty. The hibachi dishes are always a good bet here!

Author: AlissaSlowanoke
Review: We've been ordering take out from China Taste for years. Everything is fresh, delicious, and the portions are huge for the price! You must give this place a try, you will not be disappointed.

Author: PamelaDeP
Review: We arrived around 9 PM after traveling many hours in the car. This place is a takeout establishment with several tables for eating in. It was clean and the owner was pleasant We ordered pineapple chicken fried rice, egg rolls, chicken wings and steamed dumplings. Everything seemed fresh and not at all greasy. I would rate it above average for takeout fare.

Author: spencerinthehat
Review: Had my doubts due to location but outstanding reviews made me try this place. Outside of NYC this is the best I have ever had. And I myself was a gourmet Chinese cook in my younger years. I was taught by Chinese chefs. We ordered at counter to dine in. Served on real dinnerware with real silverware. Very clean restaurant and not a lot of "stuff" all over. Clean booths and tables. Lots of ppl with orders to go and several dine-ins. Extremely generous portions. Presentation of food is important to the owners. I ordered shrimp egg foo young. They were gigantic....3 of them. And crispy on the outside! Plenty of fried rice served in a soup bowl. I liked that they served the sauce in a separate bowl so I could control the amount and not have the dish overwhelmed with soy-tasting sauce. Nice size shrimp, not those rinky-dink ones. My friend had chicken chow mein. Generous amounts of white chicken; not overloaded with cabbage like most places. And not swimming in white sauce....just enough. Huge bowl of white rice. Also had bowl of egg drop soup served with bowl of sectioned deep-fried wonton wrappers. All of this for less than $16, including tax. Definitely this will be our Chinese (they have some Thai) restaurant going forward. Worth the 1/2 hr drive. At first blush it might seem their prices are a tad higher than other places but the amount of food, its freshness and the quality of their ingredients and preparation verses the others, makes it actually a better value.

Author: Thomas S
Review: Service at China Taste is superb. The food is presented well and always tasty. I highly recommend the General Tso's Chicken.

Author: Medleyz
Review: My family have been ordering from here since they opened. They are fast ,friendly and the food is always great.

Author: Mrsbowman25
Review: They have the best Chinese food hands down! The honey chicken is amazing! Prices are cheap too! We also love the fried potatoes with onions and peppers.

Author: DorieH11
Review: We have tried every Chinese restaurant in and around Roanoke and by far, China Taste is the best. Food is always fresh and hot when delivered to the table. The portion is large and for the 2 of us, our dinner is always under $20.00 and that includes the tip. It's run by a husband and wife who truly want to please. They do have take-our or eat in. It's a hidden gem waiting for more people to discover it. Great for singles, families or large groups. If you like Chinese, you'll love China Taste.

Author: Jessica R
Review: We order take out all the time from here and it has always been good. They even will swap out rice for extra vegetables when we order Hibachi shrimp and scallops. The steamed dumplings are delicious as well as the spring rolls. Everyone here is very friendly and our order is always right and on time.

Author: hbhakh
Review: We recently had dinner at 419. It was busy but we were seated quickly with reservations. The menu has a variety of items including soup/salad, pizza, sandwiches, and entrees. All of our food was good. Service was a little slow.....this may have been due to several large groups. Prices are reasonable.We'll go back.

Author: T9136ZEtonyp
Review: 419 West has a nice decor and atmosphere. Had the pimento cheese burger which was very tasty. $5 Martini happy hour offered some nice flavors. Service from Matthew was exceptional. Friendly and helpful, we had a great experience! Nice selection of apps, burgers, salads and sandwiches. Higher priced steak and seafood items are available. Really enjoyed our visit!

Author: aneishar2016
Review: Visited for dinner and I enjoyed the service. Waitress was kind enough to switch my crab bisque because I didnt like the texture. I got the spring rolls instead and it was delicious.

Author: debber44
Review: I live out of town and went to 419 with some friends. It was very busy but the service was very good. Excellent waitress! I had the salmon salad which was delicious and the dress I got on the side. It was plentiful and the blue cheese was exceptional!!

Author: Al F
Review: Thank you Marissa for a pleasant experience on the service side but expectations were let down. Shrimp Cocktail below average, bacon wrapped scallops were good. My girlfriend had the Kale Salad and she couldnt eat but a small amount. I had Sauteed Kale with my cedar plank salmon and seasoned Quinoa. I could not chew my Kale and the Quinoa was not bad but very little seasoning. Some would probably like it. Salmon, I should have had them cook it for me a little more. Outsides were to my preference, medium rare but the closer to the middle, it became rare. But, it wasn not too bad. Unfortunately the bathrooms male and female were not pleasant. Not exactly what you want after a dining experience, whether good or bad. I think they had a bad day. Normally I hear good things about this place. Two other times I dined, it was good. Give it a try. I think they will be better. I changed my rating to average because I am sure it was just a bad night for them.

Author: bugmuffin2016
