Review: We had my mother's 80th birthday in a private room. The wait staff was fantastic. Very professional and accommodating. The party was perfect and the food was excellent. We couldn't have asked for a better experience.

Author: Joe58156
Review: Weve been here several times and have had several things on the menu. However, we never tried the pizza until yesterday. It was delicious! Nice crust, a sweet sauce, and a whole host of toppings available. There was also a nice touch of seasoning in it which some of the chain pizza joints dont provide; their pizzas are bland by comparison.Next time we need to go out for pizza, we will probably go to 419 West. What a surprise!

Author: Gohoosao
Review: You advertise for a seafood event and your main dish was sold out before 6. Lump crab meat appetizer served with saltines. LOL Settled for the seafood etouffee and see what you get for $17. Plus server didnt provide a spoon. To boot service was horrible. Now I remember why I have not been back for years. $50 meal should not be this bad.

Author: Jerry O
Review: We have not been here for a couple years and was really happy with our choice for dinner. The meal was hot and tasted so good, but just the right amount to savory and enjoy. I always look for grouper.

Author: missjoanne813
Review: We chose this place for convenience and were so pleasantly surprised! Top notch, friendly wait staff, great cocktails and amazing food at reasonable prices, prepared to perfection. The perfect end to a long day on the road.

Author: tombigbee82
Review: We went early for dinner. Service was very good, food was as well. Little slow for the number of customers, but for preparation like this, worth the wait. Everything fresh, restaurant nice, clean, and enjoyably quiet for conversation. Nice experience.

Author: GKermit
Review: While in the process of waiting for a table a manager shouted at a hostess for not seating someone in a very crowded section, I'll never eat there again if that's how they treat their employees

Author: Q3194XBrebeccap
Review: Have not visited Red Lobster in a very long time. Was pleasantly surprised with a new (to us) menu. So, it took awhile to make our selection oh the Sailors Platter. It was served hot and in a reasonable time. The biscuits, of course, were brought out immediately with the drinks. The best part was one of the sides which was a buttered ear of corn - very good. In fact, I was so hungry I forgot to take a picture of the platter!!! Worth another visit soon.

Author: joe0277
Review: We probably havent been to Red Lobster is over a year and decided to go for our daughters 19th birthday. Everything was average as it usually is and the check was considerably higher than it used to be. I found it interesting they were out of Salmon for the wood fires grill meal but they substituted it for steak. For 3 adults and no alcohol the check came to $105 with a 20% tip.

Author: mullxbarh
Review: No different from any other Red Lobster I have eaten in. Good steak and coconut shrimp, fabulous biscuits and $4 wine and beer during happy hour.Easy access from highway, good parking.Staff were corporate friendly people but just a tiny bit obsequious.

Author: SinLoi
Review: Red Lobster is nicknamed "Dead Lobster" for a reason. At very best, the food is only fair. Everything has been frozen at some time or another and has that been-frozen taste, IMO. Maybe not that poor dying lobster drowning in his own excrement in the tank out front. Though alive, he is dying a slow death. They are boosting prices as their quality goes down. They are increasing their dishes with shrimp in them but who knows where it is farmed and raised? Thailand? I'm not eating it. The staff is great, I wonder if they are ashamed of the dishes they place before customers? They ought to be. I have travelled very widely and know what good seafood is. It is much better to educate yourself on how to prepare it yourself and do it yourself at home. Good luck finding truly fresh seafood in Roanoke Virginia. It is not at Red Lobster.

Author: Cassie427
Review: My husband and I went to Red Lobster for an early Valentine's Day lunch. We both had the Seaborn Lobster and Shrimp. It included lobster tail, shrimp scampi and grilled shrimp with wild rice. Salad, cheddar biscuits and one side also included. It was excellent, the service was good and we thoroughly enjoyed the meal. It was pricey- $24.99 per person, but well worth it for a special occasion.

Author: Vicki T
Review: A celebration was the reason for the visit. The food and service were good but kitchen was slow. Not sure if they were busier than they looked. It was a special of all you can eat shrimp. Even though they were slow the good was hot and fresh! Definitely recommend.

Author: jhais28374
Review: Wife and I make a stop at Red Lobster about twice a month. Wife enjoys the lunch special and I like the combine any two. For was great, service was good.

Author: virginiatopgun
Review: Very friendly server, clean place. Food was really good. Wine selection was not hitting on much. Been a while since we had been. We were happy, you should give it a try.

Author: joe0277
Review: Stopped here for lunch with my buddy while we were working in the area. Service was great, not super busy, and the food was awesome. I had the Canine Club with the house made chips. Everything was fresh, presented nicely, and tasted great. And as weird as it may sound, they also have great unsweetened tea. Id like to go back and see how the evening dining is. They have a modest bar with all the house standards. As we were there the waitress was stocking the beer coolers and it appeared they have a pretty good selection of that.

Author: jcoman321
Review: During our last visit my wife and I agreed that we don't come here often enough. The times we have been here the food and service has always been great. My only complaint about the place it that the seating & seating arrangement is not the most comfortable. The food makes up for it. Don't be surprised it you order something traditional and what you get is Top Dawg's spin on it. The best example of this is their Cuban Sandwich. It resembles nothing like cuban pressed sandwich - and it is killer good all the same. I'm not a big burger eater but my wife is. She is always happy with what she gets. She has celiac disease. They don't serve gluten-free bread options so she orders her burgers without a bun. She's never had a episode from cross contamination but I am sure they wouldn't promote that they have a gluten safe kitchen. They have a good selection of beer - domestic, import and local. The mixed drinks are never watered down, but don't expect to order anything fancy. We keep it simple - Rum & Coke or Gin & Tonic are safe bets.

Author: Gayleetro
Review: After a softball tournament, we joined the grandkids and their parents at Top Dawgs.I pass this place every week and this was my first visit. I was impressed by the menu and was glad that it wasn't just hot dawgs. The appetizers were a hit - homemade chips and wings. Hubby and I split a stuffed quesadilla and it was really good. The buffalo chicken wrap was a hit with the daughters. The grandkids had mac n' cheese, quesadillas and chicken fingers.Now that we've tried Top Dawgs, we are going to check out some of thier daily specials.This was a nice surprize and look forward to going back.

Author: charity554
Review: They have a different special every day. We went on Taco Tuesday. I had the taco salad. It was excellent!

Author: Sheri24012
Review: This is a great little place for food and drinks. Burgers are awesome and honestly everything Ive ever had there as been delicious! They have some nightly specials like Taco Tuesday and Wine Down Wednesday(1/2 price wine) during the week which makes it a good deal. Friendly staff and generally good service. Check them out!

Author: Michael G
Review: Pub atmosphere. Lots of Televisions and music playing. A good variety of beer on tap as well as good wings and sandwiches.

Author: JohnandJaneS
Review: The first thing we told the waitress was that we were in a hurry and she was great. She was also very friendly and pleasant. Great selection of micro brew beer. Food was OK, nothing special. We were there on Monday when micro brew beer and wings were half price. Cost for 5 of us was only $60.......and only one of us ordered wings (which were very good).

Author: Brad T
Review: I eat here every other week. Great appetizers and I usually get something different for dinner each time. I don't usually like sirloin, but like it there. Prices are very reasonably and the service has always been great.

Author: bettermission0
Review: The food is okay but the owner was rude and acted like my to go order was an inconvenience. Also, they charge for every little thing you ask for with your food. I don't see how small businesses stay open when you have an attitude with your patrons.

Author: rachiekatt
Review: Occasionally i will order to-go orders as it is convenient to my work. Service is ALWAYS super rude and you never know if your order will be correct and tastes alright. They charge 59 cents for a small container of ranch. When the owners have to look up which sides come with their orders you know its bad. I am a huge supporter of all local businesses as i grew up in the restaurant industry. This place honestly needs a reality check if you can't even say "Thank You" as your paying customers leave you establishment.

Author: Kevprichard
Review: I stopped here after work looking for good food. I had a hamburger and order of onion rings and a bowl of soup. My soup was good as was my hamburger, but my onion rings we're out of a box I thought.

Author: Bridgenutt
Review: We split one of their omelets - they are large. Just great, down-home cooking. mouthwatering bacon. Good coffee - and nice staff.

Author: itsit94
Review: Went for breakfast and everything was great. Our waitress was great, food was excellent and the atmosphere both inside and out were on very enjoyable. Will be back!

Author: Janice M
Review: Anthony's is warm, welcoming, friendly, the servers are great and the food always good.A great place to eat with affordable prices.

Author: bandittef
Review: Always enjoy when I'm able to eat here. Friendly staff. Good food. Reasonable prices and plenty of parking. This is my favorite Famous Anthony's.

Author: Savyluncher
Review: Good basic food. Served fast, cooked well, good price, specials.Good parking and friendly staff. Give it a try..

Author: V1273QTcarolyns
Review: I got the Surf and Turf. The steak was very bland and had the texture of liver. It was covered with slightly grilled onions and canned mushrooms. The shrimp were interesting  flat circles with a tail on a beth of withered brown-tinged lettuce. On a good note, the staff was very friendly and the baked potato was good. I may have just picked the wrong item on the menu. Wish I had taken a picture.

Author: Passenger56927493107
Review: I eat here quite often, especially breakfast with friends. I notice that quite a large number of customers are older and lots are handicapped. I watch as they slowly attempt to get up the sidewalk to the entrance. Many have walkers, lots are using canes etc. The building set-up would be easy to move the entrance to the back or North upper back side. Seeing all these people coming to eat with difficulty causes me to know if moving the entrance could be done, there would be more customers happy to be there. The owners need to sit at the front windows and watch several mornings to verify what I am saying. Our older neighbors love to come there when they can and enjoy the pleasant staff that works here. Just a thought that might strike and chord of compassion in some owner's heart.

Author: Becky Y
Review: My husband and I love Famous Anthony's for breakfast, lunch, & dinner. The foods is excellent & the staff friendly & helpful. They have all kinds of specials & the price can't be beat!

Author: Kneehi17
Review: This is a great family place. They serve large portions at good prices. The waffle fries and fried green beans were awesome, but the chicken tenders are 'formed chicken' like nuggets. The honey bacon dressing was delicious!We were passing through coming back to NC, so I don't know how to find the sanitation scores in VA. This place could (in my opinion) be cleaner, but I wasn't skeeved out. Overall, I really enjoyed it and I would go back. Oh! And our server was really sweet.

Author: nwnh40
Review: I did a take out order a gyro, it was good and and large since I just walked in, prepared very fast, it wasn't very busy and it was lunch time. I would return.

Author: BRTC
Review: Had a small family B'day party here yesterday evening. Our daughter had eaten here about 2 weeks ago and said how much she loved it so we thought we would give it a try as well. She was spot on with the recommendation. From the moment we walked through the front door until we left 2 1/2 hours later, nothing but attentive service and excellent food. Had appetizers, main meal, desserts, wine, sparkling waters, etc... Everyone loved the food and nothing was left behind. Wine recommendation was perfect. This place is about as authentic as it could get. Would be nice to have the Parthenon in the background, but oh well! The owner, Irene, made several trips to our table to check on us, bring us items we asked for, brought us homemade bread fresh out of the oven, brought the B'day cake with candles herself (it was a Red Velvet cake she had just made earlier in the day). I personally had the Red Snapper and it was delicious. We will return for more fabulous meals.

Author: marshmallow33
Review: Im giving this restaurant a five star rating for two reasons: the food and the service, both of which were excellent. I dont care thats its near a gas station or that the furnishings look like theyve been there since the day they opened. The Tzatziki sauce was the creamiest, most delicious one Ive ever eaten and I loved the moussakka. My husband raved about his baked ziti and meatballs. The hostess and our waiter were both very friendly and attentive throughout our visit and the owner stopped at our table for a quick chat. We were just passing through the area but I am always happy to share a great find with fellow travelers.

Author: Jamie C
Review: We live nearby (like 300 yards) and the only thing we do not like about this place is that it took us so many years to finally give it a try.Now we are addicted! At least once a week we order from here, even if its just a pizza. The food is outstanding, and the service (especially the owners) is incredible.From the Eggplant stack, to the amazing Spiin dip, to the salad dressing, to the pizza, to the Moussaka... you cant go wrong with anything here.Do yourself a favor and find the best restaurant in Roanoke!

Author: MG233
Review: We had an amazing stroke of luck and found this hidden little gem tucked away in a gas station shopping center near Hollins University. The food was fantastic! The spanakopita was the BEST we have had outside of Greece. The owner was truly fun to talk to. There was an original dessert called an Aphrodite cake. It was INCREDIBLE. A layer of homemade whipped cream over a custard layer over shredded phyllo dough interlaced with delicious almonds, honey, and cinnamon. That itself was well worth the trip.My family loves it so much we have agreed to make it a regular stop on our way back and forth through Virginia.Do yourself a favor and do not miss this place. Service and food were well above par. Wish I could give them an extra star!

Author: Henryinva
Review: My wife and I fell into this place. THE BEST CALZONE IN ROANOKE AREA. My wife and I eat there pretty much every Wednesday. Same server most the time who waits us very timely. I lived outside Pittsburgh and because of the diversity of Pittsburgh residents, there were a huge palette of restaurant choices of all ethnicities type food. This is the best in Roanoke for a mix of Italian ( calzones in my opine) baked ziti ( the wife's opine) . The finisher is real deal baklava. Rate it a ten folks.

Author: Carol4802
Review: Located at the end of a tiny strip mall dominated by a gas station, who would expect to find a gem of a restaurant? Tastefully decorated, with ample seating inside as well as on the veranda, this restaurant serves delicious food. From a tasty mushroom appetizer to excellent desserts, the three of us enjoyed a variety of dishes in between. Everything was yummy. The servers were helpful, the owners checked on us - the entire dining experience was fantastic. And best of all, the menu offerings provide an opportunity to try items not seen everywhere else.

Author: Piotr L
Review: We were travelling through this city and found this place for dinner. The food is superb. You have to try the spinach artichoke dip. We had the gyro dinner as well and it was excellent. Staff is friendly and polite.

Author: Kevprichard
Review: Stopped here after work looking for a good meal. This place did not disappoint as my service was good and my drink didn't go dry oh, and my food was very good. I had a pizza that was just to my liking. I'll come back and try the pasta next time.

Author: Paul L
Review: By far the best stromboli--Veranda stromboli with ham, selami, and Italian suasage--I have ever had. Very Authentic! Service was great and the setting is beautiful, if you sit out on side porch!

Author: 465PaulW465
Review: This place just has corporate America written all over it. A menu that is straight out of TGIF, over done, stuff your face kinda place. Beers way over priced as is the food. Pretty sure it is Cisco level 4 bbq ready made food. Heated up and put on a plate. Give me a genuine bbq joint any day. Bbq version of Olive Garden

Author: smromero
Review: We were in town visiting my daughter in college. We stopped for supper at it was really good. Basically a traditional bbq place. Friendly waiters and service was quick. We had the ribs and brisket. I preferred the ribs. Both were good though

Author: jamesap2016
Review: enjoyed my dinner , did a combo of pulled pork and smoked wings ( both very good ). Sides of baked beans and roasted corn were also good Looks can be deceiving, worth a try

Author: Worldtravelpartulr
Review: While spending the night in Roanoke, we tried this restaurant based upon TripAdvisor reviews. We were not disappointed. As expected, on Saturday night we had to wait 15 minutes before we seated, but the wait was within the time promised. Our server, Samantha, made us feel extremely welcome, and wanted to make sure that our experience was good. One of us had a full rack of St. Louis style ribs and the other had barbecued chicken. Both were excellently prepared, and the ribs were dry rubbed with minimal sauce as requested. The sweet potato fries (up charge for them) were also very good. We also tried a maple flavored old-fashioned cocktail, which was excellent, although it had more ice than liquid. For the price we paid, the food and the service were well worth it.

Author: Gayleetro
Review: We stopped in Smokey Bones after some shopping. We had not been to Smokey Bones in years so we were curious about the menu.It took a while for a server to greet us but once she did, she was a great server and very attentive. I had the baked potato smothered with brisket and cheese. Very very good. I had s side salad with it and it was fresh and had a good variety of salad fixings.Good choice for lunch!!!We wont wait so long to go back!

Author: Terri K
Review: Great service from our bartender,Asia. Service was excellent, food was good, beer was cold, always a good time.

Author: Kristybelcher
Review: My after work spot ! Asia is always attentive and friendly ! Highly recommended and friendly staff and quick service!!

Author: Shannon B
Review: We love Asia! Best. Bartender. Ever. We come to smokey bone at least a few times a month and she is always the most attentive and friendly bartender!

Author: pafalco1
Review: This was a random pick for lunch while we were visiting Virginia. We both wanted something delicious and healthy. I had the grilled salmon my husband had a chicken dish, both were served hot and they were delicious. We had outstanding service from Kayla and was very pleased when Tony, the manager, came over to our table to get feedback on the food and our experience. All around great food and service. I recommend people stop in if they're in Roanoke, Virginia!

Author: rcsobull
Review: Sat down at bar at 6:30. Ignored for 15 min. Asked bar tender for a drink. She apologized for the wait. At 7:00 I finally got my drink and ordered an appetizer. 7:30 she brought ranch for wings and we ordered dinner. 7:45 wings came. 7:50 dinner came with no utensils. Food was good, service was slow and horrible. Check came wrong. They added a extra drink. If employees were trained better it would be a great place.

Author: G5691GMgloriap
Review: My Sunday School class ate their with 16 people, some from the menu others from their Sunday Brunch. We ate their Sunday with 2 people in the party. Service was great with both numbers. Food is very satisfying with a large portion of everything. Very nice location, great place for relaxation.

Author: PennyM1472
Review: We've been to The Green Goat several times each visit to Roanoke. The food is good and our vegan family members can find something to eat also. The eggplant fries and the sweet potato tots are great. We haven't made it to the Sunday brunch but hope to make it before our trip is over.

Author: Bridgenutt
Review: I really was expecting better food. Just wasn't tasty. The renovated train station is wonderful. Our server was good.

Author: GreenEyedLady518
Review: Visited the Green Goat for the first time recently with two friends for a "girls lunch." We were there fairly early (11:30) and being a weekday, it was not crowded. Our server was very good and didn't mind the fact that we were taking quite awhile to order in-between talking & catching up. I had the Cobb Salad which was very good and a huge portion. One of my tablemates had the fish tacos and the other had the Southwestern salad. They both enjoyed their selections, and their portions were also plentiful. Again, our server (wish I could remember her name!) was attentive and pleasant. I enjoyed my visit very much and will return.

Author: Sean K
Review: good place using all organic stuff. great taste, and location near the old train track. I would go back again

Author: cmxp2012
Review: Everything we ordered was overcooked/burnt and extremely bland and salty. Service was good food was much lower quality than hoped for.

Author: rareathlete
Review: I always really want to love the Green Goat but just never do. This was our third visit since they opened a few years ago. We opted to go for brunch and found it be an okay experience.The good: Brunch offers a waffle and omelet station. The waffles were quite good with a variety of toppings including nuts, fruits, whipped cream and syrup. The mimosas were also quite tasty. Brunch is reasonably priced at $12.95 and is a buffet.The less than good: Service is slow. Theres only one person serving drinks for half the restaurant. We had no clue how much brunch was going to cost as there was nothing posted and nothing on the table indicating the price. I wouldnt shy away from brunch at the Green Goat. There arent many brunch offerings in Roanoke. However, I wont go to work on Monday and encourage everyone to go there either.

Author: WestieMommy08
Review: Someone recommended the Green Goat for lunch after a visit to Black Dog Salvage. Great recommendation! Delicious lunch - we got the Korean tacos and the Baja fish tacos which were awesome. Also, the Bold Rock Cider ale was excellent. Our server, Shannon, did a great job and the service was excellent. Nice atmosphere as well - would definitely recommend the Green Goat!

Author: Burt B
Review: Food is good..craft beers are cold and an awesome outdoor area complete with bonfires. We would ride our bikes along the greenway and stop here to have a beer and snack. Moved from Roanoke and this place is truly missed.

Author: sallyIQ
Review: Highly recommend trying this local restaurant. Very nice atmosphere. Its clean and features some cool art inside. Windows look out on the Roanoke Greenway, beautiful and relaxing. Jacob provided great service, very nice and attentive to our table. Really good salads and sweet tea!

Author: psudino
Review: After a business meeting our host brought us here before we all headed to the airport for a quick bite. I don't think any of us spent more than $15, and some of us spending less than $10, for an exceptional meal. I got the chimichanga and refried beans; the food was incredibly tasty. Everyone else got a variety of items and all were great. As a bonus, there is a salsa bar with 10+ salsas to choose from!

Author: Stephanie P
Review: First time in the area, we were craving mexican. Absolutely love their food, big serving, super tasty.Would eat again!!

Author: MikeCarle
Review: In addition to the typical chips and salsa they have a complimentary salsa bar with 12 different types of salsas to choose from and take back to your table. The kids menu has typical American food staples to keep picky kids content and the salsa bar has mild salsa for the kids. We left super full and the bill wasn't bad at all for what we got.

Author: difaJP
Review: Very good Mexican food, delivered by friendly, efficient and knowledgable staff. The food was exceptionally tasty, plentiful and very reasonably priced. Would definitely recommend this restaurant.

Author: O4480QBmariem
Review: Great restruant with healthier options for a mexican restruant.The salsas are fresh and you can tell the food is fresh.We will return.

Author: jlmn0221
Review: Gotta say that this little gem made me sad that we don't live in Roanoke! The help yourself salsa bar was awesome for individual tastes at our table. The nachos were massive and perfectly covered with toppings. The chile poblanos were great with corn salsa and ground beef; it was just stuffed enough to not feel like you ate a brick. The flautas were excellent, particularly the chicken. Rice and beans were cooked well and very tasty when you drizzle the creamy salsa from the bar. Place is small but service was fast and friendly. Did not order any alcohol but almost every other table had margaritas so they must be good!

Author: Distance09
Review: I tried this restaurant for lunch and they were doing a great business. I ordered a chicken and two ground beef enchiladas and refried beans. Other than the salsas the food just was not memorable. Maybe it was me. They must be doing something right or the crowds would not be there. I will try again.

Author: John E. M
Review: We went here for dinner before a show at the Jefferson Center. We had to search for public parking because there are a lot of restaurants in downtown Roanoke. We arrived and were seated promptly. When the server came to take our drink order, we ordered our food as well. We usually get Enchiladas Supremas wherever we go because it is quick and a good value. We visited the salsa bar. and in less than 5 minutes, our orders were ready. Wow! We usually go through a basket of chips. Our food was not as hot as we expected. Usually I can't touch the plates. Fillings were just bland. I know every restaurant is different. But this "go to" dish is usually pretty consistent. I guess everyone goes because they love the salsa bar, which was a neat idea, but not the main reason to visit. Also, prices are a bit higher than I'm used to, but maybe it's just the area.

Author: Annedorte
Review: With all the awards the restaurant has received we were expecting more. The food was okay but nothing special. The atmosphere was good and service good and friendly

Author: traviz
Review: Food was very good and the portions large. I loved the chips and salsa bar. They had many different kinds of salsa on their bar that you could get to go with your chips. I loved trying all the different kinds. Beware of the hot chimichurri salasa as it will burn a hole in your tongue LOL. The service was good. I got a Bahama Mama to drink. It was good but very strong with the Rum. Both my girlfriend and I had to get to-go boxes because there was so much food we could not eat it all. If you are on a budget look into sharing a plate. If I'm ever back in Roanoke I would certainly go here again.

Author: paralegal4444
Review: The place is older and run down but isn't that usually where the food is?? This was where I had my first pho experience and I loved it. Keeps me coming back. My kids and husband don't care for it so I come alone. Friendly staff and fast service. They are never busy but IDK why...

Author: shereethomas1
Review: The server was friendly and polite. The food arrived fast and was delicious. Well definitely be back!

Author: Quigg L
Review: My wife and I have eaten here three different times. You have to pass seven Vietnamese restaurants to get this far down 460 E. but it is well worth your drive. In my view this is the best Vietnamese or Pho restaurant in southwest Virginia.Let me get right to the point. The restaurant is cleaner and the ingredients are super fresh. Fresher than any restaurant we have eaten at lately. You can pretty much custom design your meal specially the Pho. Tell them what you want.The waitstaff was very attentive. Suggest the spring rolls, Pho and fried rice.

Author: Murf434
Review: Pho very good . First time there and will return. You have to look for the location between a nail shop and goodwill

Author: paralegal4444
Review: I love coming here once in a while. Prices are a bit higher but you get flavorable food and very nice customer service.

Author: 2Yummy4U
Review: The venue is relaxed and very clean, including the bathrooms. The service was friendly and efficient. Nothing was over salted!! The flavor was terrific and the ingredients very fresh. I had the Spring Rolls and the Curried Chicken Pho. Both were excellent and the portions large. The small bowl of Pho is more than enough for one person.I'll be back.

Author: traysea77
Review: Our family dined in while traveling through the area. We enjoyed vegetarian spring rolls with peanut sauce as an appetizer. We also ate tofu noodles dishes which were very good as well. They also have a large selection of bubble tea flavors. We had coconut and mango. Yum! The portion sizes were very generous. We had to take some to go.The establishment is clean and the staff very polite. I recommend and would go again.

Author: bjanavice
Review: The food here is pretty good. We ordered the Spring rolls, which were very good, and the crispy fried rolls, also good. The Pork Vermicelli, was good. Plenty of food, and the service was excellent. We will definitely be going back.

Author: laurenc714
Review: The Owner was extremely nice. The Pho was good, but just in an 'it was ok' way. I'd go back, but won't be rushing there any time soon. I did really enjoy the spring rolls (very fresh/crisp shrimp). If you happen to be passing by, definitely give the place a try.

Author: C7189EVjennifers
Review: We LOVE This place! The pho is so delicious. The atmosphere is nothing fancy at all. But the food definitely makes up for it. The price is good. The kids even love it. Highly recommended!

Author: pafalco1
Review: My husband and I went for dinner because The Quarter was rated well. We were very disappointed after believing all day this would be our best dinner on our vacation. The Creole Shrimp Dip was outstanding. The Caesar salad tasted like lemon and anchovies on wilted romaine. The blackened chicken pasta was okay, but lacked onions and peppers. The Cajun Fried Chicken was horrible. There was literally nothing Cajun about the chicken. It was just an overcooked fried, boneless breast. The collards were lacking and the mashed potatoes and gravy had no taste.

Author: Kathy M
Review: We enjoyed a nice meal here. Cajun style but not very spicy at all. Service was excellent and everyone working there was upbeat and friendly. Clearly a spot the locals enjoy. The food was good (except the coleslaw....that needed some help). We hit the happy hour shrimp special which was delicious.

Author: Charles H
Review: Stopped by with my wife for dinner before a concert on a Thursday evening. I enjoyed shrimp and grits and my wife the Nola combo.We also had oysters.There is a decent selection of regional/local beers and I picked a winner,Boulevard Tank 7,an ale,my wife had a hurricane....enjoyed dinner,friendly knowledgeable staff and made the concert on time....

Author: mwkonig
Review: We came with a family of for z very early lunch on a Friday evening. Nice outside seating, friendly waiters, good beverage selection, interesting menu. Our kids liked the blackened gator bites in particular. All other dishes were quite good as well, only we couldn't find the "cajun element" in the otherwise good fish and chips. Only negative was that service was almost too efficient and fast so it made for a somewhat rushed dinner with main courses coming out as the appetizers are barely finished. Otherwise very pleasant experience.

Author: michele m
Review: Hubs and I visited during a 'weekend getaway' The food was good. The staff we nice. If you ask me if I will remember what I had to eat in a year - probably not. BUT at the moment the place was clean, the folks were kind and the food good.

Author: AppleStud
Review: Zach as a server was awesome with our numerous requests. Music wasn't too loud. Very good food...my fried fish was bit off--too much spine remnant but fresh oysters in May were great and super tasty fried goat cheese salad. Father in law loved the blackened salmon special

Author: Kholder3
Review: We stopped in here based on some locals suggestions and got the ribeye and the pork chops. They were both good but the surprise was the pork chops. They were Devine and melt in your mouth. Our waiter was funny and made for a great weekend.

Author: Roanoketraveler888
Review: This is one of our favorite places to eat downtown and the service this time was fantastic. I had the oyster poor boy and it was authentic and delicious. I love their stake fries as well. Its a little pricey, compared to LA, but its worth the treat.

Author: Sarnremtp
Review: For almost the last year we have been coming to the quarter because its the only Cajun restaurant in the area that had a REALLY decent etouffe. Its still list on the trip advisor menu, but they have removed it from the menu. When I asked they said they didnt have the ingredients to make it anymore. Sad thing is the things it takes to make it are staple ingredients included in many of their other dishes. Theyve lost a customer who used to come several times a month and ordered through one of the delivery services.

Author: Shawn P
Review: Second trip to the Quarter, several years later, was an outstanding experience. The food was just right - salmon, fried crawfish, shrimp and grits, and shrimp & andouille pasta. Dinner was finished off by excellent by Beignets with Caramel Sauce and Powder Sugar!

Author: Warren B
Review: Again, my wife and I give our order, two sandwiches and large soup. A large group of 12 comes in and the cook comes back after ten minutes. Sorry, I have no bread to make sandwiches. This same thing happened once before. News flash...tell me at the time of order so I dont waste time. You wont have to worry about me anymore but I say customer beware. They want your money unless more money comes in the door.

Author: walkntall509
Review: The food and service was great! The server asked if we had any questions about the food which I loved. The portion size is more than enough. The egg rolls were amazing! We will definitely be back to try the Pho after reading the reviews and seeing the Pho come out of the kitchen it looked DELICIOUS! It was a little warm in the restaurant but it wont stop us from coming back.

Author: RadDocCT
Review: Located in a nondescript little building lies this gem. What it lacks in decor, it makes up in the foodPho with plenty of umami flavor and ingredients Summer rolls tasty and refreshing

Author: Keochin
Review: Wow!!! A true hidden gem in Roanoke when it comes to pho. We are typically pho snobs but this place scratched every pho itch. Small but he service was great and the food was fantastic! A must for any pho or Vietnamese cuisine lover.

Author: Manskittles
Review: Third time we have eaten here. The broth on their pho is good for your soul!! Do try their Vietnamese coffee!!

Author: Sandra M
Review: If you want some nice comfort food at reasonable prices, with a darned good likelihood of leftovers for later, Vina might be a great choice. Friend and I split two orders of appetizers (fried Vietnamese roll and rice-paper-wrapped pork/pork skin roll---4 pieces total): well-filled, with tasty dip sauces---and extremely filling. We both grabbed the combo pho (1 large, 1 reg bowl)---very nice, rich-tasting without being greasy, with generous meat portions. Went home with about 2/3 of my medium pho (I was FULL, and my friend said later he was stuffed) and a pork banh mi for leftovers supper. Although they had a few interesting drink options, we stuck with jasmine tea and soda pop. Total bill, including tax and tip: under $37 USD, for what's going to amount to 4 portions for hearty eaters. The place isn't much for elegance or decor---but it's comfy. IIRC, it's a family-operated business and so the hours of service are somewhat limited (closing at 8/9 pm, and closed Tu and W), but for your average lunch/dinner needs, it's fine.

Author: tmscott
Review: Don't drive by this little gem! The pho is outstanding and do try their original asian/french crepe! The service is quick, and friendly.

Author: jeax2
Review: The staff is friendly and the food is great. I had the rice paper spring rolls (A2) and the pho, both were fresh and so good. Perfect food for a cold and rainy night, I will definitely be back.

Author: Karla G
Review: excellent food !!!! fresh authentic nice staff I will by back soon the soups are delicious and their coffee is great please give a try small business cook with their hearths.....

Author: Tony G
Review: Happen to be staying nearby and saw this small restaurant. Decided to give it a try. Went there for dinner the noodles were great and the Pho also. This is a small family run restaurant and very economical. Food was spot on.

Author: TravelinJim2014
Review: Lews has typical diner food; burgers, subs, fries, salads and pizza. Tonight, three of us had burgers and our fourth had a salad. The burgers were half pound patties and about more than I could eat and the salad was huge. The food was great and we will be going back.

Author: NYDINO
Review: Been a few times, on different nights, asll is the same each time. Food is actually very good, but very sloe service from wait staff to kitchen, ruins the experience. If you complain, you get side eyed by the whole staff. Made it very uncomfortable. Same with Pizza Special Tuesday. Started out w/ great Pizza, after it became real popular, size of Large dwindled to 13 " , to a pretty good Pizza.

Author: Michael B
Review: Had lunch here with two friends. I had the fish sandwich, which came with chips. I got tomato and lettuce added. My bill was about $10. I thought those extras shouldn't have cost so much, but the sandwich tasted very good anyway. One friend got the signature sub, the Italian sub which was huge. He ate the whole thing and enjoyed it a lot. Service was fairly good but a little slow at the end for paying the tab. I've eaten at the other location several times and found their Philly Cheesesteak excellent. The dining area is not crowded and the photos on the wall of Roanoke scenes are attractive. I know from past visits to the one on Williamson Road that the pizzas are very good.

Author: edean l
Review: Have lived here 2 years and found what WAS A gem. Last few visits indoors were horrendous. Never enough staff, waiting more then an hour for meal, each time. Always an excuse, Mgr would not even come to table. Sad, as the food is actually good. Started ordering Large Pizza, to go on Tuesday, as is a great special, 4 of 6 times, not great, especially crust. Tonite, Pizza was barely a Medium size. Don't complain, you just get the side eye and non caring staff. Sadly, things are going down hill.

Author: Jppppppppppppp
Review: Stopped by 7/18 evening and left after sitting at our table and one waitress after another waiting on other tables. Never got a menu or had anyone come by to even say we'll be with you in a minute. Sad to see the service get that bad I really liked the place

Author: Q3194XBrebeccap
Review: First visit and first impression, I was delighted with this place. Very busy today at lunch. The server told us our meal would take awhile; we were fine with that and appreciated that she told us and that she continued to check on us and kept our drinks full. When the meal arrived - the wait was well worth the time. Food was hot, obviously freshly made. Oh the mushroom burger was so - so very good. The BLT excellent my husband said. Even the pickle was delicious. Yep, another visit in the future.

Author: Bridgenutt
Review: We had probably the best corned beef sandwich ever !!! My friend's burger was perfectly cooked. Very attentive staff. Definitely a locals favorite - we arrived at 11:00 am - by 11:30, the restaurant was full - and people waiting for a parking space - and this was during the week. Don't miss this local gem.

Author: Richard N
Review: Friggin awesome. Patty melt, Philly steak burger, onion rings, beer battered French fries. First visit. This place is really worth the stop.

Author: Hokiechip
Review: Met a friend for lunch during restaurant week and was very pleased.Outstanding service and very good food. Since it was restaurant week, there were some great lunch specials.

Author: DayleD
Review: Four of us went for lunch, everything was delicious. The French fries are crispy and my Mom has learned to get the large steak and cheese so she take half home!

Author: aneishar2016
Review: Visited for lunch with few friends. Went at lunch time and had the buffet. It was pretty tasty. The staff was also very friendly. I liked it. Will return.

Author: Virginia581
Review: The food is always great and prepared just the way your ordered it. The lunch buffet is a great deal.

Author: ejm99
Review: Stopped in around 6 pm. Restaurant busy but we were seated in one of the last available booths. Drink order and chips and salsa arrived promptly. Ordered a number 9 and 17. Food was good. Service is good. Dining area a combination of tables and booths. Also have outdoor seating. Dining room fairly quiet. A good safe place for a meal. Ample parking.

Author: jimcrowsr1961
Review: i ordered their largest margarita. i doubt i received any alcohol definitely not top shelf as advertised. when it got home i had 2 more drinks and never felt the effects, so i am pretty sure they served me virgin drinks. the food was average and service good. the atmosphere was cute much like the other mexican restaurants in roanoke. i most likely won't return unless in a group

Author: adenson09
Review: My husband had eaten here in the past on business trips. Our family ate here on our way back home while on vacation to NYC. This is a good Mexican restaurant with great food, good atmosphere, good service and is reasonably priced.

Author: Ruthy J
Review: This is by far the best Mexican restaurant but I will say we have done lunch here lately and it was better than before!

Author: escism
Review: We are particular about our Mexican food and are cautious on this side of the US. El Toreo didn't even come close... tomato sauce, unseasoned chicken for us the food was flavorless and lifeless. We recomment Allejandros for more authentic cuisine... except their Marguaritas are not good, but yeah other than that.

Author: SuTengKai
Review: El Toreo was pleasant. The decorations and inside are a splash of color. Service was fast and friendly. Guacamole was surprisingly bland. My wife and I shared enchiladas and liked them.We stopped here after driving the Blue Ridge Parkway and rather spur of the moment stopped at the first Mexican restaurant we could find. The parking lot had a lot of cars so we assumed it was good enough. It was.

Author: theoldpioneer
Review: The place is clean and friendly, the food was good, and the portions were huge. I had enough for two more meals the next day!

Author: Jeffrey M
Review: I have never been in such a flaming, brightly-colored restaurant before. Even the chairs are carved and brightly painted tropical forest colors.The food is fine; not stupendous, but fine and ample. My Hornitos marguerita was fine.So, would a drive 20 miles to eat here - NO. But, if you are nearby, stop by.

Author: j0yceg0rd0n
Review: We arrived at thr restaurant during happy hour and got a 9oz Sangria for the price of 6ozs. Hadn't had one in years, and it was delightful. I had the Minestrone Soup and the stuffed mushrooms. Both were very tasty. My friend had the meatballs and a house salad, she enjoyed that as well. We will be back again.!! Service was excellent.

Author: Mike O
Review: Yes, this is a chain restaurant. And yes, we found their food and service to be outstanding. Our server, Blake, was attentive as can be; he stopped by our table no fewer than six times during our Saturday evening dinner. Our water glass never reached half empty. The food was fresh and full flavored. The Chicken Trio, which includes their signature Chicken Bryan, had sauces packed with flavor; and the side of grilled asparagus was nicely charred. Equally good was the Johnny Rocco Salad; it was loaded with large shrimp and scallops. Even the house side salad was delicious, thanks to a big dose of their creamy parmesan dressing. Very well done.

Author: Gayleetro
Review: Hubby and I wanted pasta for dinner and decided to go to Carrabbas. Service was outstanding!!I had the Seafood Pestatore was was tasty and had a good amount of seafood on it. Scallops, shrimp and mussels. There were chunks of hard noodles that did not cook properly. Salad was excellent! Hubby had the minestrone soup and said it was the best he ever had!! He had the spaghetti with meatballs but was disappointed that there wasnt more sauce on the noodles. Overall it was a good dinner!

Author: Heather M
Review: We went to enjoy the weekend special- 6oz sirloin, lobster ravioli and 2 sides with a glass of wine. The flavors were delicious and we really enjoyed everything. We also had the nicest server and she made the evening even more enjoyable. I hope they have more of these specials often.

Author: 250debbiea
Review: Nice atmosphere, good service, delicious food for a reasonable price, many choices.. Extras like warm bread with dipping oil. The reason I wanted to write a review is how a mistake was handled: the waiter spilled an entire glass of ice water on me! Those things happen! (Thank goodness it was just water, and it was just an accident.) They immediately brought towels and helped wipe things up. The rest of the meal went fine and we enjoyed ourselves (other than a part of my dress was still wet). BUT, at the end of the meal, the manager came over and said that my meal would be comped. Think that says a lot of the customer service exhibited at this restaurant. I would highly recommend it and would go there again.

Author: georgesO7303US
Review: We go here at least once a month. Wine dinners are wonderful! Love the mussels! Jason runs a tight ship and the food and service are always first class! Great atmosphere too!

Author: WheatyTweety
Review: Had a quick dinner in the shopping mall area of Roanoke. It was just tow of us and Carrabba's did not disappoint. Food was wonderful and the service was great. Be sure to ask for Haley.

Author: moysian
Review: Wife and I ordered two 10" pizzas for carry-out, and the the bill came to nearly $30. In addition, we got to the restaurant when told to arrive, and still had to wait 15 minutes for pizzas to come out. Mine came out 10 minutes earlier than my wife's, and sat on the counter getting cold, while hers was still baking. Pizza cook/chef did not speak English.

Author: virginiagamer
Review: I was concerned about going here, because I wasnt sure that a chain Italian restaurant would be able to accommodate my girlfriends many food allergies. Boy, was I wrong. The manager came over to speak to us and go through the menu with us to pick out safe items. We were able to put together a custom meal for her that was very tasty and totally safe. Personally, I ordered the penne caprese, which I thought was a bit disappointing, but everyone else in our party enjoyed their meals. The staff were attentive, friendly, and helpful, and I would certainly be happy to come here again. Highly recommended!

Author: hbhakh
Review: Carrabba's, as part of the Outback family, always offers good food at reasonable prices. This location is not exception. Our group was seated promptly and everyone enjoyed their meals. They offer an extra entree to go for $10.

Author: barbararitaville
Review: Seated promptly. Asked table or booth preference; which was appreciated since husband is large and most restaurants immediately show us to a tight fitting booth...Salsa and chips served immediately. Good waitress service. Honest too! When asked if a menu item was good, she promptly said 'no don't order that, everything else is good'! She was right; everything we ordered was very good.

Author: Bud G
Review: The building is very nice, open with an upstairs section, making for a lively environment. Service was friendly and efficient. Chimichangas and enchiladas really good, along with the beans. Rice bland, add salsa. Fairly priced. Nice!!

Author: gwinfrey08
Review: Service was fine, guacamole was horrible, sitting in the bowl they brought to the table in the refrigerator, queso was bad, dinner bland, just overall very bad Mexican.

Author: WorldTraveling8
Review: I had the pork carnitas and it was fantastic. Lots of food - big portion. I would definitely go back.

Author: Lee S
Review: This Mexican restaurant is very by the book unlike its across the street competition (I prefer it by the book). Its slightly pricey for the food versus what Im used to, but the service was exceptional on this day as it has been on a couple of prior visits. A minor mistake was corrected speedily and happily. I anticipate returning.

Author: 460wvwadester
Review: I am an infrequent diner when it comes to Mexican cuisine because I have favorite restaurants that I enjoy and have confidence in. I stayed next door to this location in May 2019 and it looked inviting and well attended. Then the front desk clerk at my hotel recommended Rodeo Grande "If you like Mexican" and noted that they give a 10% discount with the hotel key card. So I decided to try it.. . . and was ever glad I did. From the the moment I walked in the staff made me feel like I was a "favorite regular". The dining area was well maintained, the menu offered a wide array of items and the wait staff were extremely friendly, polite and customer centered. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal and I would highly recommend trying this Rodeo Grande for a great Mexican meal.

Author: 397alr
Review: Table side preparation of guacamole- best since we were in San Antonio. I had Chicken Mexicani, absolutely fantastic! Wife had combo of enchiladas. Also very good. Portions more than adequate. Desserts sounded delicious but had not room left.Highly recommend!

Author: Junebuggiec
Review: Service was fine. Ordered 3 different kinds of tacos. They were super dry with very little flavor. Probably won't be back.

Author: hockeydad1470
Review: The staff was great at making last minute dining for a large group. The staff was very friendly and accommodating to our group which included many kids. The food was good and served in a timely matter. The unlimited chips and salsa was a hit with the kids and parents as well.

Author: dalt61
Review: First visit to Rodeo Grande. Restaurant is literally in the parking lot of the Home 2 Suites where we stayed. The service was prompt and the staff is very friendly. Our meal was very good . When we visit the Roanoke area this will definitely be on our list of dining choices.

We just enjoyed a fabulous breakfast. The service excellent. Every single item we chose was delish. Great atmosphere and this combination created a good time had by all. Sausage gravy one of the best and believe me we try it everywhere.

Author: slowboattobobby11
Review: Last week was our first (and last) visit to this restaurant. Service was slow. In other restaurants that we have had breakfast in, TWO pieces of toast was always the "standard order." With this one, we each got ONLY one piece of toast. When questioned, our server informed us that we could get another piece for $1.30 per slice. After all this bit, I had asked for plain toast and got it buttered! Food was so-so and nothing to brag about. Scrambled eggs were a bit watery, and bacon was ordered "crisp" and came greasy. There are MANY other places in the Roanoke Valley that serve a much better breakfast at a more reasonable price. And believe me, we will be eating at those places in the future and NOT here!

Author: Q3194XBrebeccap
Review: Excellent atmosphere, food and service. I was so delighted with the Crab Scramble omelet and everyone complemented their Classic Benedict and Sausage Biscuits. Very enjoyable. Looking forward to my next visit.

Author: 00Treasure
Review: My family and I found this to be an excellent choice of restaurant with persons in our party having specific dietary needs. Wait staff were very helpful and patient with us whilst we asked questions and made our choices. As the restaurant makes it's own salad dressings and salads the staff were knowledgeable about how the food was made and what the dishes contained or did not contain. Food was delicious. Highly recommend this restaurant.

Author: Ricki M
Review: The Famous Toastery in Keagy Village is the BEST place to have breakfast. I've not tried lunch, but I can say their breakfast can not be beat. They have the best waiters too. There is now way you can go wrong by visiting this restaurant. There is an outdoor patio and the indoor section is very comfortable. They also have a room you can reserve for meetings, I've done that and it will fit about 12 people, my guess. I absolutely LOVE their grits. Can't say enough good stuff about this place. Reasonably priced as well. Take the whole family!!!

Author: WheatyTweety
Review: Did not expect this to be what is was. The food selection was great and the service (everyone covers one another) was awesome. This is a must if you are in the area.

Author: MileHighFox
Review: Treated Niece to Breakfast; wanted alternative to IHOP. Chose FAMOUS TOASTY. Waitress LINDSEY; cheery, bubbly personality; excellent Waitress.

Author: centaur41
Review: On the edge of a mall area, dining outside surrounded by grass & trees, mountains not farlovely setting. Good service but food mixed: K had an excellent Florentine Benedict; since they had everything bagels, cream cheese & lox I thought I'd be set: nicely prepared and served BUT while my bagel was prepared as requested, it seems to have been stale to start with & thus tough. Too bad. Easily correctable in the future

Author: T9136ZEtonyp
Review: First visit to Famous Toastery! Upon walking in the door you are greeted to a spacious area with modern styling and some eclectic art on the walls. Service with a smile and you can tell everyone is genuinely proud of what is offered here. The famous hash was some of the best corned beef hash I have ever had. Perfectly season and nice chunky cut potatoes. The poached eggs on top were perfectly cooked with. Nice runny yolk to be sopped up with the sourdough toast. The Cali Benedict was also perfectly cooked with an excellent hollandaise sauce. The Left Coast BLT taken to the next level with deliciously creamy Brie cheese. You must also try the Mac and cheese made with gruyere cheese. A nice change of pace from the standard Mac and cheese. They also offer a selection of wines and cocktails. So if you would like a mimosa or Bloody Mary for brunch, they got you covered. Wonderful food and service! Definitely will return!

Author: klay36
Review: Seated promptly though they were fairly busy. Staff friendly, very clean. Lots to choose from. Food came and looked amazing and tasted even better. It was a little costly for breakfast spending $35 for 2 people but great nonetheless. I will return again and would highly recommend.

Author: F117TMmikem
Review: Wow! Great place! Im originally from California and have traveled a fair amount and this sushi is as good as it gets! I had a rainbow roll and a 5 colors roll. Both were tightly rolled and fresh! Miso soup was good too. I met Ben the owner and he is a great guy.

Author: 963geoffreyt
Review: We ordered fried rice. They didnt have enough because it wasnt made. I ordered chicken fried rice and it came with beef. My husband got it. Its the most plain, bland food Ive ever had. Disgusting!!! I ordered something different.. some sort of noodles and chicken and vegetables with NOOO season. It looked like regular brown rice not even fried. I mean GROSS!!! I couldnt have had a worse dinner if I tried. I cant tell you how gross this place was. Please dont go!!! HOWWWWW did this place get a good rating???

Author: riverhouse103
Review: My son has been raving about this place for years. Im ashamed to say I live about a mile way and Ive never dropped in here. My wife and I finally came by. The atmosphere and service is exactly what you would hope it would be. Everything is on point. The menu is quite extensive with some dinner options for those who arent interested in sushi or sashimi. I had the sashimi and it was quite good. My wife had a standard California roll. I tried it and it was very good. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

Author: MedIcally
Review: My husband and I tried this lovely restaurant for lunch for the first time. We ordered from the lunch selections and had more than adequate quantity and excellent quality sushi. The menu offered a variety of dishes but we both got sushi and a roll. The sushi was excellent, fresh and beautifully prepared. The service was great too! We highly recommend!

Author: RBPilotcat
Review: Went for Dinner today, i chose a Seat at the Prep Bar,Chef and Owner Ben prepared me a delicious Meal consistent of Sushi and sashimieverything was well balanced and spiced. Ben is social and talks to you while he prepares the delicious dishes.Will be back defiantly

Author: Jackie S
Review: Four stars. Freshness of fish was top notch. The roe was amazing and fresh. Portions were small compared to other places we've been, but that was the only drawback. Hot sake remained hot in carafe during meal. Service was excellent!!!

Author: Kevin P
Review: I've eaten sushi all over the United States. This has to be one of the best...if not the best sushi I have ever eaten. Who would have expected...in Roanoke. VA. Wish I could get them to deliver to Kansas. So what did we enjoy? The Tornado Roll...of course!

Author: Gayleetro
Review: My daughter and I finally got our schedules together and were able to have dinner. We love sushi and it had been quite a while since we had gone to Ben Gui, so it was time.As always, we were pleasantly greeted and seated. I am a creature of habit so I had my usual - California Roll and Miso Soup and I decided to try Ebi - because it had shrimp on it. It was delightful. My daughter had a tuna roll, which she said was also delicious. The sushi is always fresh and tasty at Ben Gui. My daughter decided to get something called the 2010 appetizer with salmon skin, shrimp, skinny noodles, roe.It was nothing like I expected - so tasty - loved the light crunch of the salmon with the soft noodles. Delightful!! It's not on the menu so if you are interested in trying it - you have to ask specifically for it.

Author: yana003
Review: My background - Sushi: as in raw fish - lover of food, traveled across US (Boston to San Diego) to Japan...This place has great service, friendly staff and excellent sashimi and sake! Who would expect in land locked Roanoke? There are actually a few really solid Sushi spots, others with other Chinese/ Japanese food, too. This place is focused on fish! And apparently the rolls and specials are fantastic, too, based on the people around me. I've moved Ben Gui to the top of my sushi list in Roanoke! Then 'Taste of Asia', Wasabi and 'Cafe Asia2'.Enjoy!

Author: klprice9
Review: This is the best sushi restaurant in Roanoke, by far. I'm not a big sushi eater, but my husband is and so we decided to go here for dinner a few evenings ago. It has been awhile since we dined here since we moved out of Roanoke in 2013. The friendliness and welcoming attitude of the stuff is warm and inviting. I appreciate this. My husband ordered "the boat" and was not disappointed. I ordered cucumber and avocado sushi and it was yummy. The miso soup was delicious. I definitely enjoyed our dinner here.

Author: johndavid1945
Review: First visit to this place. Very impressed with the diverse menu. Everything I tried was done in a tasty manner. From fried shrimp.....to good ol' pot roast with boiled potatoes.....all yummy good. Our young waiter was friendly and competent....

Author: christinecH7303MS
Review: My friend were looking for a place to go for lunch. We both love Chinese but Im more a sushi fan and he the Americanized Chinese food. We both love buffets so you can pick and choose. The buffet was one of the largest Ive seen in a long time (6 kids=buffets) the food was fresh, hot, the near empty bowls were refilled quickly.The sushi was excellent. A good variety. Some places only offer 1-3 kinds at a buffet. They had at least 6 and the man preparing the sushi said he would make the rolls with whatever we wanted!The staff was friendly, kept our glasses full. In my place coffee cup full. And their coffee tasted so fresh and robust I was tempted to ask them what brand they used.The utensils were clean as well as the table and plates. They had a great variety of Chinese and American foods; pot roast, fries, Mac & cheese etc. Salad bar with fruits and veggies.I was too full for dessert but the people around us were raving about the brownies and fudge.A wonderful family priced restaurant that leaves you feeling good, like you want to sit back and close your eyes.Looking forward to returning soon!

Author: n2heartsongs
Review: Best Chinese buffet we have patronized in a long time. Clean, friendly staff, great food and price !!

Author: teeeeekay
Review: This restaurant has it all.Sushi.American and Chinese all you can eat. Dessert tables.Fresh fruit. Ice cream. If your looking for variety, a great value and easy to get location this is a great place to eat.Lunch was less than 10.00.

Author: Hazel S
Review: This restaurant had great food and great assortment. I wish I could have tried everything they had to offer. Very clean also

Author: Tim-tim C
Review: Mostly offers maki (roll) sushi, but usually has a wide variety available with exceptional quality .

Author: Mike O
Review: I like coming here because of the large variety. And, during my occasional visits, their have been plenty of others who seem to like coming here too. That yields the benefit of the frequent replenishment of the buffet tables; I have not encountered an empty food station or one with anything other than freshly prepared food. For my taste, the food seems above the average for a typical Chinese restaurant, but not up to par with a couple of our favorite places to go for oriental food.

Author: SpiderEffect
Review: At the recommendation of someone we met in a different Japanese restaurant....we decided to give this restaurant a 'go'. Arriving at 11 am for lunch - you would expect all of the food to be fresh and prepared first thing. What we discovered was a buffet with TONS of food that was cold even though it was sitting under heat lamps in a steamer to keep warm. Let me clarify what I am saying....if you pick up stuffed mushrooms and bite into them they should be warm all the way through. Not only was the outside cold...but the inside was super cold. Sweet & Sour chicken....clearly the same. Dish after dish was extremely cold. If the food was 'fresh' and we arrived shortly after they opened....how can everything we put on our plate be cold?After the cold foods...we decided to try the Hibachi Grill. You can choose the items that you want the cook to fix for you.....rice, veggies, meats....all of it there to take to the grill. Sounds perfect ...right??? WRONG!!! When you eat Hibachi....meats are cooked longer than other sides. They are also kept separate from rice, veggies, eggs. Not here. They mix it all up and cook at one time. Giving the benefit of the doubt....I thought this would still turn out great. Nope....big disappointment. My rice was so hard ..I thought at first he left egg shells in my plate. Tons of super crispy pieces that you couldn't even chew. My husband picked the steak and I had chicken. I have to say...they pick the worst cuts of meat. How to you have grizzle and aren't able to chew either meat?The ice cream machine was broken and the solution was soft serve ice cream in a serve yourself method. What do I mean? A freezer with 4 flavors of ice cream, no scooper, and you take a spoon and scoop out what you would like. Now....how many hands have been in that ice cream you just scooped into a bowl? How many didn't wash their hands but put it in the ice cream??? Just gross....Dish after dish was cold....it was so surprising. The taste of a lot of the dishes made you wonder if the meat was 'iffy'. I seriously began thinking dishes were reheated or refrigerated and placed out for consumption. Not the things that you want going through your head when consuming foods that you can't tell what they are. VERY disappointed in our meal. For a buffet...it was lacking in taste, quality, and attention. Will not return to this place again. Did I mention it was more than $22 for two people???

Author: mercynono
Review: Restaurant was full but not crowded, Food was very good, fresh and dishes kept full. The service was good and our glasses were kept filled. Server was very polite. We enjoyed a leisurely meal with our adult children and grandchildren. Wish the temperature of the soup was hotter . Will visit again next time we visit Roanoke VA

Author: truefakeblonde
Review: Let me start with the food. To say this is a supreme buffet is an understatement. You are literally greeted with rows of deliciousness. A hibachi grill that you can add whatever you like including eggs. Sushi rolls and the wazoo. Every meat you could possibly think of plus American fare. It literally has everything. I'd recommend the ice cream and skip the other desserts. They were legitimately dry and disgusting. I didn't go for the dessert so I don't care. The service. The employees are rude. Completely rude. We were saying how nice the place was and how delicious everything tasted and she just completely ignored us. When we said we wanted water they rolled their eyes and huffed away. Asked if we wanted more water and she just grabbed the cup not really caring what the answer was going to be. I would go back but just expect to not enjoy the staff. Focus on the food. Lol

Author: Hokiehydeout
Review: Went to the Village Grill for lunch on a busy Saturday afternoon. They have a great selection of apps, burgers, sandwiches and salads. Everyone in our group enjoyed their meal. Sat outside in the covered deck. The wait staff was super friendly and efficient. Our food arrived promptly even though they were busy. Looking forward to going back and trying other items on the menu.

Author: Bridgenutt
Review: The food is just average - at best. Our server was good. And they have a great outdoor deck. This is a great place to have a drink and chat.

Author: Joe58156
Review: Good selection of meals, burgers, sandwiches, drinks and apps. Childs menu and full bar. Like 8 or 9 different burgers, each in the $9+ price range. Our service was good. Try the Mac and cheese with beans. The food tasted pretty OK. Yeah, wed prolly go again.

Author: Mike O
Review: Our server, nicknamed Sunshine, did a great job (real name Sharayah). The four of us were first time visitors; the fire at the Community Inn was our incentive to try someplace different. Sunshine took the time to review some of the ordering aspects, including salad specials. She did likewise for the beer specials. Food wise, we found the salads to all be tasty; nothing special, but tasty. They were very reasonably priced at $8.00. Likewise for the beer; $4.00 for a 23oz pilsner. Well done.

Author: WayneWalkJr
Review: Great tasting burger and buffalo chips! Nice establishment with outstanding service. Prices are reasonable.

Author: Joseph W
Review: For a great meal and fantastic service, this is a go to restaurant. I have tried lots of items on the menu and all have been wonderful. Sandwiches, salads, or whatever ordered is fine. Service is outstanding.

Author: JM0330
Review: Nice little bar and grill. Lots of TV's for sports but not loud. For some reason it was dark and chilly, like they forgot to trim m turn the heat and lights on? Food was all good. French dip, Nachos, Salad. Service efficient. A little pricey for lunch, everything around $10 but good quality. We'd return.

Author: Joe58156
Review: Good selection of burgers, sandwiches, drinks and apps. Childs menu and full bar. Like 8 or 9 different burgers, each in the $10+ price range. Our service was excellent. The food tasted just OK. Yeah, wed prolly go again.

Author: Tami R
Review: My grandson and I ate at Village Grill for a Friday evening meal. I ordered a salad and he ordered the fish and chips. My salad was fresh and tasty. My grandsons fish and chips were very good. Both the fries and the fish were sprinkled with Old Bay, which we both enjoyed. The server was attentive and our food was served in a reasonable time. We will certainly eat at the Grill again on a future trip to Roanoke.

Author: Stephen F
Review: The Village Grill has really good food and service. I have had many items on the menu and all have been delicious. For those that are looking for healthy eats Village has them as well. Today I had the Vincent an Jules and just perfect. Also is a must try is the sweet potato fries all the way. Also while I was there the restaurant became rather busy and the kitchen was quick on orders. Good cold beer alsoGreat food, service and cold beer.

Author: Joehadenough
Review: Great hole-in-the-wall beer and burger joint. A little loud....a little crowded....a lot of great signature burgers and good beer!

Author: rastyschick
Review: Absolutely our favorite place Large beer selections food grilled cheese is the best love the Burgers are great lots of options

Author: psudino
Review: Walking into this place you may think it is a grungy bar instead of a burger joint, but that's the look they are going for. The names of the burgers are rather creative, some bordering on inappropriate, which again, what they are going for.The burgers themselves are just the right size and they focus on the ingredients being bold instead of being big. I got the El Chupacabra and my friends both got Shockers. The fries are crinkle style and CRUNCHY, which is awesome. Not sure what the white sauce was but we all put it on the burgers and the fries and it was excellent. Everyone was incredibly satisfied!

Author: 801joef
Review: You want a different tasty burger? Go to Jack Browns! Quick service and friendly bar staff. Its a burger and brew atmosphere and something you must experience. The bottle/can beer list is Huge!! Specials on tap too. Sweet potato fries a must!

Author: drwillie78
Review: Fun downtown area with restaurants and shops. We stopped in for a quick burger based on recommendations from Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed! Awesome and moist burger. About 50 brews to choose from. Great atmosphere! Highly recommend

Author: shelby35571
Review: If you love a good burger or are a beer fanatic, you absolutely have to stop here. Great area downtown Roanoke, excellent food, quick service, awesome atmosphere and what seems to be over 75 different beer selections!

Author: jnzoller
Review: Casual, loud and tasty. Nice selection of specialty burgers with a daily special. Friendly staff who helped us decide on food. Visited similar establishments in other cities and this is definitely the place for burgers and an excellent selection of brews in Roanoke - all with great music!

Author: PTycz
Review: Needed a place to grab lunch in town. This place had good burgers. Fries were good as well. Ask for the special burger sauce too.

Author: Debra H
Review: These burgers are made with Wagyu beef and they were really good. The sweet potato fries and sauce was amazing.I would recommend this place if you are looking for a good and hearty hamburger! The fried Oreo was delicious as well!

Author: Slimy
Review: Not often that a burger is memorable. Great burger, great beer, wierd atmosphere (in a good way). Elvis burger......

Author: Charles L
Review: Love Sweet Frog! We go there whenever in town visiting our daughter and her family. Always great selection of flavors, and topping variety is endless.Ver accessible, friendly staff, and awesome product.

Author: paralegal4444
Review: Too many of the Sweet Frog stores are closing everywhere and it's too bad. We really love going in and making our own sundae. The flavors are light and perfect for a summer or spring day. They were closed here for a couple months but now their up and running and we will return!

Author: jeepingaz
Review: Lots of flavors and toppings to choose from. They have something for everyone including non dairy choices. However the non dairy choices aren't that great but the flavors are all labeled

Author: Kim H
Review: Self-serve soft serve and toppings info a friendly, clean atmosphere. Multiple flavors of soft serve available including traditional choices and more interesting ones (ex. mango). This branch of the franchise is family owned. Near Michael's craft store, Art in Motion Dance Studio, Pete's Deli.

Author: Connie J
Review: Serve yourself ice cream. Many types including fat free and yogurts. Add toppings. Beware though; you pay by the ounce so the toppings can add up.

Author: charleybea
Review: We love stopping in here when we're in the area. There isn't much seating inside, but they do offer seats outside as well. They have a nice selection of frozen yogurt flavors (both with sugar and without).

Author: judyCS
Review: We enjoy going here to get different flavors and try new toppings. It's very small but the yogurt is the best. Staff very helpful and friendly. They have cute tshirts for adults and children

Author: Aubrey L
Review: Good Yogurt. Many selections and toppings. It gets a bit pricey if you take the whole family. Average price for a cup can easily go over $5.00.

Author: babiesmake4
Review: we have gone several time and every time I think it ok but it's not ice cream. It's weight and paid by the pound. It can get a little pricey if you start adding on all the toppings. Not opened on sunday.

Author: bmac-3
Review: We love this cafeteria! The servings are so generous that we often split the main, share our salads and sides, but we love their desserts, so we don't share those! HA!!

Author: CharSpen
Review: Was just told it would be a 10 minute wait for a favorite entree. Not a place to go if in a hurry. Server was unfriendly and unapologetic.

Author: lcl50
Review: Went there Sunday afternoon--employees doing double duty so food was barely warm by the time we were seated. Baked spaghetti, green beans, chicken "slab" pie, cauliflower salad, corn muffin/butter, water--the butter and water were the only thing edible. Food looked and tasted like it was a week old. Could not eat it--just left it and paid our bill. We told the cashier it was the worst food we ever tried to eat--she offered to get the manager but we didn't want to go into that--just wanted to pay and leave--will never return. Don't waste your time--pure slop.

Author: MrsKerren18
Review: We enjoy the home-cooked nature of food and choices at K&W. Prices are reasonable, and there seems never to be a line when we go, even when the dining room seems full. My husband loves the baked spaghetti and I prefer all the veggies - my table is full of 'small' dishes of nearly every vegetable. the pies are excellent as well.

Author: CaribbeanWonderer
Review: This is my second review of K&W Tanglewood. The first, five years ago, related my disappointment with their 8 oz. chopped steak. Today (December 23 for lunch at 12:47pm according to the time stamp on the bill) I think I've finally convinced she who must be obeyed to opt-out of this cafeteria. She who must be obeyed (She) goes there for the shopping at a large women's-focused deep discounter next door in Tanglewood Mall. She loves K&W kale "super food" salad. Today, at the aforementioned time, barely into the first lunch hour, K&W had run out of the kale salad. She also loves the chicken stew (aka chicken and dumplings.) I got the usual 8 oz. chop steak. They had them stacked on their sides in the tray, (for a sad surprise later.) pan fried at some time (no grill stripes), Long gone is the large breaded onion ring on top of the 8 oz. chop steak. I noted the 5 oz version of the chop steak still layed flat in the pan, had the char-broil stripes and a dill pickle slice on top. She found nothing of interest in the veggie section, and my old favorite, pinto beans, had lost all taste except salt in the bean gravy, so I passed. Two yeast rolls, (still good, but the unpleasant surprise awaited) and that was it. 3 menu items for two and we stepped out of the serving line. K&W still has outstanding waitresses and our favorite found us and took us to her station. Still First class service from the K&W employees. But for the unpleasant surprise. My wife's chicken stew was cold. The waitress quickly took it back to the kitchen to nuke it. My chopped steak, stacked on edge in the steam tray instead of laying flat to absorb the heat from the steam tables, was likewise cold. But who hasn't eaten a cold hamburger for lunch when at work? So i continued to prepare it. The yeast rolls were not quite warm enough to melt the butter pats. No ketchup to be found at either condiment station, but the waitress brought me a bottle quickly. The taste, one of salt in the meat, and too much of that, even with the ketchup and semi-soft butter pats in the rolls.We finished our meal quickly, but not the meal of a cool salad, hot rolls and hot entrees we were expecting. Everything seemed to be pulled out of the fridge cold. The food was not expensive, but the lack of advertised items and the cold presentation is off-putting.

Author: John T
Review: Used to be good. This past week, in there at 5:30 for dinner on a Saturday - no bread, no desserts - the food on the line looked and tasted like it had been out all day. They offered the two-fer for $17, but since there was no bread or dessert, when I tried to ask for that deal at the register, they got confused, saying I couldn't get it, because we didn't have any bread or dessert... UUhhhhh.....

Author: David K
