Review: This restaurant is a traditional 1970's cafeteria, with a huge selection off the main line. For those with memories of that era, it's a real find. There's no haute cuisine, but just good eats and a wide selection of American favorites.

Author: ftball72
Review: Delicious good, perfect employees, a good place for dinner!! Went with a group of other folks, you should not leave hungry!

Author: Sharon S
Review: Clearly one of the reasons folks still come to the Tanglewood Mall, this cafeteria offers a large selection of home-style cooking.

Author: GodlyMommy
Review: I've been vising K&W since I was a child. It's a family tradition. But lately, over the past couple years, they've seemingly gone downhill quite a bit. I've visited other K&W locations in other states, and the food is tasty, largely portioned, and the staff is first-class. However, both Roanoke locations don't offer that any more. The staff is mediocre -not many friendly smiles here, some of the food recipes have seemed to change over the years -not for the better, and, overall, it just seems to have lost that special touch from years ago. What happened? As far as food faves, my go-tos are usually the Baked Spaghetti or Chicken Almandine. Add to that a side of mashed potatoes and either strawberry shortcake, chocolate pie, or German chocolate pie, and I'm set. The macaroni and cheese used to be on that list too, but it's severely lost its taste. Come on, Roanoke K&W, you've got this! Work on it, because I'd love to have those tasty childhood memories flood my palate once again. As for the prices, it's typically quite affordable for the sit-down, choose-your-own, cafeteria-style cuisine. An individual can probably eat rather well for less than $10.

Author: klm9340
Review: My order was accurately filled and ready when I got there to pick it up!!! Easy as 123. The staff greeted me as soon as I entered the doors. I would definitely order online again!!! Oh and by the way my sandwich tasted good too!!!

Author: nwnh40
Review: I enjoyed my sub, and always do here, the employees are very fast and friendly I will be returning soon

Author: bandittef
Review: Always greeted when I walk in. Staff pleasant, helpful and speedy. Never had a sandwich that wasn't good. Be nice if both TVs were on the same station. Being on different stations just adds to the noise. A busy place with great food.

Author: innerspark1
Review: Not a fan at all of Firehouse. They are very expensive and not sure why. Their subs are fair at best. Try Subway instead. You get twice the amount of food for half the price.

Author: jhais28374
Review: Met a group of Ham Radio Operators I know for lunch, we each had something different and all seem to enjoy the food. Lots of room and the service was quick and the food was hot and the ice tea was cold. Will return to this location again.

Author: Coach5000
Review: Standard Firehouse Subs fare, and for me, that's good stuff. Most of the staff were energetic and all did a great job getting food out fast. Good experience.

Author: Denise L
Review: Awesome service and loaded subs! My favorite subs anywhere I go. Loaded with meat and lots of veggies, made to order.

Author: Marla A
Review: We had visited Firehouse in Richmond and were glad to see their chain in Roanoke. The subs are always good, lots more inventive than many I really like their turkey and cranberry sub.Great drink selection. Okay for a toddler to hang out, as the food comes quickly.

Author: C7189EVjennifers
Review: Great subs! I get the hook and ladder light, and I love it everytime. They also have great meatball subs. The firehouse sauce is delicious! On sundays, at this location, for every adult meal, you get 2 free kids meals!! Great place to take the kids on the cheap on Sundays!

Author: jordanr793
Review: Based on what they advertise on TV, lunch here was a disappointment. The sandwiches are nothing special and they certainly are not large or full of meat as they advertise. Compared to Jimmy Johns which is not too far away, or even Subway, Firehouse Subs have some work to do before I go back.

Author: Q3194XBrebeccap
Review: Very crowded as usual. We sat down and there was myriad of papers/menus to look through. The waiter was there and wanted our drink orders before we had time to look over the drink menu or the specials that do include a drink. The table seems crowded with the four of us even though it was a booth that could have seated six. The food is wonderful but the atmosphere feels a bit rushed to me. But, due to the quality of the food we will return.

Author: Tatecrew
Review: We love their pizza but ordering ahead is a nightmare. This evening I tried for 30 minutes to call and received a Verizon message that the caller was unavailable. So I tried to order online. That took several minutes to navigate through the site, and when I finally got to the checkout screen, they wouldn't accept cash on pick up. Cancelled the order and ate elsewhere.

Author: Shadow1990
Review: I had never been to a Mellow Mushroom before but if they're all like this I'll certainly go back. Their service was great ! There was a little confusion in our order and they not only corrected the problem quickly but also gave us a 10% discount. Can't wait to try again.

Author: Pam J
Review: Stop on our way to Black Dog Salvage. Our waitress was very attentive. We shared a Jerk Chicken Hoagie. It was delicious...but a little spider than I prefer. The Spinach Artichoke dip was delicious.

Author: jerseyj0e
Review: We were looking for a place to eat after our long drive from Jersey to the mountains of Virginia and we are glad we picked the Mellow Mushroom. Our server told us that he would be able to fix our pizza any way we liked it so we ordered a medium pizza with pepperoni and mushrooms and we like our pizza a little more browned than usual, and we got just what we asked for. You can eat outside or inside and it was a little on the warm side so we picked the inside option. Our sever was great and he informed us of many choices we could make. I highly recommend the Mellow Mushroom.

Author: aneishar2016
Review: First time visiting and I can say Drinks and pizza! Pizza is delicious! I bought a small thinking it would be two bites to finish. It was 4 huge slices. Love it! Will return

Author: Srikrishna S
Review: I have searched everywhere for better pizza and nothing beats mellow mushroom. great place. great pizza. great ambience.

Author: Heather M
Review: This was not our best visit. My salad was not the salad I ordered and one of the pizzas we ordered didn't have sauce on the entire pizza. Not only that but people who were seated after we had even ordered were served before we were.

Author: rtrekker
Review: This is your standard, run of the mill Mellow Mushroom - very cool decor (with a giant Optimus Prime outside) and very good, very consistent food. Service was good, not great, but that doesn't matter. We were in the mood for some pizza and would have preferred a local place, but it worked in a pinch. Meets standard.

Author: baikey1
Review: Excellent pizza and service. Try the Pacific Rim pizza. Clean and friendly. Fast, efficient service and attentive management.

Author: Aubrey L
Review: Variety galore. Wonderful salad bar with many choices. Deserts are very limited and the cobblers are just plain bad. Cold bread which is sometimes stale. We have eaten there several times and found the food to be wonderful; however, on our last visit which was our wedding anniversary day, we were greatly surprised with the food. The chefs/cooks had heavily spiced several of the dishes to the point that we couldn't eat anything but the salad bar. The pot roast was so spicy it was inedible and the mixed vegetables left my mouth burning. We were afraid to try the tilapia. Let me point out that this was the first time we had experienced anything like this at this restaurant. We will go back and try the food later, but if we experience this spiciness again, we will be marking this restaurant off our list. If you go, just be prepared for getting a really good meal or getting a really bad meal. Hopefully they will become more reliable in the future.

Author: traderjane2019
Review: Really good lunch buffet and salad bar. My favorite is the crab cakes. The buffet changes every day, but the have a Facebook page that they post the daily items. Only downside is that it is more "banquet" style seating, with large tables that seat 6-8, so if they are busy you may end up sharing a table or waiting. The food is worth it though, and lunch buffet is only $10.95.

Author: Roanoketraveler888
Review: We eat here on a fairly regular basis and normally it is 4 Stars, but not today. The chicken was dry and the calamari was straight from the freezer to the fryer. The roast beef was cold and dried out. The cheesecake and key lime pie was half frozen. It was painfully obvious that the kitchen could not handle the volume. On a good note the salmon, cabbage, and asparagus were very good.

Author: lcl50
Review: Salad bar is fresh. Also had ribeye steak, fried chicken, cod fish in sauce, macaroni and cheese, mashed potatoes, green beans, mixed vegs--did not try the mixed vegs nor the fish, but all other dishes were well prepared and not overly seasoned. Peach "cobbler" was terrible and the coffee was barely warm. Each entree/veg is covered so it is somewhat difficult to balance a plate/uncover food/serve it to yourself. The dining room is very nicely decorated. There was no one in the entrance to greet you to be seated. Overall it was a pleasant lunch--we live only a couple of minutes away so it is a good place if you're hungry for home style cooking in a nice dining room. The servers are very nice.

Author: msfridley
Review: I made a reservation for my husband and I for valentine's dinner. The buffet was wonderful. Prime rib, salmon, were excellent. Grilled asparagus, mashed potatoes and mac n cheese cooked to profection. Salad bar with everything you could imagine. Multiple deserts and chocolate covered strawberries. You should consider making this restaurant your choice for your next event or special occasion.

Author: H2406TTrachelb
Review: The salad bar is great!! I love they also had several meat and veggie selections. It is always fresh and clean! The service was great although the waitress was by herself!! She did an awesome job but could have used more servers or someone doing the register.

Author: ButterflyB
Review: We had a wonderful, festive Easter brunch buffet here on the patio. So many choices: a full and varied salad bar, omelet station, waffle station, a good selection of entrees and sides, and an amazing array of desserts! Tea and coffee were included.

Author: AMDew1956
Review: A truly delicious meal served buffet style. A pretty place, that would be good for a small wedding as well. Only complaint was the coffee. I was only able to get a cup from the last pot, and it was very watery. I kept waiting for them to bring out another pot, but they never did. Very well kept grounds and sitting rooms off the dining room.

Author: Mark B
Review: This place serves a up scale lunch buffet at a not so upscale price. I have had Prime Rib, Ribeye Steak, Salmon on a regular bases, vegies are always fresh and delish. Only open 11-3 mon through Friday and on special occasions

Author: hbhakh
Review: The Plantation offers a daily lunch buffet that's a great find. The food is plentiful and well prepared and the price is very reasonable.

Author: jesse212
Review: The chips were great the salsa was just okay. But the meal was awesome had the enchiladas and husband had the burrito everything tasted awesome. Would highly recommend this place and the cost was only about $12.00 a meal. Extra bonus with our hotel card we got a discount.

Author: kmm1966
Review: Margarita on the rocks was delicious. The homemade salsa was so good, especially the pineapple with Cilantro and lime. Ive never had that before at any Mexican restaurant. Its a must TRY!!! The tacos was ok I prefer corn shells and these were flour. Next time I will make sure to order corn. The service was excellent will go back again.

Author: Angeline P
Review: Casual inside and outside dining . Come for The margaritas and stay for the delicious plates, shrimp fajitas always Fresh

Author: barbararitaville
Review: Service excellent (ask for Ronnie), food great, beautiful restaurant. Portions are generous and reasonably priced. Varied menu selection.

Author: MikeAllenNashville
Review: Walked over from nearby hotel for dinner. Restaurant was clean & quiet. Good service but food was not impressive in presentation or taste for what seems like an upscale Mexican restaurant.

Author: aliciafurrow
Review: birthday occasion.....been here a few times before and the food has alway been pretty good. My steak medallions were cooked a perfect MR which I give compliments to who ever cooked it bc its usually always over done. Also had a Spanish Sangria , super good and also tasted very fresh! Over all service was ok.. server was very polite but wasnt very at tentative ... but over all will definitely be back my parents love this place and its nice to not have everything smothered in cheese like some of the other local Mexican places here.

Author: Bud G
Review: ....the regular Mex restaurants in the area. Is clean, bright, upscale. Food prices reflect it, won't break the bank but still higher than others, paying for the ambience I suppose. I had a fajita salad at lunch. Unfortunately the lettuce, while fresh, had a bagged salad taste. I had to search hard for grilled onions and peppers to qualify it as a fajita salad. More of those would have balanced out, and maybe hidden, the plastic taste. The beef and chicken slices were excellent. The trifecta of salsas and chips were fine, as was the service. Will go back again, but this visit was only average for a $20 lunch.

Author: SMLgtrplyr
Review: Stop in and enjoy some great food. Not your normal stuff. Unique combinations and good presentation. A little pricey, but ya know.......

Author: Cuencathom
Review: Late night dinner & looking for something fairly light landed us at Abuelo's which turned out to be an excellent choice. We were staying nearby & scheduled for an early morning flight at Roanoke Airport. Went with their Tortilla soup & decided to share an order of nachos...smart move because the nacho platter was huge. Good atmosphere, attentive server & very fair prices added up to a great experience.

Author: I5374RNjamieb
Review: Casual dinner on a Friday night with the family. It was a beautiful evening so we sat outside. Food was good but service wasnt great. It wasnt our servers fault-they added more tables to her inside so outside was last and she was swamped. They apologized for it. We usually enjoy our experience here.

Author: sunflower35
Review: My husband and I met up with 2 other couples for a birthday dinner at Food Fanatics Kitchen. Service was friendly, there were great specials, and the food was delicious. We were there on a Tuesday and they had $5 Mexican pizza (yum) and specials on nachos and margaritas. Great night!!

Author: Tee P
Review: An innovative menu and delicious food. The short ribs are fantastic. Attentive service and comfortable atmosphere. Great location just around the corner from The Jefferson Center.

Author: ejm99
Review: Arrived around 6:15 pm and were seated at a booth with a window view. Beers and wine orders taken and promptly delivered. Ordered the white sauce spinach and artichoke large pizza. It was great. Delicious! Dining room is pleasant. Indoor and outdoor seating. Excellent service from Casey. Very pleasant evening. Highly recommend!!

Author: RobertL6946
Review: Having been to this location several times under prior owners, I can tell you that this is the best! The chef is a real pro. I had the veggie lasagna once, and it was great, although the portion was a bit small. The selection of appetizers is good, and drink prices are more than fair. Inside it's very loud, but the outdoor space is relaxing. The brick oven pizzas are real deals, and a HUGE list of toppings.

Author: Jennifer M
Review: Y'all, this is the best place in town. Hidden on the outskirts of downtown Roanoke, this restaurant has and is the best of the best. With it being 246 ft away from me, it's easy to say I'd eat there for convenience BUT there was a restaurant there before them and I only visited it once. I visit this establishment more than I care to admit (I like to eat ) and EVERYTHING is delicious. The best appetizer is the Pork on Pork, a sinfully delicious experience that I can't even describe. The burgers are great and the fries are to die for. I haven't had a single pasta (and I've tried them all on the menu) that I didn't like. Their fettuccine Alfredo with chicken blows Olive Garden out the water. My favorite is the Pasta A La Vodka. You will be speaking to the Lord with that one. The pizza is delicious, especially with their house ranch. Everyone there is great and the owner checks on everyone in the establishment. I have been treated like family since I've walked in the door and I will continue to be a loyal customer.

Author: Travelerpast
Review: I was sceptical but a party of 4 we all ordered different pizzas including the Indian Fusian Chicken Tiki and they were all excellent.Top notch service too.

Author: Michael B
Review: This is a hot new Roanoke restaurant and it is great. The menu features a number of specialty burgers, and I had one with blue cheese, roasted onions, tomato, pickle, cheese, and bacon - and it was spectacular. The fries that came with it were tasty, homemade too. My friend got the vegetarian bean burger and said it was as good as a beef one, he loved it. The menu also features specialty pizzas with Indian fusion options like eggplant. I had lunch there on a Sunday and they also had a brunch menu that another friend ordered from. He had a homemade asparagus soup to start that was a large bowl - he raved about it. Service was good, the atmosphere very pleasant. I'll go back for sure.

Author: Bailes35
Review: I went here for the first time with my girl friend and was not disappointed. We ordered the Ultimate Boat, which was far more than we could eat. The variety in this meal was quite impressive and the sushi tasted very fresh. Our server was very attentive and friendly. We will definitely be back!

Author: viajero5
Review: We weren't super hungry but wanted a bit of dinner so stopped in. It was fine sushi (not the best I've had but certainly not the worst). Reasonably priced.

Author: Spufi10
Review: We came here after a long day of sightseeing. Drinks were promptly brought. I had the vegetable teriyaki - good - and hubby had what appeared to be a box for 2 (?) but it was only for one! It was sooo much food!!! He ate approx. half & saved the other half for later. That, he said, was excellent.

Author: WCU95KA
Review: My family was in town for a softball tournament and wanted sushi. Wasabi was recommended by friends. I was a little disappointed they only had Japanese beer choices, but it was ok. The Shogun potatoes were very good. Sushi was pretty good. Not the best I've ever had but fresh and had good taste. Some rolls were better than others. Overall a strong B. Worth the trip

Author: Robert S
Review: Just had an excellent Bento Box for lunch at outdoor table. Salmon and chicken were cooked to perfection. Service excellent. Pleasant atmosphere inside. Sushi and sashimi always good as well. Have not had dinner there. Have taken my wife and family visiting from the West Coast there. They too were well pleased and satisfied. One of the few places where one can feel that they had something akin to cuisine. And a good value as well!

Author: Ace11962
Review: Love to drop by for lunchtime sushi. The lunch sushi specials are fresh and delicious served with your choice of salad or soup. My all time favorites are spicy tuna sushi or spicy tuna sashimi appetizer with a bowl of rice, dang bang shrimp, sumo roll or volcano roll. Service is excellent and the sushi chef is always friendly. Lunchtime is usually busy and the seating is limited.

Author: ecbronze
Review: We didn't experience any of the issues mentioned in other reviews. The staff was very friendly. I will say their take on the teriyaki entrees was different than what we're used to, but it was delicious. My husband and son really enjoyed the sushi too!

Author: Simslife
Review: The food at Wasabis was really good. We had sushi and the shrimp tempura. However, the service was poor. My soup, salad and entree all came at the same time!! I was bummed. I ended up sending the soup and salad back and just ate the entree.

Author: Jeffrey W
Review: We go here regularly when downtown. The sushi is fresh and the atmosphere is laid back. You may have to wait a bit during busy times, but it is well worth the wait.

Author: JDWL
Review: I had lunch here before the afternoon session at the conference began. I had five different rolls. All were fresh and tasty

Author: JerBob
Review: It was friendly staff and owner! We had a large group of 45 people. The staff was overwhelmed but the kitchen kicked out the food pretty fast. Excellent pizzaHuge subsOk saladsWe would return to this location!!!

Author: F9171ROashleys
Review: I am traveling with my family and stopped in Roanoke Virginia for the night. We stayed at the Days Inn off of 81 and were looking for delivery service. Franks delivered directly to our hotel room. Pizza was really good! Mozzarella sticks and deep fried raviolis were good too. Id order here again or recommend it to someone.

Author: ejm99
Review: Called in order for a medium sausage and pepperoni with extra sausage. Was given a time it would be ready. Arrived on time and pizza was ready. Pleasant experience. Pizza was delicious!! Highly recommend.

Author: SpiderEffect
Review: We always depend on Frank's for great tasting pizza. Our To-Go orders are generally ready before we arrive for pick up. A great place to get your 'Little Italy' fix !

Author: innerspark1
Review: Hands down, this Frank's has the best pies in town. I've been to the other Franks on Brambleton Ave, and not so good. This is some good ole New York style pizza. Great customer service. The guy that makes the pizza is consistent and knows how to make a pie. Awesome calzones...they are HUGE. This place rocks !

Author: Bravo111inf
Review: My wife and I ate at Frank's today 8/22/18. We have eaten there many times. As usual the food was great. Prompt service. Excellent subs and the Minestrone soup is the best around.

Author: JeffSidoti
Review: They still cook using the deck ovens which cook great!! Food was great. Service was prompt and fast. One server in the dining room and she was on top of every table.

Author: George G
Review: In this city, Frank's is the go to for pizza. We usually take out or have it delivered. Their cheese steaks and meatball subs are very good too. It beats the chain pizza resturants.

Author: Trip C
Review: This is a staple every time I'm in Roanoke. Delicious, straight forward pizza! Staff is super friendly and kitchen is efficient and professional. I wish I had one in SC!

Author: Stefanie M
Review: January 20 2018Love Frank's, until today. Ordered a Reuben and a Club. Comes with chips.Everything was wrong. Both sandwiches had the wrong cheese, suppose to be Swiss. The Club was taken back , was never remade, cheese was replaced. I was told she didn't want to slice Swiss today, the person who made this. Then she went to get the Swiss for the other sandwich, I noticed there was brown lettuce, very little, and very bad mushy tomato chunk on sandwich. I asked for a box, the server said very loudly, now what's wrong. I am going to take this with me. And I put the bad vegies on a napkin, and she took it away. So I ate chips. The other was okay, the Reuben. The attitudes were awful. Never was checked on after that. The only discount we got was the drinks were not charged to the bill. So had to go somewhere else to have lunch. We were long time patrons of this place, many years, after the embarrassment and the food, never again.

Author: Cora H
Review: Worst service Ive ever had in my life. Tonie is very unprofessional, accused me of lying, and threw away my food without any resolution. I asked for my biscuit and gravy to be heated or remade because it was cold and her response was sorry you let it sit so long, it had only been at the table 7 min tops if that. She was degrading and rude so of course I was upset, I just wanted something hot, and it wasnt even room temperature cold it was cold, like refrigerator, cold. She kept coming back and forth to my table making rude comments and trying to belittle me every chance she got. Because she did throw away my food without asking her manager first, she was obligated to make a new one which made her more pissed at me. Every chance she got she said its coming out of my pocket. I told her several times Id pay for it, and I left her enough tip to cover menu price of the entree. Honestly do not ever want to go back and really didnt want to pay for the meal itself after that awful experience. Hope no one has the pleasure of meeting her. All the other staff, aside from the manager she said was so horrible, everyone else seemed amazing. But never again.

Author: Becky J
Review: This was our first visit to a Waffle House. It was all we expected and more. Even though the place was very busy, we were quickly served. The food servings were more than ample, and our server was top notch. He checked back often to see if we needed anything. We will be returning.

Author: John M
Review: I ordered waffles with sausage and thought the texture of both were off - too soft. Perhaps just my taste buds today. Service was prompt and typical waffle house style.

Author: Steve L
Review: Came in for an early breakfast. I can highly recommend the hash brown bowl. As always the service is excellent and the quality is great. They cook to order and the food always arrives in a timely manner. The location has decent cleanliness. Its a pleasure watching the cook work, kinda like a dance. They know their job and their environment well. Definitely worth a visit.

Author: BoscoW52
Review: We try to eat breakfast at a Waffle House when we travel. First time at this one. I love the consistency between restaurants and can always count on a good meal.

Author: Steve L
Review: What can I say... it's the waffle house. As the typical chain location goes, this one is one of the best I've tried. It's recently been renovated so the inside is up to date. The food is of course, made to order and done well. The wait staff is extra friendly and service is fast. Nothing too fancy here, and like all the others, a wee bit limited with the standard menu but it's exactly what you'd expect from a Waffle House. One thing they need to work on, it is usually a bit dirty, floors and tables a bit greasy, but not over the top. Definitely not enough to keep you away!

Author: stephentQ9882WQ
Review: Enjoyed a good breakfast, great breakfast 3 eggs over medium cooked perfect, bacon hash browns and white toast. Coffee however was cold. But good service after coffee was topped off it was ok. Looked nice and clean and was busy.

Author: annmK2423FF
Review: Have never been to a Waffle House due to bad word of mouth from others over the years. The one in our city of Roanoke,VA closed up their old restaurant and reopened a new one close by. Yesterday we went there for breakfast and was quite surprised! Very clean,friendly employees,nice clienteles,good coffee. Our waitress,not so good. She was either new or had a hearing/ memory problem. We had to get up to get sweetener for the coffee from a different waitress,had to get the attention of another waitress to get drink refills. I wanted wheat but got white toast,I asked for hot tea and she was going to bring me coffee. No big deal but someone else,it might be. We will go back.

Author: leannamtucker
Review: They had good food, staff was ok but seems to be not so good part of town, we went straight to our rooms

Author: AmyF1965
Review: This Waffle House was right down the street from our hotel so it was perfect. The staff was super friendly, the food was good and fast! enjoyed it and would eat there again.

Author: Cecilia C
Review: The staff was able to accommodate my food sensitivities without inconveniencing any other patrons. I had the filet and shrimp and it was cooked perfectly. The bill did come with a 18% add-on and a recommended tip list. My policy is that if venues tip themselves that's is all they get! Needless to say they got their 18% but nothing additional. Yes it is one of my pet peeves.

Author: Only_One_Mike61
Review: Food was good, Chef was good, service was very sub-par. Got our sushi after we were getting our food, took 15 for drinks. Asked for a bday cake for my fiance, never got it so they gave us a peice of pie togo. wont be going back.

Author: Aubrey L
Review: First visits are really fun, but second visits get predictable and boring. Once a year is often enough. Prices are ridiculously high for the quality of food you get. (Lots and lots of rice)

Author: litulk2018
Review: Wanted Japanese. We love the show that comes with dinner. The food is always good. We went to another Japanese first and was told it would be over an hour wait to be seated. Chose Ichiban and was seated within 15 minutes. Staff were very friendly and the food was very good.

Author: revrpb619
Review: After taking my daughter back to school we needed to have dinner, she suggested Ichiban.Without a reservation we got a table immediately: good. The place was busy, but we still got a table: better.Without ordering, they brought us menus and Miso soup and salads (they were not on the bill): bonus. The sushi was fresh, generously served and very well sliced and served, this I appreciated (I frequent a lot of sushi houses)They also have a Hibatchi room, if that is to your liking. There is a respectable liquor menu: beer/wine/booze.Parking is ample.Considering that we are from a major metropolitan area with a huge Asian population, we were not disappointed, even though we were well off the beaten path, in Salem, VA.

Author: Steve H
Review: We went to Ichiban for my Nieces Graduation Celebration, we where greeted with friendly smiles and the service and pour chef was awesome. Highly recommend.

Author: FTellian
Review: This is probably the best hibachi-style restaurant in Roanoke. The entire meal is prepared in front of you, so everything is fresh. We recently celebrated a birthday there with family and friends. The menu offers steak, shrimp, chicken, pork. Additionally there is a sizeable sushi menu to select from. They have a full bar for refreshments. The chef was very attentive to our requests as well as putting on quite a show as he cooked our meals.

Author: Debbi_DiFran
Review: It's worth the wait and making a reservation is the secret. My teenagers love to catch shrimp in their mouths during the hibachi chef show. Sushi on Thursday is just $1 and the other sushi specials are very tastey!

Author: aneishar2016
Review: Was a bit worried about the service due to reviews but it was great. Chef was friendly and staff was also. Food was delicious and the price was affordable. I would return.

Author: 264bridgettm
Review: First of all this is a traditional Japanese Steakhouse where the food is prepard infront of you. My husband, son(1 year old), and I visited this restaurant on vacation. The baseball game was cancelled so we had some time. The service was excellent. The hostess ask if we wanted our sons highchair placed between us for convienance. The service was prompt and the environment was clean and neat. The cook was very easy to understand and courteous. He even asked if the baby was okay with fire before he lit the grill. We had a great time. Be warned there is an 18% mandatory tip added to your bill. As with any Japanese Steakhouse the price is a more than an usual steakhouse because it is basically food and a show. The food was very good, high quality and prepared well. Nothing bad to say.

Author: 801joef
Review: This was our second visit, the first was just the bar and music. Tonight we were upstairs and enjoyed a great beet salad and a amazing tasty bean burger! All fresh and tasty. The beer selection is unbelievable with choices from east to west! Amazing tap selection! Great wine list also! Desserts are to die for. Also great service as our waiter was attentive too all our needs! Live music later in the evening that was fantastic! If you want some good food, lively atmosphere and good drink you have to go to Blue!! It was Christmas in July last night! Great band and new menu!!!!

Author: Voyage50090366866
Review: Held wedding rehearsal dinner here...a little tight on setting, tables too close together, but good service and great food.

Author: rezz049
Review: We had our Sons Wedding Recital dinner there. It was in the bottom room. It was very clean and beautiful. the staff was superb. The food was GREAT!!!!

Author: Outdoorsman1959
Review: My wife, daughter and I decided to make a reservation to listen to a Jazz and Blues band. The service was excellent, the appetizers that included salmon and duck fries were delicious and we enjoyed a dirty martini and dewar's with ginger ale. We highly recommend Blue 5 for a Night Out.

Author: Paul L
Review: Dined and enjoyed the band--a latin jazz band--at Blue Five for the first time last night. Loved everything. First it is occupying an historical gem, with a '20s style balcony. Second the staff are very friendly and yet not in your face. And I had the ribs with macaroni pie and collard greens, all of which were excellent, but most especially with bacon and just enough heat; and my date had the chicken sandwich and fries. The beer list is amazing, and they let you sample if your not sure. And then their was the band. Very tight and fun to dance to.

Author: 801joef
Review: This was our second visit, the first was just the bar and music. Tonight we dined upstairs and enjoyed a great beet salad and a amazing tasty bean burger! All fresh and tasty. The beer selection is unbelievable with choices from east to west! Amazing tap selection! Great wine list also! Desserts are to die for. Also great service as our waiter was attentive too all our needs! Live music later in the evening that was fantastic! If you want some good food, lively atmosphere and good drink you have to go to Blue!!

Author: pennym943
Review: It was reccomended from our hotel staff as a fun spot while we were in town. We were not disappointed. The place was pretty crowded when we arrived about 8:30 Saturday night. The music was great and our dinner was fabulous. We split the Mo-Joe steak with whipped potatoes and collard greens, OMG! The chocolate fog butter was crazy good. Would love to go back...

Author: SaxMon
Review: We love going to Blue 5 with friends for good food and music. We usually go on Wednesday evenings to hear Hoppie Vaughan and the Ministers of Soul who are fantastic. If you haven't heard Hoppie you need to. A great combination of food and live music!

Author: TeamNextGenChris
Review: We've eaten here several times, and always been pleased. The menu changes quite a bit, so it's hard to recommend dishes, but we've liked everything we've tried here- it's hard to go wrong.

Author: 360marionb
Review: We went here for dinner after reading about it on a review website. The place has excellent food and a huge beer selection, which was one of the reasons we chose it. I had teriyaki salmon and it was perfect. My wife had a pasta dish and she enjoyed it.

Author: James P
Review: Good service and food served in an attractive setting. But the coffee - $2.89 for stuff not as good as McDonalds.

Author: Go567289
Review: We stopped in for brunch on a busy Saturday morning. The wait was only about 10 minutes. Service was very nice from start to end. The biggest issue we had was how slow it was to get our food. Overall food was decent. The breakfast potatoes were by far my favorite! Food was decent just wish it could be made faster.

Author: Vincent C
Review: On a recent visit, just wanted a little something to hold us over to lunch a couple hours later. The roasted or baked potatoes were under seasoned and a little more al dente than Im guessing anybody would want to eat. The Butternut Squash bisque tasted like a giant scoop of sour cream with a shake or 2 of nutmeg.....nothing at all resembling a butternut squash taste. Actually it tasted more like pumpkin than butternut squash. The bacon looked and tasted like it was precooked and warmed up in some kind of oven or microwave......nothing fresh or crispy about it! Maybe the cook should consider driving for Uber!

Author: TravelLover283
Review: Visited for breakfast on a Saturday and the restaurant was busy but not crowded, which is always good. The wife had the multi-grain pancake with bacon - the pancake was large and very good, with a slight crust on the bottom (nice!) and the bacon appeared to have been oven cooked rather than fried in a pan. Bacon was firm and very crispy with a great flavor. I had the Tri-Fecta (chose the options of two eggs over medium with turkey link sausage and one multi-grain pancake). Pancake was same as previously stated, eggs were fresh, cooked as ordered and the turkey link sausage was very good. Will stop by again when in the area!

Author: Barbara G
Review: Enjoyed this place very much. It has a very varied menu and all items are very fresh, of good quality using whole grain breads and fresh greens. Coffee is served without additional charge and it is their brew. Very good coffee, I must say. Service was good, prompt and not overly intrusive yet good attention to our needs. It IS a chain restaurant but did not feel like a chain atmosphere.My only issue was how noisy it was, poor acoustics. This was my second visit and I WILL be back!

Author: Z4733GAamyc
Review: Ive had amazing experiences with this place in the Richmond area so I know its potential. First time at this location. I arrived 6 minutes late, so if there was more spent time between the waitress and my cohorts, who had already ordered, I was not privy. Based on my personal experience, I saw the waitress when she took my order and again when she picked up plates and dropped checks. Nary a check-in to learn/correct that my cooked to death omelette housed slices of avocado harder than the bacon also inside of the bacado. Never topped off my beverage. Theres too much competition in this area for me to care if I go back.

Author: Debra S
Review: Definition of Meh: uninspiring; unexceptional. Seems appropriate for our visit. Took forever for our order to be taken (approximately 9:30 a.m. on a Thursday) but food did come out fast. Bacon was horribly overcooked and for me not to eat but 1 bite of it, my kid knew it wasn't good.

Author: davidsT1732ZN
Review: We had heard great things about and were anxious to try First Watch. Arrived about 12:30 PM. It was not very busy, but the staff acted like it was quitting time which was 2:00 PM. Long wait to take our order, longer wait to receive out food and even longer to receive the check. Restaurant floor was very littered and the restrooms were filthy. Won't be returning. Food was good but I would not consider it a value.

Author: Gohoosao
Review: I sat down and the glare from a car was directly in my eyes. I walked up to cashier to ask if she could lower the blinds. She replied, I cant but Ill get someone who can. My breakfast arrived I ate with the glare in my eyes. Very positive was the Million Dollar Bacon. Food is good but only average.

Author: wonderdog1974
Review: The food was spot on but it was a little noisy in there and tight. The absolute worst thing was that the Manager walked by our table at least 20 times without speaking, a nod, a smile , or even eye contact. What a loser.

Author: Jim112263
Review: In town for a few days and stopped by Oriental House for dinner. It's a great place for Thai food. Food was tasty, lots of variety on the menu. Thai iced tea was wonderful...and in a very large glass. Staff was friendly. Enjoyable atmosphere and experience. Might have to pay them another visit before I leave town.

Author: 126deden
Review: Sushi, Thai, Asian specialties. Pad Thai and Sweet and Sour Pork were delicious. Owner was very gracious and accommodating. We'll definitely return!

Author: Traveler11375
Review: Absolutely loved the Thai food at Oriental House. Not only was the food authentic just like you'd get in Thailand, the service is excellent. Peter, the owner, is a perfect host. He chats with the patrons and makes everyone feel at home, in customary Thai fashion. The menu is quite varied. I've eaten there several times and would confidently recommend any dish. Kudos to Oriental House!!

Author: Femalebiker
Review: I picked up something to go, dumplings and beef ginger perfect. The owners were so kind and proud of their menu and they should be. The gentleman told me when he gave me my package that this was good Thai... he was wrong it was Amazing Thai!! I hope to get a chance to go again before I leave town. Also a beautiful restaurant.. a great date place or place to go with friends. Very warm atmosphere.

Author: KHill7707
Review: Stopped into Oriental House after our other two choices were closed on a Sunday afternoon, and Im so glad! Oriental House is wonderful great menu, wonderful service and amazing food! We had the chicken satay appetizer, Shanghai clay pot, and the chicken pad Thai. Everything was wonderful! Lots of sauces available to add heat up the dishes. We were able to sample a few other dishes (drunken noodles and some sweet rice dish). Im glad we ended up here!

Author: brianm124
Review: Having lived in the DC area, Ive been spoiled with good Thai food. This place is just as good and at a different level than other restaurants in Roanoke. Order anything with noodles, you will not be disappointed. Very friendly management and staff.

Author: Martinex
Review: Have been here several times and this is first rate authentic Thai. Best I've had in Roanoke. Charming service also. A welcome addition to downtown.

Author: Mike O
Review: Thai is our favorite food and we are delighted to have another choice for this kind food in Roanoke; a very good choice. The two of us stopped by for an early dinner at 5PM on a Wednesday and were immediately greeted and seated; we were the only customers at that time. The interior looked rather sleek and spartan, with notes suggestive of Thailand. Their appeared to be about 20 tables as well as seats at the bar area. We were pleased to find that their extensive menu, which included some choices from other countries near Thailand, was identical to what was posted on the restaurant's website. Our Summer Roll app had fresh vegetables wrapped in iceberg lettuce and rice paper. The Pad Thai chicken, which is a dish that I learned to make during a cooking class in Bangkok, and which I often order at restaurants, did differ a bit from what I was accustomed to; it had fewer ingredients (did not detect bamboo shoots, tofu, or egg) and was considerably sweeter. The Green Curry was the star of our meal; boldly spiced, full flavored, with firm bits of Thai eggplant and fresh basil. Interestingly, we recognized our waiter, whose name we did not catch, from the nearby Thai Continental restaurant; he explained that he was happy that he changed (he may be the owner as well). We sure hope this new Thai restaurant is a success; I think we would benefit from finally having a good Thai restaurant in Roanoke.

Author: j0yceg0rd0n
Review: We go to Roanoke quite often for lunch or dinner on Saturdays. McAlister's Deli is one of my favorites. From the club sandwich to the Rachel Sandwich with the tomato and cucumber salad and a cookie to top it off, delicious all the way around.

Author: John H
Review: Not very friendly staff, alright generic sandwich. Some trash on the floor. Staff could barely talk to you.

Author: Spankyff
Review: Food was very good and the employees seemed very friendly. Not a long wait time during our visit. Would visit this location again.

Author: innerspark1
Review: My wife and I have been to McAlister's many times. We always receive great customer service. The staff is always friendly and smiling. The food is very good and they have a vast menu with many options. Good sized portions, you get your money's worth. Fair priced.

Author: Kim H
Review: Plenty of good sandwiches, especially ones with roast beef, and salads. Has improved kids' meals by including a nice activity book (drinks extra). Iced tea is reportedly very good, but we are not tea drinkers. Some outdoor seating... but looks out on parking lot.

Author: Heather M
Review: We ordered a chef salad and a cobb salad. Both salads lacked flavor. There was only 3 small pieces of bacon in the chef salad and there was so little guac in the cobb. The salads could have used more dressing too. Sadly we had to clean the table even though there weren't very many people in the restaurant. Was a disappointment compared to previous visits.

Author: coachchrista23
Review: Good food, a little pricey. Excellent carrot cake. Service is pretty fast, and the setting is nice. Good place for a lunch date!

Author: Juliet H
Review: My mom and I love McAllister's! Despite it being expensive, their tea is fabulous and the food is so good! I love their sandwiches and salads, never had a bad experience. I tend to get the fruit cup side. I'm picky about fruit but their fruit is ALWAYS fresh. The staff is attentive and friendly at all times, too. Highly recommend! But beware you'll pay more than you might expect.

Author: loricolonna
Review: Went to this restaurant with a group of 4 for a quick lunch. We got a variety of sandwiches which we all enjoyed. The sides which we had, which included fresh sreamed vegetables and soup, were well prepared and tasty. The prices here are a bit more than a typical sandwich shop, but we all agreed it was worth it for the quality of the food!

Author: joe0277
Review: So my buddy is pretty picky when it comes to eating out. When he finds a place he likes he eats there until they mess it up. Every time we work together and are close to McAlisters, this is our lunch spot. Lunch is about $10 per person but he always pays so I cant complain too much. Probably eaten here 6-7 times now and always get the McAlister wrap and its always the same and never disappoints me. My buddy always gets the regular club and it too looks great. The Cole slaw is so so and the potato salad is pretty good. The tea is really good, but get half and half unless you like it really sweet. All in all its a pretty good sandwich shop, just wouldnt hurt if they dropped the prices a dollar or two.

Author: Jackie1947_65
Review: Very nice Mexican decor throughout the restaurant. Wonderful smell as you walk in. The white sauce was very good. I ordered a number 2 combo dinner. This was supposed to be a taco, burrito and chalupo. I ordered water to drink. All 3 of these are high on my list of favorites when it comes to Mexican food. The taco was fine, you really can't hurt a taco. The beef burrito was somewhat dry and had an usual taste that I personally did not care so much for. Now for the chalupo. First of all, I am not convinced that they gave me a chalupo. If it was, it was more on to order of a mini salad. My wife felt the same. I would not order it again. The senorita that waited on us was not very friendly. We would thank her, but get very little response back. My friend and I across the table had to ask twice to get water refills. My wife ordered a combo dinner with one of her three items being a chicken chimichanga. It came beef instead. This is strictly my opinion. Yours may be entirely different. I encourage you to make you own decision based on your own personal experience.

Author: Jasmine B
Review: We ate here twice this week of August 2019. The food is great and not too expensive. The waiter have better attitude and service than the waitress. If you stay at Quality Inn up the block please ask for your 10% discount on your check. We love their Tilapia Platter, the fish is not too dried and serve with rice, grilled vegetable and spicy cumber salad. We also ordered the Fajitas Texanas, Tilapia Tacos, and Chile Verde, and Chicken Quesadilla. Others were great as well accept and if i have to chose which was i least favorite dish i would have to say it is the Chile Verde, too much meat!

Author: Tuckersrunner
Review: We are here after a great day of motorcycling riding. Simple Mexican food with good to large sized portions. Price per plate comparable to other chain Mexican restaurants.Pros: excellent service, family or couple friendly, affordable.Cons: none noted.We really enjoyed the friendly staff and low key atmosphere.It is a bit kitschy but in a fun way.Try the churro bowl with icecream! Awesome sweet treat!

Author: toofrank4u
Review: First of all, the building is fresh and cared for, and very Latino Motif. Inside- a Bright and Fresh 'Fresco Especial", from booth to chair backs....Clean. Tight. And Frankly, Also Friendly.I chose to "Taste it all!" Even our awesome waiter (Hambleth) raised his eyes and warned me, lol!Madam chose Chimichanga Camarones (Shrimp Chimichanga)...Nothing survived,Thoughts are that's all there is to say......Me-- MY Choice.... To Really SEE what they Have... 1. Enchilada (KILLER).2.DOS Tacos (Very FINE)3. TostaGuac (OMFG-Superior!)4. Tamale? Tamal.... Horrid...And 5 star falls BUT....5. Beans, Rice, salsa... FINE!I recommend this location

Author: gcassady
Review: Stopped in for the lunch buffet. Very reasonably priced with a large selection of options. The buffet table was constantly being wiped down and restocked. The food was fresh and delicious. The serve 3 sizes of Margaritas. A new favorite spot to go. They have gluten free as well as vegan

Author: 977samd
Review: El Toreo Mexican Restaurant is located 6617 Thirlane Road, Roanoke, VA 24019, 540-265-9116, off I-81. The restaurant is quite large with a uniquely, colorful, Mexican decor with booth and table service, and a full service liquor bar with stools, large paved parking lot with outdoor security lights, stop serving at 9:30 PM, closes at 10:00 PM. Enjoy.

Author: OfirSch
Review: Even before the food arrived, the music, the decoration, and the nice staff got us into the atmosphere. The Mexican beer also helped :)The food itself was great, and there were plenty of meals to choose from. Finally, the check arrived and we were surprised for good! It was a very fair price for the meals we had and for the experience. I will definitely come back if i ever return to roanoak.

Author: David E
Review: It's your basic Mexican restaurant where the plates are hot and most dishes come with rice and beans. The portions are big and the food was good. Service was good.

Author: LeAnn H
Review: Clean and friendly great menu. Staff and managers great. easy to find lots of parking and good hours open

Author: Kim H
Review: Tasty Mexican food -- flavorful, if salty, mole sauce on enchiladas is a favorite. Restaurant is full of carved, colorful, casual wooden chairs that add whimsy. Would have been a typical meal -- but made terrific by our server's friendliness and sincere apology of action with a drink order mistake. Well done.

Author: davidtD4888GT
Review: We came here for Friday dinner. Pasta, salmon, chicken. It was all good! Desserts were awesome! The homemade bread was fantastic. The salmon soup was absolutely delicious. Didnt find anything that wasnt good.

Author: helend0407
Review: Today our food was wonderful, the service was exceptional, and the atmosphere was nice. Definitely a great place for weekday or Saturday lunch

Author: Don A
Review: We went there for a family dinner. Everyone thought their meal was delicious. The service was exceptional - very attentive, friendly, and presented meal options for our gluten free diners. There was a nice variety of selections. The meat loaf sandwich (Lucky Loaf) was excellent. Several in my party had seasonal bowls with chicken, vegetables, and rice which they really enjoyed. There was a nice variety of beer selections - something for everyone. And to end the meal there were lots of different cakes to choose from as well as other dessert offerings. We all had the carrot cake which was an excellent finish to our meal.

Author: VTMJE
Review: Awesome dining. Evie's Wildflower restaurant Bistro and Bakery is so GOOD YOUR TASTE BUDS WILL THANK YOU FOR DINING We had a cup of salmon claim chowder soup for starters. Awesome THEN Grilled Turkey W/Tomatoes & Pesto Sandwich DELICIOUSLY Combining all ingredients to a satisfying end.DESERT was cake " BETTER THAN SEX" REALLY YUMMY. Berry herbal tea DELICIOUS. ALL ITEMS ABOUT $30. BE ADVISED EVIE'S IS ABOUT to change name By dropping WILDFLOWER. SO IF YOU GO LOOKING.A MUST VISIT WHILE IN ROANOKE VA.

Author: Beth S
Review: We were staying in Roanoke for two nights and this restaurant was highly recommended. So glad we went. The food was delicious! A must do dining experience if you are in the area.

Author: Paul L
Review: Used to eat here all the time, but haven't been for years. Was very nice to revisit one of my old favorites. Had Seared Salmon Salad. Fish was a little under-cooked but still amazing! Service is good and quaint setting.

Author: Irene L
Review: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed listening to Isaac Hadden play and sing as we had dinner. It was a nice volume level - easy to hear but not too loud to talk over. The variety and quality of his performance were top notch!So entertainment at wildflour was new but the food and beverages were as outstanding as ever. I really enjoyed the salad special - blackened shrimp with blue cheese. My husband enjoyed the pasta salad and a Reuben. One cannot skip the sweets at wildflour! I had chocolate raspberry mousse cake. He had fresh strawberry rhubarb pie. We enjoyed the Malbac, too. Isaac will return July 6. Put it on your calendar if you're in town!

Author: O4480QBmariem
Review: I came to Wildflower Cafe after reading reviews.Thet were advertising their home made chicken salad. The quantity is appropriate and plated with care. I purchased a pint to bring home, it was that good.Location is in a strip mall with grocery,speciality stores and other restruants. Wildflower is a place you have to look for at The Towers Shopping Area.

Author: mary a
Review: Just in town for the Virginia Garden Tour. Ate here on the recommendation of our Airbnb host. A quick walk through an interesting neighborhood to this quirky, airy local favorite. Food was GREAT, fresh, creative, and the service was excellent. Unpretentious and fun. Multi-generational clientele. Just sorry we were too full to try the yummy looking desserts!

Author: johnandshirley
Review: We visited this place for lunch last week - really enjoyed it. We were in town for a wedding and stopped in here on a recommendation from a friend. The decor is quirky but fun. They make their own bread, so we mainly chose sandwiches. Overall the menu seemed like a lot of healthy options. Everyone enjoyed their meal. The server was very kind and helpful.

Restaurant: Tony Avellino's New York style pizza
Author: Starr G
Review: Best Cheese Steak Special in the valley, HOT!!! not spicy, but fresh HOTLocally owned and operated, nice employees

Restaurant: Tony Avellino's New York style pizza
Author: annmK2423FF
Review: After living in LA,CA for 36 yrs and living in the Roanoke area for 13,weve been seeking a really good pizza. Finally found it! The pipizza was perfect,great crust,good sauce,good cheese. It wasnt dripping with oil,not greasy and the large was HUGH! Prices were also good for everything on their extensive menu. Smallish place,clean,but chilly(ac) and tables were cleaned after customers left,immediately,but with BLEACH which was disgusting to smell while eating. I know it disinfects but it was over the top smelling it!!! They do a big take out service.

Restaurant: Tony Avellino's New York style pizza
Author: leslieandcats
Review: Weve had pizza here several times now and each time its been great. Also the best cold leftover pizza Ive eaten.

Restaurant: Tony Avellino's New York style pizza
Author: ejm99
Review: Saturday night. Called in order to go. Given order number and minutes until ready. Order was ready at time promised. Converted Waffle House building. Staff pleasant. Medium pizza is 14 inch. With two meats and cheese price is just under $$16 including tax. Sausage and pepperoni was excellent.Recommend!

Restaurant: Tony Avellino's New York style pizza
Author: Jimmy H
Review: If you're looking for a great Philly cheesesteak then look no further. the service is fast and very friendly.

Restaurant: Tony Avellino's New York style pizza
Author: KMarnWVU
Review: I've been here a couple times already since I first went about a week ago. The pizza is really good, and the cheesesteak is downright delicious. The guy who runs the place can be a little brusque, but I thought he was really nice. There's no table service, and the decor of the place isn't really the best. The food is the focus of this place.The cheesesteak is maybe the best in the valley, although I haven't had the one at NY Pizza in a while to compare. They've got a plain cheesesteak as well as a cheesesteak special (peppers, onions, mushrooms). Both are fantastic. The pizza is very good. The hot Italian sandwich was also really good.The arancini (rice balls) were disappointing, and the cold Italian was average. Stick with the other items listed above, and you're going to have a really good meal.

Restaurant: Tony Avellino's New York style pizza
Author: ejm99
Review: Saturday night. Called in order to go. Given order number and minutes until ready. Order was ready at time promised. Converted Waffle House building. Staff pleasant. Large pizza is 18. With two meats and cheese price is just under $20 including tax. Sausage and pepperoni was excellent.Recommend!

Restaurant: Tony Avellino's New York style pizza
Author: Diane1313
Review: So far, we have only tried their pizza and it is great! We bought a mushroom and pepperoni 14 inch and we ate it for 3 meals. There was a lot of mozzarella, just the way we like it. The people were very efficient and it was ready and hot just when they said it would be. It is a great addition to the neighborhood.

Restaurant: Tony Avellino's New York style pizza
Author: Betty S
Review: The ordering process was very disorganized, there were two people giving conflicting answers to questions when we ordered.There is no one waiting tables and they seem to expect customers to know the ordering process. I ordered scrambled eggs, bacon(crisp) and toast. The eggs were not done and i asked that they be recooked. The cook seemed offended, but the eggs were no more cooked the second time. And the rest of the meal was cold. The bacon was no more crisp than a wet noodle. I expressed my dissatisfaction when paying and the attitude was "oh well". VERY DISSATISFIED!!!!

Restaurant: Tony Avellino's New York style pizza
Author: Patay1
Review: We watched the renovation of the old Waffle House with great anticipation. Now they're finally open and we orderedt take out on Friday night. HUGE pizza with ground beef, mushrooms, green pepper and banana pepper - YUMMY! Also got the Cheese Steak Special with mushrooms, peppers and onions. It was enormous - and delicious! So Glad they're on this side of town now too!

Author: walkntall509
Review: Our first visit with Frankie Rowlands was great! Our second visit not so much. My steak was under cooked and his was over cooked. When the waiter came by to check on us we explained that the cooks must have gotten our steak temperatures mixed up. I did ask him if my steak could be cooked a little longer. For the price you pay you definitely expect it to be great every time. The waiter was nice and the manager did come out and wanted me to cut the steak to make sure it was cooked correctly. It was correct. My boyfriend at that time had already finished his meal by the time I received mine. We were both disappointed and hope that its not like that every other time we come. We do give second chances so, we will be back. I just hope we can eat together the next time we come and our meal is what we pay for.

Author: Hotdog49
Review: This has got to be the best steak I've ever eaten. The waiters were on the spot and the ambience was superb. Cannot wait to be back in that area again.

Author: rrconklin
Review: Recently celebrated a 50th birthday party here and the staff were excellent and extremely accommodating. The menu is mostly steak and some seafood and everything is al la carte. The wine list is varied but not overwhelming and reasonably priced. The menu is a bit expensive for the Roanoke area but is well prepared and everyone seemed to enjoy their selections from the Lamb Chops, Salmon, and steaks. The side dishes we ordered and shared were the excellent. For personal taste I felt my steak which was the Rib Eye, ordered medium rare, was very salty which must be the seasoning mix. Although I didnt send it back I should have. Outside of that issue the evening was perfect. The staff went out of their way to make it memorable. Overall an excellent choice for a special night out in Roanoke, VA.

Author: traviz
Review: This was my first visit to Frankie Rowland's and I must say it was a night to remember! I've been to Roanoke many times this year and for some reason had never heard about this place. Roanoke is a special place for my fiance' and I and so I decided to propose to her at the Roanoke star. When looking for a nice place to go to dinner after the proposal I found Frankie Rowland's. The reviews looked good and I had others speaking highly of it so it sounded like the perfect place for my new fiance' and I to celebrate. We were seated at a table sort of to ourselves which was nice. This is a small restaurant and if they had been crowded it would have felt a little bit like you were on top of each other but we had a small wall to one side of our table and the tables to the other side of us were empty so this made it great for an intimate dinner. Our server was a very nice lady. She took care of us really well. We started off with drinks and I had the pineapple martini. It was okay but I would have preferred it a bit sweeter. We also had a few other drinks that were good.My fiance' and I shared a filet that was quite delicious, especially with the clarified butter put on it. We also had the shrimp and lobster tail both which were very tasty. The sauce used for the shrimp was very good. On the side we had the au gratin potatoes and the brussel sprouts. These were some of the best brussel sprouts I had ever had. The glaze and bacon on them just made them so delicious! Since we had just gotten engaged they gave us a free dessert and we got the creme crme brle. My fiance' likes strawberries so we requested those and they were able to put strawberries on top. It was so good and made the end to our night very enjoyable. My only minor complaint was the coffee I got with dessert. It was very weak and not up to the level I would have expected for a restaurant of this caliber. The food here is not cheap so most people will want to reserve this for a special occasion but I would certainly recommend it anytime you want to take your significant other to a meal they will not soon forget. From start to finish they made our engagement night so much better! I can't wait to go back sometime.

Author: T9136ZEtonyp
Review: Dinner with friends and had a wonderful time. Cocktails and wine were very good. I had the tomahawk rib eye medium rare and it was amazing! Very tender and packed with flavor! Scallops on the side were excellent! Service was very good. If you feel like a splurge, Frankie Rowlands is a good choice!

Author: infoX9636PF
Review: We drove up from VB to have a look at the blue ridge mountains and stayed in Roanoke.Whilst in town we was recommended this restaurant by a bar tender.The food and service were second to none but what did it for me was the way we were treated as we were totally underdressed.But rather than have to go back and get changed we were warmly welcomed and treated as if we were suited and booted its something we could learn from back home.If i was ever within a 100 miles of this restaurant i would call in again.Thank for a lovely evening

Author: Anne H
Review: Love being able to drop in for a late lunch on fridays here. Yesterday had a wonderful lunch experience. Candace our waitress was amazing. She was cheerful and personable.Food was excellent. Oysters Rockefeller always a fav and the key lime martinis a must!!It is well worth the $$$.

Author: QsbyTraveler
Review: Attended a business dinner at this elegant restaurant. Service is superb! Each course of the meal was excellent! Portions are hearty. Colleagues chose the steaks and were more than satisfied. I choose the bourbon salmon and was very happy with the results. Careful on the delicious pineapple martini. Theyre ample while tasty. A great dining experience.

Author: mmb198
Review: Nice place to take customers or friends. Prime steak seems to be their specialty, and they prepare it perfectly. Service is excellent and professional. Pricey but worth it.

Author: 841edwardf
Review: Frankies did not disappoint again. Ethan was a very attentive and polite server. The surf and turf was amazing. If you havent had a steak here. You are missing one of the best I ever had. Tender cooked to perfection. Dessert of creme brle was very tasty. We will be back.

Author: 77jp
Review: Were traveling and looked for an Italian restaurant close to our motel... we lucked out; This place is a hidden treasure. There were about 6 people ahead of us but they moved them through quickly. The server was friendly and attentive without going overboard. I had chicken piccata which was really, really good. Husband had Stromboli and really liked it. He asked to leave all of the vegetables out and they were happy to oblige. Wish we had a Sals where we live.

Author: Becky V
Review: A masterpiece,a delicious gift for your taste buds.Pizza the way it was meant to be.If you are anywhere near this amazing little restaurant,please do not miss it.The quality,the taste,the service...pure excellence,Thank you,thank you,thank you

Author: Barbara C
Review: Family had lunch today and several different items were ordered Everyone enjoyed the food and the service was great!

Author: rven4ever
Review: Ok have mixed feelings so will start off with the good. Food was very good on everything we ordered. Price was reasonable and place was clean. Knocking off a couple points for this reason. After we finished the meal we were sitting around talking. Place had lots of open tables so it wasnt like we were taking up space. We received our bill so paid for it and continued enjoying our visit. When we asked for a refill of our drinks (just pop and sweet teas) we were told since we had cleared our bill she could not give us refills without charging us again.I really felt like ordering the drinks and taking it out of her tip. Most restaurants give out unlimited refills and even togo glasses . The idea of stopping service just cause we paid our bill put me off.They just lost a future customer over the few pennies for the refills and get a 2 star review

Author: mikemillsaps
Review: Great place to eat. My wife and I live near by and enjoy eating here. Great food and service. Also friendly and fresh food.

Author: Brandon W
Review: For a 9 dollar sub I expect to get full. Talking about portion control.. Ordered the chicken parmigiana sub. More bread than anything. Horrible. That was a first and last visit. Keep the 9 bucks. Apparently you need it.. Thanks for the bread!

Author: Trickyfae
Review: First walking in it seemed overly dark but after going from the entry way to the dining area it became much brighter. We were the only customers there at 5pm which in my opinion is never a good sign. There were paintings everywhere and the decor was not overly italian cheesy. The linens and glass tops were a very nice choice but the fold lines in the linens looked just lazy. We were greeted by a friendly gentleman who seated us. Our waitress came over and I immediately was questioning the place due to her bad appearance just shy of a bad drag interpretation. She was friendly but after ordering an appetizer she asked me to point it out like she didn't know the menu. When the Bruschetta Al Granchio came out it looked lovely I unfortunately was to excited to taste it that I failed at getting a photo. We ordered our food my husband got the marsala I ordered the alfredo. I had put the wine menu down to order my food and when I went to pick it back up the waitress took it away. I wasnt about to stop her one less thing on my bill I guess. Our food was delicious the marsala was a great flavor you could definitely taste the wine sauce as it has a teriyaki type flavor, and the alfredo was as expected. The waitress was well mannered and kept up with our waters. When we ordered our deserts we asked for 2 cannolis one in a box and one here. They both came in a box and by that time the waitress had disappointed me enough we paid our bill and went on our way. I think this restaurant would have been five stars if not for the server. I will however be returning as I enjoyed my meal mostly the appetizer but I will not be sitting with that waitress again.

Author: TreeHugger54
Review: The food, people, service and setting were all great. This is real Italian food that is very reasonable price. The people are great. Highly recommend dining there if you get the opportunity.

Author: Savyluncher
Review: Finally had a real Italian dinner. The preparation was up to par. Service was excellent and very friendly. Had Chicken Parm with Spaghetti and tossed salad. Hubby had Sausage and peppers and it was delicious according to him.

Author: MrsKerren18
Review: We had been to this restaurant when it first opened and weren't overly impressed. However, we recently learned that on Sundays, they offer free Canolis for dessert. The dining room(s) are clean and quickly bused for incoming guests. The servers are prompt and neatly dressed in uniforms. The menu is pretty standard, without much imagination or deviation from 'Americanized Italian' options. My husband got baked spaghetti, which looked and tasted like Chef Boy ArDee. I ordered what I thought was clam white sauce (only described as white sauce), but it turned out to be garlic and oil...which was ok, but not what I expected. The clams were still in shell, so clearly not mixed with the sauce. It was ok, but not what I expected and nothing to write home about. Nothing comes with the meals (such as a salad), and the roles were hard, and hardly done baking. The inside tasted very doughy.The server didn't bring up the canolis until we asked about the dessert menu. We noticed that no one in our vicinity had canolis, so perhaps they weren't offering them anymore. It turns out they did have them, and they were the best thing of our lunch.I can remember now why we didn't return. As my husband said, "at least we didn't spend a fortune to be reminded."

Author: psudino
Review: I was here on business and after dinner I came here with two of my business colleagues. One of them after a few too many drinks is kind of a...donkey. Besides the old school decor, good drinks and above average healthy pour, the bartender was wonderfully sarcastic and sassy. My other colleague and I enjoyed the show as she handled the donkey guy with grace and humor. Bravo to her!

Author: Angela G
Review: My husband and I enjoyed a casual meal at The Pine Room Pub. The atmosphere has a charming, boys club atmosphere. The food was good but the cocktails were the star of the show. The wait staff was attentive and friendly.

Author: kenmartin2018
Review: This sports bar is very warm and comfortable with soft colors and pinewood walls. It is a quiet atmosphere even though it is a sports bar. Sandwiches are great.

Author: raysfire1
Review: I arrived late Sunday night and I went to the hotel restaurant called The Pine Room for a bite. I was very surprised that there was only one veggie plate...a veggie wrap....no tuna, fish, or a veggie burger. Well, since it was late, I had no choice but to have the veggie wrap. Not impressed, no flavor, no spices, very bland taste. The only reason I still have it 3 rating was because the service was very attentive. Still, I will not be back.

Author: KShawnT
Review: We had a great time hanging out at the pub. It was great being able to listen to live music - made for a nice close to the days.

Author: donl355
Review: Constructed entirely at Pinewood this vintage bar pub and Grill was built in 1882. For 136 years it has been a landmark in Roanoke Virginia and offer a fun menu with sandwiches and full meals. Theres a full bar including a billiards room to relax in as well as plenty of televisions for sports. The service is wonderful and be sure to try the burgers theyre terrific. Enjoy

Author: I3091MGrichardr
Review: Great atmosphere, TV, pool table and great location easily accessible to downtown. Upscale environment for a late night drink.

Author: LBLivingBetter
Review: A friendly pub with good seating, the Patriots on the television and a friendly and helpful bartender. Free pool table that is great for families as it is just outside the actual bar area. After a long day of train travel, this was a welcome respite.

Author: tello999
Review: Arrived at the hotel late after a day on the road, and didn't want to venture out again, so checked out this place for dinner... Turned out to be a great choice! The crab dip was fantastic and the mac & cheese was hearty. Didn't need both, but I couldn't decide, so figured why not... Pub was busy, but the service was still good.

Author: JDWL
Review: We stopped in for a glass of wine and some tea after dinner at Billy's down on Market Street. The pour was generous, and reasonably priced at $9.00 for a house Chardonnay
